The palate has a textured mouthfeel that owes as much to yeast as it does to lemon zestiness. With its great concentration, it still needs time to unfurl the full force of its citrus power. The finish is incisive, long and lemony. Drink 2020–2030.
title: Buchegger 2016 Ried Vordernberg Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

description: Stewed red berries and an herbal streak define the nose, which also offers carob and spice notes. The palate feels mostly deep and padded, with layering and flavors of herbs, pepper, spice and plum. A meaty, herbal finish with a tomato paste quality is the final act.
title: Errazuriz 2010 Max Reserva Carmenère (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Robust, concentrated black-fruit aromas bring accents of citrus rind and spice. The palate is rough and rugged, while flavors of blackberry, spice, fig and chocolate finish dark and toasty, with minty oak and tannins still needing to be resolved.
title: Concha y Toro 2012 Marques de Casa Concha Merlot (Peumo)

description: Executed in a streamlined and traditional fashion, this ruby-colored wine shows tart acidity and bright fruit flavors of wild berry and blueberry. Medium bodied, this would pair beautifully with lamb or pork chops.
title: Carpineto 2010  Chianti Classico

description: It took Vina Robles some years to figure Cabernet out, but they did it. The Huerhuero now is one of Paso's best bottlings, at a fair price. Dry and sufficient in acidity, its blackberry, cassis and dark chocolate flavors are comparable to a fine Napa Cab. Drink over the next few years.
title: Vina Robles 2008 Huerhuero Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This is a bit dry and scratchy on the bouquet, with direct cherry and plum aromas. It feels snappy and a little on the acidic side, with oaky creaminess softening things up. It tastes of vanilla, butter, cherry and plum, with vanilla on the finish. This comes across both bright and woody.
title: Puelles 2008 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: More steely than the Isolation Ridge, the nose offers plenty of floral notes combined with pineapple, stone fruit, apple and yeast. This leads into a tightly wound yet fruity palate, with crushed stone and a poise and structure that sets this up for plenty of years of cellaring. Drink 2019–2032.
title: Frankland Estate 2016 Poison Hill Riesling (Frankland River)

description: This medium-bodied wine gives a sweet impression along with heavy-handed oak aromas and flavors like cedar, menthol and wood smoke.
title: Pra Vinera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This somewhat angular and lean wine holds small percentages of Merlot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. A savory sense of cigar and tobacco lies at its heart, the fruit sourced from all across the Napa Valley. Plum and rhubarb pop their heads out before a fuller-bodied oak finish.
title: Duckhorn 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Smoke, candlewax and lemon zest lend savory tones to fresh lemon and apple flavors in this brisk off-dry wine. It's piercingly tart with a hit of lime acidity on the midpalate, but a waxy richness adds body and mouthfeel. The moderately long finish carries a hint of honeysuckle perfume.
title: Red Newt Cellars 2012 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Apple and honeydew aromas show on the nose of this boxed wine, which prides itself on having a small eco-footprint. The palate is flatter than the nose, with green apple skin flavors but not much texture or acidity to speak of.
title: Loft 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Very sweet in white sugared orange and vanilla flavors, like a honey-nut candy bar. Will satisfy Chard lovers with a sweet tooth
title: Lander-Jenkins 2010 Spirit Hawk Chardonnay (California)

description: Crisp, tart and clean, with notes of tomato leaf, fresh cut grass and ripening strawberries. It doesn't hang around very long but it's an honest effort that's worth considering for a summer picnic.
title: Fabbioli Cellars 2008 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

description: This clean, racy, young Sauvignon Blanc brims with citrus, Asian pear, mango and white-pepper flavors that finish dry and tart with acidity.
title: Beaucanon 2011 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: There is plenty of toasty oak on the nose of this reserve bottling, but it's judiciously applied and cut by lemon balm, Asian pear, hot croissant and pecan oil aromas. The sip also shows a savory oak-smoke character, but the midpalate is all about lemon cream and butter-basted apple pie, with a touches of vanilla, cinnamon and cashew riding into the finish.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Tannin management is improving for many Oregon Tempranillos, and this is a good example. Its light, peppery red fruit is cloaked in pretty barrel flavors: baking spice, mocha, almond paste. The alcohol has come down significantly from the 2014 bottling, to good effect.
title: Delfino 2015 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

description: Cab Franc has always been one of the best potential wines in these Foothills, and now, veteran Easton tackles it with special focus. This is a good, medium-bodied wine, with pleasurable flavors of cherries, cola, bacon and sweet smoky oak. Has more elegance than you might think at this price.
title: Easton 2008 Monarch Mine Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

description: Griva Vineyard is supersensitive to the slightest vintage variation. The chilly 2011 harvest has given just enough sweet tropical-fruit flavor to balance out the tart gooseberry note. It's still a slightly green wine, but a good one, and it will pair well with goat cheese.
title: Bernardus 2011 Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

description: This has aromas of prunes and burnt rubber, but it tastes better than that. It's a pretty raw effort.
title: Quickfire 2008 Top Chef Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: A soft, frankly sweet wine, almost like a dessert sipper, with orange, apricot and honey flavors.
title: Cupcake 2010 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Lots of rich, sweet flavors of raspberry, cherry and mocha appear in this vigorous, young Merlot. Blended from vineyards around the valley, it emphasizes fruit. Drink now with beef-based Mexican food.
title: Freemark Abbey 2010 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Dusty apple aromas are nice for this level of wine. A round, solid mouthfeel is a plus, while flavors of melon, apple and nectarine come with light oak and vanilla offsets. A pithy, melony finish concludes this easygoing Chardonnay.
title: Château Los Boldos 2013 Cuvée Tradition Chardonnay (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Sweet, spicy oak is the dominant smell on this racy, youthful wine that's packed with aromas of coconut, cola and pepper. On the palate, oak remains front and center, while plum, raspberry, butter and vanilla flavors rest in back. The finish is crisp and focused; drink now through 2019.
title: Valduero 2009 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Notes of cassis, herb, worn leather and mocha appear on the nose. Medium to full in body, this is structured with stocky tannins and supporting acids. The spiced-berry finish ends a bit short.
title: Barrel Oak 2009 Merlot (Virginia)

description: A bit muted and light on intensity with soft ripe stone fruit and citrus aromas and flavors. Slightly prickly in the mouth with a short but clean finish, this is a good choice for heartier roast chicken dishes.
title: Neil Ellis 2009 Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)

description: Simple and sweet in cola, blackberry and oak flavors. At this price, it's suitable for big parties.
title: Round Hill 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: There's a bit of oak here, but not too much, giving a smoky, buttered toast richness to the orange, lime and pineapple fruit. It's a rich, flashy Chardonnay, with crisp acidity and a clean, spicy finish.
title: Saintsbury 2010 Unfiltered Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Brown-gold in color, with a staunch, ripe bouquet of syrupy peach, apricot and caramel. The palate is rich and full bodied, with peach, apricot and sweet melon flavors. Thick and satisfying on the finish, but still fairly juicy due to good core acidity.
title: Morandé 2008 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Almost as good as some of the winery's best single-vineyard bottlings, this wine has a tremendous nose that offers tangerine blossom, pink grapefruit skin, sea salt and toast around a line of graphite. The palate presents juicy nectarine and ripe citrus alongside yeasty sizzle, salt and a chalk minerality.
title: Testarossa 2013 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: While this wine starts with an oniony aroma, it blows off fairly quickly, displaying aromas of honey, peach, guava, lemon and dried herbs taking its place. The palate shows a whisper of sweetness, balanced by tropical fruit flavors and a herbal finish.
title: Jade Cove 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Baked red-cherry, vanilla, baking-spice and turned earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Strong herbs, from oregano to thyme, show on the sip, alongside tangy red fruit flavors.
title: San Simeon 2014 Estate Reserve Merlot (Paso Robles)

description: This ripe wine is intense and full bodied, with sultry layers of baked apple and peach. A flinty note marks the finish.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2013 Director's Cut Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a dull, tannic and robustly full bodied wine, brooding in tobacco and tea without much in the way of fruit or acidity.
title: Eaglewood 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Cool and green smelling, with briny notes and whiffs of green pepper and sea foam, this shows intensity, while the flavors veer toward lime, passion fruit and green herb. It's nervy and tasty on the finish.
title: William Cole 2011 Columbine Special Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Bright and cheerful with a candied black cherry nose, this is a deliciously fruit-forward yet focused wine. On the palate, soft, fresh fruit and supple vanilla flavors meld beautifully with supple tannins and a rich, dark, roasted coffee finish.
title: Osprey's Dominion 2007 Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Woodsy cedar and spice tones swirl into layers of vanilla cream in this intensely oaky, yet enticing Chardonnay. Brisk lemon-lime acidity and fresh apple and pear notes freshen the midpalate.
title: Tousey 2013 Chardonnay (Hudson River Region)

description: At first the nose is clouded by earthy funk but then rather pure notions of dried mandarin peel and ripe apple appear. The palate is very concentrated and also pulls this aromatic coup from earthy smoke to mandarin-scented marvel. This is unusual, but has real impact. The finish is dry and utterly lemon fresh. It's lovely now. Drink through 2028.
title: Preiss-Zimmer 2013 Brand Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Produced from estate-grown fruit, this also includes 10% Petit Verdot. A tart raspberry flavor fades into a light finish, with streaks of tobacco and vanilla that are bolstered with generous natural acidity.
title: Jones of Washington 2009 Estate Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)

description: Cherry-berry aromas mix with a hint of vinegar and cleanser to create a sketchy, foreboding bouquet. The wine is a little blocky in the mouth, with both weedy-herbal and plum-berry flavors. Finishes with tolerable but noticeable bitterness and burn.
title: Sun Valley 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lontué Valley)

description: A wonderful follow-up to the debut vintage, this generous Chardonnay brings green apples, stone fruits and suggestions of pineapple, with a judicious use of new oak that refrains from becoming more than a pleasing nuance. Excellent balance, with a firm, lingering finish that brings in butterscotch and ripe, sweet lemon.
title: Olsen Estates 2007 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

description: Sensations of mature black plum are layered with notes of chocolate and roasted coffee bean. It's ripe, dense and evolved, with a markedly sweet finish. Drink now.
title: Palazzo 2012  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Smells damp and murky, with raisin and other sweet berry aromas along with some mulch. The palate brings more freshness, but it's grabby and tannic as it delivers prune, raisin and berry flavors in front of coffee and herbs on the finish. Good but smells and tastes a little overripe.
title: Volvoreta 2008 El Vino del Buen Amor  (Toro)

description: Standard plum and berry aromas are clean and get the job done. This is clampy on the palate, with grapy dark-fruit flavors. Solid fruit character and firm tannins on the finish confirm that this is a good everyday Cabernet.
title: Santa Rita 2016 Secret Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This is rich, ripe and succulent, with blackberry and black currant flavors. As decadently fruity as it tastes, the finish is firm and dry. There's lots of balanced elegance in this drink-me-now Cabernet.
title: J. Lohr 2010 Hilltop Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Smooth, tropical and pure on the nose, with pineapple as the lead fruit. The palate is solid and full-bodied, with pineapple, papaya, honey and toasted flavors. Not “oaky” but it is well oaked, and thus the finish is warm, toasty and creamy. Drink now.
title: Lapostolle 2008 Cuvée Alexandre Atalayas Vineyard Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: A plush, big, oaky California Tempranillo with plum, fig and black cherry in the mix, but also clove, bittersweet chocolate and did we mention, oak? Oy, the oak. Maybe more than it needed. A pruney aftertaste muddles the finish.
title: Fenestra 2008 Tempranillo (Lodi)

description: Ripe and creamy, with touches of honey, this wine is smooth and rich. A pinch of spice as well as almonds go with the richness. Drink this full-bodied wine from 2019.
title: Rijckaert 2017 Les Crays vers Vaux  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: Opens with peppery, earthy black cherry and berry aromas, yet the palate is clacky and narrow, with high acidity and dry, limited flavors of blackberry and black cherry. Narrow as well on the finish. Middle-of-the road and respectable but hardly a head-turner.
title: Vizcarra 2008 Senda del Oro  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Former Cloudy Bay winemaker Kevin Judd's new label displays a vibrant pungency to its leafy aromas, then opens up on the palate to add gooseberry and grapefruit notes. It's refreshingly medium bodied, with a slightly creamy texture and a long finish filled with pink grapefruit.
title: Greywacke 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Flat slightly flabby aromas of green and grassy black fruits smell of sweet plastic and oak. This feels raw, choppy and scraping. Flavors of minty, herbal black fruits are toasty and show grainy, forced oak. Pepper and mint flavors along with scratchy tannins make for a solid but rough finish.
title: Loscano 2013 Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)

description: Named for a type of surfboard, depicted on the label, this dark, inky and leathery red wine is blended with 6% Malbec and 2% Merlot. Rustic and full of earthy minerality, it shares a juicy underbelly that provides welcome succulence on the palate.
title: Longboard 2013 Rhino Chaser Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

description: Somewhat thin and acidic in cherry fruit, and also overoaked. It's as if they thought the aromas and flavors of smoky wood would compensate for a simple wine. Lacks richness.
title: Comartin 2007 Watch Hill Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

description: The fruit of the historic Hickinbotham vineyard once went into some of Australia's top wines, including Penfolds Grange. Currently owned by California's Jackson family and meticulously farmed by Vineyard Manager Michael Lane, this top-notch fruit is getting the recognition it deserves under its own label. This wine is a heady combo of juicy ripe blackberry fruit, damp wood, the charred embers of a fire, sumac spice and something sanguine and meaty. The palate shows richness of fruit but it's well integrated with savory spicy wood and drying tannins. It's one for the cellar. Drink now–2038.
title: Hickinbotham 2014 Trueman Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)

description: Elevates the Keller style of superripe, oaky Chardonnay into a more refined, balanced wine, equally rich but more perfect. It's still potent in buttered toast, vanilla, caramel, honey and pineapple jam, but crisp acidity and minerality help to give structure to the opulence.
title: Keller Estate 2009 Precioso Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Blackberry and black cherry fruit anchor this well-built Cabernet, accented with scents of sandalwood and smoke. The acidity keeps it vibrant and brings good definition throughout.
title: Mercer 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Full, rich wine that combines an aromatic herbal element with ripe red fruits. It's the wood aging that knits this dense wine together, adding the spice and the smoothing element. Still young, this wine should be kept and drunk after 2015.
title: Domaine Guillaman 2010 Les Hauts de Guillaman Merlot (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Slightly more advanced notes stand out: a herbal tinge of sun-warmed, wild thyme has crept into the citrus peel which utterly dominates the palate. This sleek Smaragd has just started on its long ascent. It has the toned muscle and the stamina to go on and on—those who have enjoyed older vintages know of its near eternal youthfulness. On the aftertaste, herbal notes assert themselves again: dried tisane of verbena and dried apple punctuate with pleasant accents.
title: Domäne Wachau 2013 Smaragd Terrassen Riesling (Wachau)

description: Hints of smoke and nut lend a savory tone to fresh pear and yellow peach on this dry, full-bodied Riesling. Textured and expansive on the palate, it's brightened by a splash of white-grapefruit acidity. Finishes moderately long.
title: Rooster Hill 2012 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Lemon and Key lime star on the nose in this wine, alongside aromas of tropical pineapple. A voluptuous, creamy vanilla crème brûlée suggests itself on the palate, threatening to become over the top before the wine finishes lean.
title: Michael Pozzan 2013 Annabella Special Selection Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This wine shows the peachy notes of a top vintage, spiked with crushed stone and briny notes. The additional weight shows on the palate, where the wine is broad and mouthcoating yet spicy, peppery and fully dry.
title: Johannishof 2009 Rüdesheim Berg Rottland Erstes Gewächs Riesling (Rheingau)

description: A fresh cherry aroma is wrapped in loads of intriguing spice on the nose of this bottling, including clove, mint and cocoa. A chalky texture of grainy tannins frames the palate, where plum, blackberry, dried ginger and more baking-spice flavors ride a persistent acidity.
title: Dusty Nabor 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This soft, fresh Sauvignon Blanc just hints at herbaceousness and brings out riper fruits, peaches and red apple skins. A ripe and warm wine, it is ready to drink now. Screwcap.
title: Chavet Fils 2012 Tradition  (Menetou-Salon)

description: This is a simple, easygoing white wine, with ripe flavors of apricots and oranges. It has just enough acidity to get by.
title: Arrow Creek 2012 Coastal Series Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is a solidly built wine with ripe black-fruit flavors and lots of texture. It looks deeper than usual, smells like blackberries and black pepper, and tastes dry, full and firmly tannic.
title: Barra of Mendocino 2013 Estate Grown Sangiovese (Mendocino)

description: This has brisk, tingly acidity and rich, toasty new oak flavors, plus mineral and fruit notes. Try this in 2015 as it could become surprisingly complex.
title: La Fenêtre 2010 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: From vines between 20 and 40 years old, this is a ripe, intense wine with great acidity. A good mineral texture enhances the white fruits, apricots and pineapple. The aftertaste is crisp and tight. Keep until 2017 for the wine to be at its best.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2015 Les Baronnes  (Sancerre)

description: Cola, spice, peppercorn and compost aromas are present and accounted for. Firm, structured and tannic across the tongue, with refined but powerful herb, blackberry, carob and spiced flavors. A lush and generous wine with mocha and herbal notes on the finish. Only 200 cases made.
title: Quintay 2010 Q Syrah (Casablanca Valley)

description: Aromatically muted at first, the bouquet opens up with time to reveal steely, finessed notes of pear and fresh citrus that continue through to the palate. The oak is subtle and well-managed, and the minerality alive and fresh.
title: Anaba 2011 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Under the same ownership as Domaine Tinel-Blondelet, this estate has made a crisply textured wine, intense with acidity and still very young. Its freshness and brightness need to soften, so drink from 2019.
title: Domaine La Croix Canat 2017 Chantepleure  (Pouilly-Fumé)

description: “Califa” is a Native American word meaning the prettiest one, and that's what winemaker Fintan du Fresne delivers in this estate-grown wine. The lovely nose is spun tightly around citrus, white roses and limestone, while the well-integrated palate offers a touch of jasmine followed by apple elements that arise in the midpalate. Serve with shrimp paella.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2012 Califa Estate Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Ripe and creamy style of Riesling. It's fresh of course but the main thrust is ripe yellow fruits, a touch of tropicality and pineapple, along with a contrasting mineral aftertaste. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler 2011 Riesling (Alsace)

description: Noticeably lighter in color and density than other Syrahs, this bottling packs a wide array of freshly shaved cinnamon and clove on the nose, along with rose petals, raspberry and chaparral scrub. Bright on the palate with dried strawberry and hibiscus notes, this intriguingly low-alcohol exploration boasts rose hips and orange-rind complexity, almost more Grenache-like in style.
title: Margerum 2013 Purisima Mountain Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)

description: With spicy oak and very ripe fruit aromas, this wine is full bodied and mouthfilling, with rounded tannins and good flavor length on the finish. A very good example of the varietal, it's easy to enjoy.
title: Deaver 2012 Sangiovese (Amador County)

description: This wine's rubbery, leafy berry aromas are forced and strained. Its raw, choppy palate tastes of peppery currant and plum, while its tight and narrow finish tastes a touch green.
title: Domaine Bousquet 2016 Finca Lalande Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Solid up front, with sweet and spicy aromas of plum, vanilla and candied berry. Feels full and good, with weight and thickness boosting up toasty, woody berry flavors. Dries out on the finish, leaving spice and a resiny taste. Drink now through 2014.
title: Bodegas Muriel 2005 Vendimia Seleccionada Reserva  (Rioja)

description: This is a firm, full wine that needs some time. It's led by ripe plums, blackberries, mint and baking spices. There's sappy, soapy element to the oak and a savory, soy sauce note. The chalky tannins are big and blocky, driving the wine but nevertheless integrated with the plump black and purple fruit. Drink 2020–2030 and likely beyond.
title: St. Hugo 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)

description: Prunaio delivers aromas of prune, rum cake and cherry liqueur. The fruit is dark and savory, and there's an aged, almost gritty quality to the mouthfeel.
title: Viticcio 2008 Prunaio Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: This medium-bodied, well-balanced wine has peppery, light-smoke aromas, modest rhubarb flavors and interesting white pepper and raspberry notes. It has personality and a rustic, authentic appeal.
title: Skinner 2013 Grenache (El Dorado)

description: From a little-known site in the Ruwer, this wine starts off slowly, then builds to a fine crescendo. The aromas are barely present, but the flavors of apple and citrus expand on the palate, adding mineral notes on the lengthy finish.
title: Christoph von Nell 2009 Kaseler Dominikanerberg Ruva Nova Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

description: Almost sweet in its old age, this ethereal wine has crisp acidity to go with its almond and mushroom flavors.
title: Kirchmayr 1988 Solist Altenberg Riesling (Weinviertel)

description: Expertly integrated aromas of black plum, vanilla cola, light clove, pralines and a touch of caramel cream show on the nose of this bottling by a Sta. Rita Hills producer that sourced from up north. Wild berries, red cherry and black raspberry pop on the palate, where an earthy tension of chipped slate meets with a baked goods richness.
title: Zotovich Cellars 2013 Grenache (Paso Robles)

description: Primary notes of green pear dominate the nose. The palate is tight with grapefruit zestiness, while some ripe yellow pear in the background provides measure and balance.
title: Domäne Wachau 2013 Terrassen Federspiel Riesling (Wachau)

description: Just off dry on the palate, this medium-bodied Riesling offers primary lemon and lime flavors with just a touch of crushed mineral notes. It's moderately concentrated on the palate but thirst-quenching. The finish is refreshingly dry. Enjoy now–2020.
title: Leonard Kreusch 2017 Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: A very firm and well-structured expression of pure Walla Walla Syrah. There is a core of blueberry and blackberry fruit, amply wrapped in sweetly toasty, smoky oak (despite very little new barrel usage). It finishes clean with the characteristic earthy foundation of Walla Walla Syrah, and a streak of rock and licorice.
title: Gramercy 2009 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: From a fairly cool vintage, this wine starts out with aromas of lychee and grapefruit that move to toast and a mineral. The palate is clunky and the fruit a little sour, with the acidity on the sharp side.
title: Wildberry Estate 2017 Two Passions Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: Lots of oaky richness in this detailed, highly enjoyable Chardonnay. It's tart and savory in acid-tinged lemondrop candy, tangerine and Asian pear flavors, elaborated with sweet buttered toast. Elegant and upscale, a wine to drink now.
title: Robert Mondavi 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A great value, Thorn Clarke's 2009 Terra Barossa Cabernet Sauvignon boasts bold aromas of cedar, cassis and mint, then follows up with similar flavors. It's medium to full in body, with firm tannins and mouthwatering acidity that make it drinkable now but suggest it may age nicely through 2020.
title: Thorn Clarke 2009 Terra Barossa Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa)

description: Delicious and crisp in acidity, this is dry despite its flavors of honey and ripe, jammy tropical fruit. How this wine achieves such a quality is magic, but the brisk acidity helps, as does its stony minerality. Ready to enjoy now.
title: Stephen Ross 2010 Bien Nacido Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: What you see is what you get, a simple, affordable Cabernet, with decent berry, spice and oak flavors. It's dry and balanced.
title: Grayson 2010 Lot 10 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: There is a lot of pent-up energy on the nose of this fresh and zesty bottling, which shows aromas of key lime, tangerine, wet stone and a hint of nectarine. The palate is overloaded with citrusy flavors, from Meyer lemon peel to grapefruit pith, but there is also baked-apple warmth at its core.
title: Dierberg 2015 Dierberg Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Intense aromas of wild berry, forest floor, leather and grilled herb take center stage. The firm palate shows oak, cherries marinated in spirits, licorice, sage and roasted coffee bean alongside grippy tannins. Drink 2022–2030.
title: Tornesi 2010 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: One of the winery's more accessibly forward Cabs, the Spaulding is rich in blackberry and cherry pie, chocolate and caramelized oak flavors. It's delicious, if a little direct. Drink now–2013.
title: Von Strasser 2007 Spaulding Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

description: Superbly warm weather in 2015 gave an extra boost of sunshine to many of the Mosel's entry-level wines, and the RK is one of the best. Whiffs of freesia and tangerine peel waft from the glasss of this semidry Riesling. It's low in alcohol, yet so honeyed and ripe that flavors of grapefruit and peach seem to slick sumptuously on the palate. Zesty lime acidity freshens a lingering finish.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2015 RK Riesling (Mosel)

description: This Sangiovese from central Italy offers a very fresh and vibrant quality of fruit that is expressed as cherry, blackberry and sour plum. It's a simple, one-dimensional wine and its best attribute is precisely that.
title: Fattoria Zerbina 2011 Ceregio  (Sangiovese di Romagna Superiore)

description: An obvious but appealing aroma of sour candy lead into a dry palate that's crisp but balanced, with nice pear and grapefruit inflections. An apple note shows through on the short-to-medium finish. Drink now.
title: Weingut Georg Albrecht Schneider 2008 Niersteiner Dry-Style Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Francesco Spadafora makes one of the best Syrahs in Sicily and Italy. This offers beautiful aromas of dark fruit and chocolate, followed by spice, leather and tobacco accents. These aromas are well integrated, resulting in a silky, creamy mouthfeel, with long persistency.
title: Principi di Spadafora 2008 Sole dei Padri Syrah (Sicilia)

description: This wine's thick and buttery aromas range from cashew cream and caramel to honeysuckle and Maui onion. Its powerful acidity cuts through the palate's unctuous and oily qualities, with buttercream and lemon juice flavors combining for a big personality.
title: Scott Family 2015 Dijon Clone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Opening with aromas of underbrush, perfumed berries and crushed violets, this balanced Rosso displays its pedigree. The savory palate delivers dense wild cherry layered with orange peel, white pepper, mocha and cake spices alongside supple tannins. Energizing minerality signals the close. Enjoy now–2017.
title: Citille di Sopra 2012  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Light aromas of mowed lawn, ripe peach and wet concrete show on the mellow nose of this bottling. It's fairly simple on the palate, with ripe pear and seared lime flavors.
title: Falkner 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

description: Soft entry, with generous aromas introducing supple purple and black fruits. Tannins are substantial, well-structured, slightly grainy. There are light streaks of smoke, coffee, herb and bark; the earthy character of Syrah is evident but seems somehow softened and wrapped in the toasty barrel flavors. The blend includes 3% cofermented Viognier and 17% Grenache.
title: Corliss Estates 2006 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: If you like your white wines fruity and sweet, this one's for you. It has pretty flavors of peaches, honey and spices.
title: Coastal Ridge 2010 Riesling (California)

description: Reduced black-plum and dark berry aromas make for a somewhat simple, slightly shy nose on this bottling. There is density to the palate, with chalky tannins presenting flavors of slightly sour black plum. Still very young and tight, it may emerge with more complexity over time.
title: La Honda Winery 2016 Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: An eccentric Chardonnay, although it's well made and has intellectual appeal. Bone dry and acidic, this has intense flavors of apricots, pineapples and honey. It should age for up to 8 years, gradually losing fruit and gaining earthy, minerally qualities.
title: Lucia 2010 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Mushy black fruit characteristics lead on the nose and mouth, and don't really subside until the slightly astringent finish takes hold. Medium weight with a firm structure; drink now.
title: La Forge Estate 2010 Unfiltered Cabernet Sauvignon (Pays d'Oc)

description: Floral and brimming in citrus-laden acidity, this is a creamy, lush example of the variety, with a strong peachy flavor and aromas of apple blossom.
title: V. Sattui 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Done in the rich Paso style, this bottling shows fresh blackberry jam, crushed thyme, rosemary and vanilla on the seductive nose. The lavish palate offers espresso syrup, caramel and dense vanilla-laced blueberry. It's a great bottling for those who love a rich and decadent style.
title: Brecon Estate 2014 Syrah (Adelaida District)

description: This is a forward, slightly sweet-tasting wine, with flavors of cherry candy. The up-front fruitiness leads into some drying, astringent tannins, with notes of tea and tobacco.
title: J. Scott Cellars 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: Minty and raisiny on the nose, with Port-like elements of dried fruit and high (15.0%) alcohol. Still, it shows the variety's trademark delicate structure and silky texture.
title: Jasper Hill 2007 Cornella Vineyard Grenache (Heathcote)

description: Surprisingly, this seems quite light at first, with strawberry and cranberry fruit flavors, and a fair amount of acidity. Give it a few hours of breathing time and it gains flesh. The wine spent 19 months in a combination of American and French oak (two-thirds new).
title: Fielding Hills 2009 RiverBend Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

description: Dry, tannic and acidic, with proper flavors of blackberries and cherries. Perfectly fine for drinking at parties.
title: Firefly Ridge 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

description: A spicy, herbal Merlot, sourced from a site on the Royal Slope, this distinctive wine ranges from strawberry to cherry, brambly and rather tightly wound. Woven through are threads of seed, herb, stem and earth. It's as close to a Bordeaux style as this winery ever comes.
title: K Vintners 2010 Stoneridge Vineyard Merlot (Washington)

description: This wine is predominately Cabernet Sauvignon, with smaller amounts of other Bordeaux red varieties. Together, they offer bold, ripe red-currant and -berry flavors, with a rich entry and gravelly texture. Highly stylized, grippy tannins and a leather note provide additional strength.
title: Joseph Phelps 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Note to Andeluna: avoid the Cab Franc. If this is any example of what to expect on a regular basis, we'd prefer not to dive too deeply into what amounts to a green, vinegary wine that smells and tastes of canned beans and bell pepper. Sharp on the finish as well.
title: Andeluna 2005 Grand Reserve Cabernet Franc (Tupungato)

description: This is a gloriously juicy wine, full of melon, apricot and the brightest citrus flavors. This fruit salad is given structure by the wood and the tangy, zesty edge. It drinks well now, still young and fresh, but will be better aged. Drink from 2016.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2012 Rabourcé Premier Cru  (Rully)

description: Another rich, soft, sensual release from this winery. Cabernet doesn't get riper than this, showing flashy, decadent blackberry, blueberry and currant flavors, liberally enriched with toasty oak. Seems too sweet and soft for aging, but a flashy wine to drink now.
title: Coup de Foudre 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This wine opens with aromas of vanilla and baking spices that are followed by broad, silky-feeling fruit and barrel flavors, finishing on a somewhat bitter note. The oak holds a prominent role but still plays its part well.
title: Claar 2011 Estate Grown and Bottled Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Despite showing an herbal nose that includes tomato leaf, carob and creamy oak, this solid, chunky Cab comes around on the palate, where black fruit, pepper and mild herbal flavors set up a warm, toasty, satisfying finish. This comes across as Chilean Cabernet in every way.
title: Viña Casas Patronales 2010 Reserva Privada Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)

description: This wine is creamy and hugely oaky, with a sweetness of candied marshmallow.
title: David Bruce 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Considered to be the best block of Syrah in the vineyard, here it shows a generous mix of tart berry, plum and raisin fruit flavors, with a lush middle suggesting blueberry pie and Christmas cake. But there is more—chocolate, cinnamon and on it goes into a riot of holiday pastries. Flat-out yummy.
title: Owen Roe 2009 Red Willow Vineyard Chapel Block Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: Opens with mellow peach and melon aromas and some oak. The palate is round, creamy and full, but hollow in the center. Tastes of spiced, dried apple with a stalky, pithy accent. Easy and basic on the finish, and overall it's pricey for what's in the bottle.
title: Añoro 2010 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Dark and deep aromas of black currant, black plum and kirsch meet with shaved licorice on the nose of this bottling. There is chalky tannic framing and decent layers of acid on the sip, where milk chocolate and caramel meet with cassis and black-cherry flavors.
title: Aver Family Vineyards 2014 Heritage Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Clara Valley)

description: Oily in green apple and lime, this crowd-pleasing wine is supple and smooth, with touches of honey and vanilla, especially on the finish. With a lilting ripeness at its core, it will pair well with roasted chicken in herbs.
title: Cuvée Wine Cellars 2012 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Pencil shaving aromas kick off this winery's top-shelf bottling, and then come hints of char, delicate but strong purple flowers and a core of blueberry on the nose. There is a tarry grip to the palate, where flavors of charred boysenberry, lilac and burnt caramel are very clean and elegant.
title: Jaffurs 2014 Upslope Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Floral highlights accent the nose, leading into a crisp and textural wine with pear skin and citrus dominating. This falls on the steely side of Chardonnay styles, offering texture and accents of mineral for added interest.
title: àMaurice 2008 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: With an ashy undercurrent of char and smoke, this wine offers medium-bodied layers of dried cherry and leather, finishing with a lasting note of black pepper.
title: Mengler Family Wines 2016 Alegria Vineyards Sangiovese (Russian River Valley)

description: A light tan color and tropical aromas of bath soap and scented candle lead to a low-acid palate that's a tad cloying. Creamy, tropical flavors of lychee and banana are flat on a one-dimensional finish.
title: Sombras del Sol 2016 Reserva Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: Varietally correct aromas of grapefruit and lime show a touch of coastal Leyda's patented cool-climate, vegetal qualities. In the mouth, this is tangy and fresh, with scallion, green herb, grapefruit and tangerine flavors. A long, persistent finish is minerally and oceanic in style, with some bitterness.
title: Santa Rita 2012 Medalla Real Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: From two superb vineyard sites, Charles Heinz and Dutton Ranch, both on the cool edges of the Sonoma Coast and Russian River Valley, this is a thick, concentrated and delicious wine, which manages its richness with grace. Honey, vanilla and baked apple linger on the palate, finishing softly and with a note of nutmeg.
title: Sanctuary 2014 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: There's a barnyard funk to this that some will love and some might squirm at, but there's also plenty of ripe strawberry fruit, chocolate, earth and smoke. The palate shows plenty of drying, savory tannins balanced by fresh acidity. Everything wraps up with an earthy, savory finish. Drink now.
title: Hope Estate 2014 The Ripper Shiraz (Western Australia)

description: This plump, medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc features distinct notes of fig and nectarine alongside hints of passion fruit. It's a bit sweet and simply fruity, finishing without much length. Drink now.
title: Cupcake 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: With lemon, orange, apricot and green melon flavors, this is a fruity wine, with tart notes of green gooseberries that make it savory. There's a lot of honey on the finish that makes you wonder if it's truly dry or flirting with off-dry.
title: Balverne 2012 Forever Wild Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: Round black-fruit aromas are bold and friendly, while in the mouth this is grabby and full bodied. Flavors of roasted plum and berry are generous albeit a hint green in the middle, while toasty darkness defines the finish, which brings a touch of bitterness.
title: Viña La Rosa 2010 La Capitana Barrel Reserve Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

description: The namesake comedy may have its fans, but this selection leaves a bit more to be desired. It's a lean, aggressively green wine that even includes hints of pickled jalapeño.
title: Twelfth Night 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Strong blueberry and black-cherry aromas mesh with cedar spice and tobacco ash on this rather elegant nose. A balsamic blueberry reduction flavor shows on the palate, where fine-grained tannins also present smashed vanilla flavors.
title: Byington 2013 Alliage Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Aromas of crushed stones and smoke lend a dusty mineral tone to this steely, savory-style Riesling. It's dry on the palate, yet refreshingly lean with a kick of lemon-lime acidity that reverberates through the finish. A surprisingly elegant wine at a bargain price.
title: Villa Wolf 2012 Dry Riesling (Pfalz)

description: Medicinal, mildly herbal aromas revolve around red and black fruit scents, with a candied accent and a root-like dryness. This is a mature wine with screeching acidity that pushes raspberry, plum, briary spice and oak flavors. The finish tastes peppery and feels dry.
title: Odfjell 2007 Orzada Cabernet Franc (Maule Valley)

description: This has been an inconsistent Merlot over the years, but the '07 is a good one, at a fair price. Must be the vintage. It's dry and rich in black cherry, red plum and spice flavors, sweetened by smoky, caramelized oak. Easy to drink now.
title: Ballentine 2007 Pocai Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: A really good value in a California Chardonnay. Blended with a touch of Viognier to add brightness, and fermented in a little new oak, it hits just the right notes for today's popular taste. Slightly sweet in buttered toast and pineapple jam flavors, it's balanced with crisp acidity and a stony minerality.
title: Liberty School 2010 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Fragrant plumes of orange blossom, tangerine and yellow apple are juxtaposed by a densely earthen crushed-mineral undertone here. Dry and full in body, it offers bold orchard fruit and quince flavors offset by steely strikes of acidity and a lime pith astringency. This stately wine needs some time to meld. Hold till 2023.
title: Gunderloch 2016 Rothenberg Trocken GG Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Hard aromas of tire rubber and black fruits lead to a clampy palate with raw tannins. Blackberry and rubber flavors finish on the bitter side.
title: Salentein 2011 Portillo Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: This is the first release from a new winery from Willamette Valley Vineyards that will be located on the Oregon side of Walla Walla Valley. The aromas bring a sense of purity, with notes of black currant, raspberry, plum and fresh tobacco. The palate offers a sense of delicacy and restraint. There's structure here, but it relies less on overt tannins than most Cabernets. It's a unique offering of the variety.
title: Pambrun 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: Good acidity in this wine, with a pleasant minerality, but it's really too fruity and buttery. Shows little subtlety beyond pineapple, peach and pear jam flavors.
title: Adelaida 2010 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Direct and bold in cherries, raspberries, chocolate and spices, this is a tasty Syrah. The richness is wrapped into fine, sweet tannins, with a tweet of smoky oak. Drink now.
title: Atmosphere 2007 Parmelee-Hill Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Valley)

description: The wine's label sports a black and white image of a city skyline, and the wine inside the bottle might make for a decent glass pour at an urban bistro. There's a lot of vanilla flavor and some pleasant black cherry fruit.
title: City Limits 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A terrific Cabernet Sauvignon, dramatically structured in smooth mountain tannins, with lush, complex blackberry, cassis and dark chocolate flavors. Satisfies on every level you could ask of Napa Valley. Good as it is, it will age over a decade.
title: Pestoni Family 2007 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

description: Fruity wine that's also given a firm structure by the ripe tannins. It is a textured wine, just starting out on life, with the fruit and acidity dominant. There is a mineral edge, giving a more racy feel, and bringing out the aging potential of 2–3 years.
title: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2011 Terres Chaudes  (Saumur-Champigny)

description: Black plum, soy, baking spice and a hint of vanilla show on the nose of this bottling by Bret Urness (with the label giving a nod to the vineyard's manager Brook Williams). Rich, dark and lush flavors of baked pastries and black-currant syrup show on the palate, which is creamy in mouthfeel and finishes with a splash of acidity.
title: Levo 2016 Spot Slide Hill Vineyard Syrah (Edna Valley)

description: Aromas of toast, yellow apple, corn silk and whiffs of tropical fruit lead to a restrained, elegant palate with a lightly creamy feel.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Canoe Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: From the Double Canyon Vineyard, this herbal, stemmy Cabernet seems more like a Carmenère. The green and herbal character dominates, despite alcohol pushing near 15%.
title: Hawks View 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: A very good Sauvignon Blanc, crisp in cool-climate acidity and clean in the mouth, with a scour of minerals. It's also very fruity, showing flashy flavors of tangerines, pineapples and peaches. Delicious as a cocktail sipper.
title: Fritz 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: This ripe wine is fruity, with both citrus and tropical flavors. Light and bright, with a crisp, tangy texture, it's ready to drink.
title: Château Grand Bourgeau 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Crisp in lemon and apple that's lean and clean. It's well-made and a good representation for Potter Valley, an inland area of Mendocino County that's nonetheless cool enough to grow Pinot Noir and Chardonnay.
title: McFadden 2012 Chardonnay (Potter Valley)

description: There are a number of lovely Cab Francs coming from the Finger Lakes, but the smell of ripe red cherries accented with rich mocha, vanilla and smoke make Atwater's especially enticing. Lusciously fruity on the palate with intense blackberry and raspberry flavors, it's balanced with rustic notes of bramble, herbs, earth and violets. Soft tannins and smoke carry through to a long finish.
title: Atwater 2007 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

description: Wild berry, herb and rhubarb aromas precede a wiry, grabby palate with generic berry flavors, herbal accents and spice. Juicy, tartaric-feeling acidity creates a tangy impression on the finish, yet there's enough body and good flavors to hold things together.
title: Tussock Jumper 2010 Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: A big-boy Syrah named for the producer's daughter, this is a jammy, juicy, brown sugar and maple syrup kind of Syrah, with a great peppery nose and a lot of bacon fat flavors intermingled among the soft tannins.
title: Klinker Brick 2009 Farrah Syrah (Lodi)

description: Nutty and tart in acidity, this is complex in flavors of Granny Smith apple, lime and tangerine. The texture on the palate is lush yet structured in acidity, which gives this wine cellar-worthy potential. Enjoy 2025–2030.
title: Gary Farrell 2015 Westside Farms Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is slightly spritzy and sugary, with simple yet clean apple flavors. The finish is sweet, quick and pleasantly quaffable. Best to chill it down before drinking.
title: StoneCap 2011 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A very good value Carmenère with oak and charred aromas in front of berry, herbs and olive. The body is full and the wine has a nice feel; flavors of blackberry bring herbs, pepper and black olive accents. Toasty and a bit hot on the finsh, but bold and done well.
title: Haras 2009 Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: The latest release of the legendary Comtes de Champagne comes from a great vintage. It has full, toasty bottle-age notes that give the wine depth of flavor, with a ripe, rounded mouthfeel and taut acidity. An almond note combines with the citrus-driven acidity on the finish.
designation: Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Taittinger 2002 Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A vigorous, aggressive Syrah, this is full bodied and tannic, and it deals assertive blackberry, cherry, currant and sandalwood flavors.
title: Mercy 2009 Zabala Vineyard Syrah (Arroyo Seco)

description: Beefy in body and also in flavor, this full-bodied wine brings aromas like singed rosemary and flavors like maraschino cherries and barbecue sauce. It has moderate tannins for a grippy mouthfeel.
title: Criss Cross 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Clarksburg)

description: Like the name suggests, this Carmenère is opaque purple in color, with earthy, complex aromas of graphite, char and herbal black currant. The palate is, not surprisingly, saturated and dense. Flavors of toasty, minty black fruits are charred, while the finish tastes roasted, heavily oaked and blackened. Drink through 2021.
title: Montes 2013 Purple Angel Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Rounded and full, it's firmly in the tropical fruit Sauvignon Blanc camp. It is rich, softly textured and ripe. The warm fruits are well balanced with a line of acidity to keep a good element of freshness. Apud Sariacum was the Latin name of Raimbault's village of Sury-en-Vaux.
title: Domaine Philippe Raimbault 2012 Apud Sariacum  (Sancerre)

description: Piquant aromas of green fruits are feline in nature. This SB from Rueda feels chunky, with soft edges to the palate. Briny, lightly vegetal flavors of citrus fruit and bell pepper finish with just enough acid to make this worthwhile.
title: Palma Real 2017 MontePalma Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

description: Sweet and oaky, and a little bit forced, but even so this is a natural, full-bodied Chardonnay with a chunky palate and tropical, sweet flavors. As it opens it goes more into the banana, vanilla and papaya field of play, and it finishes decidedly creamy and round. Very good stuff from Tamaya.
designation: Winemaker's Selection Single Vineyard Quebrada Seca
title: Tamaya 2009 Winemaker's Selection Single Vineyard Quebrada Seca Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)

description: There's a compelling dairy component to the nose of this bottling, but more toward yogurt rather than butter, and then the aromas evolve into white peach and crushed nuts. A salty edge leads the palate, where lemon zest, roasted apple and oak smoke ride a racy acid-driven sip.
title: Fernwood 2016 Vanumanutagi Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: You get your money's worth with this Cabernet. It's dry and richly textured, bearing flavors of blackberries, currants and prunes, with a seemingly sweet finish.
title: Snap Dragon 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: New Zealand-style gooseberry and citrus fruit notes give this wine a rather tart taste, but it's dry, and gets the mouth watering. Pair with salty tapas foods.
title: Toquade 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Tomato leaf, rhubarb and herbal aromas come in front of a tight, tannic and prickly palate with green, spicy berry flavors. Turns hot and smacky on the finish, with carob and herbal flavors.
title: Finca El Origen 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: A good, elegant and young Cabernet, whose brisk tannins strongly suggest time in the cellar. Shows a hearty, deep core of blackberries, with an alluring coat of smoky cedar. Give it at least six years, but it could surprise after a decade or more.
title: Charles Krug 2008 X Clones Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Lime zest, peach and floral notes precede a clean, zippy, slippery-textured palate. There's a nice weight to this wine, along with a long, peachy finish.
title: Villa Maria 2017 Cellar Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Much in the style of Leonetti Cabernet, with the richness of Napa Valley fruit, this deeply satisfying, superripe wine is 100% varietal. Notes of cassis, fig and a hint of prune are swathed in deeper flavors of espresso and dark chocolate.
title: Boudreaux Cellars 2007 Champoux & Loess Vineyards Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: From selected, sunny parcels of vines, it's powered by its citrus and pear fruits along with an intensely mineral texture and supreme concentration. It's a Sancerre to keep, still young and gawky, best drunk from 2016.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2012 Jadis  (Sancerre)

description: The aromas of herbs, pink grapefruit and guava don't seem entirely knitted together on this young wine. It's dry and fleshy in feel but doesn't have the concentration to bring it all together.
title: Jones of Washington 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Ancient Lakes)

description: Pressed blue flower, wild berry, Mediterranean scrub and baking-spice aromas create an enticing fragrance. Taut and vibrant, the linear palate is a bit on the lean side in terms of fruit richness but bristles with energy, offering tart sour cherry, strawberry, dried aromatic herb and star anise set against youthfully assertive tannins and bracing acidity. This needs to time to unwind, so it is best to drink after 2023.
title: Lazzeretti 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Intense and rich, a wine that shows the fine effects of aging in old wood, giving a rounded and smoky character. The wine has great concentration, very full and ripe in the mouth.
title: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2009 Clos Häuserer Wintzenheim Riesling (Alsace)

description: This recent addition to the lineup at DeLille blends Cabernet from Klipsun, Ciel du Cheval, Grand Ciel and Upchurch vineyards. It's a fine effort, structured like the scaffolding on a high-rise building, narrow and vertical, with a spine of steel and a core of cassis. Firm acidity completes the picture.
title: DeLille 2011 Four Flags Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: Simple in its bright embrace of plummy flavor, this wine contains smaller additions of Syrah. Mocha and leather lurk beneath the full-bodied concentration of fruit.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2014 Merlot (Sonoma County)

description: As intense and strapping as a Hall of Fame cornerback, this Cabernet is ripe in dark cherry, vanilla and milk chocolate, the tannins mouthfillingly sweet. Built to last, it should stand up to even the fiercest of meats, from rib eye to ribs.
title: TwentyFour by Charles Woodson 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

description: Brambly fruit, wet earth and a green stalky character make up this wine's aroma profile. The stalkiness disappears on the palate and the plush fruit takes the fore and is balanced by a solid line of tannins. Sweet oak creeps in on the finish.
title: Jacob's Creek 2015 Reserve Shiraz (Barossa)

description: This wine's complex nose of tangy, herbal Seville orange and salty stoniness leads to a tingling, taut and lip-smacking palate. That tautness is shot through with lively lemon freshness that leaves the palate wanting more. But it still needs to fill out. A little patience will be rewarded with even more fruit. Drink 2020–2035.
title: Franz Hirtzberger 2016 Setzberg Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

description: Braised green pepper, herb and tar aromas are followed by lightly sweet plum flavors. It's extremely green for the variety.
title: Original House Wine 2016 Mountain Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Starts out heavy and roasted, with herbal, earthy berry aromas settling in. Feels pruney but there's also acidity, while the flavors run herbal and peppery as prune and plum represent the fruit side. Decent but doesn't fully click.
title: Altanza 2008 Dominio de Heredia  (Rioja)

description: This is the first vintage for Upright—100% Klipsun Vineyard and 100% varietal Merlot. Thick and syrupy, it's a full throttle wine, with deep flavors of berry, cherry and cassis. Red licorice lightly streaks through the back end, and the wine makes a smooth landing on a strip of Bourbon barrel notes.
title: Efeste 2010 Upright Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

description: This sophisticated and beautifully balanced wine shows that Lodi can make crisp and poised whites. It has aromas like white pepper and dried thyme, crisp lemon flavors and racy acidity. It is nicely dry, clean and tautly refreshing. While medium bodied, it has a big, vibrant presence.
title: Sand Point 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

description: A musky perfume accents fresh lemon and tangerine aromas on this off-dry wine. It's ripe and rich on the palate with flavors of quince and yellow peach. Zesty with lime, it finishes moderately long with a hint of savory herbs.
title: Peter Mertes 2012 Platinum Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this linear red opens with inviting aromas of pressed violet, iris, dark-skinned berry and a whiff of cake spice. The taut elegant palate offers succulent wild cherry, cranberry, white pepper and chopped herb set against firm refined tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2018–2023.
title: Castelli del Grevepesa 2012 Panzano Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

description: This wine is sourced from two parcels, one planted in the 1930s and the other in the 1950s. The low dosage is possible because of the concentration and ripeness of the fruit, resulting in a sophisticated, balanced and rich wine with a lemon zest flavor, a tight, mineral texture, and a crisp finish.
designation: Vieilles Vignes de Cramant Grand Cru
title: Larmandier-Bernier 2006 Vieilles Vignes de Cramant Grand Cru Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Good Cabernet Sauvignon, spicy, full  bodied and fruity. It's a little gritty and rustic in the mouth, with the blackberry and cherry flavors turning jammy sweet. Drink now.
title: Pomar Junction 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: For a Touraine Sauvignon, this is rich and ripe with tropical fruits as well as the necessary acidity. It is fruity, with a lightly zesty texture and a soft aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Paul Buisse 2017 Domaine Paul Buisse Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

description: This Chardonnay opens with a strong blast of oak resin that frankly doesn't smell very natural or nice. The palate feel is heavy and mealy, while flavors of resiny oak and salt lack fruit. The finish is much the same: salty and oaky.
title: Vistamar 2011 Sepia Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: It's a bit chunky for a Mosel Riesling, but this wine also offers enough in the way of semisweet lime and pineapple flavors to compensate. There's a hint of struck flint on the nose and a slightly custardy texture. Drink now.
title: St. Gabriel 2010 Riesling (Mosel)

description: Not ready to open now, it's just too tannic, although the flavors are so ripe and lush, they erupt right through the numbing astringency. Floods the mouth with ripe red stone fruits, berries and currants, as well as earthier notes of herbs, carob and minerals. The oak is strongly sensed, but entirely in keeping with the wine's volume. Cellar this very fine wine until at least 2012, and it should develop for many years thereafter.
title: Silverado 2006 Solo Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: A deep color and aromas of toasted baguette, wood smoke and black cherry signal a classic style. The flavors are like dark-chocolate-covered cherries and cranberries. The toasted character of new oak barrels persists from the aroma to the finish, but it's well complemented by ripe fruit, an impressively tannic texture and lingering finish.
title: Hourglass 2012 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Dusty, dry and lightly spiced aromas frame stalky red fruit scents. Feels chunky and clampy, with rooty berry sweetness and rubbery bitterness on the back palate and finish. Good, but tough around the edges.
title: Rivarey 2008  Rioja

description: This medium-bodied and complex wine keeps a nice balance between ripe pear and buttered-toast flavors and some good, mouth-cleansing fruit acidity. It has richness, layers of interest and a measure of restraint, too.
title: La Follette 2013 Manchester Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)

description: It's no insult to say this Merlot is fine for drinking now. It's softly tannic and dry, with the briary, brambly raspberry jam and spice flavors you often find in Dry Creek Zinfandels, except that it's Merlot, and shows a more noble structure.
title: Kokomo 2011 Pauline's Vineyard Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Ripe, luscious black-cherry and berry notes are fresh and perfumed, accented by anise, violet and dried herb. It's plush and silky on the palate but anchored by crisp acidity and finely edged, persistent tannins. Enjoyable now for its youthful, primary side, it should develop more savory complexity from 2025 and hold further.
title: Jean-Claude et Nicolas Fayolle 2015 Les Dionnières  (Hermitage)

description: This is proving to be one of the more distinctive vineyards in the region, set in the De Luz hills to the west of the valley floor. Aromas of charred hickory and cherry wood meet with black cherry juice, roasted meats and campfire aromas on the nose. The palate shows licorice, hoisin, star anise and a slight gamy quality.
title: Leoness 2014 Alessandro Vineyard Syrah (Temecula Valley)

description: A simple, rustic wine, dry and tannic, with earthy flavors of tobacco, blackberries and herbs. Considerable acidity gives it a real bite.
title: Mutt Lynch 2007 Merlot Over and Play Dead Merlot (Central Coast)

description: Sourced from 1985 plantings on the Oregon side of the Columbia river, this is a light version of Cabernet, with gentle flavors of berry, underbrush and dried herbs. It's balanced and shows some interesting complexity, but should be consumed over the next four or five years.
title: Merriman 2016 South River Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: This is from an old-vines Wente clone, planted in 1977. You'll notice the texture first, layers of well-proportioned citrus, lemon zest, wet stone and hints of barrel toast. The length and detail are superb, and though drinking well already, this is a wine that will reward cellaring. Drink now through the 2020s.
title: Bethel Heights 2015 The High Wire Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This is a very nice value wine with balsam wood, almond candy, cola and black-fruit aromas. The palate feels pure and fresh, with a ton of plum, berry, cocoa and tobacco flavors. It's smooth, long and solid on the finish.
title: Bodegas 1898 2011 Ramón Roqueta Tempranillo (Catalunya)

description: Light and fruity, this wine has layers of attractive acidity along with a mineral texture that keeps it on its toes. The wine's freshness makes it attractive and ready to drink.
title: Yves Giroux 2016 Les Raidillons  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Very fine and high-toned, a Cabernet that shows real class and pedigree. Entirely drinkable now for its soft, lush tannins and elaborately detailed blackberry, black cherry, anise, carob and cedar flavors that last long through a spicy finish. Should age well through 2015.
title: Summers 2006 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This best-of-barrels blend shows the powerful tannins and dryness that mark all of Turnbull's 2009 Cabernets. It's a huge wine, powerful and concentrated in blackberries, black currants and sweet dark chocolate, with notes of spices on the long, dry finish. Drink it now, with the best beef entrée you can find. It should slowly develop bottle-age characteristics over the next 8–10 years, at a minimum.
title: Turnbull 2009 Estate Grown Black Label Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: This is the inaugural vintage of a new estate wine, from a 30-acre property on Eastside Road across the Russian River from the winery. Pear compote, anise and lemon candy wrap around voluptuous layers marked by green apple and orange peel, offering richness and weight in hearty measure.
title: Williams Selyem 2014 Lewis MacGregor Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The nose is limey and floral, with stone fruit and pea shoots at the core. It's the palate that keeps you coming back for more, with acidity that is in check rather than enamel-stripping, held up by a juicy, limey core.
title: Villa Maria 2017 Private Bin Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: There's a classic California Chardonnay backbone to this bottling, with aromas of toasted wood, crème brûlée, poached pear and apple custard, yet there are also more delicate hints of chalk and orange blossom as well. The palate combines ripe Pink Lady apples and vanilla spice and caramel richness.
title: Wente 2016 Riva Ranch Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Intense aromas of savory spice and smoke lend a mysterious tone to flavors of pressed apple and pear in this dry, medium-bodied Riesling. The palate is bright with lemon-lime acidity, but finishes on a dusty mineral note.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2012 Wiltinger Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

description: Aromas of cedar, herb, fennel and dried cherry lead to tart, reserved fruit flavors. It's an intriguing wine with one foot planted in the Old World and another in the New.
designation: Anne Marie Liegeois Hedges Cuvée Marcel Dupont Les Gosses Vineyard
title: Hedges 2012 Anne Marie Liegeois Hedges Cuvée Marcel Dupont Les Gosses Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: Smooth and earthy on the nose, with tobacco, cola and restrained red-berry aromas. Has depth and the right amount of snap to the palate, which features classic flavors of herb, spice, tobacco, cedar and berry fruit. Long and barrel-driven on the finish, but cuddly in feel and ready to drink.
title: Echeverria 2008 Founder's Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Complexities of slate and wax meld into notes of tangerine and apricot on the nose of this buoyantly sunny wine. It's dry in style, but plush white peach and honeycomb notes give it a silken richness not necessarily typical of Mosel Riesling. Firm strikes of lime and lemon tighten up the midpalate and extend through a long, steely finish.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2015 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Trocken Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: A lovely Cabernet, dry and classy, with rich flavors of blackberries, cherries, currants, herbs and oak, housed into firm tannins. Good as it is, it disappoints at this price. Hall is making at least seven different Cabernet Sauvignons. Are they spreading themselves too thin?
title: Hall 2007 Bergfeld Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Full-bodied and elegant, this opens with aromas of mature orchard fruit, crushed stone and nut. The linear, structured palate boasts more complexity than most Pinot Grigios, offering ripe pear, toasted almond, mineral and dollop of acacia honey. Drink through 2020.
title: St. Pauls 2015 Passion Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This opens with truffle, black-skinned berry and leather aromas. Made with organically cultivated Sangiovese, the juicy, medium-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, cinnamon and black pepper while polished tannins give it balance and support. Enjoy through 2023.
title: Villa Calcinaia 2014 Vigna Bastignano  (Chianti Classico)

description: This wine is soft, with a warm, tropical-fruit character. With crisp acidity to back up the ripe fruit, it is a well-balanced wine, both crisp and generous. Drink now.
title: Thierry Véron 2016 Cave de la Bouquette  (Sancerre)

description: A charred onion and nuts offer a reductive quality that presides at first sniff. Underneath it are more typical characters: grapefruit, lime and pineapple. The texture is slippery, finishing on a salty note.
title: Cottesbrook 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is a thick and concentrated wine with a touch of oaky reduction and coconut shavings that also methodically reveals a lush richness of red berry and currant. The texture and structure are gentle and soft, inviting one in.
title: Pine Ridge 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: A very pretty effort, the wine's strawberry and rhubarb flavors are balanced against spring herbs and hints of leaf. The Morrison Lane Sangiovese is blended with 15% Syrah from the Boushey vineyard.
title: Trio Vintners 2007 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: The texture on this Syrah is a little rough, with edgy tannins accentuating its sharpness. It's robust and sweet in blackberry jam and black pepper flavors, with a hint of teriyaki beef. Drink this rustic offering now.
title: Martin Ranch 2009 Thérèse Vineyards Lester Family Vineyards Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Sweetly charred oak presently dominates the blackberry and cherry flavors that finish so long and strong in fruity power. The tannins are big and hard, making the wine clumsy and rude in youth. Yet it has the overall balance to age well. Give it up to a decade in a cool cellar.
title: Tayson Pierce 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: A showcase of the vintage and varietal, this is a luxuriously thick and decadent wine, integrated in tannin and oak, with a length on the palate. Chocolate truffle, pencil lead and tobacco all have parts to play, meeting succulent raspberry and blueberry.
title: Darioush 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Plum, herb and vanilla aromas lead to easygoing black-currant flavors. It provides a lot of easy drinking appeal.
title: Washington Hills 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: More blossomy and mineral than ripe or ruddy, there's a demure elegance to this bristling off-dry Riesling. Crisp, almost crystalline flavors of tangerine and yellow peach accentuate and lengthen the palate. It's a deftly cutting wine to drink now through 2020.
title: Dr. Loosen 2014 Bernkasteler Lay Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Seemingly sweet and mellow, this tastes like white toast that has been spread with raspberry jam and butter, sprinkled with cinnamon and brown sugar. It's already drinking well.
title: Flocchini 2008 Saddle-Up Syrah (Sonoma Coast)

description: Brooding aromas of blackberry seed, black currant and licorice are followed by a full-bodied palate, with a tight core of dark-fruit flavors supported by fine-grained tannins. It's near irresistible, showing impeccable styling.
title: Substance 2013 Super Substance Me Northridge Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

description: Pretty good Cabernet, fine for easy, inexpensive drinking. It's bone dry and modest in alcohol, with decent berry, cola and cedar flavors.
title: Small Wonders 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Earthy like a Pinot Noir at first, but bigger boned like Syrah, this Tempranillo (with 10% Graciano blended in) has brooding mushroom notes throughout, is quite savory and has a long, peppery finish. Still very young, its tightly wound tannins will let loose over time.
title: Straight Line 2010 Tempranillo (California)

description: Not the stellar value of prior years, the 2007 Jacob's Creek shows low, earthy tones and a stingy amount of fruit, though a touch of cassis pops up on the short finish. Drink up.
title: Jacob's Creek 2007 Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)

description: This is quite tannic and earthy, with some sweet berry fruit somewhat buried underneath the structure. It finishes with a little herbal bitterness.
title: Eola Hills 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oregon)

description: Vivid aromas of tart cherry and cranberry are followed by equally vivid, crisp and tangy flavors that echo the cherry and cranberry but add richer plum notes and nuances of cinnamon, nutmeg and cedar. This is so well balanced and bright that it tastes lip-smacking delicious now but will improve with age through at least 2020.
title: Steven Kent 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

description: Les Loges is one of the focal points of fine Pouilly Fumé. This wine has some of the richness associated with the area while at the same time being easy and accessible. White fruits dominate and the wine will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Pierre Marchand & Fils 2017 Les Loges  (Pouilly-Fumé)

description: Aromas of cocoa, baking spice and herb are followed by cocoa and vanilla-speckled flavors. The tannins bring a slight sense of astringency but overall it offers some appeal.
title: Apex 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A good effort for the money. The nose has rubber and bold fruit, while the palate has a natural, balanced feel and nice flavors of berry, cassis, brown sugar and chocolate. Blends juiciness with enough weight and sweetness to rate highly in the value class.
title: Finca Agostino 2007 ILKA Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Leathery lightly herbaceous berry aromas are not overly ripe. In the mouth, this is scratchy on the surface but dilute below deck. Lightly weedy plum and berry flavors finish herbal and green.
title: Finca Las Moras 2014 Barrel Select Cabernet Sauvignon (San Juan)

description: This wine is expansive and juicy on the palate. A tight grip shows its youth while the underlying softness on the texture reflects the relative coolness of the growing spot. It imparts Napa's robust ripeness in its depth of cassis, chocolate and black pepper.
title: Trefethen 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)

description: Made in small amounts, this floral, tangy and richly textured white wine offers a depth of honey and caramel that overpowers the prettier, more mineral-driven aspects lurking in the underbelly of body. Youthful, it should come around.
title: Jeff Gordon 2014 Leveroni Vineyards Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: There's a minty, ammonia streak of greenness that can charitably be described as gooseberry in this dry Sauvignon Blanc. Oak brings sweet vanilla richness, but the wine is still pretty eccentric.
title: Petroni 2010 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

description: This wine has loads of fruit, with a complex steely and racy texture. With its weight and intensity, this is likely to develop slowly. Give it at least four years.
designation: Kaefferkopf Clos Saint Landelin Grand Cru
title: René Muré 2010 Kaefferkopf Clos Saint Landelin Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: This Cabernet shows the austerity and dry tannins of a Howell Mountain wine, as well as a fine streak of acidity and oak. It has a blunt core of red currants and mocha. Seems to want some time, so give it 4–6 years to settle down.
title: W.H. Smith 2009 Bronze Label Piedra Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

description: Bright cherry and blue floral aromas come with hints of leather and spice. The vibrant palate delivers succulent wild cherry and white pepper restrained by fresh acidity and bracing tannins. It has mesmerizing depth, finesse and balance. Drink 2015–2028.
title: Salvioni 2008  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Clean on the nose, with pure citrus and minerality. It's full but not heavy in the mouth, with developed, mature flavors of grapefruit and other citrus fruits. Mildly pithy, green and long on the finish. Not a prima ballerina; this has force and strength along with elegance.
title: Chilcas 2010 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: This medium-bodied Merlot boasts an abundance of ripe, juicy black-cherry and plum flavors, but with a shade of savory green herbs that persist on the palate. Bright acidity and soft tannins make it brisk and easy to drink.
title: Pellegrini Vineyards 2007 Estate Grown Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This full-bodied and thick-textured wine wraps spicy smoky beefy flavors around a good core of blackberries and black cherries. The spicy oak character dominates but it's attractive and adds to the wine's boldness.
title: Odisea 2015 Lewis Vineyard The Temp Tempranillo (Clements Hills)

description: This is a fabulous gran reserva from a very good but lightly heralded vintage. Aromas of spiced plum, black olive, fig, tobacco and cassis come together like a puzzle. A deep, pure palate shows near-perfect balance, while this tastes of plum, berry fruits and earthy spice. Smooth, elegant and chocolaty on the finish, this delivers all one can ask for from Rioja. Drink through 2035.
title: CVNE 2011 Imperial Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: As usual, the Cailloux is co-fermented with Viognier. The oldest of the Cayuse vineyards, it's really coming into maturity, delivering a tour de force performance in this new vintage. Aromatically explosive, it opens with floral and citrus—notably orange peel—then fills out with a lush palate bursting with cherry fruit, and the winery's characteristic, savory, umami flavors. The finish seems unending.
title: Cayuse 2010 Cailloux Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This big but smooth wine has a seductive spicy, oaky aroma, rich and generous fruit flavors, a good layer of tannin to add mouthfeel and a lingering, delicious finish. The layers of flavor match layers of texture for an irrestible combo. 10% Cabernet Franc and 4% of the Portuguese variety Touriga Nacional contribute to the flavor complexity.
title: Di Arie 2011 Estate Grown & Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)

description: Banana and lacquer aromas blend with pickled white fruit scents and brine. It's by no means a fresh and inviting Chardonnay; instead, it's a bit mustardy and briney, and not terribly fresh in feel. Is that sauerkraut on the finish?
title: Undurraga 2009 T.H. West Limarí Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)

description: Concentrated, compact aromas of black fruits are generous but also monotonous and low on character. A big, bulky palate is round but offers enough acidic kick to keep everything above water. Baked, flat flavors of black fruits and roasted meat finish smooth but low on pulse. Drink through 2017.
title: Linaje Garsea 2009 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Alluring notes of pastry dough, spiced blackberry and strawberry-flavored fruit leather carry onto the succulent, medium- to full-bodied palate. Firm tannins bolster the wine's nutty herbal-tea flavor, and it concludes with a textured finish.
