description: Dry spice and wild herb aromas are prickly and blend into larger plum notes. The palate is snappy and choppy, with oaky cream, berry and spice flavors. Finishes dry and woody, with mild tannic bite. Good but regular.
title: Viña Mayor 2009 Tinto Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

description: This is buttery to a fault, with the overpowering aroma of microwave popcorn. Once in the mouth, the simple fruit flavors are buried, and the finish leaves a lightly bitter impression.
title: David Hill 2010 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Forward in style, with lightly toasty, creamy aromas that accent baseline apple and tropical fruit scents. The palate cruises at a good pace, with citrusy apple, lemon and green pear flavors. Long, lingering and a little loud on the finish, with more than ample power and zest.
title: Ruca Malen 2009 Yauquen Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Floral muscat-like aromatics persist in this wine. This is a tight, firmly crisp in acidity example of the variety that is integrated and moderately ripe.
title: Taft Street 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Ser Lapo is a celebration of Tuscan Sangiovese with refined berry aromas and cherry undertones followed by blue flower, cola and spice. The color, consistency and fruit flavors are all excellent.
title: Mazzei 2006 Ser Lapo Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: Fragrantly floral, it offers ripe red fruit in delicate balance, its tannins softened and the oak imprint kept at a minimum. The vines are thought to be more than 25 years old, the clone and rootstock unknown. An elegant, tightly woven Syrah.
title: Fields Family 2011 Estate Syrah (Lodi)

description: Smells like a mix of leather, olive paste and sea foam along with bold berries. The palate is saturated and layered, with thick blackberry and full, herbal accents. Chewy and beefy stuff, with a brooding, bulky personality and an herbal, baked finish.
title: Santa Rita 2006 Reserva Shiraz (Maipo Valley)

description: This is a classic Russian River and Williams Selyem Chardonnay, so bright in acidity and rich in fruit, you hardly notice the oak. Papayas, tangerines, peaches, pears, Meyer lemons and minerals mingle perfectly with vanilla, buttered toast and acidity, producing a wine of elegance and creamy flair. Drink it now, but not too cold.
title: Williams Selyem 2012 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This newish winery swings for the fences with this dramatically ripe, soft and complex young Cabernet. It's made in the modern style, with appealing blackberry, black currant, dark chocolate and sweet oak flavors that impress for sheer intensity and flamboyance. Seems somewhat generic, in the way of cult Napa Cabs, but awfully good. It remains to be seen if a wine like this can get staying power, given the competition.
title: Crosby Roamann 2009 Dark Garden Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: One of the first bottles to bear the name of this new growing region, the aromas are light with notes of baking spice, cherry, vanilla and Red Vines. The fruit flavors are sweet and supple, backed by lightly grainy tannins.
title: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2014 Single Vineyard Syrah (Eagle Foothills)

description: A dry, austere Riesling, with what one hopes will be considerable cellaring potential, Dry River's 2009 Craighall displays apple and lime accents and a long, citrus-rind, almost lip-puckering finish.
title: Dry River 2009 Craighall Vineyard Riesling (Martinborough)

description: A distinctive, sweet, resiny note dominates the aromatics, suggesting an herbal flower such as calendula. Those notes highlight the flavors as well, with hints of pollen, fresh herb and ripe apple.
title: Martin Woods 2016 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Super-tannic, one of those dry Napa red wines that makes you wonder why you opened it now. It's just so tough and astringent, offering more pain than pleasure, which leads to the question, will it age? Well, there's good cherry-blackberry fruit. But this is Merlot, not Cabernet. Risky.
title: Reverie 2007 Estate Merlot (Diamond Mountain District)

description: Baking spice, wild berry and violet aromas escape the glass. The lithe palate is rather lean, offering cranberry, tart sour cherry and a hint of star anise alongside taut tannins and firm acidity.
title: Caparzo 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

description: The bright and inviting nose is loaded with lively red fruit, including raspberries and cherries, along with a soft hint of vanilla. Incredibly lightweight with soft fruit flavors; easy to drink.
title: La Forge Estate 2008 Unfiltered Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: A terrific example of drink-now pleasure from the Barossa, this Shiraz deftly combines cedar and vanilla notes with dark fruit flavors. It's richly textured, with velvety tannins and crisp acids that frame the long finish. Drink now–2020.
title: St Hallett 2013 Faith Shiraz (Barossa)

description: Apart from being part of a sparkling wine blend, Aligoté is found in the Côte Chalonnaise where it produces ripe full wines. They have a delicious crisp green fruit and floral character. It is a wine to drink young and fruity, so drink now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Buissonnier  (Bourgogne Aligoté)

description: Tightly packed blackberry, wood-smoke and black-pepper aromas are remarkably vivid in this full-bodied, rich and creamy-textured wine. It's big in structure, attractively oaky, and filled with ripe, exotic but classic meaty spicy gamy flavors.
title: Vasco Urbano 2015 Henry Hayes Ranch Syrah (Livermore Valley)

description: Made in the popular style, with vanilla oak, cream and sweet buttered popcorn notes dominating the pineapples, apricots and peaches. Production was 8,093 cases.
title: Magistrate 2008 Limited Production Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This has a raspberry aromas that is sweetened by a graham cracker note and deepened by a leather accent. It feels round, well balanced and lively, with berry, cassis, chocoalate and spice flavors. The finish is solid, echoing the palate's flavors and feel.
title: Primus 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: This wine seems sweet and refreshing, with juicy flavors of orange, apricot and peach, leading to a spicy finish. It's polished and drinks well now; try it with Asian fare.
title: Whitehall Lane 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Exotic strips of lemon zest mark this wine, followed by intense acidity that begs for food to tame it down. The vineyards involved are on the cooler side. Expect spice and tangy grapefruit to glide on the finish.
title: Schug 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine has a crisp, steely texture. The apple and citrus flavors and the wood underlay make this a food-friendly selection.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010  Saint-Romain

description: This nose on this wine is dense and after some time in glass reveals appealing ripe blackberry and raspberry fruit, drying violets, mint and a savory, earthy mushroom and soy sauce aroma. The palate is big and the tannins have power. They're fine grained and chewy but not chunky. The fruit is sweet but lifted, not jammy. Drink now with time in decanter and proteins or for the next 10 years.
title: Penley Estate 2015 Steyning Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)

description: The flint and sand soil of this vineyard brings out the minerally, steely character of this taut, tight wine. While it is herbaceous and flavors of pineapple and white fruit, the structure dominates. Give this impressive wine another year or two.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2010 La Chapelle des Augustins  (Sancerre)

description: Being 100% varietal, the aromas of black currant, boysenberry, graphite and cherry are piercing and pure. The palate puts and emphasis on texture, showing layers of lightly jammy dark fruit flavors that pique the interest, with a long finish only upping the enjoyment.
title: Substance 2013 Super Substance Cs Stoneridge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Big, smoky fruit and a nicely honed structure combine well in this full-bodied wine with touches of red cherry and berry and toasted wood.
title: Pope Valley Winery 2013 Eakle Ranch Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Pear and nectarine flesh are cut by a quince, Gala apple and slightest touches of guava and mango on the chalky nose of this wine. It's refreshingly light on the palate, with sliced pear and squeezed lime notes, bound by a very grippy texture.
title: Zaca Mesa 2014 McGinley Vineyard Homage Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: A Mendocino Sangiovese with odd vanilla notes that's stingy in fruit and tannin.
title: Girasole 2010 Sangiovese (Mendocino)

description: Bradley Brown's appellation blend is a nice entry point to this exciting winery. This wine shows lavish smoked black currant and plum flavors, with aromatically lifting spices of anise and black pepper and a savory roast-beef element. The palate packs lots of pepper and relies on plump black cherry, boysenberry and a dark-chocolate syrup richness.
title: Big Basin 2013 Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A block selection, barrel-fermented and aged in French oak, this brings rich scents of spice, toast and white pepper, and tight, compact tree fruits. As it airs, flavors of buttered nuts come up, leading to a long and delicious finish. Drink 2018–2028.
title: Domaine Serene 2013 Clos du Soleil Vineyard Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

description: Dried herb and lavender highlight a smooth, rich and round palate of wild strawberry and blueberry in this well-made light-bodied wine.
title: Balletto 2015 Estate Grown Syrah (Russian River Valley)

description: Grown on the producer's 1,800-foot-high, dry-farmed property west of St. Helena from 40-year-old vines, this is a great wine, structured and elegantly designed to highlight cassis, clove and cigar. Thick, heady tannins soften in the glass, allowing room for enviable structure and a black pepper-dotted finish.
title: Smith-Madrone 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

description: Lively and crisp, this wine hints more at fragrant red berries and red fruit than the tannins of Cabernet. The structure is there, but in the background, giving the wine a chance at a couple of years' bottle aging.
title: Steininger 2011 Rosé Sekt Cabernet Sauvignon (Österreichischer Sekt)

description: Fiery at first, this also has mint and toast notes to the otherwise black-fruit-scented nose. It feels tannic and drawing, but strong boned. Flavors of roasted black fruit are bolstered by olive, chocolate and spicy toast accents. Finishes savory and firm.
title: Lamadrid 2010 Single Vineyard Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Agrelo)

description: This is a very rich, fruity Sauvignon Blanc, offering waves of pineapple, guava, lime, green apple and honeysuckle flavors. Crisp acidity gives it a fine tartness. Nice for drinking now with spicy tapas appetizers.
title: Novy 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: Hard, crusty leather is the opening aroma, then a touch of tar gives way to notes of tobacco, latent oak and perfumed, mature fruit. It feels full, grabby and on the cusp of being syrupy, with roasted berry and spice flavors. It shows an herbal, hot side on the finish.
title: Ochoa 2004 Single Vineyard Reserva Tempranillo (Navarra)

description: A touch green and herbal/spicy on the nose, with lively red berry and plum aromas. Snappy and zesty on the palate, with red berry, citrus and herbal olive at the base. Finishes solid, with some heat. Juicy, healthy and herbal.
title: Santa Ema 2009 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This vintage is accented by 8% Malbec and 5% Cabernet Franc, aged a year in French oak, much of it neutral. Earth dominates on the nose before thick, sultry blackberry, cassis and tobacco join rich, firm tannin and punches of oak for a satisfyingly approachable experience.
title: Director's Cut 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Aromas of juniper and green herbs are raw and austere. This cool-climate Cab Franc is severe in feel, with tart currant, oak and green flavors. Hard tannins, spice notes and herbaceous red-fruit flavors control the finish.
title: Loma Larga 2012 Unfiltered Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)

description: As usual when young, the oak is obvious in the 2006 Octavius, reeking of smoke and cured meats. But there's also balancing raspberry fruit and hints of green peppercorn. This is full bodied and a bit tough and chewy on the finish; give it a few years to soften and integrate. Drink 2014–2020.
title: Yalumba 2006 The Octavius Shiraz (Barossa)

description: The nose of this wine is shy, just hinting at passion fruit and citrus foliage. The palate is juicy yet imprecise, finishing dry, light, clean and refreshing.
title: Adolf & Heinrich Fuchs 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Steiermark)

description: Good Chardonnay, rich and ripe and steely. That metallic thing shows up both in the crisp acidity and in the stony, pebbly tang that adds a piquant freshness to the pineapple, lime tart, tangerine and smoky custard-cream flavors.
title: Rochioli 2008 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Savory aromas of baked raspberry, cranberry and vanilla are somewhat foxy. Flavors of raspberry and pomegranate are nearing overripe, with layers of pepper and grippy tannins that offer some much needed structure. The finish is all tannin and spice.
title: Markko 2012 Select Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Ohio)

description: Plenty of pepper and dark red cherry aromas meet with crushed asphalt, beef char and a touch of tar on the nose of this bottling. There is decent energy to the sip, where roasted black cherry, pepper-crusted beef and hints of rosewater and oregano make for a very quaffable wine, perfect for backyard barbecues.
title: Dracaena 2015 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

description: Blended with 12% Petit Verdot, this comes from spot picking the estate site for older estate vines atop Pritchard Hill. Floral in violet, it's smoothly textured and lightly spiced, with a delightful brambly note of black raspberry. The tannins are expansive and slightly sweet in mint chocolate, complementing the peppery, spicy elements well.
title: David Arthur 2014 Old Vine Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Raspberry and strawberry aromas include a note of tomato sauce. This feels fairly spineless, but not outright flat. Herb-infused flavors of berry fruit and bell pepper finish steady but are devoid of complexity.
title: William Fèvre 2015 La Misión Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: With 12% Sémillon in the blend, this is a lovely, fresh, almost exuberant Sauvignon Blanc. Bracing and textural, with good varietal character but no excessive herbaceousness, it's loaded with fruit flavors of melon, grapefruit, kiwi and apple. A fine mix of precision and length.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Made from Oak Knoll District grapes, including 20% Sauvignon Musqué, this wine spends time in both stainless steel and French oak. Fleshy in white peach, apricot and melon, it offers balanced acidity and layers of texture.
title: Ladera 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Ripe, juicy Conference pear, clearest Mirabelle plum and ripe lemon meet on the fragrant nose. These flavors mingle on the concentrated palate with wonderful juiciness, helped along by the bright lemon freshness. Zesty texture adds precision. The finish is dry and mouthwatering. This is utterly lemony, dry and moreish. Drink 2020–2035.
title: Stadt Krems 2017 Ried Grillenparz Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

description: Beautifully aromatic hints of Cox's Orange Pippin apple are surrounded by overtones of orange and lemon on the nose. The palate makes this fruity array even more precise and appetizing. All is drawn precisely due to bright citrus freshness—think ripe lemon, tart red apple and tangerine. There is concentration, ripeness and utter freshness and quite a bit of power. The dry finish lets these notions speak all the more clearly. Drink through 2030.
title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2015 Praelatenberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: A rich, creamy wine, with flavors of buttered toast, vanilla cream, pineapple and orange. It's rich, but fine in dry acids and minerals.
title: La Crema 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Loads of sweet, pure, ripe and refined blackberry fruit in this dry, young Cabernet. It's very tannic, with a lockdown astringency, but the fruit is so strong, it punches right through. The idea here clearly is the cellar. Eight years seems like no problem. Twenty years may not even be pushing things.
title: Charles Krug 2008 Estate Grown Celebrating 150 Years Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Tough and chewy, with stringy tannins and lots of acidity perking up red licorice and cherry flavors. Drink now.
title: Casa Tiene Vista 2012 Sir Charles Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Yes, a certain amount of acidity is desirable in Australian Riesling, but this one is exceedingly lean and crisp. Perhaps it will blossom with age, but for now it is simply intensely citrusy and rather skinny. Pair it with oysters, or put it in a cool dark place and hope for the best.
title: Château Tanunda 2010 Grand Barossa Riesling (Barossa)

description: Light but pleasant aromas of baked apple and spice are followed by dry and clean fruit flavors. There's not a lot of complexity but the variety is unmistakable.
title: Latah Creek 2016 Familigia Vineyard Chardonnay (Ancient Lakes)

description: Silky-smooth tannins surround a foundation of herb, cherry and plum before integrated oak gives way to thicker, richer elements of tobacco, smoke and chocolate. A well-made, 100% varietal wine, it offers exuberance and elegance.
title: Piña 2012 Wolff Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)

description: This wine's exotic aromas include spice cake, cocoa powder, graphite and blackberry. The palate is juicy yet tight as a drawn rubber band, with high acidity. Its spiced plum flavors are herbal and enlivened by salt and pepper notes. The finish is driven by racy acidity. Drink through 2022.
title: Viña Leyda 2015 Single Vineyard Canelo Syrah (Leyda Valley)

description: Sultry and rich with ripe black cherries and dark damson plums, this menthol-spiked Merlot is a stand-out with an intensity in fruit and body that's unusual in the Finger Lakes. Brisk acidity and a dry, elegant palate keep things in balance through a soft, vanilla spice finish.
title: Shalestone 2008 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

description: Rubbery on the nose, then sharp in the mouth, with herbal, sour plum flavors and weird funk as well. Bitter, tart and hard on the finish.
title: Finca El Origen 2010 Syrah (Mendoza)

description: This special commemorative bottle celebrates the 60th anniversary (1947–2007) of one of Italy's flagship wines. The characteristic aromas of Sangiovese come through loud and clear in the form of bright pulses of wild berry, blue flower, light spice and dried tobacco. The wine is bright and tight on the finish. Hold this bottle in your cellar.
title: Ruffino 2007 Riserva Ducale Oro  (Chianti Classico)

description: Made in the popular style, this Chardonnay is heavy in oak, with ripe, jammy orange, pineapple and creamy lees flavors. It's a good wine, if not particularly subtle or complex.
title: Alysian 2010 Russian River Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Strong, ripe fruit and oak characterize this opulent young Chardonnay. It's flavors of pineapples, oranges and mangoes are rich, dry, honeyed and accented with a note of buttered toast. Drink now.
title: Schug 2010 Heritage Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Dry spicy aromas of balsam wood, cherry and berry fruits come in front of a bumpy rough palate with purpose. Roasted spicy berry flavors are oaky and finish with drying tannins and lasting barrel notes.
designation: Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate
title: Viña Bisquertt 2014 Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Does just what Merlot is supposed to do, giving you a soft, friendly but complex red wine, with Napa flair and a fair price. It's dryish in the mouth, with candied raspberry and cherry flavors that are kissed with smoky oak.
title: Flora Springs 2011 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Like many of Keuka Lake Vineyard's excellent Rieslings, the Evergreen Lek benefits from time spent in the glass, slowly opening in flavor and aroma. Initially a bit subdued with savory apple and nut tones, it builds in texture and complexity, revealing fascinating layers of lime, fresh herb and stone fruit.
designation: Estate Grown and Bottled Evergreen Lek Vineyard Dry
title: Keuka Lake Vineyards 2011 Estate Grown and Bottled Evergreen Lek Vineyard Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Gentle and open, this is a ripe, apricot flavored wine. It has light acidity, its pleasure coming from the generous, full texture. It's ready to drink now.
title: Cave de Lugny 2011 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This wine was barrel fermented and aged in 100% new French oak. Aromas of sweet spices, toast and stone fruit are followed by a full-bodied palate. It shows a lovely sense of texture.
title: Ashan 2014 Conner Lee Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Called after a former name for the Sauvignon Blanc grape, this wine is well balanced between ripe fruit and crisper herbal flavors. A strong minerality gives the wine its youthful texture. Crisp at the end, it is still full and concentrated. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Tinel-Blondelet 2014 Génetin  (Pouilly-Fumé)

description: Made from a several sites within the appellation, this wine is marked by full-barrel caramelization and an inviting nod to brioche. Toffee and cinnamon interweave within its rich, thick waves of texture. Tropical mango allows for a hint of fruit amidst the darker flavors.
title: La Crema 2014 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A very good but not great Cask 23, showing plenty of decadence and flair but not perhaps that extra edge of complexity. It's forward now in sweet new oak and flashy, jammy blackberries, cherries and raspberries. The tannins are quite an achievement, rich, vibrant and supple. Made from 100% Cabernet, it's full-bodied and dense, with a chocolaty finish. Could gain in the bottle beyond 2012 to about 2018.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2006 Cask 23 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Dry peppery currant and red-plum aromas are light and nothing you haven't come across before. Plum flavors are a touch baked, with a chocolaty backdrop. A solid finish with savory, spicy plum notes is satisfying.
title: Echeverria 2013 Gran Reserva Merlot (Curicó Valley)

description: Harsh and jammy, with thin flavors of cherries and pepper, accompanied by sharp acids. Okay in a pinch.
title: Oak Grove 2008 Reserve Shiraz (California)

description: A common wine, slightly sweet and simple in construction, showing jammy flavors of raspberries and cherries. Finishes somewhat bitter, with green tannins.
title: Parkers Estate 2008 North Peyton Block Merlot (Sonoma County)

description: Forest floor, leather and tobacco aromas come together on this. The brawny palate shows dried cherry marinated in spirits, grilled herb and a hint of star anise alongside the heat of evident alcohol. Tight close-grained tannins provide firm support. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind then drink to capture the remaining fruit.
title: Abbadia Ardenga 2012 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Dark, with a complex nose mixing very ripe, raisiny fruit with smoke and a hint of spoilage. The wine seems pushed just over the edge, losing focus and definition. The fruit quickly gives way to leaf and forest floor flavors in an herbal, earthy finish.
title: Silver Lake 2007 Roza Hills Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rattlesnake Hills)

description: The grapes come mainly from the Rancho Santa Rosa vineyard, which is a great one, source to many top-scoring Chardonnays over the years. The wine is brisk,  tart and clean, with rich, dramatic flavors of pineapple, lime, honeysuckle and buttered toast. Really elegant and wonderful, and should blossom through early 2012.
title: Longoria 2008 Cuvée Diana Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This Chardonnay is tight and concentrated, with ample acidity and flavors of citrus, peach, apricot and tropical fruit. There's a hint of minerality, and the finish is touched with toast and vanilla. Don't drink it too cold.
designation: Three Coins Betsy's Vineyard Cannon Block
title: Lawer 2012 Three Coins Betsy's Vineyard Cannon Block Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: It tastes as if Noceto is getting a better and better handle on this tricky grape variety. This wine captures the tension along with the complexity and generosity of this traditional Tuscan grape. It has intriguing smoke, raspberry and black-pepper aromas, lively cherry and cranberry flavors and good gripping tannins in the texture.
title: Noceto 2015 Marmellata Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: Plump black-currant, wood oil and licorice aromas show on the fairly ripe and deep nose of this bottling from northern San Diego County. Tannins rise quickly as does prominent acid on the palate, where black-fruit and darker-spice flavors reign.
title: Castelli Family Vineyards 2014 Estate Sangiovese (Ramona Valley)

description: A dense vanilla-bean character coats a nose of seared white peach and toasted nuts. The palate features thick, ripe fruits, preserved lemon, a touch of walnut and a rocky grip.
title: Inception 2013 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: From the Cognac region, this ripe, totally fruity wine has no suggestion of wood aging. Attractive apple and light citrus flavors are ripe and right up front. Acidity adds freshness to the end. Drink now.
title: Maison des 3 Ponts 2014 Maison des 3 Ponts Chardonnay (Charentais)

description: Smells oxidized, as if it's dying. The palate is bland in feel and the flavors suggest fermented orange juice. Not hideous but uninspired; shows only a modicum of citrus character and pulse.
title: Familia Cassone 2009 La Florencia Sauvignon Blanc (Luján de Cuyo)

description: A deep gold color and effusive aromas of dough, toast and butter start this wine off with a bang. The flavors are rich, vivid and nicely oaky, giving up butterscotch, toast and lemon curd along with softer vanilla and pear tones. It is generous and rich in texture.
title: Domaine Anderson 2015 Walraven Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: This is a forceful, simple wine, with a slight herbaceous quality that keeps it varietal and cooler-climate in style and weight. Bright red fruit shines in a light-bodied frame.
title: Kenwood 2014 Merlot (Sonoma County)

description: Delicate aromas of new leather, wild berry, chopped mint and a balsamic whiff of eucalyptus come together on this stunning wine. The palate is still youthfully restrained, but already offers juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and a hint of truffle set against tightly wound, refined tannins. Bright acidity provides balance. It needs time to unwind and fully develop but promises to blossom into a stunner. Drink 2023–2038.
title: Salvioni 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

description: This offers aromas of plum, tangerine peel and a hint of hay. The no-frills palate offers prune, vanilla and star anise alongside firm tannins that lead to a rather abrupt finish. Drink after 2021.
title: Canneta 2013 Le Bruciate  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Young, vigorous and direct, showing little more than potent blackberries, black currants, dark chocolate and oak. The structure is really refined, and the tannins are soft, rich and complicated. So will it age? It's made in the modern cult style, which is increasingly suspect when it comes to the cellar, so drink now.
title: S. P. Drummer 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: Malbec and Petit Verdot are the other two grapes in this juicy, toasty blend. There's plenty of black cherry fruit, and equally generous flavors of mocha and toast, all wrapped together around ripe, slightly grainy tannins.
title: Alder Ridge 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Forward aromas of game and earthy spice notes are upfront on the bouquet, with notes of mulled berries, red plum and fig providing a concentrated, fruity backdrop. Earthy tones continue to dominate the medium-weight mouth, as flavors of tree bark and baking spice flood the palate and linger long into the finish. Fine tannins lend a satiny, smooth texture to the mouthfeel.
title: Mullineux 2009 Syrah (Swartland)

description: Racy acidity and oak-inspired lemon, lime and tropical fruit flavors mark this bone-dry, elegant wine, with a minerally edge. Don't drink it too cold.
title: Windsor Oaks 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe black-fruit aromas include notes of prune and raisin. In the mouth, this Syrah is bold, focused and full of energy and tannins. Flavors of dark plum, wild berry and chocolate end with fresh, wiry acidity that creates length. Drink through 2022.
title: Marques de Griñon 2011 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Syrah (Dominio de Valdepusa)

description: Rubber, flower petal and candied fruit aromas comprise the unique bouquet. The palate is solid but edgy, bearing grabby tannins and heaviness, with sweet flavors of blackberry, cassis and pepper. Monotone on the finish, then bitter at the very end. This is 100% Cabernet Sauvignon.
designation: Marqués de Badajoz El Marqués Dulce
title: Bodegas Medina 2007 Marqués de Badajoz El Marqués Dulce Cabernet Sauvignon (Extremadura)

description: Aromas of smoke, sawdust and herbs are followed by lighter-styled cherry and cranberry flavors with spice accents.
title: Darby 2011 Aunt Lee Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Baked apple, bread crust and sweet spice abound on the nose and palate, with a solid peach-pit nuttiness that lingers on the medium-length finish. Medium weight with a lush texture, but good acidity enlivens the close.
title: Sieur d'Arques 2009 Toques et Clochers Méditerranéen Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: From vines around the village of Epfig (“E”), this is a wonderfully pure wine that's fragrant and crisp. It has apple and citrus flavors lightly blessed by honey. Acidity cuts right through the fruitiness, giving the wine a tight and steely aftertaste.
title: Domaine Ostertag 2011 Vignoble d'E Riesling (Alsace)

description: Here's a big, rich, fruity Cabernet that satisfies for its array of blackberry, cherry, currant, mineral and oak flavors. It's dry and tannic, and the overall quality is quite high. The price makes it a good Buy. Drink through 2014
title: Fuse 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Truffle, forest floor, grilled herb and a whiff of mature plum lead the nose. The solid juicy palate presents dried Marasca cherry, ripe cranberry and hints of baking spice framed in rounded fine-grained tannins that leave a drying close.
title: Val di Toro 2015 Reviresco Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: A proprietary blend of 81% Cabernet Sauvignon with 11% Malbec and 8% Syrah, this is a big bold wine, full of flavor. Green and black olive play against juicy blackberry and mocha, with lingering hints of cedar and tobacco.
title: Kelly Fleming 2014 Big Pour Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Attractive white-pepper aromas and powerful dark-fruit flavors combine with firm tannins in this full-bodied wine. It is bold and a bit rustic, and should pair well with a juicy hamburger or rich lasagna.
title: McCay Cellars 2013 Lot 13 Vineyard Tempranillo (Lodi)

description: On the oaky side of things, with lots of cedar, vanilla and baking spices supported by vaguely plum-like fruit flavors and plenty of weight on the palate. Drink it over the next few years.
title: Willow Bridge 2007 The Dog Shiraz (Western Australia)

description: This is a fresh, open and very accessible wine. Crisp acidity cuts through the green apple flavors and tangy, mineral texture. With juicy fruitiness, it is a light wine that is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Gérard Duplessis 2014  Chablis

description: This 100% Cabernet is firm in tannins and concentrated with fruit. Flavors of blackberries and black currants have a mineral edge, while new French oak brings sweet, toasty caramel notes. As luscious as it is now, you might want to give it six years of additional age.
title: Conn Creek 2009 Saffron Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

description: Smells bright, citrusy and clean, an impression followed in the mouth, where intricate flavors of pineapple, lemondrop candy and Key lime pie turn spicy on the finish. The acidity is brisk; the wine did not go through malolactic fermentation. Just shows that a great Chardonnay doesn't need oak, although sur lies aging gives it a notable creaminess.
title: Cambria 2007 Unwooded Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Tart, acidic hard-candy fruit flavors come through, along with hints of sweet spices. But the wine quickly hits a wall, stopping abruptly in a short, tight finish with austere tannins.
title: Griffin Creek 2012 Merlot (Rogue Valley)

description: Meaty, big-boned and steeped in both woody oak and tannin, this is a brawny full-bodied wine with ample concentration. The midpalate takes on a succulence of juicy black currant and black cherry, finishing with a leathery accent.
title: Bennett Lane 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Smoke, honey and delicate white flowers meld luxuriously on this not-quite-dry beauty. Sweet white grapefruit juice flavors are intensely concentrated on the palate, highlighted by a shower of lime zest and a stony minerality on the finish.
title: Hermann J. Wiemer 2009 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Even grapier than the Cabernet Sauvignon, this forward, light, candied, confected wine has a hole in the middle. The tannins turn quite astringent, a marked contrast to the sweetness of the fruit.
title: Gilbert Cellars 2007 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)

description: Full and spicy from the get-go, with hints of clove vying with savory berry and leather. The optimum word to describe this wine is friendly, meaning it delivers ripeness, berry flavors and sweet, spicy accents that complete the package. Leans toward baked and sweet but keeps things properly framed.
title: Marqués de Campo Nuble 2006 Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Wiry, scratchy blueberry and black-currant aromas come with an odd soapy perfume. This feels choppy, with outsized acidity and oak making their presence felt. Salty, briny plum flavors are cutting, while the finish feels raw and astringent.
title: Concha y Toro 2013 Marques de Casa Concha Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Barrel-fermented in entirely new Russian oak, not something one sees every day, this somewhat thin, while ripe, wine offers a curious combination of anise and ham.
title: Trinitas 2012 Family Collection Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: Rich and elaborate, a crowd pleaser to satisfy just about any Cabernet lover. Although it's potent in classic blackberry and cassis flavors, it shows a dryness and balance that you could call Bordeaux-style. Should develop easily for a decade in the cellar.
title: Joel Gott 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Lots of rich flavors in this affordably priced Chard. It brims with golden mango, orange jam, buttercream, butterscotch, glazed donut and caramel flavors, finished with zesty acidity.
title: Cameron Hughes 2012 Lot 427 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Deep aromas and flavors, full body and a firm, tannic texture make this wine bold and attention-getting. It tastes like juicy black cherries and ripe black plums, has a grippy mouthfeel and good acidity. It will be best after 2018.
title: City Winery Chicago 2013 Alder Springs Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Mendocino)

description: Thick chocolate and tar exude on the nose before a palate of tar, leather and tobacco adds to the robust mix. Dry tannins aim and deliver on the lengthy finish after a medium-bodied impact of black tea, blueberry and black pepper.
title: Pride Mountain 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Sonoma County)

description: Stiffly structured, this wine holds tight to its blackberry and black-cherry flavors with very firm tannins that leave a drying sensation. It has a good core of ripe black cherry and black pepper but will need to pair with a fat juicy piece of meat to tame its astringency.
title: Matchbook 2014 Tempranillo (Dunnigan Hills)

description: Char, toast and dark chocolate barrel aromas are out front, with herb and cherry lurking underneath. Full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors. The wood influence is heavy, but there's enough fruit to largely stand up to it.
title: Love That Red 2015 Seattle Slew Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Bold smoky aromas join equally bold and concentrated fruit flavors in this full-bodied well-oaked wine. Beyond the wood smoke and grilled meat components are ample blackberry, dark chocolate and black-cherry flavors.
title: Daniel Cohn 2015 Bellacosa Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: The wine smells and tastes like fresh, crisp pippin apples, has a lively, refreshing texture and soothing fruity aftertaste.
title: One Leaf 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Very consistent in style with previous vintages, this textural, lemony, racy Riesling seems bone dry, though it is noted as having 1% residual sugar. Along with rich flavors of grapefruit and citrus, there are nectarine and pear fruit highlights and a sharp minerality.
title: Chehalem 2008 Corral Creek Riesling (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This is arguably the best of the current Agate Ridge reds. It's a nicely focused Syrah, mixing flavors of raspberry, chocolate and coffee syrup into a ripe bundle. The tannins are supportive and proportionate.
title: Agate Ridge 2009 Estate Syrah (Rogue Valley)

description: Rich wine, full of yellow fruits, apricots and peaches that give ripeness. It has weight, a solidity that is balanced by the totally refreshing acidity. Hints of the wood aging give spice as well as adding to the rich effect. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2010 Les Chaniots Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: Light on its feet, this cool-climate Syrah shows just-pressed elderberry and boysenberry on the nose, with hints of cedar, herbs and game. The palate is restrained, likely a reflection of the young vines, with clean and easy flavors of berry, thyme and white pepper.
title: Spear 2016 Estate Grown Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Lots of classic varietal character in this Cabernet. It's very dry and rich in blackberries, cassis and herbs, with a kiss of smoky oak. The tannins are a bit sticky now. Give it 2–3 years in the cellar.
title: Peter Franus 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This wine contains mostly Cabernet Sauvignon from Discovery and Champoux vineyards, with pinches of Klipsun Merlot (8%) and Champoux Cabernet Franc (4%). Its black currant, cassis, blackberry, graphite, scorched earth and herb notes intoxicate. The palate is ripe, textured, layered and generous but still tightly wound, with polished tannins and an extremely long finish. It is a Cabernet Sauvignon prototype—a complete standout that is delicious now but will have a long life in the cellar. Best from 2023–2035.
title: Passing Time 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: You can't beat the low price and overall good cheer of this fresh Italian Chardonnay in a screwtop bottle. The golden-colored wine reveals a soft and smooth texture accented by pretty aromas of stone fruit, honey and almond nut.
title: Lagaria 2008 Chardonnay (Delle Venezie)

description: Nothing but fruit in this cleverly named, unoaked Chardonnay. The wine shows intense, long hangtime flavors of limes, oranges and exotic tropical fruits, heightened by crisp acidity and a strong minerality that accentuates and delineates the flavors.
title: Carmel Road 2010 Liberated Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Peachy aromas meet with Key lime pie and grapefruit pith on the nose of this bottling. The palate is crisp in texture and citrusy in flavor, if a tad sour.
title: Integrity 2016 Riesling (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Textured and medium bodied, this wine has a simplicity of citrus and peachy stone fruit buoyed by bright acidity. Fermented entirely in stainless steel, it was aged in concrete, stainless steel and French oak. It displays the concentration of the vintage.
title: Flora Springs 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: A subtle savory earthy leathery aspect adds intrigue to this medium-bodied and rather soft-textured wine. The fruit component is light raspberry.
title: Cavaletti 2016 The 109 Mile Grenache (California)

description: This very floral and herbally tinged bottling shows fresh crushed thyme, black peppercorns, lavender and woody blackberries on the nose. The palate shows some of the same, but descends into a very purple Concord grape flavor.
title: a-non-ah-mus 2010 Alisos Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Starts out grapey and big, but soon it finds its focus. The palate is wide and fruity, with balanced tannins and acidity propping up black grape and blackberry flavors. There's some smack to the finish, but the berry flavor is prime and the wine gets better with air. One of Tamaya's best Cabs to date. Imported by Ecovalley Quality Wine Group and National Refrescos Import Company, LLC.
title: Tamaya 2008 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Limarí Valley)

description: A lovely effort from proprietor Raimund Prüm, this plump, creamy-textured spätlese displays ample minerality—there's a distinctly slate-driven note—allied to ripe apple, stone fruit and citrus. Sweet but not overwhelmingly so, this would be terrific with slightly sweet or spicy dishes.
title: S.A. Prüm 2009 Graacher Himmelreich Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: With a rare if tiny showing for the Blaufränkisch grape (3%), which this estate grows on their Los Olives property, this is a tangy, tart and lean Syrah, with bright cherry fruit, coffee, light menthol, tobacco and cedar on the nose. Aromatic wood flavors of pipe smoke and cigar box show on the palate, along with red cherry fruit, vanilla and sagebrush elements.
title: Solminer 2013 Vollmond Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Cobblestone's regular Cabernet is very consistent from year to year, a good wine but not a great one. This 2007 is superfruity, with a blast of blackberries, cola and currants. Drink now–2015.
title: Cobblestone 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

description: There's an indulgence of oak on the nose and palate of this wine, which makes it more challenging for the aspects of pear, nutmeg and melon to shine through. The acidity fights to make its mark, too, resulting in a medium- to full-body feel.
title: Gibbs 2013 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Cocoa, woodspice, licorice and cherry aromas are out in front in this wine, accenting light-bodied dark fruit flavors. The tannins seem a bit gritty, but it otherwise provides appeal.
title: J. Scott Cellars 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Grass and bell pepper aromas define the nose on this lithe white. Following the nose, the palate is tangy, angular and sharp. Lively flavors of lemon, scallion and tarragon finish long, with hard-driving acidity.
title: Garces Silva 2014 Boya Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Smoothly round and rich, this blends Cabernet Sauvignon from three sites, including Vineyard Georges III in the heart of Rutherford. Vanilla-tinged oak meets cherry cola flavor and juicy, fresh acidity. It's moderately structured and full-bodied.
title: Sojourn 2014 Proprietary Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Deep, lush, balanced and oaky, with bacon, floral notes and huge raspberry and cassis aromas. Layered and structured across the palate, with concentration and balance to go with lusty cassis, blackberry, mocha and spice flavors. Finishes toasty and dark, with waves of espresso and mocha. Now–2015.
title: Bodega Catena Zapata 2007 Catena Alta Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: From a southern-exposure, 3.7-acre vineyard, this presents a rich style of Sauvignon Blanc. It has all the minerality the chalk soil can give, at the same time offering ripe citrus and zesty acidity. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Pascal Jolivet 2017 Clos du Roy  (Sancerre)

description: Floral and fruity, with clean aromas. In the mouth, it's saturated and intense as if offers up a meaty set of dense fruit flavors. Doesn't show as much complexity, layering and variety as we might like to see, but it's pretty flashy and good for a 2007, a vintage that was problematic in this region.
title: Neo 2007 Punta Esencia  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Fresh apples, spring blossoms and yogurt scents make for a deliciously tempting nose. On the palate, it's dry and full bodied, with a good concentration of that fresh apple flavor. The alcohol feels just a tad high, but the acidity is balanced and the finish long with a warm, nutty tone.
title: Peconic Bay Winery 2009 La Barrique Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Winemaker Henrik Poulsen worked alongside the late Denis Malbec on this winery project, which is relatively new to the appellation. Deep brambly berry aromas rise from the glass in this elegant effort, blended with tiny additions of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Brown-sugar flavors accent a velvety rich and smooth texture, the tannins tamed and softened.
title: Acumen 2014 Peak Edcora Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

description: Coombsville has emerged as the hottest appellation in Napa Valley, and Cameron Hughes is right there, doing his negociant thing. The Cabernet was blended with Malbec and Merlot, and the wine is fantastically satisfying. Its rich, sturdy tannins frame elaborate blackberry, blueberry, red currant and smoky oak flavors that are wonderfully complex, with an elegant, balanced finish. This is an unbelievable price for a Cabernet of this high quality.
title: Cameron Hughes 2011 Lot 451 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

description: Though not planted until 2001, the east-facing Lone Oak Vineyard is adjacent to the legendary vines of Garys' and Rosella's. The nose conveys lemon-lime soda and white rock minerality, and flavors combine baked apple, yeasty bread and lime. Bright acidity exhilarates the tongue, making a perfect partner for a lunch of shellfish, halibut or chicken salad.
title: Testarossa 2012 Lone Oak Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Heavy and sweet in cherry and blackberry flavors, this blush wine shows why Cabernet Sauvignon is a challenging variety for rosé. While it's a sound wine, it lacks vivacity.
title: Keating 2012 Rosé of Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Slightly vinegary on the cherry-laden nose, with a mild but persistent briney character. The palate is high in acid, leading to some scour, but the flavors of plum and berry, while generic, are pretty good. Finishes with hints of toast, pepper and spice. Solid enough for $8.
subregion: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Ermita San Antonio 2009 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Woody, expansive, gritty and grippy, this is an exotic, delicately layered wine from the historic producer, so good in its complexity and lightness of being. Bread and salted butter greet lemon zest and stone fruit along with a line of sophisticated acidity and stony mineral intrigue. This wine will do well in the cellar; enjoy 2025–2030.
title: Stony Hill 2015 Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)

description: Chanson owns four acres, a quarter of this premier cru. This 2011 is smooth, rich and very elegant. Fruitiness is striated by a mineral, tight texture that gives a touch of steeliness. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Chanson 2011 Les Chenevottes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is a well-priced Chardonnay that's rich and properly varietal. It's fruit-forward in pineapples, papayas, green apples and pears, with a subtle oak influence. The texture is smooth and creamy.
title: Kirkland Signature 2012 Signature Series Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lingua Franca, a Larry Stone/Dominique Lafon project, offers a challenging, absorbing lineup of Chardonnays and Pinot Noirs. The Avni bottling is tangy and tight, with white peach and melon fruit and hints of toasted nuts and butter. The finish extends gracefully, keeping you riveted.
title: Lingua Franca 2015 Avni Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: An elegant wine that is appealing for its pure mineral expression. There's papaya and lemon fruit here, with a sophisticated caramel undertone that carries over to the medium finish. Drink now or hold a few years for more nuance.
title: Hay Shed Hill 2008 Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: For this wine, grapes are sourced from cooler sites within the valley, as well as from a high-elevation site on Mount Veeder. Together, they provide a juicy, fleshy core of apple and pear girded by mineral-laden texture and tension. The finish is marked by oak-derived toast and brioche notes.
title: Chappellet 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Ripe, clean apple aromas meet with a touch of green honeydew and an interesting note of cut celery on the nose of this wine from the Riboli family. The palate offers decent tension and verve, with flavors of chilled pear juice and fresh lemon rinds.
title: Maddalena 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

description: There's a stunning amount of action on the nose of this bottling by Josh Jensen, with dried jasmine, lemon curd, squeezed tangerine, key lime pie and a warm touch of nuttiness. Rounded stonefruit and apple blossoms show on the palate, which is bound by a grapefruit pith grip and features a steadily growing salty character that comes on smooth and strong. A botanical twist hits the finish.
title: Calera 2014 Chardonnay (Mt. Harlan)

description: A blend containing the major Bordeaux varieties, this has lots of acidity and tannins, plus flavors of sweet cherries, blackberries and pepper. Drink now with robust fare, like Santa Maria barbecue.
title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2010 Merlot (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: This pure Cabernet does not have the sweet, forward, jammy aromatics of many red wines from this ripe vintage. It's stiff and tight, tannic and herbal, with a structure suited to play off a thick, juicy steak.
title: Airfield Estates 2012 Runway Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

description: Charred and smoky on first take, this has plenty of upfront oak that adds a toasty quality to the core plum and berry aromas. It feels full, round and pure, with dark, slightly balsamic-like flavors of baked berry and earth. It's smooth, mild and unobtrusive on the finish. Drink now–2016.
title: Ysios 2007 Reserva Edición Limitada  (Rioja)

description: Sugary sweet and simple in the modern style, with vanilla, caramel, buttered popcorn, orange jam and toast flavors.
title: Foodies 2010 Chardonnay (California)

description: Whiffs of caramelized sugar and smoked nuts accent aromas of ripe, concentrated peaches and nectarines on this intensely juicy semi-sweet Riesling. It's fruitiness makes it unabashedly approachable, but it's stately in feel with bold mineral and smoky earth tones that linger on the finish.
title: St. Urbans-Hof 2011 Kabinett Feinherb Wiltinger Alte Reben Riesling (Mosel)

description: Buoyant and blossomy, this semidry Riesling bursts of fresh apple and grapefruit flavors and a distinctly floral perfume. A tart lime edge frames a brisk, clean finish. Drink now to appreciate its freshness and aroma.
title: Lamoreaux Landing 2014 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Composed and showing no overwrought oak or tropical fruit aromas that so often plague Chilean Chardonnay. A smooth operator, with toasty apple and mineral aromas leading to a ripe but cleansing palate and finish. This is like winemaker Marcelo Retamal's favorite child; with proper guidance it is growing better every year. Best overall Chardonnay to date from Limarí.
title: De Martino 2008 Legado Reserva Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)

description: Fresh-pressed boysenberries give zest to dusty aromas of tobacco and strong shoe leather on the nose of this bottling. Tobacco shows powerfully on the palate, as do dill, marjoram and black pepper. Dark fruit, from blackcurrant to elderberry, provides the base.
title: Magistrate 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This smooth-textured, mature-tasting and medium-bodied wine offers lots of fruit character. An earthy vein runs through the aromas and flavors.
title: Barrel Racer 2013 Sangiovese (California)

description: Good, but not without problems. It's dry and tannicly smooth in the mouth, with black cherry and mocha flavors. But there's a tart, sandpapery roughness that's just a little short of ripe. Drink now.
title: Hawkes 2006 Stone Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: This wine comes from one parcel that has particularly flinty soil. With a strongly mineral character, it is tight and nervy, needing some time to calm down. The fruit is all there, fresh citrus, apples and green plums, all ready to burst out over the next few months. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Paul Thomas 2014 Silex  (Sancerre)

description: Roasted pear, light banana and baked-earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Muddled flavors of pome fruit, lemon peel and melon arise on the palate, which is a touch flat in texture.
title: Cinnabar 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Alluring scents of ripe plum, tobacco, underbrush, fragrant blue flower and a whiff of new leather set the tone. The taut tightly-knit palate delivers juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and baking spice framed in bright acidity and a backbone of assertive, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2038.
title: San Polino 2013 Helichrysum  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This is the inaugural vintage for this producer, a husband-and-wife team in partnership with winemaker Maayan Koschitzky, who also works with Philippe Melka. The vineyard-designate is lush and powerful, a full-bodied, tannic representative of an amazing growing year. Mint, black olive, blackberry and cigar highlight the sensual texture, enriched in dark chocolate.
title: Brilliant Mistake 2013 Taylor Family Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: This offers fruit cocktail aromas, with canned pears and light honey, making for an inviting if not varietally typical nose. The flavors are light once sipped, closest to nectarine and apricot. This would be a very drinkable lunchtime wine.
title: Esser 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

description: This is dryish to off-dry, with simple lemon, lime and honey flavors.
title: Markham 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: With layers of coffee, spice and cedar enveloping scents of ripe black fruit and bramble, Hazlitt's Cab is beautifully composed on the nose. It's lean in style and body, however, with a black plum palate marked by whiffs of sweet tomato and green leaves on the finish.
title: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Finger Lakes)

description: Sleek and sappy, this was fermented with native yeast and aged nine months in 50% new French oak. There's a spine of iron keeping it a bit stiff and compact, with concentrated fruit flavors of crème de cassis. Still young and slightly grapey, it's best to cellar it a few more years, for a drinking window of 2020 to 2030.
title: Cowhorn 2012 Reserve Syrah (Applegate Valley)

description: Starts with leather, cedar and chocolate, then adds in plenty of cherry-berry fruit and some herbal notes. It's full bodied and richly textured, with a long, lush finish that just lacks a little nuance. Drink now–2018.
designation: Hand Picked Single Site Fromm Vineyard Lyndoch
title: Yalumba 2006 Hand Picked Single Site Fromm Vineyard Lyndoch Shiraz (Barossa)

description: An interesting wine that's picking up some aging characteristics. The primary blackberry and cherry flavors are drying, accentuating earthier, mushroomy notes, while the oak has become fully integrated. A complex, low-alcohol wine that should gain traction over the next 6–8 years.
title: Bonneau 2006 Hyde Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Carneros)

description: Dark, concentrated and practically dripping with ripe berry flavors, this wine shows the benefit of extra aging. It is unusually focused and delicious. Hints of cocoa and coffee join the dark blueberry and blackberry-syrup flavors, with very little evidence of oak.
title: Fenestra 2011 Estate Syrah (Livermore Valley)

description: Rubber and asphalt aromas dominate the nose of this high-acid coastal Syrah that's about as shearing as they come (only 12% abv). Additional scents of olive and savory plum feed into a tight palate that lives on a hard beam of natural acidity. Flavors of tomato and citrus are tart and end with a raw, juicy finish.
title: Casa Marin 2010 Miramar Vineyard Syrah (San Antonio)

description: From one of the most dramatic vineyards in the entire state comes a bottling almost as impressive. Refreshing Key lime and mandarin zest mesh with sea shells, chalk and honeysuckle on the precise, steely nose. A chalky tension binds the palate around flavors of lemon-lime, grapefruit flesh, nectarine and a touch of vanilla.
title: Albatross Ridge 2014 Estate Chardonnay (Carmel Valley)

description: A big, hard, dry Cabernet whose mountain tannins need quite some time to resolve. Right now they're tough as nails, although the blackberry fruit is so brilliant and intense, it punches right through. Give this dramatic wine at least six years, and it could well develop beyond the next decade.
title: Von Strasser 2008 Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

description: A delightful bistro wine from a producer who's specialized in Rhône-style wines for decades. It's dry, with pleasant raspberry, strawberry, orange zest, vanilla and spice flavors, wrapped into the silky texture of a fine Pinot Noir.
title: Quivira 2009 Wine Creek Ranch Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

description: An easy-to-drink wine, with a tart tang of gooseberries to the orange, lemon and lime flavors. A good value for a dry, crisply clean sipper.
title: Hess Select 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

description: Somewhat rustic, hard edged, not much pleasure here.
title: Louis Latour 2008  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Smells dark and compact, with black-fruit aromas, floral notes and a minor herbal influence. Feels mild and lean, with soft tannins and dry flavors of berry fruit and barrel spice. Short and not overly flavorful on the finish.
title: Chilensis 2010 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: At the age of nearly five years, this Cab is at a stage where it won't develop further. It' a softly tannic wine, with simple berry-cherry and oak flavors.
title: Pietra Santa 2008 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Cienega Valley)

description: The 2016 vintage is strong for this well-established winery's Chardonnays, and this twist-top appellation blend is a more affordable way to indulge. Broad, fleshy aromas of ripe Asian pear, sea salt and nectarine tart lead into a rich palate that's rip with lemon and yellow pear but defined by penetrating acidity and decent tension.
title: Bernardus 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Too oaky, with over the top sweet vanilla candy, butterscotch and caramel flavors. Somewhere under all that is a decent wine, crisp in acidity and rich in pineapple fruit.
title: Center of Effort 2008 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Not clear that Cab Franc deserves a bottling on its own, as it's better as a blending wine. That said, this is a pretty, polished red wine, full-bodied and dry in cherry, spice and oak flavors. Drink now and over the next five years.
title: Reverie 2008 Estate Cabernet Franc (Diamond Mountain District)

description: Dark blackberry fruit meets with raw game on the nose of this bottling. Tangy black-plum flavors meet with a funky kick on the palate.
title: Estancia 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: There's a soft, candied appeal to the cherry, strawberry and blackberry flavors in this dry, young wine. With a sweet oak jacket, it's clean and pleasant to drink now.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2009 Wetzel Family Estate Syrah (Alexander Valley)

description: Dry grainy, full-force oak aromas are front and center, with spiced apple notes playing in the backdrop. This is scorchingly oaky, with about as much toasty new oak as any Chardonnay can handle. Flavors of burnt wood and resiny apple finish extremely woody.
title: Viña Cobos 2015 Bramare Los Arbolitos Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Light aromas of red plum and raspberry lead to a wiry, snappy feeling palate with a mix of raspberry, plum and cocoa powder flavors. This is a lean, juicy Tempranillo with modest character and a clean finish.
title: Finca Nueva 2008 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: Two vineyards go into the making of this wine, including Stonestreet Estate. A nose of plum and dried cherry ride along an extracted palate of relative lightness and notes of soy and tomato leaf.
title: Arrowood 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Not bad for a seven buck Chardonnay in a screwtop. Shows plenty of varietal flavor in the buttercream, honey and pineapple flavors. Easy to find, with 20,000 cases produced.
title: flipflop 2009 Chardonnay (California)

description: Made with 100% Syrah, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, cooking spice and a hint of smoke. The forward palate delivers blackberry jam, clove and black pepper alongside assertive tannins. Drink through 2020.
title: Tenuta Rapitalà 2016 Nadir Syrah (Sicilia)

description: This wine is somewhat dull in texture and elusive in fruit, offering a strong sense of oak and sulfur.
title: Merriam 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is powerful but well-balanced, showing a ripe black-fruit aroma and rich black-cherry flavor. Moderate tannins and bright acidity yield a lip-smacking texture. The appealing fruit flavors are lightly accented by subtle oak spice.
title: Lava Cap 2015 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)

description: Chunky, herbal berry and plum aromas are the introduction. A tight, grabby, tannic palate delivers herbal plum and berry flavors backed by scratchy tannins. Overall, this is a good and fair rendition of Chilean Cabernet.
title: Ventisquero 2013 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: While this isn't easy to identify as Shiraz, it still qualifies as a good, everyday red wine. Rubbery berry aromas come with a pinch of spearmint, while the palate feels juicy and racy. Berry and mild oak flavors finish with a chocolate note and a rubbery accent.
title: J. Garcia Carrion 2012 Ópera Prima Shiraz (La Mancha)

description: Spicy and bright, with an almost-too-ripe note to the fruit. Sweet ripe berries are joined by hints of sweet tomato and fecund, autumnal flavors, suggesting that this Syrah should be consumed sooner rather than later.
title: Owen Roe 2009 Ex Umbris Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This producer's balanced style of Chablis shows well in this wine that is poised between freshness and a richer, smoother texture. Bright and packed with green and white stone fruits, it will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Gueguen 2017  Chablis

description: Earthy, lightly stalky aromas of leathery plum and currant are not overly assertive. This has a slightly gritty, grating feel, with acidity outmuscling body. Oaky flavors of vanilla and spice accent red plum and pie cherry, while this finishes dry, with lively acidity. Drink through 2020.
title: CVNE 2011 Viña Real Crianza  (Rioja)

description: An excellent value for this low price, this is an easy-going wine that would pair with tuna salad, sliced ham and cheese, or vegetables with a creamy ranch dip. The wine is clean and tonic with a good touch of acidity on the close.
title: Castellarin 2009 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Aromas of Bosc pear, apple, diesel and apricot lead to elegant fruit flavors. It drinks just a hair off dry. The concentration seems a bit wanting but what's there is well balanced.
title: Pacific Rim 2014 Solstice Vineyard Riesling (Yakima Valley)

description: This blend of grapes from Shaw and Jones vineyards has vanilla, papaya, banana and baking spice aromas that lead to broad fruit flavors with a lightly creamy feel. With caramel notes on the finish, it's a delightful interpretation of the variety.
title: Seven Falls 2015 Chardonnay (Wahluke Slope)

description: Cofermented with just under 5% Viognier, this varietal wine was aged in neutral French oak, the better to let its earthy core speak loudest. Mushroom, pine forest and black pepper highlight a broad brawny plate that's densely packed and moderately structured.
title: Pride Mountain 2014 Syrah (Sonoma County)

description: Blended with 15% Mourvèdre, this hails from Stoney Vine, Stone Tree, Olsen and Red Heaven Vineyards. Its generous raspberry, black pepper, herb and orange peel aromas are fresh and pure. The palate is rich and ripe, with a smoked meat-filled finish that carries into the distance.
title: Dusted Valley 2014 Stained Tooth Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pristine pink grapefruit and quince notes perfume this primary, juicy Riesling. Off-dry in style with a forward, fruity disposition, it offers easy-drinking tangerine and lemon flavors with just a touch of slate. Enjoy now.
title: Von Der Leyen 2016 Riesling (Nahe)

description: This producer continues to impress with varieties that are outside the usual suspects, showing finesse with this dry expression of waxy apple and tart lemon. Creamy on the palate, it exuberantly releases stony minerality as it goes, finishing with a taste of wet stone.
title: Imagery 2014 Upper Ridge Riesling (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)

description: Maple-tinged oak aromas are huge and frame equally massive black-fruit scents. A tight clampy palate needs time to soften and expand; it's hard and unyielding now. Flavors of black fruits, coffee, chocolate and heavy oak finish firm and peppery, with a reprise of grabby, grating tannins. Drink from 2020 through 2030.
title: García Figuero 2011 Noble  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Not disappointing given the price. There's some toast and tropical fruit on the nose, and then pineapple and mango flavors. The acidity runs a bit sharp, but overall this is a reasonable, warm-climate, tropical Chard for the money.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2009 Reserva Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: Although this is mild on the nose, almost to the point of neutrality, there's a speck of red fruit to be found with airing. It feels lively and a bit acidic, with juicy, jumpy flavors of red plum and cherry.
title: Bodegas Ontañón 2011 Vetiver Rosado Tempranillo (Rioja)

description: Crisp and fresh on the nose, this bottling offers lime skin, lemon juice, crushed flint and graphite aromas. It's tightly wound and zippy on the palate, but with ample flavors of Asian pear flesh, grippy chalk and a Key lime twist.
title: Gainey 2016 Limited Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Concentrated lilac and violet flowers paint a pretty picture to the beef char and creosote darkness on the nose of this bottling from a Los Olives vineyard. The palate blends boysenberry, blackberry, coffee and bittersweet dark chocolate, loaded atop a very firm structure.
title: Bernat 2010 Intrigue Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This SB smells neutral except for a pinch of grassy green. The palate is tangy, while citrusy flavors are not specific. On the finish, this is zesty at first and then falls off.
title: Porta 2013 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Bío Bío Valley)

description: Ripe, sun-warmed peaches and a flash of lime zest frame the rich but wonderfully dry palate of this clean-cut, grown-up Riesling, which has enough concentration to balance that linear acid.
title: Steininger 2012 Novemberlese Reserve Riesling (Kamptal)

description: Many Australian wine prices look unsustainable in the long run, but in the short run, consumers are the beneficiaries. This value-priced offering features fresh herbs, bright cherry fruit and a touch of baking spices, all in a reasonably full-bodied package. Drink now.
title: West Cape Howe 2008 Zeepaard Shiraz (Western Australia)

description: Inviting aromas of blackberry preserve on rye toast, cigar box, split pine, dill and black olive show on this single vineyard expression by Billy Wathen. Lifted by a slowly simmering acidity, the palate is earthy and forest-driven, with mushroom, juniper, pine needle, strawberry and dried mint flavors.
title: Foxen 7200 2013 Vogelzang Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: Dark, crusty aromas mix with sweet coconut on the nose, while the palate seems lactic and oaky despite fairly pointed acidity. Berry and plum flavors are entirely regular, and the finish is sharp due to the aforementioned acidity. A bit leafy tasting as well.
title: Four Aces 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: This expression of Chardonnay from Abruzzo in Central Italy delivers amazing intensity and opulence, but what sets this particular vintage apart is the purity of its aromas. The drying mineral note in particular appears vibrant and fresh and gives backbone to the whole wine. Long-lasting flavors of apricot, honey and almond cap the finish.
title: Masciarelli 2007 Marina Cvetić Chardonnay (Colline Teatine)

description: Bogle's knack for producing value wines shows again in this crisp, flavorful Riesling. It's a little sweet, with orange, mango and vanilla flavors balanced by zesty acidity.
title: Bogle 2009 Riesling (California)

description: Nice and dry, with solid black cherry, herb and smoky tea flavors that finish in a swirl of tannins. Easy to drink with steak, pork loin, a great cheeseburger.
title: Cameron Hughes 2009 Lot 230 Cabernet Sauvignon (Chalk Hill)

description: Elegant and feminine on the nose with lovely cassis, toasted oak and violet notes, this medium-bodied Cab is another excellent bargain from Romania's Prahova Valley. Sturdy tannins and a pleasant astringency add structure to the luscious, ripe red fruits on the palate. It's high in acid, but well balanced, ending in a puckery, sour cherry finish.
title: Prahova Valley 2008 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Dealurile Munteniei)

description: There's a chalky, almost sweet element to the mouthfeel that recalls Pez candy or lemon soda. The fruit aromas are bright, intense and make up for the streamlined mouthfeel.
title: Castelfeder 2010 15er Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This is an easy-drinking style, attractive in aromas of peach, pineapple, pressed yellow flowers, and butter that flow right into a light- to medium-weighted palate. A slightly chalky texture with more tropical fruit flavors carry to a spicy, vegetal finish. Drink now.
title: Shoofly 2015 Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)

description: A woody nose smells of maple and spice. This is a racy feeling Cabernet with full tannins and a lot of wood-based resin to the palate. Lightly herbal plum and berry flavors are accented by heavy wood spice, while hickory is the key flavor on the finish. Despite heavy oak, this is a top-notch Cabernet to drink over the next five to seven years.
title: Rutini 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Aromas of fresh bread and baking spices lead to buttery appley flavors in this well-balanced and reasonably crisp wine. It is light to medium in body, but has a good sense of ripeness.
title: Bee Hunter 2016 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Aromas recall nail polish remover, overripe fruit, oak vanilla and coffee. The palate offers black cherry mingled with vanilla, chocolate and sweet oak. However it lacks intensity and persistence and doesn't have an age-worthy structure. It closes on a drying, tannic note before trailing off.
title: Caparzo 2008 Vigna La Casa  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Nice and dry, with a good cut of acidity balancing out the ripe black cherry and cola flavors. Fully drinkable now for the soft tannins, it's a pleasant wine that wants pairing with a grilled, salted and peppered steak.
title: Jorian Hill 2008 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This smells bland but clean, with a hint of citrus. It feels spritzy but simple, with papaya, green melon and mild citrus flavors. Good in a very basic way, but drink now before it fades.
title: Bodega NQN 2010 Malma Finca la Papay Sauvignon Blanc (Patagonia)

description: This is 100% varietal. The fruit for this wine hails from Obelisco, Klipsun and Olsen vineyards. Almost completely closed up on first pour, it opens to reveal aromas of the blackest of cherry, crème de cassis, graphite, fresh herb and luxurious barrel spicing (88% new French). The flavors are rich and ripe but still reserved, showing a very appealing sense of balance, with the tannins combed to a fine sheen. An impressively long finish caps it off. It should have a long life ahead of it.
title: Mark Ryan 2015 Lonely Heart Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: A classic high-end Carmenère, with enticingly rich, chocolaty, herbal aromas. The palate is lush but balanced, with a generous texture, smooth tannins and plenty of depth. Saturated in flavor, with blackberry, herbal notes, chocolate, spiced meat and more. Drink now through 2012.
title: Montes 2007 Purple Angel Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Leathery and woody is the first impression you'll get, but the palate excels with grippy warmth, a firm tannic structure and dark, plummy flavors that bring black olive, sous bois and sauvage flavors that are true to Rhône Syrah. Tasted by a three-person panel, the wine was unanimously well liked, with one reviewer finding it more hard and "clacky" than the others.
title: Delas Frères 2007 Les Bessards  (Hermitage)

description: The sun-ripened skin of yellow mirabelle plums and their ripe flesh suggest both texture and fruitiness. This burgeons with gloriously ripe fruit, which attains an apricot touch on the palate, but is held firmly and with beautiful poise by lemon zestiness and citrus freshness. A wonderful combination of generosity and tang with lovely concentration, brilliant fruit and a long finish.
title: Proidl 2015 Pfeningberg Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

description: Starting out reductive, this wine has aromas of wet copper penny, fresh herbs, woodspice and dark fruit. The coffee and black fruit flavors are high octane, seeming out of balance.
title: Inconceivable 2012 After the Floods Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Tropical fruits, flowers and citrus lead this appetizing Chardonnay from Peconic. On the palate, the wine has some depth, with lemon/grapefruit citrus, pear and apple. A good everyday white.
title: Peconic Bay Winery 2007 Steel fermented Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Barrel grain and spiced apple are the key aromas. This is round, chunky and not showing a lot of structure or backbone. Oaky flavors of butterscotch and baked apple end with a note of caramel.
title: Domaine Jean Bousquet 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Tupungato)

description: Light and smoky, this is a fruit-forward, soft wine. Berry flavors are balanced by the stalky texture. It's young, although very ready to drink.
title: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille  (Chinon)

description: Wet stone, pear peel and zesty lemon signal clarity and freshness on the nose. The palate stays slender and concentrated, sinuous in a ripe lemon note. There is a flowing current of lemon refreshment on the palate, with a harmonious balance and a clean finish. Lovely now, it is sure to blossom with bottle age. Drink now–2035.
title: Loimer 2017 Ried Seeberg Riesling (Kamptal)

description: Soft and somewhat waxy in texture, this is a dry, muted Chardonnay. The flavors suggest sweet hay and light tree fruits, and the finish fades quickly.
title: Hedgeline 2011 Chardonnay (Washington)

description: A big, firm 100% Cab, rich in blackberry jam and black currant flavors, enriched with lots of sweet, smoky oak. It's made in the modern cult style of soft approachability. It might age, but seems best now for sheer luxury.
title: Jean Edwards 2009 Seventy Four - Forty One Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This Chardonnay, as you may have guessed from the designation, is unoaked. What you get is fruit, and plenty of it, in the form of pineapples and peaches. There's a good burst of acidity on the finish.
title: Carmel Road 2012 Liberated Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: This is a simple, fruity wine, with blackberry, cherry and oak flavors that finish dry and crisp in Monterey acidity. It's compromised by a green, vegetal note of unripeness.
title: Formation 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey County)

description: This rusty-colored Merlot opens with roasted, herbal, burnt aromas of plum and currant. Light, fresh and saucy on the palate, this tastes of tomato sauce, pepper and barely ripe plum. Herbal, savory and green on the finish.
title: Tres Palacios 2013 Family Vintage Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: A remarkable wine from the appellation's westernmost property, this shows lemon, honeydew, pomelo pith, tangerine skin and a touch of hazelnut on the nose. Lots of steely notes power the palate, with flavors of honeysuckle, pears and tangelo racing across the tongue. It's a perfect Chard for shellfish.
title: Solomon Hills 2012 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This curious Chardonnay transforms rather dramatically in the glass. It's initially savory, with notes of dried herbs and leaves, but gradually it reveals touches of fresh lemon, apple and vanilla, accompanied by dashes of dusty minerals that linger on the finish. Full bodied and dry.
title: Peconic Bay Winery 2010 Lowerre Family Estate La Barrique Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: What's so likeable about this Cabernet is the dryness and the overall balance, which is stylish and elegant. It keeps the blackberry and black currant fruit in check with earthier tones of tobacco and olives.
title: Watkins Family 2006 Nuns Cliff Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: A rich wine, with a precise texture that offers layers of acidity. The fruit flavors are likely to open out this year, already hinting at peach juice richness.
title: Patient Cottat 2008 Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)

description: Tangy pear, lime skins and lemongrass aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a decent tension to the palate, where Bartlett pear and soda-like flavors of 7-Up arise.
title: The Archivist 2016 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
