description: One of three Sauvignon Blancs from J. Christopher, this limited-quantity, single-vineyard bottling mixes pretty citrus fruit with lightly grassy, herbaceous elements. Nothing is overblown, and everything combines into a seamless, fresh, delicious wine with oyster-shell minerality.
title: J. Christopher 2012 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

description: This tiny production (250 cases), single-vineyard wine is boisterous on the nose, with pushy aromas of violet petal, earthy berry, cleaning solution and citrusy oak. Pronounced acidity and a raw, resiny oak texture give a hard, choppy feel, while flavors of cheese, coconut, vanilla and raspberry announce a warm-vintage wine. On the finish, excess acidity and abrasive tannins call for additional cellaring; best from 2015 onward.
title: Monteabellón 2009 Finca La Blanquera  (Ribera del Duero)

description: The oak is heavy-handed, giving the wine strong buttered toast and caramelized flavors despite rich pineapple and lemon fruit. The winery's Stainless Unoaked 2011 Chardonnay bottling is more balanced.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2011 Estate Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This is a fragrant and full-bodied Tempranillo, with flavors of sweet cherry and plum and a leathery, long-lasting finish.
title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2009 Tempranillo (Lake County)

description: Dark berry fruit, loamy soil and dense purple flowers make for a pure straightforward nose on this bottling from the longtime producer. The palate shows pleasant flavors of black currant and black cherry with hints of vanilla and anise-laced biscotti. The tannins are chalky, tough nearly chunky, and will smooth with time.
title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Emphasizes intense passion fruit aromas that grow more pungent upon breathing. Feels tangy as it dances on the palate, with passion fruit, lemon-lime and tarragon flavors. Long and focused on the finish, with tons of zest.
title: San Pedro 2011 1865 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Made in a frankly sweet style, this Sauvignon Blanc has sugary flavors of lemon, lime and pineapple Lifesaver candy droplets. It's okay for folks who like a simple, approachable white wine.
title: Jericho Canyon Vineyard 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Schloss Saarstein's auslese is remarkably consistent year to year, testament to the greatness of the site and the quality of the farming and winemaking. The 2008 features cool, slate-driven scents softened just slightly by hints of superripe apples and ripe apricot. This medium-bodied wine is clean and tightly focused, with the sweetness admirably balanced by crisp acids. Should age 15 years or more.
title: Schloss Saarstein 2008 Serrig Schloss Saarsteiner Auslese 375 ml Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: Rich, savory and yet still beautifully floral, this is all that a Syrah can be. Dark and thick in the glass, it begins with aromas of stewed black plums, burned beef, tar and teriyaki, yet with the lift of violets. The palate shows similar cohesive qualities, from dark fruit to roasted game, and is leveled by dramatic black-pepper spice and a bright acidity.
title: Novy 2015 Gary's Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: An everyday wine for drinking at parties. It's dry, full-bodied, tannic and earthy, with hints of currants and oak.
title: Dixie Flyer Vineyards 2012 The Brakeman Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This wine has a good structure and richness. Ripe white stone fruits go with still-young acidity, a taut and mineral texture, and a perfumed aftertaste. From one of the better known of the Chassagne premier crus, this wine will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Les Morgeots Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Dark and a touch baked, with blackberry and spice aromas along with carob and creamy oak. Feels solid, saturated and healthy, with weight and herbal dark-berry flavors. Warm and scratchy on the finish, with length and depth.
title: Santa Carolina 2010 Reserva Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: Tangy aromas of lemon curd meet with warmer touches of Marcona almonds and cider-laced popcorn on the dynamic nose of this bottling. The palate starts with a melted butter richness before tangy citrus peels and savory sea salts combine for a long finish, where both butterscotch and vanilla also make an appearance.
title: Two Sisters 2015 Courtney's Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is concentrated on the nose and palate, with ripe, fleshy peach and a spray of yellow flower. Dry and medium bodied, it features zesty acidity and a hint of green herb on the finish. A great value wine to be enjoyed now.
title: Senator 2010 Varius Sauvignon Blanc (Viile Carasului)

description: Herbal and lean, with hints of sweet charred oak and tart cherries that combine to yield a slightly confected impression on the palate. Drink now.
title: Wolf Blass 2008 Yellow Label Cabernet Sauvignon (South Australia)

description: Buttercream, sea salt, caramel and lemon candy aromas show on the nose of this solid bottling. The flavors are full but not overly ripe, with yellow apple, poached pear, white peach and a sea salt character that keeps it mouthwatering.
title: Jekel 2014 Gravelstone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Zesty lime cuts razor-sharp edges into this buoyant, fruity Riesling full of white peach, apple and honeysuckle notes. Delicately honeyed, it's piercing yet lip-smackingly juicy, finishing on a lingering spray of green florals. It's an elegant, tightly structured wine that's stunning now but will hold nicely through 2020.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2014 Kaseler Nies'chen Kabinett Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: This is a pleasant fruity wine in a bottle that is too heavy for its attractively light and soft contents. There are red berry fruits followed by rounded tannins and layers of ripe fruits. Drink now.
title: Enoport 2013 Vinhas Altas Reserva Syrah (Tejo)

description: This has aromas of cedar, mature dark-skinned berry and scorched forest floor. The compacted palate offers dried blackberry, tobacco and licorice alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.
title: Patrizia Cencioni 2012 123 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: The aromas are still locked up but draw you in with notes of earth and barrel spice. The flavors are concentrated and layered, bringing a real sense of energy and richness. It's a knock out, with balance that is spot on and a finish that persists.
title: Fidelitas 2013 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: This lemon-scented Riesling has a bright apple character and hints of peach. It is also delightfully fragrant, while the finish is bright.
title: Lucien Albrecht 2012 Réserve Riesling (Alsace)

description: A dark, softly thick wine, with pleasant cherry, chocolate, cedar and spice flavors. There's some good depth, but the wine could use greater structure and complexity.
title: Oberon 2008 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: The 2008 Phoenix Cabernet displays amply concentrated notes of cherry, cassis and tobacco. There's plenty of stuffing here, with a long finish that fades slowly away to notes of dried tea leaves.
title: Penley Estate 2008 Phoenix Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)

description: Rich summer peach and yellow cherry flavors flood the palate of this deeply concentrated Spätlese. It's intensely fruity and forward, yet elevated by a crush of lemon-lime acidity and a crystalline clarity that's exhilarating. The finish is long and lip smacking.
title: Fritz Haag 2014 Brauneberger Juffer Sonnenuhr Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Tart, firm and simple, this wine lacks complexity and structure somewhat, providing quiet flavors of leather saddle and cedar amongst a soft rounded tannin profile.
title: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2013 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This vineyard has been source to some of Fogarty's greatest Chardonnays, and this 2009 bottling continues the tradition of excellence. It's bone dry and tart in acidity, with smoky oak and lees influences. But the real star of the wine is the fruit; the flavors of lemon and lime custard, papaya, guava and nectarine are delicious.
title: Thomas Fogarty 2009 Damiana Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Simultaneously green and sweet on the nose, with murky fruit aromas and marshmallow. Tannic and tight in the mouth, with crisp acidity pushing olive, herb and plum flavors. Peppery and drying late, with a final wave of minty green.
title: Chilensis 2010 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Nicely dry and crisply acidic, with a minerally scour of stone that cleans the mouth and gets the tastebuds watering. The flavors are of cool-climate lemons, lime and grapefruits. But shows a considerable note of green, feline spray that lowers the score.
title: Wrath 2009 San Saba Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

description: The wine is dull, without great character other than some light fruitiness and a hint of wood aging. Drink now.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2012  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This Elqui SB delivers green-fruit aromas of underripe melon and pea along with passion fruit. In the mouth, it shows good body and acidity, while grassy flavors blend with tropical notes. A green but not vegetal finish provides a good ending.
title: Mayu 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

description: Like this producer's other wines, this starts reductively with an oniony aroma that struggles to blow off. Citrus and tropical fruit and snow pea characters lie underneath but are pretty well hidden. The palate improves a bit, with a slippery texture and prickly, if slightly underripe, acidity, although the fruit still feels a little lost.
title: Te Pa 2018 Pa Road Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: There's a lot of promise in this blend of Grenache (85.5%), Syrah (10%), Mourvèdre (4%) and Roussanne (0.5%). Coming from a cool vintage, it's aromatic with notes of raspberry, white pepper, and flowers. The palate is light, tart and fresh.
title: Lookout Point 2011 Grenache (Rattlesnake Hills)

description: Rich, velvety blackberry and cherry flavors flood the palate of this decadently full-bodied Cabernet Franc. It's irresistibly juicy and forward, but invigorating acidity and shades of herb, bramble and fine-grained tannins lend depth and structure. The finish is languid and luscious.
title: Billsboro 2013 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

description: A 100% varietal wine blended from three vineyard sites, this has fantastic aromatics, floral and meaty in all the best ways. Sanguine, it flirts in black peppercorn, game and a density of black licorice, remaining sturdy and firm on the palate in leathery grace. Drinkable now, it has years to go, through 2022.
title: Eric Kent 2012 Kalen's Big Boy Blend Syrah (Sonoma County)

description: Earth, leather and herbal aromas blend with riper berry notes on the nose. This feels choppy, with cheek-scraping tannins. Flavors of minty herbal black fruits finish with chocolate, herbal flavors and stickiness.
title: Domaine Bousquet 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Tupungato)

description: Thick and dense, with managed tannins and a nest of oak, this marquee wine offers classic insight into the Napa Valley. It's weighty and somewhat smoky, with a lurking sense of minerality and balance. A powerful grip gives way on the lengthy finish to satisfying end notes of coffee and toffee.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2012 Cask 23 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Notes of sour apple and lemon accompany this wine's dialed-high acidity. Priced to sell, it'll suffice in certain settings as an apéritif or quaffer with snacks.
title: un4seen 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

description: Sharp and leathery on the nose, with murky, leathery aromas. The palate has a soupy but acceptable mouthfeel with flavors of roasted, savory berry and tobacco. Seems a little cooked and tired, but with just enough signs of life to make it worth a try.
title: Septima 2007 Tempranillo (Luján de Cuyo)

description: This wine includes small percentages (5% each) of Merlot, Petite Sirah and Petit Verdot. Altogether the experience is confectionery in marshmallow, mocha and blueberry, with a perception of sweetness amid its soft pillowy tannins.
title: Gibbs 2014 Three Clones Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Rich and oaky, with a golden color suggesting the oak that has been lavished on the pineapple, green apple and pear fruit flavors of the grapes. Barrels have provided richer layers of buttered toast and caramel. This is an exotic, dramatic Chardonnay, although it perhaps trades subtlety for opulence.
title: Mi Sueño 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: While a tad pulpy and overripe on the nose, there's a purity to the dark red fruit on the palate of this Virginia Cab Franc that penetrates amidst notes of fresh green leaves and herbs. Full bodied in style with just a hint of green bramble on the finish.
title: Bogati 2010 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

description: From a producer better known for its red wines, this is a notable white—although there is a slight coppery tinge to the wine's hue. Melon and herbal notes are true to the variety, as is the broad mouthfeel and faint tactile dustiness on the finish. Drink now.
designation: Mount Crawford Estate Grown Single Vineyard
title: Thorn Clarke 2010 Mount Crawford Estate Grown Single Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Eden Valley)

description: The wine is almost salmon in hue, but don't let that put you off. Layers of ground cinnamon help provide balance to the broad, ripe flavors of melon, pear and stone fruit.
title: Brancott 2014 Pinot Grigio (Marlborough)

description: This is a thick, concentrated version of the variety, tropically succulent in mango, papaya and a refreshing twist of lemon.
title: Peju 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Opens with pointed red fruit aromas as well as an herbal/green infusion. Feels grating and scratchy, with red currant, plum and milk chocolate flavors. Finishes with buttery oak and vanilla. Pretty much your standard fare Chilean Cab.
title: P.K.N.T. 2009 Gold Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)

description: Brings out Cab's herbaceous side, with an aroma of grilled asparagus and black pepper. An unsuccessful wine that's simply not ripe.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2007 Flood Family Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)

description: Opens with generic berry aromas and a slight candied, gaseous undercurrent. The palate is modest and lean, with decent raspberry flavors and not a whole lot of follow through. Basic and a bit rubbery.
title: Viña Vilano 2008 Tinto  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Consulting winemaker Michel Rolland oversees this bottling in the Long Shadows series. Fans of his forward, sometimes voluptuous style may find this vintage a bit thin. The fruit is peppery and the tannins chewy, while the barrel flavors of chocolaty oak have not quite assimilated. Further bottle age might improve the wine.
title: Pedestal 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Marked by a lean minerality, this Chablis-style wine is not one of those fat, opulent Chards that dazzles with sheer richness. It's more subtle than that, and more acidic. Structure, in fact, is the name of the game here, with its lemon and lime flavors that barely break into green apples. Fine now, if not served too cold, and for the next 2–4 years. Beyond that, wines of this kind go quickly downhill.
title: Morgan 2007 Hat Trick Double L Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a good medium-bodied wine for those who don't mind generous sweet-oak seasoning. It smells like maple syrup and brown sugar, and adds black-cherry notes on the palate along with another wave of oaky spices.
title: Chop Shop 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Blended with small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot, this offers high-toned spice, raspberry, matchstick, cherry and dried herb aromas. Its light, elegant fruit flavors make it a pretty expression of the variety.
title: Cloudlift Cellars 2015 Ascent Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

description: A pretty Sangiovese, gentle and easy to drink now. With crisp acidity, it has flavors of sour cherry candy, tobacco, red licorice and peppery spices.
title: Valley of the Moon 2008 Sangiovese (Sonoma County)

description: Soft and thin, with rustic berry, tobacco and spice flavors that finish sweet.
title: Waterstone 2008 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Lean and steely, with penetrating minerality, this bone-dry Riesling just begs to be paired with briny oysters or caviar. The palate boasts delicate apple and pear flavors that are layered with smoke, fresh fennel and a deliciously herbaceous finish.
title: Hosmer 2010 Vintner's Reserve Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

description: The berry, graphite, leather and spice aromas are light. The flavors are plush yet still restrained, showing a sense of balance that carries through the finish.
title: Snoqualmie 2013 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Luscious and creamy in mouthfeel, this ripe, full-bodied Chardonnay showcases almost tropical flavors of mango, melon and quince. Hints of vanilla and sweet spice are integrated nicely, leaving a crisp, clean finish that's surprisingly mineral. Ready to drink now but should hold till 2020.
title: Fitz-Ritter 2014 Dürkheimer Spielberg Trocken Chardonnay (Pfalz)

description: This straightforward, robust Rosso offers aromas of espresso, underbrush, and black berries. The warm, accessible palate delivers crushed black cherry accented with notes of baking spices and licorice. Enjoy now to capture freshness.
title: Col d'Orcia 2012  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Winemaker Nick Goldschmidt plies his trade mainly in California, but this effort from his native country is a winner, featuring a lush mix of nectarine, melon and tomato leaf that finishes long and harmoniously.
title: Nick Goldschmidt 2008 Boulder Bank Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Initial blackberry aromas are met with notes of olive, herb and violet petal. It feels tight, pure and not overdone, with baked berry, coffee and chocolate flavors. The finish is chocolaty and smooth, with some complexity.
title: Undurraga 2009 Founder's Selection Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Tropical fruit and vanilla-cookie aromas come with a note of nectarine. This feels juicy, racy and citric, with flavors of tangerine and nectarine. Despite having tangy acidity, the wine turns heavy on the finish.
title: Zuccardi 2012 Serie A Chardonnay (Uco Valley)

description: All estate-grown Cabernet, this textural, smoky wine weaves its pristine black currant fruit into a more complex display with herbal highlights and a sweet, toasty finish.
title: Gamache 2007 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Ruddy, ripe yellow peach and deep mineral tones go hand and hand in this lush, full-bodied dry Riesling. The palate is slick, almost oily, in texture, bolstered by fleshy yellow fruit and honey flavors. It's deftly balanced though, struck by reverberating notes of steel and slate that linger through a long finish.
title: Wittmann 2014 Westhofener Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Subtle oak gives the lemon, lime and peach flavors a creamy richness to this dry, easy-to-like wine. It did not undergo the malolactic fermentation, allowing it to maintain mouthwatering acidity.
title: Waterstone 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Punchy berry aromas lead to a fresh, direct palate with fairly sharp acidity. This shows flavors of plum, berry, herbs and spice, which are standard for Rioja. A lasting finish with mild oak and acidic snap wraps up this easy-to-gauge Crianza.
title: Viña Herminia 2012 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: Very tight wine, very mineral, with a distinct steel and coiled spring feel to it. Citrus and green apples dominate. This will age well.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2009 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Savory apple and lemon scents open this delicately composed, but intensely minerally spätlese. The palate is ripe, with juicy yellow peach and orange flavors, anchored by earthy tones of crushed rock and slate that linger on the finish.
title: Baron Knyphausen 2011 Erbacher Steinmorgen Spätlese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Biodynamically-farmed, old vine fruit from the Eola Hills vineyard is the source. The wine is forward and tangy, with a Vouvray-like sweet/sour character. It could be Chenin Blanc, only just a bit lighter, but with the same tart and tasty mix of acid and sugar, with lemony fruit and floral highlights. Really tasty.
title: Love & Squalor 2009 Riesling (Willamette Valley)

description: Aromas of toast, vanilla and citrus zest lead the way and carry over to the bright palate along with Golden Delicious apple, lemon drop and mineral. Firm acidity offsets the fruit flavors while a walnut note closes the finish.
title: Primosic 2013 Gmajne Chardonnay (Collio)

description: Jammy black currant aromas are rooty and medicinal. This young Tempranillo is hard and smacking on the palate. A forced-oak flavor of clove is dominant, while this is drying and raw on the finish.
title: Zumaya 2016  Ribera del Duero

description: This Syrah is heavy and minty, with plastic aromas. The palate is chunky and citrusy in feel, with little body. Flavors of clove, mint and berry lead to a resiny, almost fruitless finish.
title: Botalcura 2010 Litú Syrah (Central Valley)

description: This informal red suggests red fruit and baking spices on the nose. The simple palate offers wild cherry and clove flavors alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.
title: Tenuta di Trecciano 2016  Chianti Colli Senesi

description: Fleshy, full-bodied and floral, this wine is generously proportioned in stone fruit and Meyer lemon tones. These tones complement the palate well, giving a sense of substance and style.
title: Flora Springs 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: This is a seriously beautiful Chianti Classico characterized by impressive elegance and a smooth, long feel that lasts many long minutes on the palate. The nose is equally pristine with bright but integrated aromas of dark fruit, spice and polished river stone.
title: Castello di Ama 2006  Chianti Classico

description: Bordeaux wine should not have high alcohol; it detracts from the play between fruit and tannins, as in this wine. It is powered by its extracted structure, with flavors of bitter chocolate that leave the fruit behind.
title: Château des Landes 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: Dry, full bodied and firmly tannic, this wine begs for some rich meat or roasted bird with which to pair. It has good, solid dark-berry flavors and a sense of breadth on the palate.
title: Guenoc 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)

description: Snappy black raspberry and young strawberry aromas meet with white pepper, marjoram and a touch of vanilla bean on the nose of this estate bottling, a blend of two clones. Caramelized cranberry and underripe raspberry flavors show on the lighter-bodied sip, lifted by anise and clove.
title: Roblar 2016 Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Though pungent with crisp varietal grassy notes, this does not push that herbaceous character too far over the edge, as one-quarter was fermented and left on the lees in French oak barrels. The fruit flavors run to bruised apple and melon, which contrast with the herbal side.
title: King Estate 2016 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

description: Light aromas of citrus, white peach, soda water and herbs are followed by elegant, just off-dry, spritzy fruit flavors backed by a zing of acidity.
title: Convergence Zone 2014 Dewpoint Bacchus Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This starts with a startling but tangy lemon-tea flavor. Cinnamon and plum notes enter the palate, which are underscored by rather chalky acidity, and finished with a coffee highlight.
title: Northstar 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is sharper and more rustic than most other expensive Rutherford Cabernets, with a cut of citrusy acidity that dominates the cherry and herb flavors. While it's tough and hard to appreciate now, you never know if these aggressive young wines will develop with time. This one doesn't seem like it will benefit, so drink up.
title: Riboli 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Jumpy and aggressive on the nose, with a mix of charred, burnt, meaty aromas and saline, this struggles to register. A grabby, sticky, roasted palate tastes burnt and herbal, while the finish is charred and chocolaty.
title: Von Siebenthal 2010 Gran Reserva Single Vineyard Carmenère (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Aromas of mature dark-skinned fruit, espresso, baked plum and grilled porcini lead the nose. The tight, taut palate delivers fleshy Morello cherry, blackberry clove and licorice while close-grained tannins leave an assertive, tongue drying finish.
title: Cava d'Onice 2011  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Opens with aromas of funky fruit, sweet spice and Band-Aid. The palate is heavy and kind of flat, with weight and richness. Tastes candied and herbal, with a sweet and syrupy finish that's sticky at first and then burns a little as it fades away.
subregion: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Finca Constancia 2009 Parcela 23 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: A broad black-fruit scent defines this Cabernet Sauvignon, with muffled hints of blueberry, toast and cheese rind. The palate is marked by strapping tannins that tug on the upperlip, bearing flavors of toast and coffee bean.
title: Breaux 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Virginia)

description: Dry, creamy and crisp in acidity, this has rich pineapple, lemon, lime and buttered toast flavors. It's easy to drink and enjoy.
title: Martin Ray 2011 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Sweet, plummy and unrefined on both the nose and palate. This is nothing more than simple juice that isn't terrible. It's grapey, sweet and tart, with an edgy bit of tang to the finish. Regular at best; subpar if you're being critical.
subregion: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Bodegas Fariña 2009 Peromato Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: A voluptuous white wine with a bite of acidity to keep it buoyant and vibrant on the palate, this sings in lemon zest, orange blossom and ripe yellow apple. Lushly layered, it threads a needle of stony, salty complexity, finishing with full-flavored flair.
title: Ulises Valdez 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This Cab is so attractive to drink now that most people will lose the opportunity to age it. Don't be one of them. As delicious as it is now in blackberries and chocolate, it will be better in 2015 or 2016. But don't hold it much beyond that.
title: Mount Veeder 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Golden-apple, lemon-extract and toasted marshmallow aromas immediately reveal that this is a California Chardonnay, but one held in balance. The palate is clean and crisp with lemon and Asian pear flesh flavors, woven by a firm grip and strong acidity.
title: Martellotto 2017 Melodeon Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Still showing tannins as well as fresh, juicy red fruits, this wine is young and still developing. It is in a light style, fruity while with a core of tannins and stalky, black currant fruit. It is likely to remain a lean wine, a product of the 2013 vintage.
title: Domaine des Béguineries 2013 Réserve de Satis  (Chinon)

description: This is an oaky but airy Chardonnay with peach, melon and vanilla aromas. The palate mixes fresh acidity and creaminess with oak-based flavors of vanilla as well as more standard melon and banana. The finish features mostly woodspice and vanilla flavors.
title: Vega Sindoa 2011 Chardonnay (Navarra)

description: Soft and luscious, this has just enough tannin and acidity to give structure to the delicious black-cherry, cocoa and bacon flavors. Drink now.
title: Sebastiani 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Roasted meat, floral notes, peppery spice...sounds rather nice. Add in silky tannins, hints of coffee and blueberry and a long finish, and you have a pretty wine at a realistic price. Drink now-2014.
title: West Cape Howe 2006 Shiraz (Western Australia)

description: There's a sweet cherry and licorice flavor that makes this soft, direct Merlot taste candied. That sweetness lasts all the way through a sugary finish. Drink up.
title: Tedeschi 2007 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Some superripe notes give this wine a raisin-skin bitterness, but there's no denying its immediate lushness. Softly tannic, it has fantastic flavors of black currants and sweet toasted oak. If you drink it now, give it a few hours in the decanter.
title: Alpha Omega 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Voluptuous white peach and lighter butter notes form a classic nose set against a chalky backbone of lemon verbena and pink apple skins. The palate is tightly knit with lime skins, quinine and pink grapefruit pith, proving versatile and tartly acid-driven in style.
title: Roblar 2013 Gold Collection Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Too sweet, almost like a dessert wine, this Chard has sugary flavors of pineapple custard, with caramelized wood vanillins. Could use greater balance and subtlety.
title: Ruby Hill Winery 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Soft, fruity and gently textured, this wine has apple and citrus flavors and a hint of zestiness. Light and bright, it is ready to drink.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2017 Réserve Personnelle  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Aromas of white flower and ripe orchard fruit lead the way. The creamy palate doles out crisp apple, Bartlett pear and a hint of lemon zest alongside fresh acidity. It closes clean and crisp.
title: Alois Lageder 2016 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Piercing aromas of very ripe fruit, verging on scents of raisins and prunes, mix in with dark streaks of cedar, coffee, and baking chocolate. Nothing shy here! This is full-bodied, forceful, big, bold and still balanced, though not a wine to pair with anything but the most robust foods.
title: Hard Row To Hoe 2008 Cabernet Franc (Lake Chelan)

description: Crisp and clean lines of tart apricot, nectarine, Gala apple and honeysuckle ride a steely frame that characterizes the nose of this wine. Minerality shows first on the sip, but then the wine becomes ripe with apple, pear and peach flavors. A green-apple-rind tartness arises on the finish.
title: Angeline 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This Sangiovese hits the palate in a very direct and determined manner because of the biting acidity and high acidity that will make your mouth pucker. At the back are tones of bitter cherry and unripe plum.
title: Costa Archi 2008 Monte Brullo  (Sangiovese di Romagna Superiore)

description: Made with 100% Sangiovese, this opens with delicate aromas of violet, red berry, new leather and underbrush. The lean, straightforward palate delivers sour cherry, chopped herb and a hint of licorice framed in firm acidity and polished but fleeting tannins.
title: Avignonesi 2014  Rosso di Montepulciano

description: Aged mostly in stainless steel with a touch of new French oak (10%), this has notes of toast and char along with freshly cut mango. It's on the lighter side of medium bodied, drinking just a hair off dry with a bitter note on the finish.
title: Girardet 2011 Chardonnay (Umpqua Valley)

description: Dusty slate and mineral notes abound from nose to finish in this light-footed dry Riesling. It's not deeply complex but offers loads of refreshing lemon and quince flavors amplified by a juicy tangerine crush on the midpalate. Enjoy now through 2022.
title: S.A. Prüm 2017 Luminance Dry Riesling (Mosel)

description: Hot gravel and tart cranberry aromas are vividly enhanced with roasted jalapeño pepper notes on this small-batch wine from one of the region's more quality-focused producers. There's lots of fun flavor on the palate, with a bell pepper element quickly evolving into black raspberry and cherry fruits, picking up dusty leather in the midpalate and finishing on fudge brownie.
title: Lorenzi Estate 2011 Lot 318 Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)

description: Grassy in pea shoots, this is an easygoing, quaffable white with buzzy acidity and a lasting taste of fig and melon.
title: Mason Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Big and bold, loaded with red fruits and sharp acidity, the Murray Syrah from Hightower brings a spicy mix of fruit, loam and mineral. There's some heat in it as well. The grapes are estate grown, and the Syrah was cofermented with 5% Viognier.
title: Hightower 2008 Murray Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: Light aromas of spice, yellow apple and butter are followed by viscous, sweet fruit flavors. It provides easy-drinking appeal.
title: Castle Rock 2014 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Slightly darker than most basic Campo de Borja Tempranillos, with earthy aromas along with black fruit notes. The palate is full and rugged, with scratchiness but also fresh, forward flavors of black fruits including plum and boysenberry. A good wine with guts.
title: El Pensador 2009 Tempranillo (Campo de Borja)

description: This is a big-boned wine, showy in spearmint and eucalyptus, burly blackberry and tar. With integrated oak and tannin, it presents a respectable showing of approachably lush texture and succulence, the finish persistent in juicy fruit.
title: JCB 2013 No. 1 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This wine is on the dry side of Brut. It is rich, at the same time crisp with a delicious creamed pear and apple flavor, lifted even further by pineapple acidity. Congratulations to Philipponnat for indicating disgorgement date and even the dosage on the back label.
title: Philipponnat 2004 Grand Brut Blanc Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: High-toned aromas of lime and lemon are accented by hints of crushed earth and white flower perfume here. It's a fruity, forward wine offering loads of juicy pink grapefruit and tangerine flavors. Primary fruit flavors and delicate, lingering sweetness make it a crowd-pleaser to enjoy now through 2021.
title: St. Urbans-Hof 2017 Nik Weis Urban Riesling (Mosel)

description: Lush and dramatic. Shows intense flavors of black currants and cedar, wrapped into extremely fine tannins and liberally enhanced with sweet, smoky oak. Very good, but young and fresh. Best 2010–2013.
title: Korbin Kameron 2005 Moonridge Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: Soft, fruity and dry, with cherry-berry flavors and notes of violets, oak and sweet dried Provencal lavender and thyme. There's a good backbone of tannins, but they're the ripe, finely-woven type.
title: Chateau St. Croix 2004 Merlot (America)

description: This wine is very floral on the nose with rose petals and hibiscus, as well as plush strawberries and framboise. The palate is loaded with plummy flavors, proving both somewhat light and very extracted at the same time.
title: Seven Oxen 2015 Grenache (Paso Robles)

description: Soft, ripe apple and nectarine notes mix with fresh lime, jasmine and Anjou pear on the nose of this unoaked bottling. A pinpoint, lemony acidity is racy once sipped, but fleshy apple and pear keep the palate grounded.
title: Foley 2013 Steel Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Made with organically cultivated Sangiovese, this fragrant elegant red opens with enticing scents of underbrush, sunbaked earth, wild berry, violet, crushed mint and a balsamic whiff of camphor. Smooth and savory, the linear palate has surprising vibrancy for such a hot vintage, delivering juicy Marasca cherry, strawberry compote, star anise and white pepper. Elegant fine-grained tannins lend polished support while a coffee note lingers on the close. Drink through 2025.
title: Salcheto 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: This is a massively rich style of Chardonnay bordering on fat, but delicious throughout. The nose offers aromas of golden apple slices, jasmine, honeysuckle, marzipan, melon and prominent pineapple. Once sipped, vanilla-laced butter and sea-salt caramel flavors ensure.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2013 Chamise Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Stainless-steel fermented, this white is fruity and fresh, with a nutty character that rides alongside ripe apricot and melon. There's a robust intensity to the finish.
title: Taft Street 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: This is one of three Chardonnays from the winery, each a portrait of their three daughters. Made with no pressing, taking two tons to yield a single barrel, the aromas draw you into the glass with notes of the underside of a pineapple and spice. The palate is full bodied, textured and well balanced, with stone fruit flavors lingering on the finish.
title: Morell-Peña 2016 Ysabella Bjork Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Very good price for a Riesling of this quality. It's very dry and high in acidity, cleansing the palate and stimulating it to appreciate rich fare, from liver paté on toast to grilled trout or chicken satay. Or delicious on its own, with fresh citrus, apricot and peach fruit flavors.
title: Jacella 2009 Riesling (El Dorado County)

description: Red-plum and raspberry aromas are lean and come with a note of cinnamon. Astringency and tartness are notable issues on a high-acid palate that's dealing strained flavors of plum skins and currant. On the finish, this Patagonian Cab Franc is sharp and even a touch sour, with rubbery tannins and a persistent tang.
title: Verum 2017 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

description: Smashed black rocks and turned earth meet with black plum and pasilla chile on the nose of this bottling. The palate is relatively thin in body but full of blueberry and pepper-spice flavors.
title: Magness 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: A cuvée of the best Chardonnay grapes, this sparkler is rich and smooth, with intense aromas of stone fruit, honey, apricot and baked bread. The mouthfeel is long and satisfying, thanks to the persistence of the perlage.
designation: Villa Crespia Riserva dei Consoli Brut
title: Fratelli Muratori 2004 Villa Crespia Riserva dei Consoli Brut  (Franciacorta)

description: The opening of smoke, rubber and black cherry comes across as being dark and good. The palate holds form with lively cherry, plum and currant flavors and finally a medium-long, somewhat warm and meaty finish. Good for an everyday, no-frills Garnacha.
title: Bodegas y Vinedos del Jalón 2008 Viña Alarba Old Vines Grenache (Calatayud)

description: Three quarters Cab Franc, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Merlot, all from the Champoux vineyard. A dark, smoky, earthy wine loaded with flavors of loam, coffee grounds, baking chocolate, black cherry and cassis. Dense, detailed and delicious, this represents exceptional value.
title: O•S Winery 2006 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: This is an absolutely beautiful wine from a winery that's quietly been doing a great job with their Cabs. Made from grapes grown high up on Mount Veeder, which insiders know as one of Napa's premier mountain appellations, it's rich and softly refined in blackberry, blueberry, currant and chocolate flavors, with lovely minerality. It will age for a while, but there's no reason not to drink it now.
title: Yates Family Vineyard 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

description: A beautiful Cabernet, rich and soft and profoundly structured, showing near-perfect tannins. They melt in your mouth, yet retain firmness, and carry flavors of blackberries, black currants and cedar. Lacks the concentration of previous vintages, but is a lovely wine for now and over the next six years.
title: Robert Mondavi 2006 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This wine offers touches of tropical fruits as well as a crisper edge of citrus and herbal flavors. It is a lightly textured, tangy and very fresh 100% Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now.
title: Château Grand Bourgeau 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Quite restrained on the nose, this nicely priced bottling slowly unleashes sea salt, apple peel, key lime pith and chalk aromas. It's tightly wound on the palate with lemon skin and pear skin tartness, proving very racy in style.
title: Talbott 2014 Kali Hart Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Earthy compost, mushroom and black pepper meet cedar and tomato leaf—a savory backdrop against which thick, persistent tannins rule. The fruit is a mix of black cherry and wild strawberry, which give the wine a ripe bold character touched only sparingly by oak.
title: Carpe Diem 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This tastes like an inexpensive Merlot you opened a few days ago and left on the kitchen counter. It's soft and simple, and the cherry fruit turns dry and stale.
title: Doohickey 2010 Merlot (Carneros)

description: One of the better examples of Sangiovese out there, in a difficult field. You have to credit the fine vineyard iocated in the emerging Ballard Canyon section of the valley. The acidity is brisk, as it tends to be in this variety, and the finish is thoroughly dry, with flavors of cherries and tobacco. Try as a lighter alternative to Zinfandel.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2009 Stolpman Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Oak dominates this Chardonnay, with buttered toast and butterscotch flavors. Underneath is a ripe wine, with pineapple and tangerine fruit, brightened with crisp acidity. Made in the popular style and pretty good, but the oak is a little too much.
title: Silver 2009 White Hawk Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This reserve-level Chardonnay does not outperform the winery's regular bottling. Some light cinnamon spice adorns the clean, simple green-apple fruit.
title: Lange 2010 Three Hills Cuvée Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Another of the producer's 100% varietal wines designed to showcase a specific Napa Valley appellation, this one shines in juicy black licorice and dark cherry. Expansive on the palate, it's bright and minerality-driven, with a flourish of coconut and vanilla on the finish.
title: Raymond 2012 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: From a single vineyard, this wine is generous and ripe with red apples and a touch of spice. It is young, with a strong mineral edge that gives a zesty citrus tang. At the same time, the acidity and the fruitiness are developing well. Drink from mid-2018.
title: Domaine des Valanges 2016 Hors Classe En Crêches  (Saint-Véran)

description: Gilded with toasty oak, this Cabernet is opulent with flavors of blackberries, cassis liqueur and mocha. The tannic mouthfeel is elegant, complex and dramatic. Blended with Cabernet Franc and Merlot, it's delicious and heady for drinking now and over the next six years.
title: Beringer 2010 Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: It's always a cliché to compare wine to the nectar of the gods but there's little that comes closer than this. It's decadently sweet, offering layer upon layer of unctuous honey and stone-fruit nectar, yet exhilarating, fine and filigreed. The finish is endless and breathtaking. Delicious now but will hold for decades to come.
title: Robert Weil 2016 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Trockenbeerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Soft in tannin and oak, this wine shows a cool-climate profile, its grapes sourced largely from Mount Veeder's mountainous terrain. Blackberry pie, cedar and crushed herb combine nicely alongside integrated power and full-bodied concentration.
title: Darioush 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: With a touch of apricot fuzz and fresh-cut grass, the wine is high in acidity and clean, bright and layered.
title: Hannah Nicole Vineyards 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Contra Costa County)

description: Tight at first, this has a fine tannin structure that wraps around the wine like a scarf. The aromatics come with force, with intoxicating wafts of violet, pepper and herb.
title: Terre Rouge 2009 High Slopes Syrah (Sierra Foothills)

description: This wine includes 16% Merlot and 2% Petite Sirah. Pungent earth overrides a dense syrupy concentration of blackberry mocha. The tannins are tight and green.
title: Liparita 2014 V Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)

description: A flashy wine that shows how ripe and sweetly soft Paso Robles gets Cabernet. It's rich in blackberry and cherry pie filling, currant, anise and cedar flavors, with a long finish. Will provide satisfying drinking over the next 4–6 years.
title: Falcone 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Rarely is Grenache the best grape to lay down in the cellar, but this bottling has the bones and pedigree to qualify. Plump berry, cherry and red-currant fruits have a floral edge on the nose, while the palate is very grippy with tannins that hold the sumac and tart cherry flavors tightly. Drink 2020–2026.
title: Jaffurs 2016 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

description: A wonderful Sauvignon Blanc, bone dry and tartly crisp, with mouthwatering flavors of lemons, limes, grapefruits, minerals, vanilla and peppery spices. Entirely unoaked, it's a fine cocktail sipper, and great with savory little appetizers.
title: Trinchero 2009 Mary's Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Calistoga)

description: There's a lot of sweaty leather in this wine's aromas and tastes, which may put some people off, and it doesn't blow away. Under that are rich cherry, cedar and violet flavors. The funkiness lowers the point score considerably.
title: Bourassa Vineyards 2005 Reserve Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Freshly cut apple peel and apple fruit create a very welcoming and lively palate. The fruit is clean and very invigorating, while the dry finish provides cool refreshment.
title: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2014 Vieilles Vignes Riesling (Alsace)

description: While the wine does have richness, it's the mineral and citrus side that is coming through at this stage. The balance with the wood aging is so right that you feel the toast rather than tasting it. As it matures, the wine will deepen in intensity and power, certainly over the next 5–10 years.
designation: Sous le Dos d'Ane Premier Cru
title: Domaine Leflaive 2007 Sous le Dos d'Ane Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Three vineyards contribute to this lovely wine, two in Rutherford, both certified organic, and another in Soda Canyon which is at 800-feet in elevation. Red and blue fruit open for leather and a touch of cedar and dried herb—the wine ultimately elegant and Old World. The tannin weight is substantial but never distracting.
title: Pine & Brown 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Soft and simple. The berry and cherry fruit has a vegetal tug of asparagus, and the absence of structure makes the wine taste sweet. Drink now. Tasted 3 times.
title: Waterstone 2005 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Nuanced, with 10% Cabernet Franc and 4% Petit Verdot, this is a quietly powerful wine, smooth and structured and immediate in its beauty, yet possessed of legs to cellar for 20-plus years. Crushed flowers and rocks open on the nose, providing a clutch of minerality, as grippy tannins support red currant, plum and a freshness of persistent acidity. Try to wait on this one. Best 2024–2034.
title: Spottswoode 2014 Family Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: Punchy, vibrant aromas  of grapefruit and pineapple juice meet a mild, floral hop note on the nose. There's a round feel to the  palate which displays lots of tropical fruit rinds and floral, grapefruit flavors. Perfect for a hot summer's day.
title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

description: The Grand Ciel Vineyard seems to be coming into maturity, and this shows impressive depth and complexity. Infused with flavors of rock and light herb,with hints of stem, anise, coffee and cocoa, it nonetheless remains firmly anchored in ripe black cherry and cassis. This could easily be cellared for 10–15 years.
title: DeLille 2008 Grand Ciel Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: Heavy, raisiny aromas carry heat and a whiff of vinegar. In the mouth, this is thick and almost syrupy. Earthy flavors of blackberry, raisin and prune finish chewy but flat. Look for a ripe, rich wine that's soft and earthy more than structured.
title: Bodega Beleluin 2010 Amadeo  (Rioja)

description: From the Vincent family of Château de Fuissé, this is a ripe wine, with its green plum and nectarine fruits giving it roundness. At the same time, there is a bright, attractive edge of crispness, with a citrusy finish.
title: Vincent 2010 Marie-Antoinette  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Eroica has a proven ability to age; in fact it needs at least a half decade in the cellar to show its real strengths. Tight and packed with primary fruit flavors of lime and peach, this beautifully proportioned wine has perceptible sweetness but plenty of natural acidity. Lively and fresh today, but best given a few more years in the cellar.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle & Dr. Loosen 2010 Eroica Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Rich and rounded, with the toast sinking into the the rich yellow fruit and spice. The wine is gorgeous, opulent, while retaining an intense acidity and an edge of minerality. For medium-term aging.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2008 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: It delivers just what many consumers want, a creamy wine with flavors of citrus fruits, honey and buttered toast. With a production of 67,000 cases, it will be easy to find.
title: St. Francis 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This simple Chardonnay has candied flavors of pineapples, lemons, vanilla, honey and buttered toast.
title: Folie à Deux 2012 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an excellent, concentrated, and velvety textured wine that's full bodied and well balanced. It pairs dense blackberry and black-cherry flavors with a healthy coating of fine-grained tannins that add texture and chewiness.
title: Lake and Vine Cellars 2013 Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)

description: This is soft and jammy, with raspberry, cherry and oak flavors. A pretty wine, with a good tannin-acid balance, for drinking now.
title: Muscardini 2010 Gracie Creek Vineyards Syrah (Sonoma Valley)

description: This is one of the more luxurious Syrahs out there. It has a soft, smooth texture, and absolutely delicious flavors of blackberry and blueberry jam, milk chocolate, anise, figs, beef jerky and spices. It's high in alcohol, which gives some heat to the finish.
title: Trione 2009 River Road Ranch Syrah (Russian River Valley)

description: Impressively delicate but also generous in aromas, this bottling shows lemon curd, caramelized apple and a touch of baby powder on the nose. There's a sharp line of salty acidity on the palate, with flavors of candied apple and Meyer lemon.
title: Wrights Station 2013 Backwards Block Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a beautiful wine that's a classic example of a high-alcohol style that retains balance. It's soft and mellow, with a warmth that conveys the most delicious black raspberry, chocolate, espresso and spice flavors. Blended with Merlot, it's a sexy wine to drink now and over the next eight years.
title: Hall 2010 Bergfeld Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: Earthy berry, tomato, vanilla, herb and spice notes are textbook Rioja. This is drawing but sturdy in feel, with a mix of dry oak, tomato, plum and currant flavors. A salty tasting, tangy finish is in good shape.
title: Heredad Ugarte 2011 Cincuenta  (Rioja)

description: Substantial and muscular, still quite tight and unyielding, this grudgingly displays purple fruits in a mix of roasted coffee beans, clove and black olive. If past releases are any indication, this will continue to evolve and expand as it gets a bit more bottle time.
title: Dusted Valley 2009 Stained Tooth Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Brooding, very varietal aromas of grass, herbs and citrus lead to broad fruit flavors that dip in the middle, with some reduction providing a bit of distraction. It doesn't quite stand up on its own but should perk up at the dinner table.
title: Columbia Crest 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Full in the face Sauvignon Blanc, with a cough drop bite, tense with acidity. It has ripe green fruits and lime zest. Drink now.
title: Bougrier 2010 Domaine Guenault Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

description: Zesty, waxy aromas of lime peels and crushed stones belie the bright grapefruit and tangerine flavors in this dry, yet deeply mineral-laden Riesling. It's softly textured on the palate, with bright yet lenient acidity that leads into a lingering lemon-lime finish.
title: August Kesseler 2011 Junge Reben Kabinett Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Brander's basic Syrah is a good, dry wine, and while it's a little on the light side, it has pretty flavors of blackberries, black pepper, cola and black currants. The alcohol is nice and low, under 14%.
title: Brander 2009 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Lots of ripe, forward orange, sweet Meyer lemon, apricot and green apple fruit in this delicious Chardonnay. The grapes are a winemaker's selection of some of Dutton's best vineyards. Oak adds the perfect touch of buttered toast, while crisp acidity keeps the richness zesty clean. Even though it's pricey, it's an exceptionally lovely wine to drink now, especially with crab.
title: Dutton Estate 2011 Kyndall's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A light and easygoing Chard with bright aromas of lemon citrus, green apple and watermelon rind. Riper apple and tropical fruit notes appear on the palate, followed by a refreshingly clean finish. 3,000 cases imported; drink now.
title: Brampton 2010 Unoaked Chardonnay (Western Cape)

description: An awkward wine, high in acidity and sugary sweet in candied cherry and raspberry flavors that veer into Port. Tasty, but rustic. Ready now.
title: Muscardini 2008 Monte Rosso Vineyard Sangiovese (Sonoma Valley)

description: A nice, firm and good Livermore Cabernet with structured tannins and good bones, length and a roundedness that works. Black currant and nutmeg flavors prevail. The wine spent a while in all new Hungarian oak. McGrail is also a vineyard source to look for on other Livermore producer's bottles.
title: McGrail 2007 A Jo Elet Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

description: Only three barrels of this distinctive wine were produced. It's aromatically complex, with hints of pear and mushroom, the fruit flavors firmly rooted in citrus and peach, with a touch of mint as well. The texture is impressive, and helps to extend the finish.
title: Scott Paul 2015 La Paulée Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Perfumed in black cherry and smoky oak, this is a robust, richly ripe red, meaty and brawny in leather and blackberry jam.
title: Peju 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Very light in the glass, this wine shows fresh honeydew aromas along with sweet peach, honeysuckle and slightly tart orange rinds. The easy simple flavors include peach and ripe apple.
title: Europa Village 2016 Vienza Pinot Grigio (Temecula)

description: This Reserve is higher in alcohol, oakier and contains more Cabernet Sauvignon than Bello's regular '10 Cab. But, like its sibling, the wine is all elbows, with the black currant and dark chocolate flavors sticking out from the other parts. The wine should have no trouble negotiating the years. Try it in 2020.
title: Bello Family Vineyards 2010 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: This is a strongly flavored Chardonnay, with powerful notes of ripe mango, pineapple, papaya and oak. Its intensity of fruit is impressive. What it lacks in subtlety, it makes up for in sheer power.
title: Ram's Gate 2010 Sangiacomo Vineyards Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Ripe aromas of blackberry, prune, raisin and oak spice come together with aplomb. A full-bodied palate with controlled weight is the vessel for toasty flavors of oak, vanilla, mocha and baked black fruits. A solid finish with latent acidity is a worthy conclusion to this fully oaked Tempranillo. Drink through 2027.
subregion: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Bodegas Leda 2014 Viñas Viejas Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: Superrich, made in the modern style of exceptionally ripe fruit and lots of oak. Floods the mouth with pineapple, pear, green apple butter, buttered toast and crême brûlée flavors, accented with brisk acidity.
title: Foley 2008 Barrel Select Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A raw, hot wine, thin in fruit, showing overripe raisin and prune flavors.
title: Manzanita Creek 2008 De Luxe Syrah (Sonoma County)

description: This has classic aromas of wild cherry, leather and truffle. The palate delivers notes of ripe cherry, raspberry, mint, white pepper and white chocolate. A fresh and well-balanced selection.
title: Renieri 2010  Chianti Classico

description: A steely mouthfeel and tight lemon and herb flavors make this full-bodied wine refreshing, dry and reserved. It will make a good accompaniment to shellfish or pasta.
title: Paul Dolan 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Potter Valley)

description: An absolutely gorgeous Cabernet. It flatters all the way through, from the flamboyantly ripe cassis, cherry, cocoa and anise flavors to the smooth tannins and long, spicy finish. So refined and rich, yet so elegant. Should age for at least the next 6–8 years.
title: Silverado 2008 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Somehow this manages to be intensely fruity, searingly tart and still rounded out with appealing sweetness. It's a dynamic, lively and lingering mix of flavors, running from grapefruit into pear and apricot, with an underlying minerality. Powerful and full-bodied.
title: J. Bookwalter 2010 Anecdote Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Sourced from Sagemoor Farms and the Homestead estate vineyard, this detailed and complex wine opens with pear and pineapple scents and flavors, then layers in pretty spices and toasty highlights.
title: Ryan Patrick 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Wiry plum and green-tobacco aromas transition to red-fruit scents as this breathes. A fresh, forward palate is medium in body, while a mix of spice, green herb, olive, plum and berry notes comprise the flavor package. A tight, juicy palate maintains the wine's core flavors.
title: Caliterra 2014 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: This is a big, tannic, midnight black Cabernet, rude in youth and barely drinkable. The tannins are powerful enough to lock down the palate. The grapes, grown in Calistoga, are very ripe in blackberries, currants and dark chocolate, but those tannins are stubbornly astringent. Almost old-fashioned in toughness despite very high alcohol, it's a curiosity that seems likely to develop in the cellar, but with so little evidence of past vintages, all bets are off.
title: Hourglass 2009 Blueline Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Released at the age of nearly four years, this wine tastes a little sweet and tired, like melted apricot jam sprinkled with vanilla and cinnamon, with dried fruit and herbal notes. Drink now before it goes further downhill.
title: Sonoma-Cutrer 2006 The Cutrer Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Aromas of raspberry meld with cedar and baking spice. The palate echoes the nose adding tart cranberry, white pepper and tobacco leaf. Vibrant acidity and velvety tannins linger through the finish that's filled with a tart berry flavor.
title: Pedernales 2015 Tempranillo (Texas)

description: A dark, toasty nose offers a hint of horseradish and char along with herbal black-fruit scents. This is chunky and fleshy on the palate, with good balance. Herbal plum and spicy berry flavors are common, while the finish holds up.
title: Vistamar 2013 Reserva Sepia Cabernet Sauvignon (Cachapoal Valley)

description: With lilting lemon, grapefruit and pretty pineapple aromas and flavors, this is a good example of Lake County Sauvignon Blanc. It's light and bright, and the flavors on the finish veer into equally pleasing peach and apricot notes, with a touch of almond.
title: Six Sigma Ranch 2011 Asbill Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

description: Concentrated essences of honeysuckle and lily pair up with orange oil and a touch of nuttiness on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. It's zippy on the lively palate, showing smashed walnut and seared lemon-wedge flavors.
title: Crawford Family 2015 Tin Shack Rita's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Black currant stars in this mountain wine, juicy and brushy in big, pillowy tannin. Still tightly wound, it shows complexity and plenty of natural structure, begging for more time in the bottle to allow for the gunpowder, smoky oak and dark, lush black fruit to marry further. It should show best 2020 through 2023.
title: Jean Edwards 2013 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Dark, tannic and toasty, it's a rich mouthful of wine. The fruit is moderately ripe, with light berry flavors; but the toast and chocolate and coffee barrel flavors add a lot of weight and punch. Nice winemaking from Gordy Hill turns out a delicious wine.
title: Milbrandt 2006 The Estates Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

description: Sweet and oaky, in the modern style, with oodles of buttered toast, caramel corn, vanilla cream and pineapple jam flavors.
title: Esser 2008 Chardonnay (California)

description: Fat, heavy in the mouth, rather lifeless wine, with light acidity and some pear juice flavors.
title: Louis Max 2008  Mâcon-Villages

description: This has lovely and deep black fruits, with smoke and toast from the barrel aging. There's a streak of caramel and a hint of coconut, good balance and length, and less obvious burn and astringency than the more recent vintages.
title: Adams Bench 2006 V Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: This is on the more herbal side of the Sauvignon Blanc spectrum, showing obvious notes of tomato leaf and boxwood, but there's ample white grapefruit to back up those green elements. This medium-bodied wine finishes long and crisp.
title: Mount Fishtail 2014 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Shows great acidity that really gets the tastebuds whistling, and also deep, complex varietal flavors of Meyer lemons, limes and sweet vanilla, with a green grass component in the background. Very fine and dry, an elegant, sophisticated Sauvignon Blanc of great integrity.
title: Foursight 2008 Charles Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)

description: There aren't too many Yountville wines of any variety at this price, but here's a Syrah, and while it's not one to age, it's pretty good. Dry and tannic, it shows flavors of black cherries, bacon and black pepper, and is complex enough to drink with fine fare.
title: People's Wine Revolution 2011 Moon & Sun Massa Ranch Syrah (Yountville)

description: Here's a straightforward Rosso with flavors of succulent black cherry, wild strawberry, truffle, white pepper and clove. It's round, ripe and extremely accessible so enjoy this now.
title: Cordella 2012  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Dark boysenberry, dried lilac and the slightest touch of tar show on the nose of this bottling, one of the first that Foxen has labeled with the new Los Olivos District appellation. Tart plum skins and elderberry show on the sip that is structured by solidly dry tannins accented by flavors of lavender and thyme.
title: Foxen 2014 Williamson-Dore Vineyard Syrah (Los Olivos District)

description: A simple, dull wine, from a producer that has struggled with Chardonnay for years. Tastes soft and sweet, with some vegetal notes.
title: Double Bond 2008 Edna Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: There's a pleasant array of violets, lilacs, lamb roast, rosemary and dark fruit swirling on the nose of this bottling, with includes 11% Counoise. Ripe boysenberry, a hint of tar and a vanilla-laced syrup arise on the palate, which is dominated by a Concord grape-syrup element that's both thick and tangy.
title: Kukkula 2015 Noir Syrah (Adelaida District)

description: Hard-driving aromas of nettle, jalapeño, sea brine, wet stones and grapefruit set up a chunky palate with a ton of weight. Passion fruit, orange and controlled vegetal flavors are in harmony. Drink now.
title: Arboleda 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Costa)

description: Here's a fun and fresh Italian Pinot Grigio with piquant aromas of citrus and peach. The wine is informal and easy-drinking. A good food pairing would be chicken salad or lightly roasted fish. Screwcap.
title: La Villa 2008 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Alluring aromas of ripe plum, fragrant violet, menthol and baking spice emerge on this savory, enjoyable red. The juicy, easy-drinking palate combines an enticing weightless quality with succulent fruit including fleshy black cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and chopped herb alongside round, polished tannins.
title: Querciabella 2012  Chianti Classico

description: Soupy tomato, plum and green tobacco aromas feed into a pinched biting rubbery palate. This Merlot tastes roasted and oaky, with baked plum and berry flavors matched by clove and chocolate notes. A drawing tannic finish tastes stewy and woody.
title: Ferllen 2011 Reserve Merlot (Mendoza)

description: A little dusty and also sort of briney on the nose, with citric acidity pushing orange, apple and pear flavors. A textbook sweet, simple South American Chardonnay with a tropical leaning and finishing flavors of pineapple.
title: Finca El Portillo 2008 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Uco Valley)

description: This shows the ample muscle of Washington Merlot, with vineyard sources ranging from Canoe Ridge to Sagemoor to Seven Hills and beyond. It's juicy, tangy, forward yet deep. This is not your ordinary Merlot; it's got flavors of cured meat, almond pastry, and black tea sifting through, ephemeral but fascinating. At the heart is good black cherry fruit.
title: Substance 2008 Me Merlot (Washington)

description: This is a strong wine, dark and oaky, with rich flavors of licorice, toffee and espresso. The fruit is washed in Bourbon barrel flavor. It's impressively rich, but a bit overpowering.
title: Wapato Point Cellars 2008 Cougar Ridge Reserve Syrah (Lake Chelan)

description: With more than four years of bottle age, this Cabernet is soft, elegant and lovely to drink now. It has subtle but complex black currant, mocha and cedar flavors, along with rich tannins that will pair well with steak.
title: Arrowood 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

description: This white will benefit from decanting to let some dusky aromas blow off and bring lovely pine and grass scents to the fore. There's some good intensity in the mouth and green apple flavors that trail off to a shortish finish. Drink now.
title: Vasse River 2007 Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: Ripe apple and honeysuckle aromas meet with gunmetal on the nose of this bottling. Fresh citrusy flavors meet with toasted hazelnut, a hint of flint and chilled apple flesh on the palate.
title: Pali 2016 Highlands Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Sweet mesquite meets dark berries and anise on the nose of this Texan Tempranillo. The medium-bodied palate is juicy with red fruit, yet crisp in acidity and supported by ample tannins. Toasted coconut and vanilla adds depth to the finish.
title: Brennan 2012 Tempranillo (Texas)

description: Grown in a chalk and flint soil, this is a strongly textured, tight wine. It has a dense mineral character, steely and with layers of citrus. Very dry, very young, this impressive wine needs to age until 2015 before drinking.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2012 La Chapelle des Augustins  (Sancerre)

description: Tomato leaf, dried herb and cedar are offered on the nose and palate of this wine, which is well-integrated in oak. Full-bodied and grippy, it's youthful in structure, with final notes of pencil shavings and focused acidity.
title: Whitehall Lane 2014 Leonardini Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Black plum, dark kitchen spice, leather and pressed violet aromas lead the nose on this round, savory wine. On the velvety palate, firm, polished tannins frame mature black cherry, licorice and a hint of chewing tobacco. Drink through 2018.
title: Villa Calcinaia 2011 Piegaia Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: Resting solidly in the medium-bodied spectrum, this wine offers primary red berry and cassis fruit geling with the vanillin oak aromas and flavors, offering a touch of mint and dried herbs for interest. Softly textured with plump fruit and enough acidity to make another sip an easy endeavor, this is a simple drop with an short finish but an attractive price point.
title: Yellow Tail 2017 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

description: A surprise and a true find in that this wine is excellent but priced well below its quality level. The nose is outright gorgeous; it's subtle, spicy, layered with dried fruit and folds in hints of tomato leaf and dill. The palate is expressive, delicate and offers smooth, leathery flavors. In a perfect state of evolution; drink now through 2013.
title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2001 Rioja Bordón Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Made from 100% Cabernet, this wine is very extracted and jammy, in the modern style of extreme ripeness and fruit-forwardness. Sweet oak, 70% of it new, adds layers of cream, vanilla and buttered toast. Appeals now for its juicy, New World style.
title: Hewitt 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: This is a fleshy Cabernet, with meaty, olive notes to the blackberries and black currants. It's nicely dry and tannic, the kind of Cab that needs a rich steak to tame the astringency. Should develop over the next 5–6 years, at least.
title: V. Sattui 2009 Preston Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Guava-glazed beef ribs, smoky teriyaki, black peppercorns and black cherry fruit swirl into a luxurious nose on this lush wine by Michael Mooney. Very silky in texture, the palate shows pencil lead, concentrated elderberry, black pepper and light, varietally correct flashes of bell pepper, dried oregano and thyme.
title: Chateau Margene 2012 Cask 7 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

description: Rubbery blackberry and peppery spice aromas lead to a palate with piercing acidity that might be perceived as shrill. Tangy red-plum flavors are so intense and shear that there's a citric element to this cool-vintage Rioja. On the finish, which is racy and choppy in feel, spice notes return. Drink through 2030.
title: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA 2013 Macán Clásico  (Rioja)
winery: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA

description: Full bodied and firm textured, this wine offers plenty of fruit flavor, light oak shadings from the use of 30% new oak barrels and a good grippy mouthfeel.
title: Oak Farm 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: Tangy and mineral, this is a crisp apple- and citrus-driven wine, full of fruitiness while also having a tight texture. Its acidity just adds to the generally ripe character of the wine. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2013 Réserve Personnelle  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Lots of rich, rewarding cherry pie, red currant and sandalwood flavors in this dry young Grenache. It's a bit pert in acidity, and not likely to improve with age, so decant and drink up.
title: Kaena 2010 Larner Vineyard Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: One of the few bubbling Pinot Grigios available in California, there's enough promise here to wonder why not more. Pink grapefruit, ripe peach, kiwi and Gravenstein apple aromas show on the nose, while the palate picks up light apple cider, lime juice and jasmine flavors.
title: South Coast NV Sparkling Pinot Grigio (Temecula Valley)

description: The Eléni Syrah, sourced from old vines at Red Willow Vineyard, may lay claim to being the best of a very fine lineup. It is a densely fruity wine, with concentrated flavors of raspberry liqueur, set upon a foundation of liquid rock. Focused and precise, it is almost crystalline in its resonant elegance.
title: Efeste 2009 Eléni Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: The Lucas 2007 Limited Reserve Syrah shows the potential the Syrah grape has in upstate New York. Dense raspberry and strawberry fruit vie with aromas of barbecued meat on the nose while a thick layer of vanilla cushions the fine tannins and smokey notes in the mouth. The juicy finish throws up an enticing licorice note. Nicely done. Drink now to 2011.
title: Lucas Vineyards 2007 Limited Reserve Syrah (Finger Lakes)

description: This medium-bodied, nicely firm and approachable red shows cherry, cassis, tobacco and black olive along a juicy core of grippy texture.
title: Raymond 2013 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

description: Smoky cherry and tar open the way to well-defined flavors of cola spice and vanilla in this 100% varietal wine from the famous Oakville site. Integrated, it is succulent and fruit-forward with sultry, sensuous texture and heavy toasted oak.
title: Blind Justice 2015 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This BSH is 86% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Franc. Ripe to the point of showing some scents of raisin and prune, this is most expressive of baking spice highlights, clove and licorice. It turns a bit volatile and the tannins seem to be quickly drying out. Drink up.
title: O•S Winery 2010 BSH Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Dusty berry and plum aromas register as fresh but simple. This is similar on the palate: fresh and fruity, but not too serious. Flavors of plum and cherry are raw and drawing, while the finish sports supportive juicy acidity.
title: Atalayas de Golbán 2013 Linde  (Ribera del Duero)

description: A little too soft and sweet, with jammy berry flavors spiced up with cinnamon and cloves. It's a sound, everyday Merlot for drinking now.
title: Q 2009 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: The near-vertical slope of the Monts Damnés produces wines that have great elegance, style and impressive richness. This 2011 is still young, needing another year to start to bring out all the complex texture and aromatics. Drink until 2020.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2012 La Côte de Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)

description: Campfire smoke and meat rise on the nose of this 100% varietal wine, a nearly rustic experience if it weren't for the powerful beauty behind the rest of the story. A soft, dry grip of tannin plays against youthfully ripe notions of blackberry jam on toast, with chocolate and cigar lurking in the background. Drink now through 2023.
title: Wallis Family Estate 2013 Seraphim Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

description: A slight hint of petrol on the nose of this wine by veteran Kathy Joseph then ventures into delicate and soft aromas of preserved lemons and scratched grapefruit skin. It's edgy in style, treading a pithy line of tangelo, pomelo and yellow grapefruit, with racy and lingering lemon-spritz acidity.
title: Fiddlehead 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, incense and a whiff of underbrush. The rounded palate delivers dried black cherry, clove and tobacco alongside velvety tannins.
title: Fattoria Il Colombaio 2015 Gaspero  (Chianti Classico)

description: Made in the Lokoya style, which is darkly colored, full bodied, tannic and dense in mountain fruit. A spicy oak tone joins with massive blackberry, cassis and violet flavors to make this wine delicious from the start. It's very tannic and needs a great deal of time. Begin to enjoy this wine in 2016, and it should go far longer than that.
title: Lokoya 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

description: Lean and spry, this dry Riesling balances fresh apple and tart nectarine notes against a backdrop of crisp lemon-lime acidity. The finish is moderately long but marked by a pleasantly bitter lemon pith note. Drink now.
title: Treleaven 2013 Dry Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

description: There is impressive depth to the nose of this bottling, with concentrated black cherry, black plum and blueberry fruit enhanced by white pepper, roasted meat, licorice and hot asphalt. The palate is awash in savory flavors, with soy, charred beef and tobacco followed by waves of blueberry and leather and a wash of vanilla, plum skin and mocha, all atop perfectly polished tannins.
title: Falcone 2013 Mia's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Snappy aromas of citrus and lime come with minerality on a bouquet that's pungent but doesn't punch. This feels clean, friendly and well built; flavors of lime, tangerine and mango finish persistent, with no breakdowns. This is what top Chilean SB is all about.
title: Viña Leyda 2013 Single Vineyard Garuma Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Lavish in oak, with buttered toast and sweet caramel dominating the underlying citrus and tropical fruits. The acidity is just fine, providing needed balance, but those woody notes are jarring.
title: Gallo Signature Series 2011 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A five-grape blend from a range of outstanding vineyards—Stillwater, Dionysus, Bacchus, Sagemoor and Weinbau. The detail and the dance between delicate nuances of vineyard and vine, and the supple berry and black fruit flavors, make this a wine to contemplate as well as savor. Can be drunk young for its vitality and superb structure, or cellared for another decade or more.
title: Corliss Estates 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Oak and resin aromas are overpowering and dominant. The wine is big and woody in the mouth, so much so that it almost collapses upon itself, leaving resiny flavors of melon and underdeveloped citrus. Flat on the finish.
title: Matetic 2009 EQ Chardonnay (San Antonio)

description: Tries for Burgundian richness, but ends up rather common, although it will satisfy fans of buttery, oaky Chardonnays. Shows ripe flavors of pineapple jam, apricot purée and buttered popcorn.
title: Dutch Bill Creek 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: White flower perfume and rain-soaked concrete scents make an interesting and appealing nose on this wine from the summits of the Santa Cruz Mountains. There is tight, barely ripe nectarine on the palate and a bright freshness, making it a perfect partner for shellfish or counterpoint to aged cheese.
title: Comartin 2012 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
