description: The wine is young, which explains the intense acidity and flavors of currants as well as citrus. It is right up front with its fruitiness. Bright acidity shines through and gives the wine delicious, ready-to-drink character.
title: Domaine Sautereau 2012 Côte de Reigny  (Sancerre)

description: Entirely barrel-fermented and aged in French oak, half of it new, this is made from estate-grown fruit. Pear, Gravenstein apple and oak flavors are integrated well, with a bite of acidity twisted around the wine's powerful concentration.
title: Baldacci 2016 Sorelle Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: There's not much aromatic intensity here but this luminous Riesling from cool-climate Northern Italy has a soft, fruity feel, lean consistency and balanced acidity. Easy going, light and informal, pair this wine with spicy tapas or Indian vegetarian appetizers.
title: Lagaria 2008 Riesling (Trentino)

description: Pungent, feline aromas of sweat, nettle and grapefruit precede a lemony, dilute palate with lime, scallion and green-herb flavors of tarragon and thyme. It's tangy and light on the finish, with a chalky feel.
title: Familia Cassone 2012 Finca la Florencia Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

description: Wakefield is a reliable producer of Clare Valley wines, and the Chard is no exception. Toasted nuts mingle easily alongside grilled pineapple and peach notes, and the almost plush texture of this wine gives it another dimension. Contains 4% Viognier. Drink now.
title: Wakefield 2008 Chardonnay (South Australia)

description: This is a 100% Cabernet. It has deep, ripe flavors of black currants, licorice and raspberries, with hints of dark chocolate and toast. The tannins and acids are a bit fierce, suggesting that a few years in the cellar are warranted.
title: St. Francis 2010 Lagomarsino Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Russian River Valley)

description: Sourced from the Bacchus vineyard, this shows terrific improvement from the previous vintage. Firm, focused, spicy fruit is framed by a mouth-cleansing minerality. A lick of toasted hazelnuts and a hint of butterscotch add to the finish.
title: Cloudlift Cellars 2012 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a full-bodied wine that belies the notion that Oregon always makes a sleeker style of Chardonnay. Here are ripe, round flavors of peach and mango, wrapped in naturally vivid acidity, with a warming sensation in the finish. Best enjoyed soon, while fresh and young.
title: Carabella 2009 Dijon 76 Estate Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Rich and rounded, packed with yellow fruits and pineapple flavors, this is a warm, opulent wine, combining toast and fruit. True, there is some minerality, but this Meursault revels in its ripe fruit and generosity.
designation: Sous le Dos d'Ane Premier Cru
title: Domaine Leflaive 2009 Sous le Dos d'Ane Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Loamy, dark, rich aromas of pastry, blackberry, blueberry and turned earth scream “ripe.” In the mouth, this is bulky but focused. Flavors of black fruits, chocolate, fig, herbs and spice finish with notes of tobacco, raw oak, mint and bright acidity. Drink now through 2019.
title: Montes 2011 Folly Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: The purity of fruit flavor in this medium-bodied wine is compelling to taste, and shines through in a focused way uncomplicated by noticeable oakiness. The wine is elegant, sleek in texture and redolent of red cherries all the way through a lingering finish.
title: Noceto 2014 Riserva Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: There's a mix of fresh- and stewed-fruit tones in this wine, with baked red currant and fresher cranberry notes. The palate is round and juicy in feel, with grainy tannins and a mild oak flavor.
title: Heron Hill 2015 Reserve Merlot (Finger Lakes)

description: For the price, this offers an exciting array of spice and herb notes layered over blueberry fruit. Cracked pepper and licorice mark the nose, while the midpalate is supple, making it go down deceptively easily. If it falls off a bit on the finish, that's a mere quibble. Drink it over the next several years.
title: Earthworks 2010 Shiraz (Barossa Valley)

description: This wine's dark berry aromas recall cassis and raisin. Citrusy acidity and hard tannins make for a lively mouthfeel, framing roasted plum and currant flavors. Mint and herbal notes linger on the finish, which is bold with acidity.
title: Concha y Toro 2015 Marques de Casa Concha Merlot (San Clemente)

description: Fruity and lightly herbaceous, this is a crisp wine. Gooseberry and pink grapefruit flavors are rounded out with a fresh apricot and tightened with minerality. It's ready to drink.
title: La Chablisienne 2013  Saint-Bris

description: Good for the winery for making a bone-dry, crisply tart rosé wine that stands for elegance and finesse, which is not the easiest thing to do with a blush Syrah. Avoids heaviness in favor of a light, crisp mouthfeel that frames cherryskin, herb and vanilla flavors.
designation: Heritage Tree Vineyard Estate Rosé of
title: Gustafson Family 2009 Heritage Tree Vineyard Estate Rosé of Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Fresh, informal and fun (in a screwcap bottle), this organically farmed Pinot Grigio delivers bright aromas of cut grass, exotic fruit and citrus. It's an easy wine with a carefree attitude.
title: TerrAmore 2010 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: This is soft, full-bodied and richly tannic, with blackberry jam, beef jerky and spice flavors. A little sweet and direct, but a nice wine to drink with steak, chops, grilled chicken, even Mexican food.
title: Mahoney 2007 Syrah (Carneros)

description: Even if you like some earthy, mushroomy notes in your Syrah, this one is unripe to the point of vegetal. It's also too soft for balance. Despite some decent blackberry and cola flavors, it's a real disappointment.
title: Astrale e Terra 2009 Estate Syrah (Atlas Peak)

description: There's a good fruit core to this value Shiraz, with bright notes of cherry and strawberry thoughtout. The medium-weight mouth offers soft, approachable tannins and ends with a clean close.
title: Two Oceans 2010 Shiraz (Western Cape)

description: This pretty white start with aromas of fragrant flowers, spice and vanilla, leading into creamy layers of citrus and fruit. A richer style of Chardonnay, but balanced with acidity and minerals. Pair with steak, lamb, richer seafood dishes.
title: MAN Vintners 2009 Chardonnay (Coastal Region)

description: Captivating, with zesty lemon and wet stones on the nose, followed by a complex medley of citrus, passionfruit and carnations on the palate. The wine finishes well, with punchy notes of lime marmalade and dry chalk. Try with smoked trout. Drink now for its vibrant fruit or lay down for a few years for more honeyed depth.
title: Knappstein 2008 Hand Picked Riesling (Clare Valley)

description: Ripe grass scents meet with green pear, dill, thyme and gooseberries on the nose of this vivacious wine. It's very approachable and easy to like once sipped, with green-apple ripeness, pepperiness in the midpalate and delicious kiwi fruit throughout, altogether crisp and fresh.
title: Asuncion Ridge 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

description: This wine is marked by dry, tingly acidity and pure, laser-iike pink grapefruit, Meyer lemon and lime flavors. A strong hint of green gooseberry gives it a savory appeal akin to New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc.
title: Niner 2012 Jespersen Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)

description: This wine has a strong tangy texture, tight acidity and a good structure for aging. With minerality and crisp acidity that balances with the concentrated character, this is not a wine to drink now. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine des Valanges 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: There's nice raspberry and pomegranate fruit here, along with some attractive bramble but it's held back by a slight funkiness and confected notes in the mouth. Short, spirity finish. Drink up.
title: Reilly's 2007 Old Bushvine Grenache (Clare Valley)

description: Good balance and subtle flavors make this full-bodied wine quietly attractive and versatile with food. It tastes fresh, like white peaches, and has mild hints of herbs and lemon along with richer notes of honeydew melon on the finish.
title: Paul Dolan 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Potter Valley)

description: Earthy aromas of truffle, new leather, celery, botanical herb and balsamic notes align with a whiff of iris. The palate shows dried black cherry, raspberry, orange rind and tobacco framed in polished tannins. It's a bit forward for the vintage but still offers good midterm aging potential. Drink from 2020 through 2025.
title: Collosorbo 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

description: A nice, flavorful and dry Syrah for drinking now with barbecue or a rich lamb or beef stew. Soft and gentle, it's rich in blackberries, cherries, currants, beef jerky, pepper and smoky oak.
title: Brander 2009 Clover Creek Vineyard Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Combining structure and finesse, this offers aromas of spiced plum, underbrush, French oak and pipe tobacco. It's full bodied and smooth but also has tension, evoking mature black cherry, prune, mocha, licorice and clove framed in firm close-grained tannins. It closes on a coffee-bean note. Drink 2023–2030.
title: Poliziano 2015 La Caggiole  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Despite showing neutrality on the bouquet, you will find modest salinic, citrusy aromas. The palate feels round and good, with flavors of orange and briny lime. A fleshy feeling, citrusy tasting finish is nice even if it isn't overly zesty. Drink now.
title: Chilensis 2012 Reserva Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Crushed violet petals, bramble and baking spice mixes with boysenberry and blackberry tones on the nose and mouth of this easy-to-like wine. Straightforward and solid, it's well balanced, with some textural interest that lends a subtle grip to the close.
title: Recital 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: This easy expression of Syrah is redolent of ripe berry, moist earth and forest floor. There's a touch of fresh mint or peppermint as well, and a drying mineral feel on the close.
title: MandraRossa 2010 Syrah (Sicilia)

description: This wine has lemon peel and apple skin flavors that come through the firm, tangy structure. It has richness and the potential to age for the medium term. The finish is full of refreshing acidity.
title: Domaine Luquet 2011 Clos de Condemine  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This is a simultaneously fruity and savory wine of complexity and power from one of Victoria's underrated regions, Heathcote. From a mix of granite and the region's famed Cambrian red soils, this wine offers ripe blue and red fruit, florals and a peppery, olivey punch. The juicy fruit continues on the palate but here the savory elements play more of a starring role: Dried herbs and graphite are woven into fine-grained tannins and a long, almost tangy finish. Drink now–2027.
title: Syrahmi 2015 Demi by Syrahmi Shiraz (Heathcote)

description: At first blush, this comes across scratchy and raw on the nose. In the mouth, it's more jammy than lively, with saturated, reduced flavors of blueberry and prune. On the finish, this feels big for its britches and tastes mildly bitter.
title: de Restia 2009 Crianza Selected Harvest  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Saturated purple in color and grapy on the nose. The palate is mouthfilling but carries semisharp acidity, and the flavors run in the direction of standard black fruit. Notes of mocha and coconut soften the finish, and overall this is a good but rather generic wine.
title: Santa Ema 2008 Reserve Barrel Select Syrah (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Despite its age, you can still smell sawdust, dry oak and resin on the nose. The palate is acidic and drying, with tight plum, cola and raspberry flavors. The finish warms up some, with caramel and roasted fruit notes. Nice and tasty, and ready to drink now through 2011.
title: Bodegas Peñafiel 2001 Miros de Ribera Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Super-dark in color, this extracted wine offers a reductive note on the nose, followed by a rustic tinge of hay and brick. Intensely flavored and oaked, it finishes unexpectedly herbal and dry.
title: Snowden 2013 The Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is earthy, cool and foresty on the bouquet, with a coconut note that accents the wine's deep berry aromas. It feels smooth and nicely balanced, with modest tannins and toasty, oaky flavors of spiced blackberry and licorice. Smooth and subtle on the finish, this is ripe, stylish and ready to drink now.
title: Alidis 2006 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Mild fruit flavors and subtle spices give this medium-bodied wine a low profile. The aromas are vaguely appley and the flavors bring hints of vanilla, while soft acidity and a light buttery finish complete the picture.
title: Paris Valley Road 2015 Chardonnay (California)

description: An almost neutral nose offers mild green herb and citrus aromas but little more. The palate is zesty, tangy and fresh, while a narrow set of lemon-lime, grapefruit and lime flavors ends with focused crispness. For something tight and refreshing, this is it.
title: Undurraga 2012 Sibaris Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Sweet, a bit candied and creamy on the nose, with marshmallow and other oak-driven aromas. The palate has a common, regular, comfortable feel as well as vanilla and boysenberry flavors. Dark and savory late; well made in the “value” class.
title: MontGras 2008 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Fresh aromas, vivid citrus flavors, elegance and poise make this an attractive wine. It has a balance that is easy to enjoy and keeps calling for more sips, with pleasant notes of citrus and green fruit throughout.
title: Murphy-Goode 2015 The Fumé Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

description: While sunny melon and peach flavors are forward and fruity, an underlining of chalky minerality lends finesse and elegance to this dry, neatly composed wine. It feels sprightly on the palate, finishing briskly on a lifted white-blossom note.
title: Lakewood 2014 3 Generations Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Aromas of white peach, white flowers and green apple prepare your palate for bright fruit flavors of ripe apple and yellow peach. This wine is well balanced, with a crisp and clean finish.
title: Rough Day 2016 Chardonnay (Thracian Valley)

description: A standard Chardonnay, dry and nicely acidic, with citrus, pear, vanilla, lees and oak flavors.
title: Adler Fels 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Sweet red-fruit aromas are mild and earthy. This feels rough on its own but will drink well with food. Flavors of plum, berry and chocolate lead to a similar-tasting, medium finish.
title: Alma del Sur 2011 Colección Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Mouth-watering scents of Old Bay and black cherries emerge from the glass, but the palate does't quite live up to the early promise. It's ample in weight and well balanced by acidity, yet the black cherry fruit seems a bit simple and turns drying on the finish. Give it until 2015 or so and see if it comes around.
title: Domaine des Hauts Châssis 2010 Les Galets  (Crozes-Hermitage)

description: Meaty and savory, this is surprisingly full-bodied and supple for a Yarra Valley Syrah. Blackberry and spice notes balance out the meatiness, imparting a bright, mouthwatering juiciness to the long finish.
title: Ben Haines 2013 Under Woods Steels Creek Syrah (Yarra Valley)

description: Awesome Cabernet from this esteemed vineyard in Oakville. Defines the modern Napa style in the perfectly ripe black currant and blackberry fruit, and the ultra-refined tannins. Hard to exaggerate the depth and length, the sheer opulence of this 100% Cab. It was aged in 80% new French oak, which adds even richer notes of wood smoke and sweet vanilla. Should evolve slowly through 2020, but only 75 cases were produced.
title: Alpha Omega 2007 Beckstoffer To Kalon Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Broad tropical fruit and nut aromas gain more focus on the medium- to full-bodied palate. The wine feels lush and plump, but solid acidity gives it some buoyancy.
title: Pillsbury 2011 Chardonnay (Cochise County)

description: This is a bright selection, showing wild cherry, leather and balsamic notes alongside hints of well-integrated oak, pepper and espresso. It's not complex but it has a silky texture and is enjoyable now. Michael Skurnik Wines, Estate Wines.
title: Le Cinciole 2010  Chianti Classico

description: An impressive Syrah. Shows ripe, flashy blackberry and cherry fruit flavors, complexed with bacon, pepper and sweet oak notes, wrapped into gentle but firm tannins. Tastes as sweet as brown sugar, yet finishes dry, a curiosity that makes it all the more interesting. Drink now–2014.
title: Phoenix Ranch 2009 Estate Syrah (Napa Valley)

description: Mellow aromas of pear, rainy sidewalk and nectarine show on the nose of this bottling. There is bountiful acidity on the sip, with cut grass and apple skin flavors.
title: Pegasus Estate 2016 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This opens with aromas of hay, pressed yellow flower and orchard fruit. The direct palate offers yellow apple skin, toasted nut and a mineral note alongside invigorating acidity.
title: Poggiobello 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

description: Beautiful aromas of forest floor, dusty berry and smoked meats lead to a huge, tannic but tolerable mouthful of toasty blackberry, cassis, chocolate and additional darkness. It's toasty and really long on the finish; almost syrupy but not quite. A tannic effort, like all Griñon wines.
title: Marques de Griñon 2005 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Syrah (Dominio de Valdepusa)

description: Aromas of candy corn, spice and almond butter are followed by full-bodied, tropical-fruit flavors that show a pleasing sense of richness and intensity. It's a delicious example of the variety, with a lingering finish.
title: Ashan 2016 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The Limit seems to refer to bringing this Chard to the edge of oaky ripeness. Whether it goes beyond it is debatable. It's enormously rich and ripe in oranges, apricots, mangoes and oak, with good acidity and a creamy texture.
title: Babcock 2012 The Limit Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Simple, well made and tropical, with a touch of oak. The palate is zesty, citric and healthy, with pineapple and orange flavors along with a pinch of star anise, vanillin and pith. Finishes fresh and juicy, with mild vanilla shadings.
title: Pascual Toso 2010 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: A year's maturation and wood aging have produced this smooth, rich wine. The tannins are integrated into the red fruits that burst out of the glass. Aromatic and spicy, the wine is still full of young fruitiness and will be better from late 2017.
title: Domaine Chancelle 2014  Saumur-Champigny

description: Supposedly set on an ancient burial ground, this vineyard is well placed halfway up the slope of Chassagne. It has almond and spice flavors as well as a tighter, steely texture. The wine, with its wood-aging flavors, is still developing. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2014 La Maltroie Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Black cherry fruit is accented with flavors of coffee grounds and dark chocolate. The fruit is clean and brambly, and the wine overdelivers for the price.
title: Hyatt 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rattlesnake Hills)

description: A big, sweet, soft Napa Cab, made in the modern style. It means to dazzle with blackberry and blueberry jam, sweet new oak and chocolate flavors, and does. Too soft for aging, but delicious now.
title: Boyanci 2008 InSpire Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This classic-style wine has cedar, tobacco and dark fruit aromas, bold and ripe flavors and a structure that's very firm yet not harsh. Cinnamon, clove and allspice accents complement its black cherry and dark chocolate notes, while a thick blanket of tannin wraps it all up.
designation: The American, Pilot Ridge Vineyard; Estate Grown
title: Everhart Cellars 2014 The American, Pilot Ridge Vineyard; Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)

description: Bright and fruity aromas of wild berry escape the glass. The savory easygoing palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry and star anise alongside supple tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2019.
title: Pietranera 2016  Rosso di Montalcino

description: With full-throttle flavors of black and red cherry jam, black pepper and sandalwood, this is a savory Merlot. It shows the variety's silky texture and soft tannins.
title: Waterstone 2010 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Made with organically grown grapes, Pizzolato's ruby-colored Merlot starts off easily enough with focused aromas of wild berries, wet earth and spice. The wine's appearance is thin and simple, and so is the mouthfeel.
title: Pizzolato 2009 Merlot (Piave)

description: The aromas of this wine are rich, with sweet cream, butter, vanilla extract and pineapple. Butter is also very present on the palate, as is vanilla, overripe apple and some toasty charred oak. Medium in body, it feels creamy and round. The finish has a bit of a bitter seed or pit quality.
title: James River 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Virginia)

description: Wood-heavy aromas of bacon and clove don't allow for much fruit expression. This is tannic and weighty on the palate, with flavors of baked berry fruits, clove and burnt wood. Bacon and clove notes remain out front on a finish that's all about oak.
title: MontGras 2013 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: There's a terrific core of cherry, red currant, mineral and iodine flavor in this wine, along with an elaborate oak treatment that makes it complex and dramatic. But it's also extremely tannic, leading to the question of ageability. In all likelihood, the fruit will outlast the astringency. It should begin to come into its own after 2015, and it could continue to develop much longer.
title: Terra Valentine 2009 Yverdon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

description: Punchy citrus and minerally aromas open this fresh SB. A juicy, citric palate points in the right direction, while this tastes like tangerine and orange peel mixed with lime and green herbs. A crisp, persistent finish closes it out.
title: Concha y Toro 2015 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

description: Young, tangy and tart, with racy raspberries, strawberries and pomegranate––this is a vividly fruity and penetrating wine. Crisply defined, immaculately fresh, it is structured for both immediate enjoyment and cellaring over the next 6–8 years.
title: Leonetti Cellar 2008 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Lavender and violet notes are lavishly floral against a backdrop of ripe, juicy peaches on this sunny off-dry wine. Zingy citrus acidity gives the palate backbone and a bracing finish. A great value wine to enjoy throughout the summer season.
title: Escher Haus 2012 Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Lightly textured and with simple apple and pear flavors, this wine is ready to drink. The light acidity, touch of pepper and final acidity are all in balance.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2017 Floréal  (Mâcon Chaintré)

description: Chocolate and caramel brace themselves against a crisper note of spearmint in this thick and near-syrupy wine, built with tremendous structure and weight, the finish somewhat puckering in coconut flakes.
title: Hersly 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

description: Lavender and licorice combine effortlessly on the nose and entry of this wine, which deserves its reserve billing. Juicy cherry, currant, cedar and dried herb are the highlights, woven around a dense core of generous tannin, richness and density. Enjoy 2024–2034.
title: Pride Mountain 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County-Napa County)

description: Aromas of anise, Fruit Roll-Ups and medicine cabinet are followed by pitch-black fruit flavors. The tannins bring a sense of astringency—a surprise from this typically supple site. It all seems a bit dried out.
title: Seven Hills 2015 Seven Hills Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: For the first time these excellent grapes are being shown in a single-vineyard cuvée. It's a big, tannic, high-octane wine, with smooth, ripe and generous purple fruits. There is plenty of supporting acid, along with rather astringent tannins that carry a leafy note through the finish. Drink now–2019.
title: :Nota Bene 2010 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: For people who like wines that speak a little softly, try this very moderately priced Chardonnay. Subtle aromas and flavors of green apple, honey and almond build slowly as you enjoy the light to medium body, smooth texture and a finish that hints of sweetness.
title: Leaping Horse 2011 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Dark, earthy and rubbery aromas go along with a reasonably fruity bouquet, and as a whole the entry is good. The palate is full, a bit rough and rugged, with ripe, sweet black-cherry and cassis flavors. Concentrated and a touch syrupy, but good for what amounts to basic Cabernet.
title: Eberle 2008 Steinbeck Vineyard Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: Bold hits of spice, vanilla, toast and smoke envelop this Cabernet Franc, but beneath it all, there's a penetrating core of berry and cherry flavors that resonates. It's a hedonistic, perhaps aspirational style of Long Island red wine, but anchored firmly in its fruit. Full-bodied in style, it's structured tautly by fine penetrating tannins and a burst of sour cherry acidity on the midpalate.
title: Waters Crest 2013 Grand Vin Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This suave, seductive wine opens with forward aromas of black currant, blackberry and mentholated plum that are hit by green, earthy tones of tobacco leaf, licorice root and flower stem. The palate is full and lush, with rich and opulent dark-fruit flavors that are framed by bold, structuring tannins and lifted by ample acidity, as well as pronounced oak and licorice spice tones. It's harmonious and balanced, with all the components strong and upfront. A complete and delicious wine now, enjoy through 2026.
title: Anthonij Rupert 2012 Vinified and Bottled on Lormarins Cabernet Sauvignon (Franschhoek)

description: Raspberry and plum aromas are mild and entirely fresh. This is your typical cosecha wine with plenty of fruit and giddy-up. Punchy plum and cherry flavors finish with controlled bitterness and a spot of burnt toast.
title: Carlos Serres 2012 Serres  (Rioja)

description: Good for a mature wine but it does smell a bit flat and damp. That murkiness blows off somewhat, leaving a solid, aged Rioja wine with acidic zap and lightly baked berry, cherry, tomato and spice flavors. Mild on the finish. Drink now.
title: Ramirez de la Piscina 2001 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Only 30 cases of this gorgeous wine are imported, so snag what you can when you find it. It's a deep and complex Syrah, exuding attractive aromas and flavors of juicy red cherry and fresh raspberry spiced up with accents of vanilla crème, sweet wood, soft Earl Gray tea and whole baking spice on the close. Creamy and lush with a silky texture; drink now–2014.
title: Bizoe 2009 Estalét Syrah (Western Cape)

description: This Sauvignon Blanc is dry, crisp and long on citrus and tropical fruit flavors that finish with a hint of honey. The acidity is bright and clean. Sourced from the lesser-known regions of Clarksburg and Lake County, this is a bargain buy that's easy to find, with 10,000 cases produced.
title: Pepi 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: Oak, in the way of vanilla and buttered toast, dominates. Underneath are simple pineapple and apricot flavors that are watered down on the finish.
title: Waterstone 2009 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Aromas of baked plum, fragrant blue flower, cooking spice, toasted oak and a whiff of scorched earth come together on this robust wine. The hearty palate offers mature black cherry, raisin, Asian spice and oak alongside solid, close-grained tannins that leave a bracing finish.
title: Fossacolle 2011  Brunello di Montalcino

description: In a piece of French wine shorthand, the new appellation of Saint-Bris takes in the old Sauvignon de Saint-Bris wines. The style, though, hasn't changed: an attractive, if rustic type, with crisp gooseberry and grapefruit flavors and a fresh burst of acidity. Screwcap.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2007 Sauvignon de Saint-Bris  (Saint-Bris)

description: Very rich, dry and crisp in acidity, a Chardonnay that feels fine from your first sip through the spicy finish. Made with 35% new French oak, and aged eight months on the lees, it's drinking beautifully now, with pear, pineapple, vanilla custard and buttered toast flavors. Just lovely.
title: Sequoia Grove 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Briny apple and lime aromas set up a minerally, fresh, natural palate with stony lime, green apple and white-pineapple flavors. Par for the brut nature course is a stony, chiseled finish that frames the wine's crisp, lean character.
title: Alta Alella 2013 Privat Brut Nature Chardonnay (Cava)

description: This is a barrel selection, presumably limited in cases. It's an extraordinarily rich, concentrated 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, made in the modern cult-style of massively extracted blackberries, black currants, cassis liqueur and chocolate, with oak bringing the usual sweet toast and vanilla complexities. This deserves its high score for sheer opulence and great Napa structure. Delicious now, and could easily age for at least 10 years.
title: Silverado 2009 Limited Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A fruity wine, full of grapefruit, lime and melon flavors, cut with passion fruit acidity. The wine has a light texture with a zesty edge, clean and totally ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Villebois 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

description: Broad aromas of tangerine rind, tangerine blossom, wet dough and soft yellow melon make for a very pleasant start to this single-vineyard expression. The palate is framed by a powerfully stony grip, which provides a serious backbone to the approachable rounded flavors of ripe melon and creamy peach.
title: Comartin 2016 R-Bar-R Ranch Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a gentle and easy-going Chardonnay. It is soft, lightly buttery and conveys apricot and ripe pear flavors. The aftertaste just touches on acidity.
title: Café du Midi 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: You can taste the warm Paso Robles sunshine in every sip of this exuberant Cabernet. It brims with jammy blackberries, black cherries and chocolate, yet the finish is dry. Be aware of quite high alcohol, though, that gives it prickly heat.
title: Tower 15 2011 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: A little heat on the nose is acceptable given that the remaining cherry and plum aromas are pure. A bit acidic on the palate but staunchly fresh, with good fruit flavor in the red plum category. Cleansing due to higher acidity, with hints of mocha and mineral.
title: Quo 2008 Grenache (Campo de Borja)

description: Minerally and neutral on the nose, this tastes fresh and crisp like a green apple, with dry flavors of white fruit and bitter almond. It retains that almond character on the finish, which turns even drier and more bitter.
title: Arauco 2011 Reserva Pinot Grigio (Central Valley)

description: This wine shows prominent volatile acidity, which overpowers its red apple, cherry and baking spice aromas. The palate has lightly styled, smooth-feeling plum flavors backed by astringent tannins.
title: Goose Ridge 2015 g3 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This opens with aromas that recall moist underbrush, grilled sage, menthol and a whiff of cellar floor. The brisk, diluted palate offers raw red cherry, oak and a hint of star anise alongside stinging acidity and astringent tannins that leave a raspy finish. It lacks fruit richness.
title: Villa Calcinaia 2013 Vigna Contessa Luisa Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

description: You need to give this 100% Cabernet Sauvignon time in the cellar. It's nowhere near ready, even if you're used to tannins in your reds. It's hard as nails in astringency. This 2006 vintage doesn't have quite the concentration of the ‘05, but there are some lovely black cherry and black currant flavors, and they should begin to blossom in 4 or 5 years.
title: Corison 2006 Kronos Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: An intoxicatingly sensual Grenache, velvety and light in cherry and strawberry fruit, smooth earth, a streak of anise and deep swirls of chocolate and caramel on the finish. The Dalton Vineyard in Calaveras County has been one to watch for in Syrah and Zinfandel; it can now add Grenache.
title: Calavera Wines 2011 Dalton Vineyard Grenache (Calaveras County)

description: Mild lemon and minerally aromas are about as expressive as it gets, although you get some apple and melon flavors. Finishes with more apple flavor, a fleshy feel and not much follow through.
title: Tierra de Antes 2010 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Full-bodied and tangy in acidity, this wine is from a hillside site planted with some Sauvignon Musque. Refreshing, it offers a mix of salty green olive with exotic tropical pineapple.
title: Cosa Obra 2015 Hummingbird Hill Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

description: Coming from three different blocks of the winery's estate vineyard, it brings notes of cherry cola, peppery spices and medicine cabinet. The fruit flavors are quite ripe and lush, with the use of one year-old French oak putting the fruit front and center.
title: Alexandria Nicole 2011 Jet Black Destiny Ridge Vineyard Syrah (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Full of blackberry fruits and ripe tannins, this wine is spicy and with a perfumed character. It does have a dry core of structure to it along with rich fruits and the smoothing effect of wood aging. This is still developing and likely to be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Cortes de Cima 2013 Syrah (Alentejano)

description: A slightly richer expression of the grape, this bottling shows ripe Asian pear, blanched almonds, baked apples and a slightly alkaline touch. The palate starts slightly sweet, with lemon-laced apple-pie flavors and finishes the same.
title: Esser 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

description: Ripe, exotic papaya, mango, apricot and tangerine flavors highlight this wine. There's also plenty of buttered toast notes, but it's balanced with brisk acidity. This is a fine wine for drinking now.
title: Calera 2012 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A bit thin, but it shows tropical fruit, citrus, peach, vanilla and buttered toast flavors.
title: Niner 2012 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A young wine, this is still resolving itself in the bottle, with astringent tannins, a hint of sweet cracker and rich, raspberry fruit flavors drenched in wet stone. Good concentration and persistence, with threads of moist earth, cola and tanned leather.
title: Gorman 2007 The Pixie Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: Ripe, juicy notes of pear have zesty lime freshness on the nose. The same interplay between juicy ripeness and zesty tang happens on the slender palate that is shot through with lemon brightness. This wine has impact, tons of freshness and a dry finish.
title: Emile Beyer 2016 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)

description: Good juice anchors this Cabernet blend, with the 13% Malbec and 10% Merlot filling in the flavors. Cassis and pomegranate notes hit first, followed by darker notes of cacao and coffee, dotted with black pepper.
title: Hogue 2009 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Aromas of meat juices, forest floor, perfumed berries and grilled herbs lead the nose on this savory, full-bodied Rosso. The dense palate doles out ripe wild cherry accented with orange peel and allspice. Bold, velvety, and fresh, it's made to be enjoyed soon.
title: Collosorbo 2012  Rosso di Montalcino

description: This shows the sharper, more herbaceous side of the grape, though perhaps without being fully ripe. It seems to fall away quickly into simple lemon juice flavors, with a hint of herb.
title: Vin du Lac 2008 LEHM Sauvignon Blanc (Chelan County)

description: A tight and structured wine, this is still young, but the great fruit and mineral texture indicate fine potential. It has green fruits, crisp acidity and a nervy character that will soften. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2017 Pascal Renaud Champs de Perdrix  (Saint-Véran)

description: It's labeled Merlot, but the blend includes Syrah and other grapes, and the result comes across as a rather generic red wine. Soft and very buttery, it has light red fruits and some green tannins.
title: Mercer 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Scents of cherry and plum are infused with notes of undergrowth, currant bud and pastry spice. The medium- to full-bodied palate bears firm, sinewy tannins and vivid acids.
title: Cedar Creek 2011 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Shenandoah Valley)

description: Ripe raspberry, spicy red plum and licorice unfold on the nose, while soft flavors of cassis chime in on the palate. Light weight and watery with a short finish.
title: Mont Tauch 2009 Le Dog de Christophe Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: This wine beautifully blends vivid fruit, enticing spice and luxuriously creamy flavors that are concentrated, layered and complex. It pulls it all off gracefully due to underlying acidity that supports a lush texture and leads to a long finish.
title: Lava Cap 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (El Dorado)

description: This vineyard is at one of the highest Castillon points. Big in tannins and also fruit, this is a dense wine. It has a dry core as well as rich blackberry fruits. Concentrated and full, the wine will be seriously worth drinking from 2019.
title: Château Montlandrie 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The aromas of stone fruit, spice and toast show nuance and detail. The palate is restrained, showing a beautiful sense of balance to the elegant lemony flavors.
title: Owen Roe 2014 DuBrul Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

description: Light aromas of white flower, lemon curd and spice are followed by sleek, light fruit flavors. It's a straightforward, varietally correct wine.
title: Maryhill 2016 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A fine effort and multiple gold medal winner, this is loaded with cherry fruit set around a broad midpalate. It holds its flavors consistently right on through the finish, bringing in barrel notes of coffee liqueur, Bourbon barrel and vanilla.
title: Zerba Cellars 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Orange rind, flower and botrytis aromas lead to medium-sweet peach and honey flavors. There's plenty of sugar but the acid balances it out.
title: Pacific Rim 2014 Sweet Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pleasant floral aromas and sunny fruit-bowl flavors meet light buttery, earthy touches in this rather light-bodied wine. This shows nice complexity on the palate, with pear, peach and apple flavors.
title: Montevina 2013 Omira Hills Chardonnay (California)

description: This is a thick, even meaty Chardonnay with plenty of power. It rolls through well-integrated scents and flavors of lemon verbena, chervil and both green and yellow apples. The balance is impeccable, and the length and detail promise another eight to 10 years of drinking pleasure. It finishes with a soft hint of butter.
title: Lingua Franca 2016 Bunker Hill Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: This slightly sweet but utterly fresh bottling shows lime zest, honey dust, ripe red apples, lemon candy and spicy jasmine on the nose. There is nearly effervescent acidity on the palate, with strong night-jasmine notes, orange blossom and lemon verbena spicing up the apple-driven fruit core.
title: Maddalena 2013 Riesling (Monterey)

description: Juicy tangerine, lemon and lime abound on this dry, light-bodied Riesling, but earthy, savory herb and mineral notes are prominent as well. It's a brisk, refreshing wine, with a lean, steely finish. Drink now through 2019.
title: Familie Steffen 2016 Dry Riesling (Mosel)

description: A terrific Cabernet, this is rich and sophisticated, showing the classic proportions of the fabulous 2007 vintage. Dry and smooth in tannins, this is packed with flavors of berry, currant, spice and smoky cedar, leading to a long, satisfying finish. Hold and allow it to develop over the next six years.
title: Neal Family 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This great value wine opens with steady aromas of wild berry and blueberry and offers enough crisp acidity to cut though cheese or cream based pasta dishes.
title: Ruffino 2008  Chianti Superiore

description: With just that extra touch of concentration from old vines, this is a ripe, full and creamy wine, its acidity rounded out and given extra depth from the rich fruits. It has some weight and density at the end.
title: Manuel Olivier 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne Aligoté)

description: A touch of fennel seed joins the notions of freshly cut red-apple peel on the nose. The palate comes in with lemon oil that suffuses the entire palate, bathing the dry, lithe but toned body in lemony light. The finish is long and intense.
title: Henri Schoenheitz 2016 Herrenreben Riesling (Alsace)

description: Varietal offerings are a rarity in this appellation. This one brings aromas of dill, woodspice and vanilla, with the focus on the barrel. The tart red cherry flavors are silky smooth, gliding on the finish.
title: Plumb Cellars 2012 Estate Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Toasted hazelnuts and pressed apple cider notes lend a smoky, rustic character to this dry, medium-bodied Chardonnay. Orange-inflected acidity adds balance and brightness to a wine that's hearty enough to stand up to braised fowl or even lighter pork dishes.
title: Oak Summit 2010 Chardonnay (Hudson River Region)

description: An immense wine, this is bold and rich with powerful yellow and white stone fruits. It comes from one of the Montrachet vineyards that makes the greatest white wines in Burgundy. Under Julie Belland's hand, it shows in the generous, opulent nature of the wine with its balance of fruit and tight texture. Drink this very fine wine from 2023.
title: Domaine Julie Belland 2014  Criots-Bâtard-Montrachet

description: This shows moderate scents of ripe black plum, blueberry and raspberry that ride over subtle hints of blackcurrant leaf, bramble and pressed purple flowers. Medium weight and smooth on the palate, it boasts crushed-velvet tannins. The medium-length finish offers a solid fruit presence that veers toward berry compote and crumble, with lingering sweet spice.
title: Excelsior 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Robertson)

description: Hints of sea salt and crushed stone add layers of minerality to this Riesling that's just a shade off-dry. The palate is concentrated with notes of tangerine juice, lemon peel and pressed apples, balanced by puckery lemon acidity.
title: Glenora 2011 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Easy and fresh, this wine shows a natural ability to pair with most pastas or meat-based dishes. The finish is driven by smooth tannins and bright, berry-like freshness.
title: Fattoria Le Pupille 2010  Morellino di Scansano

description: If there's any quibble with this wine, it's that the aromas and flavors remain in a very narrow range, from struck flint to citrus. Otherwise, it's a lovely dry Riesling, slightly plump and custardy on the palate yet crisp and sharply focused on the finish. Drink it over the next several years.
title: Fitz-Ritter 2009 Dürkheimer Rittergarten Kabinett Trocken Riesling (Pfalz)

description: Bright cherry and raspberry tones are enhanced by sophisticated notes of toasted nut and dried tobacco. The wine is smooth and fine with elegant finesse on the close.
title: Valiano 2006  Chianti Classico

description: An interesting blend of McLaren Vale and Beechworth fruit, this wine likewise blends bright berry fruit with subtly savory elements like smoke and leather. Tannins are soft and silky, showing a bit of creaminess on the midpalate. Drink now–2015.
title: Brokenwood 2008 Shiraz (McLaren Vale-Beechworth)

description: There is no lack of oak barrel scents and accents here—chocolate and toast, layered around light strawberry fruit.
title: Mount Baker Vineyards 2007 Barrel Select Merlot (Yakima Valley)

description: This Riesling is the project of Roman Roth, accomplished winemaker for Long Island's Wolffer Estate. Tropical fruit and pear in the nose and on the palate is balanced by a nice minerality and spice. The wine has depth but is still refreshing. Pair with Thai food, fruit.
title: The Grapes of Roth 2008 Riesling (Long Island)

description: There's a warm and welcoming note of baked goods and toasty brioche on the nose of this bottling, along with hints of vanilla and black cherry. The flavors are also very accessible and delicious, with black-cherry syrup, maple, brown sugar and more vanilla spice that carries deep into the finish. The tannins are firm enough to hold up the richness.
title: Jaffurs 2014 Larger Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Here the high alcohol does not obscure the layered fruits and overall complexity of this exceptional Cabernet. Thick, ripe and richly endowed, it keeps its black fruit, ripe tannins and liquorous barrel notes all in proportion, and pulls in top flight fruit from Champoux, Sagemoor, the estate vineyard and other select sites. Earth, cedar and tobacco notes highlight the extended finish.
title: Woodward Canyon 2009 Artist Series #18 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: From a vineyard once planted to Golden Delicious apples, this 100% varietal wine is herbal and a touch green, thin with chalky tannins and a taste of dried cranberries.
title: Toad Hollow 2012 Richard McDowell Vineyard Merlot (Russian River Valley)

description: Sixty-year-old vines give concentration and richness to a wine that also has a light step. Plum, dark chocolate and some wood come together in a wine that has ripe fruit and a still-youthful structure.
title: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2009 Concerto Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

description: Shy aromas of cut grass and yellow-apple rinds show on the nose of this bottling. There is a sweet flash of ripe apple on the palate, but it's cut with a fresh lime juice kick.
title: Falkner 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

description: Smoky char on the oak emphasizes savory and earthy aspects of this weighty wine, a combination of tobacco leaf, pencil and compost. A hearty 9% Merlot is added, as are 3% Petit Verdot and 2% Petite Sirah.
title: Hoopes 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Sourced from the Seven Hills vineyard, this deep and dark Syrah offers rich black-cherry and cassis flavors. The palate is dense and complex, with beautifully integrated charcoal, gravel, earth and espresso components.
title: Rasa 2009 Occam's Razor Block Ten Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Solidly mainstream in style, Whitehaven's 2009 Sauvignon Blanc displays slightly sweaty aromas to accent its red bell pepper and passion fruit flavors. It's nicely concentrated, with enough palate weight to pair with slightly rich fish or poultry dishes. Drink up.
title: Whitehaven 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A good, fruity, everyday Cabernet. It's a little too sharp throughout, but offers fine blackberry, blueberry, currant and licorice flavors. Ready now.
title: Ben Hogan 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Fragrant and flowery, this is a ripe, full-bodied and structured wine. The violets often present in Syrah are here in force, giving an aromatic wine that also has plenty of black fruits and tannins to give power. It's worth aging, so drink from 2017.
title: Cortes de Cima 2012 Syrah (Alentejano)

description: Pure Sauvignon Blanc, this is herbal while also crisp, very fruity, bright and lively. Gooseberry juice dominates this intense wine.
title: Domaine des Pierrettes 2009 Element Terre Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

description: Noticeably herbal, this Cabernet, a good deal at its price point, is rich and the right call for midweek pizza or other casual fare.
title: Monogamy 2011 Truly Madly Deeply Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: There's an odd, fishy scent that runs through this wine, which also has strong scents and flavors of cilantro, lime and grapefruit.
title: Kudos 2017 Riesling (Willamette Valley)

description: Very ripe and saturated with dark fruit flavors, this full-bodied wine combines a jammy character with wisps of smoke and grilled herbs. It gets points for good fruit concentration and feels smooth and full on the palate.
title: Nine North Wine Company 2015 Parcel 41 Merlot (North Coast)

description: Underbrush, dill, espresso and toasted oak aromas lead the nose on this big but simple Rosso. The palate displays ripe black fruit, sweet vanilla and roasted coffee bean alongside packed tannins and the warmth of alcohol.
title: Il Poggione 2012  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Ripe plum, pressed violet, roasted coffee bean, oak, leather and eucalyptus aromas unfold on this structured red. The full-bodied palate offers raspberry jam, raisin, licorice, coconut and espresso alongside assertive, close-grained tannins. Give it another few years for the tannins to loosen up then drink sooner rather than later.
title: Bibbiano 2011 Vigna del Capannino Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

description: Full bodied and brimming in vanilla and ripe peach, this white also offers big flavors of grass and lime zest, coming down in the middle in terms of acidity. Fermented in stainless steel, it's fresh and fruity, with a creaminess to the finish.
title: The Rule 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Roasted and mildly leafy, and then clacky and a bit tannic in the mouth. The fruit flavors are good and mostly pure as they settle on black cherry and blackberry, while the finish is jammy but short. For $8 this should not disappoint.
subregion: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Capa 2008 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Vanilla, pear and a whiff of wintergreen make the nose intriguing, but after that it's commercial mango and pineapple flavors with a pithy finish. A sweet, overpumped Chardonnay.
title: Santa Alicia 2009 Reserva Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: This is a sugary Sauvignon Blanc. It tastes like a sweetened pineapple, orange and peach fruit juice drink.
title: Galante 2010 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Carmel Valley)

description: This is a remarkable value, over-delivering in terms of its varietal characteristics of cola, cinnamon, grippy tannin, black pepper, cedar and leather. Medium bodied and approachable, it's right for the table or cocktail party, able to please a range of palates.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This everyday Cab is firm and solid, with light, minty, brambly berry aromas and blackberry, pepper and chocolate flavors. The finish is reedy, light and peppery.
title: Château Los Boldos 2015 Momentos Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Cachapoal Valley)

description: An appealing quaffer with notes of passion fruit, papaya and citrus. It drinks a hair off dry (1.2g/L residual sugar), with moderate concentration, and goes down easy.
title: Original House Wine 2013 Fish House Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Ripe pear and lemony brightness on the nose suggest generous richness. The palate is more zesty than expected, giving wonderful precision to those burgeoning, juicy and full-fruited notes of pear and Mirabelle plum. Yet there always is that welcome zesty citrus to tone and refresh. Lovely bright, zesty and dry finish.
title: Proidl 2017 Ried Ehrenfels Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

description: There's a lot of rich, ripe blackberry, blueberry, black currant and cassis flavor in this Cabernet, but it's still finding its balance. The fruit is primary in nature with strong tannins and oak that's not yet integrated. The wine lacks subtlety now, but on the other hand, it doesn't seem to have a long life ahead, so give it 3–4 years and drink with steak.
title: Groth 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: This is a very good Napa Cabernet, stylishly dry and smooth in tannins. It's rich in blackberries, cherries and sweet new oak, with earthier hints of dried sage and tobacco. Drink now–2016.
title: Bell 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Whispers of smoke and flint on the nose of this intensely minerally Sauvignon Blanc blow off to reveal a bright, elegantly balanced wine with hints of fresh green grass and stems. It's brisk and refreshing, with an easy drinking feel.
title: Comtesse Thérèse 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Aromas of wet limestone, citrus zest and quince are tight and focused on the nose of this dry-style Riesling. Flavors of tart green-plum and lime are persistent on the palate, softened by some textural roundness and extended by a lingering marshmallow finish.
title: Bellangelo 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: With this wine's lifted aromas and candied fruit, it's frankly a bit confectionary. Chocolate-covered cherries define the palate, while the tannins are creamy-soft and the finish slightly warming. All that said, it's cleanly made, and fits the bill as an easy-drinking cocktail red.
title: Château Tanunda 2007 Grand Barossa Shiraz (Barossa)

description: With an average age of 45 years, the Chevreau family's vines bestow intensity and richness. This is a generous wine, the green fruits lifted by good acidity and a taut mineral texture that comes from the chalk in the soil. This wine is young but very ready to drink.
title: Château de Crézancy 2015  Sancerre

description: Char, dried herb and broad black-fruit notes give this Cabernet Franc a sense of darkness. Medium to full bodied, it has an easygoing midpalate and a finish that comes with a tangy, candied element and an inflection of mocha.
title: CrossKeys 2011 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

description: Subtle aromas of sunbaked earth, toast, French oak and chopped herb slowly emerge in the glass. The aromas carry over to the round robust palate along with raspberry jam, dried black cherry, licorice and baking spice while velvety tannins lend finesse. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the close. Drink 2018–2023.
title: Pieve Santa Restituta 2011 Rennina  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: California's warm, dry summers are the star of this wine. They have given it lusciously ripe, opulent blackberry, cherry, plum, currant and cassis flavors. For all the richness, the wine is balanced in a tension of tannins and acidity, and the finish is totally dry. Young and vibrant now, it will develop additional complexities over the next six years.
title: Jaffurs 2010 Verna's Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a bit hard and aggressive now, with a punch of green tannins. That makes it hard to appreciate the underlying oaky, ripe blackberry and currant fruit. It doesn't seem to have the inherent balance necessary for aging, so give it a decanting and drink it now.
title: Joseph Cellars 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of banana, tropical fruits and spun sugar set up a weighty, citrusy palate with flavors of fresh-squeezed orange juice and grapefruit. Fruity from front to back.
title: Fabre Montmayou 2013 Phebus Un-Oaked Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Aromas of chlorine, stewed berry fruits, turned earth and green herbs set up a choppy palate with biting tannins. Strained, oaky plum flavors are savory and green, while this Cabernet has rubbery green tannins that dominate the finish.
title: Terrazas de Los Andes 2015 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Sourced from both Volcano Ridge and The Pines vineyards, this is a smooth, supple wine, 100% varietal, with a mix of plum and blueberry fruit. Somewhat high toned and bright, it is ready to drink over the next couple of years.
title: The Pines 1852 2015 Merlot (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: Big, burly, medicinal aromas get it going, and there's no shortage of creamy, spicy oak as well. Good mouthfeel and enough clarity of fruit override the wine's sweet, oaked-up side, and the finish is dry, a touch leafy and drives home the fact that this is authentic Chilean Carmenère.
title: Santa Rita 2008 Medalla Real Special Reserve Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: This wine is a blend from all the major separate areas of Pouilly Fumé. It has ripe fruit and a structure that is typical of the appellation. Lemon fruit and a tangy, mineral texture ensure a bright, crisp wine that also has some weight. Drink now.
title: Pascal Jolivet 2016  Pouilly-Fumé

description: This is a thin, sharp Chianti Superiore with thorny acidity and zesty aromas of white cherry and cassis. You'll want to match this wine with a creamy food such as risotto with grated Parmigiano cheese.
title: Poggio al Casone 2007  Chianti Superiore

description: Yellow plum is boosted by bright ripe notes of Amalfi lemon alongside some grassy hints. The palate has a similarly bright, fruity and expressive outlook. Zesty citrus dominates the light dry body and leads onto a dry finish.
title: Strauss 2017 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (Steiermark)

description: Seems like it might have been better a year ago. Although you'll find rich pineapple, lemon drop and butterscotch flavors, they're getting a little tired, and the oak is starting to dominate.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a rich, green-plum and yellow-fruit flavored wine. Toast gives an extra roundness to a palate that is full, fragrant and ripe with fruit. It's delicious now, but could age for 2–3 years more.
title: Domaine Vincent Delaporte 2010 Maxime Vieilles Vignes sur Silex  (Sancerre)

description: It's unbelievable that this Chardonnay is unoaked, it's so incredibly rich and creamy. Just packed with layers of tropical fruits, peaches, Asian pears and oatmeal cookies. All that butter and cream must be from the malolactic fermentation and aging on the lees. One of the best unoaked Chardonnays ever.
title: Marimar Estate 2010 Acero Don Miguel Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This has ripe, rewarding blackberry, cherry and oak flavors, wrapped in full-bodied tannins and finished with sweet oak. It's easy to drink with any beef or lamb dish.
title: Educated Guess 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: There's a vegetal touch in this dry, earthy Syrah. Despite some cherry and mocha flavors and a nice structure of acids and tannins, it's just not rich enough to merit a higher score.
title: Eberle 2010 Steinbeck Vineyard Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: Aromas of wood spice, plum and herb lead to black fruit flavors and chalky, dry tannins that make it hard to access.
title: Three Rivers 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is an excellent wine for the price. Aromas of lightly salted nectarines and pan-seared Asian pear are very inviting and pretty. There's a nice sizzle of acidity on the palate and a nervy tension, with lime juice and sea-salt sharpness leading into rounded almond and apple notes in the midpalate.
title: Sextant 2014 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Lehmann's 2009 may not be its best or longest lived Stonewell, but it's a luscious example nonetheless. It's round and creamy in the mouth, with no hard edges, and easy-to-appreciate flavors of black cherries, plums, toasty oak and menthol. Drink now–2020.
title: Peter Lehmann 2009 Stonewell Shiraz (Barossa)

description: Smoky and meaty smelling to begin with, like a mix of barbecued spare ribs and roasted berries. The palate is full, tannic and drying, with bacon, hickory and baked blackberry flavors mixed with herbs. Hard and clacky on the finish, but flavorful and solid throughout.
title: Bodegas Fuentespina 2007 Selección  (Ribera del Duero)

description: At 12.7% alcohol, this is—not surprisingly—a light, tart wine. The pomegranate fruit is surrounded with caramel and toast flavors from aging in French oak. The finishing tannins have a green-tea edge.
title: AntoLin Cellars 2010 Estate Carmenère (Yakima Valley)

description: With four years of age behind it, this Cab is soft and fine and ready to drink now. It's delicious in blackberry, cherry, currant, licorice, beef jerky and smoky oak flavors, and feels elegant in the mouth.
title: Hauck 2006 Redwood Hill Vineyard Tableau Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

description: Bollini's bright, cool-climate Merlot opens with a rich, ruby color and fragrant aromas of cherry, blueberry and wild strawberry. The wine sees six months of light oak aging, adding moderate spice and tobacco. The price is right and the mouthfeel is tonic and tight.
title: Bollini 2008 Merlot (Trentino)

description: Heavy handed in ripe fruit and oak, with a soft, sweet mouthfeel. Will appeal to fans of the tropical fruit and buttered toast style of Chardonnay.
title: Bargetto 2008 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Coming from one of the state's premier Syrah vineyards, this wine starts out aromatically reserved before blossoming to reveal notes of dark raspberry, dried cranberry, woodspice, vanilla and anise. It shows the warmth of the vintage with concentrated, black-fruit flavors backed by a light squeeze of tannins followed by a lengthy finish. The oak plays prominently but it works.
title: Kontos 2013 Les Collines Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This full-bodied wine is rich with tropical fruit as well as a more citrus character. It's ripe, packed with apples, apricots and then cut with acidity. There is a cool, fresh aftertaste.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Grand'Arte Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: Cool, herbal aromas of tomato leaf, oregano and beef stew set up a chewy palate with grabby tannins. A mix of savory spices and minty, baked berry flavors end with peppery notes, chunky weight and a tough of heat. Drink through 2022.
title: Viña Cobos 2013 Bramare Cabernet Sauvignon (Luján de Cuyo)

description: The pedigree of this Cabernet shows in the incredible depth of flavor and softly gentle, complex tannins. With intensely concentrated blackberry jam, cassis liqueur and oak flavors, it's distinctly Napa-esque. It is, however, compromised by sharp acidity that's noticeable throughout the palate experience.
title: Signorello 2010 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is dry and velvety in texture, with rich, complex flavors of cherries, licorice, bacon, Dr. Pepper and savory, peppery spices. A touch of oak adds a sweet smokiness. Almost as light as a Pinot Noir, it's a very pretty, polished Syrah to drink now.
title: Renaudin 2009 Reserve Syrah (Carneros)

description: A simple, straightforward nose of apple and citrus carries to the light- to medium-bodied palate. It's enjoyable in its transparency and a perfect crowd pleaser.
title: Benmarl 2016 Stainless Steel Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: While this is certainly on the higher end of South African Shiraz price points, it's worth the investment. The intense bouquet is loaded with rich dark cherry, raspberry, sweet spice and small wild strawberries. All-spice and pepper dominate the creamy mouth, with opulent flavors of meaty plum, roasted espresso and black cherry guts. Full and powerful in the mouth with a strong vanilla-accented finish. Delicious now but worthy of cellar time as well.
title: Hartenberg 2006 The Stork Shiraz (Stellenbosch)

description: So ripe and sweet in raspberry jam, cherry pie and plum sauce flavor, it makes it hard to appreciate the other qualities of this Syrah. It also has lovely, soft tannins and a long, spicy finish. Doesn't leave much to the imagination, but it sure is a tasty wine.
title: Eponymous 2010 Syrah (Napa Valley)

description: Honeycomb and wilting citrus blossom notes make up this wine. It's lightly concentrated, with mild acidity and a short finish.
title: Winery of Ellicottville 2015 Riesling (New York)

description: This is a finely tuned Cabernet with dark blue-and-black fruit tones and concentrated shovelings of earth and mushroom. A new vineyard designate for the winery, this one's worth seeking out. It's suited to pair with anything braised or roasted. Let it age for another 5–7 years.
title: Steven Kent 2009 Folkendt Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

description: It's really easy to like now for its rich black currant, cherry and chocolate flavors. The tannins are firm and ripe, and there's a lovely balance of acidity and oak. This is one of the best Martini Alexander Valley Cabs to date.
title: Louis M. Martini 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: This light-bodied wine sings in bright, citrus-laden overtones, with enough length and complexity to intrigue. Rocky minerality overlays lemon pith and a delightful crispness that makes for a food friendly, celebratory selection.
title: Blue Farm 2013 Gap's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Subtle aromas of smoke, Bartlett pear and Granny Smith apple carry over to the palate along with a citrusy note and a hint of raw almond.
title: Peter Zemmer 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: This wine's pretty strawberry and spicy/tart cherry fruit shines, with medium concentration and length. Its light tannins and supportive acids are in fine balance, making it a nice alternative to more elegant Pinot Noir-based Oregon rosés.
title: Eliana 2017 Rosé of Merlot (Rogue Valley)

description: Crossfork Creek is a new label for Sheridan Vineyard, designed, says winemaker Scott Greer, as his laboratory for vinous experimentation. This meaty, smoky, dense and chewy Syrah is one of the first releases. The black cherry and cassis flavors are accented with a touch of cola, and the wine resolves with a firm, substantial and somewhat tannic finish.
title: Crossfork Creek 2010 Dark Matter Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: Initially this seems completely flat and raisiny. Yet despite a flabby, heavy mouthfeel and roasted, syrupy flavors, it offers just enough life on the finish to merit a go with soft cheeses and the like. Think of it as Port with far less structure; drink now.
title: Marques de Griñon 2006 Estate Bottled Syrah (Dominio de Valdepusa)

description: A gamy meat aroma meets black cherry, black plum, hickory, licorice and peppercorns on the nose of this cool-climate Syrah by Winemaker Nicole Bertotti Pope. Loads of cracked pepper and bright purple-fruit flavors show on the palate alongside rosemary and bay leaf, all wrapped in a taut structure with zippy acidity.
title: 96pointsStolo 2016 Estate Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Rounded aromas of Gravenstein apple, marmalade on warm toast and fine-grained oak show on the nose of this bottling. It's clean and very classic on the palate, offering roasted apple, crushed nut, lemon rind and seared orange flavors.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Jackson Estate Camelot Highlands Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Pungent aromas of concentrated stone fruits, bubble gum, a whiff of diesel and pine tar introduce a multidimensional wine with lip-smacking acidity. All stainless fermented, no malolactic, no acidification—just a clean, pure, natural and richly delicious wine, loaded with ripe, luscious peach, pear, papaya and apricot fruit.
title: Arbor Crest 2009 Bacchus Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A solid effort, with cherry and red currant aromas. The palate bears scratchy tannins and flavors of raspberry and red plum, with mild, dry and crisp finish. This should pair well with basic foods.
title: Casa Silva 2009 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: This is a ripe, creamy wine with fresh currant and ripe peach fruits. It is lightly tangy, although its main strength is the refreshing fruitiness. Bright and crisp at the end, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul Picard 2014  Sancerre

description: Thin and simple, this is a direct and straightforward wine, with green apple fruit flavors and a very light dusting of cinnamon. Drink now.
title: Girly Girl 2011 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The aromas pop, with notes of raspberry jam, cherry and spice. The cocoa and jammy red-fruit flavors are light and appealing, tapering toward the finish. It's a straight down the fairway offering of the variety.
title: Maryhill 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Peju's Merlots have been inconsistent. When they're good, they're quite good, but you never know. This 2008, from a less successful vintage, is all right. It's dry and tannic and soft in cherry and tobacco flavors. But there's not a lot going on. Drink up.
title: Peju 2008 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Seems slightly dark in color—a burnished brass—but with mouthwatering notes of vegetable oil, ripe peach and citrus fruit. It's concentrated to the point of a slight viscosity on the palate, lingering on the finish. A solid effort, if not completely up to expectations.
title: A. Christmann 2008 Königsbacher Idig GG Trocken Riesling (Pfalz)

description: Supple and round with lusciously forward honeydew and apple flavors, Casa Larga's French Oak Chardonnay balances layers of fruit and white florals with a dusty, dried herb and fresh-cut wood character. Dry in style but generously composed.
title: Casa Larga 2008 Estate Grown French Oak Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: This 100% Tempranillo was sourced from the Stonetree vineyard. It's soft on entry, with brambly red fruits, a wash of milk chocolate (from aging in 50% new oak) and a hint of leather.
title: Walla Faces 2012 Tempranillo (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Moderately ripe aromas of plum and cranberry lead to a rubbery-feeling palate with hard tannins. Earthy berry flavors come with nut-skin bitterness, while this can't shake its aforementioned rubbery character on the finish. The 2016 vintage in Mendoza was tough on red wines, this one included.
title: Mendel 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: This mild-flavored and smooth-textured wine will be a good supporting actor at the next meal or party. It has subdued fig and baking-spice flavors, a supple mouthfeel and lightly fruity finish.
title: Borrellie 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Chardonnay (California)

description: This wine intrigues with its aromas of peppery spices, tobacco and purple fruit. The flavors are lush and focused, bringing a lot of hedonistic pleasure, though it trails a bit toward the finish.
title: College Cellars 2014 Anderson Estate Vineyard Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Bricky, spicy berry aromas come with a streak of green. The palate on this Cab is sticky and tannic, with generic berry flavors, sweet brown sugar and herbal notes. On the finish, it's oaky and chocolaty, with firm tannins.
title: François Lurton 2010 Gran Araucano Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Dark red fruit, wet wood, a pinch of herbs, pepper spice and a baked licorice aroma show on the nose of this top-end bottling from the historic regional producer. Shaved licorice shows on the palate, where grippy tannins and a woody spice make for an impressive sip.
title: Callaway 2012 OPR Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)

description: Big and flamboyant, an impressive Chardonnay whose flavors are explosive. Tangerines, blood oranges and tropical fruits are massively enriched by sweet oak. Coastal acidity provides a fine, minerally backbone. A complex, delicious wine. Don't drink it too cold.
title: Joseph Carr 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Sweet and sour, with candied pineapple and butterscotch flavors as well as brisk acidity, leading to a sugary finish. Okay as an everyday Chardonnay.
title: Fleur de California 2008 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Plenty of blackberry, cherry and mocha fruit flavors in this sugary sweet Cabernet. It's a sound, full-bodied everyday sipper.
title: Kunde 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: Marked by crisp, zingy acidity that gives the lemon and lime fruit a mouthwatering tartness, this voluminous Chardonnay is perfect for drinking now, as a cocktail or with rich shellfish dishes. It's really elegantly constructed and stylish, a great restaurant wine.
title: Freemark Abbey 2010 Chardonnay (Howell Mountain)

description: Dried leaf, cherry, woodspice and medicinal aromas are followed by supple, sweet cherry flavors backed by lightly grainy tannins and a tart lick of acid. It's an intriguing wine that keeps you coming back for more.
title: Mosquito Fleet 2012 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Tingling acidity wraps around a core of pear and peach fruit in this well-integrated, layered and lush wine. The oak is quiet through the entry and midpalate, picking up power and weight on the finish. Lovely on its own, it's also a good choice for the table.
title: Roth 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

description: This sugary-sweet dessert Chardonnay tries hard to please, offering waves of honey, tangerine, mango and vanilla flavors. It's tantalizingly delicious, but could be just a tad more concentrated, especially at this price.
title: Lynmar 2011 Divinity Late Harvest Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Tannic, crisp and borderline unfriendly when tasted on its own, this is a firmly structured, berry-and-earth-inflected dry red that should be paired with rare steaks or burgers in order for it to shine.
title: Kangarilla Road 2009 Sangiovese (McLaren Vale)

description: Hearty, smoothly textured and with a thickness to the palate, it's deep in blackberry and leather and shows an electric streak of earthiness and spice throughout. It balances lushness with structure effortlessly.
title: Yorba 2009 Shake Ridge Vineyards Tempranillo (Amador County)

description: Burgundy-raised vintner Christian Roguenant gets to show his stuff in this line of Firepeak wines. Wet cement, honeysuckle, crisp Asian pear and the slightest hints of tropicality show on the nose, while the palate offers yellow grapefruit, lemon skins, squeezed lime and lime-blossom flavors, wrapped around nervy tension.
title: Baileyana 2014 Firepeak Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Crisp, fruity and with a strongly herbal character, this wine has a rich texture from the lees aging before bottling. Hints of riper white fruits will develop as it ages for another few months. Drink from 2019.
title: Les Celliers de Pauline 2017 Cuvée Eric Louis  (Sancerre)

description: Mixed red and black fruits seem to be maturing quickly—the wine hits a wall and stops short. The finish turns chalky, but the wine is perfectly fine for drinking now, perhaps with a peppery steak.
title: Barking Frog 2010 Elerding Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Washington)

description: Blackberry cordial leads in this fruit-driven wine, followed by vanilla, mocha, black olive and a bit of dusting polish. The palate is plush and brambly backed by a good grip of fine-grained tannins and a savory olive finish. This will cellar nicely. Drink now–2027.
title: Two Hands 2015 Gnarly Dudes Shiraz (Barossa Valley)

description: There's definitely some horsey notes on the nose, but the decadent palate, with its intoxicating blend of raspberry, loganberry and cranberry, all couched in a sophisticated vanilla and coffee framework, takes the day. Medium-to-long finish shows grippy tannins. Drink now or cellar several years.
title: Hugh Hamilton 2007 The Villain Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)

description: Sweet and powerful in toasted oak and ripe fruit, this Chardonnay brims with pineapple jam, lemon custard, buttered toast, caramel corn and vanilla bean flavors, in a creamy texture.
title: Arrowood 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A musky, herbal element rises on the nose of this wine, a majority varietal, with small additions of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Dry and structured, it features soft waves of savory tobacco and tea leaf around crisp cherry and clove.
title: Tin Barn 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: Unbelievably rich, this tastes pretty much as excellent as the winery's more expensive Chardonnays. It really dazzles with its complex flavors of tropical fruit, green apple, pear, buttered toast and honey. It's all brightened by terrific acidity and wrapped into a creamy texture.
title: Matanzas Creek 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This is a lovely, age-worthy wine that sings in earthy tobacco, black pepper and leather before revealing balanced acidity and a light background of its 20 months in French oak, 40% of it new. Made by Gary Brookman, it finishes awash in cherry and chocolate. Drink now through 2022.
title: Mueller 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

description: This wine impresses, with cedar, black cherries, dill and licorice on the complex nose. Sagebrush and blueberries power the palate, which also shows charred beef, asphalt and smoked meats. This is proving to be a very heavy and deep wine.
title: Firestone 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Forward in cherry and blackberry jam flavors, this Cabernet has been generously oaked, giving it a buttered-toast smokiness. It's soft and mellow, making it drinkable now.
title: Celani Family Vineyards 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Initial oak-driven aromas of grilled and smoked meats don't allow for much fruit expression on the nose. A jammy, plush palate is solid but not too hard or tannic. Spicy, toasty flavors of plum, raisin and licorice expire with mild heat and burn on the finish. Drink through 2032.
title: Licenciado 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

description: This medium-bodied wine leans toward sweetness and offers flavors like grape jam and maple syrup. It is generally soft in texture but does have a touch of grippy tannin.
title: Rotation Vineyards 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This 100% Cabernet was aged in new French oak. That potent combo gives it an intensity of black currants and sweet buttered toast. The tannins are hard and the alcohol level is high. It's a bit predictable in the modern style, but delicious.
title: Vice Versa 2010 Le Petit Vice Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Grown in the flatlands and benches of Alexander Valley, this Cab tastes more like a high mountain wine, with its firm tannins and flavor intensity. It's quite fine, showing intense blackberry, cherry, black currant, plum, cocoa and violet flavors that are tinged with soft, dry herbs. Very beautiful now for sheer charm, it will develop bottle complexities over the next decade. The best Cabernet from Hanna in memory.
