title: Hanna 2005 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Made with Bordò (a biotype of Grenache) in limited case production, Kupra is a special wine that is clearly designed to showcase the potential of winemaking in the Marche, Central Italy. The wine is crisp, clean and elegant with a long assembly of aromas that span from cherry and cinnamon to crushed white stone and white pepper. The close is smooth and elegant.
title: Oasi degli Angeli 2008 Kupra Grenache (Marche)

description: Sunbaked soil, mature plum, vanilla and a balsamic note of menthol lead the nose. The ripe, velvety palate doles out juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry, mocha and baking spice alongside hearty but polished tannins. It's already delicious and accessible but also shows some staying power. Drink 2017–2028.
title: Talenti 2010 Pian di Conte Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Dark coffee, mocha, vanilla, cherry and herb aromas are followed by plump-feeling fruit flavors. One wants a bit more structure to hang all that fruit on but what's there is pleasant.
title: North by Northwest 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: With fruit from Les Collines, McKinley Springs and Elephant Mountain vineyards, this offers coconut, vanilla and baking spice aromas and full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors. The oak influence is pretty intense.
title: Maryhill 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This Merlot is dry, full-bodied and delicious in fruit and oak. Black cherries, currants, mocha, plums, vanilla and fragrant sandalwood all come together to provide a complex drink that's firm in tannins and fancy in the finish. Drink now.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2011 Grand Reserve Merlot (Sonoma County)

description: Biltmore is a well-known North Carolina winery, and now they're producing from California. With this Cabernet, it seems like they're trying to figure it out. The wine is soft and simple and rather sweet, with jammy cherry and raspberry flavors that turn cloying the more you swish it around the mouth.
title: Biltmore Estate 2007 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: This Lodi wine has a whirl of smoky, oaky flavors, plus a not entirely pleasant green tinge to its finish.
title: Insatiable 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: The new project of Erica and Kim Crawford (yes, the Kim Crawford), Loveblock is situated on a spectacular windswept promontory overlooking the sea. Passion fruit, vibrant and pure, marks the nose, while the plump palate reveals hints of gooseberry that linger through the extended finish.
title: Loveblock 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Textbook Rioja gran reserva in every way. It's light and smoky smelling, with brown sugar, fine cologne and cedary aromas. Generous but well-cut in the mouth, with fig, mushroom, raspberry and spiced plum flavors. Fresh on the finish, with light herb flavors and good weight. Drink now through 2018.
title: CVNE 1999 Imperial Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: This nicely rich and rounded wine smells like vanilla and toasted bread. The flavors are ripe and black-cherry-like, with a hint of chocolate and baking spices that comes from oak. It's medium bodied and easy to like.
title: Tortoise Creek 2013 Cherokee Lane Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: Less weighty than some of the other top-rated Hawke's Bay Syrahs, Homage relies on complexity rather than raw power. Its sour plum fruit is perfectly balanced by black olive and roasted meat, hints of bacon and espresso, while the tannins are fine and silky, the acids bright. Drink now–2025.
title: Trinity Hill 2009 Homage Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

description: This offers aromas of dark berry, spice, tobacco and a whiff of vanilla. The palate delivers ripe black cherry layered with chocolate, coffee and white pepper. This is delicious and already drinking well but should develop complexity with more cellaring. Drink now through 2019.
title: Castelli del Grevepesa 2009 Riserva Castello di Bibbione  (Chianti Classico)

description: Savory berry and tomato aromas come with mild notes of mint and green. This is racy on the palate, with bold acidity. Toasty, savory berry flavors come with chocolaty overtones, while this settles on the palate but remains juicy and high in acidity.
title: Viña Casablanca 2014 Nimbus Single Vineyard Syrah (Casablanca Valley)

description: ). You'll want to cellar this young 100% Cab because it's not showing its full potential yet. Dry and tannic, it's very rich in black currants and blackberry jam, but all of the wine's parts need more time to fully integrate; currently, the oak is forward, the acids are tart and citrusy, and the tannins are fierce. Should improve over the next 10 years, maybe even 20.
title: Venge 2010 Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A Chardonnay with noticeable barrel influence, this is creamy and thick, with a baked apple flavor. Pair it with chicken in cream sauce or lobster and butter.
title: Peirano 2011 Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: A good buy for its dryness and overall balance. You won't mistake it for a cult Cabernet, but the blackberry and currant flavors work.
title: Delicato 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: After starting out slightly reduced, the aromas of lemon pith, wet stone and oyster shell bring appeal. The feel is broad and generous, backed by tart, well-balanced acidity and a lingering finish.
title: Savage Grace 2014 Celilo Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Gorge (WA))

description: A deliciously soft, easy-drinking Merlot for enjoying tonight with a nice steak or burger. It's basically dry, but ultrarich and sweet in raspberry, cherry, cocoa and baking spice flavors.
title: Madrigal 2008 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of sweet tangerine and peach are spiced with cardamom on this sun-drenched, semisweet Riesling. It's breathtakingly perfumed, yet deeply concentrated in stone fruit on the palate. Laser-like acidity and a crystalline finish lend upright structure. Gorgeous already but likely to improve through 2025.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2016 Graacher Himmelreich Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: A unique style of Riesling, naturally fermented on the skins for 20 days prior to pressing. The result is intriguing: honey and baked apple notes tinged with peach-like ripeness and briny minerality. It's medium-bodied, crisp and dry yet with a sense of honeyed richness.
title: Würtz 2008 Geyerscheiss Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Too acidic for real enjoyment, with a bite of citrusy sharpness, as if a few squirts of lime juice were added. Otherwise, it's bone dry and tannic, with blackberry and pepper flavors.
title: Lafond 2008 SRH Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Everything about this wine is big. It's superripe in jammy cherries and raspberries, and super-oaky, with a sweet coating of caramelized candy corn. It's a crowd pleaser for many red wine fans, but simply too sweet and simple for the price.
title: Middle Ridge 2008 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Quite a good, rich Chardonnay, showing classic cool-climate, long-hangtime flavors of pineapple, citron and white peach, with a coating of sweet oak. Shows once again how perfectly the Bien Nacido Vineyard ripens Chardonnay.
title: Tyler 2009 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Worn saddle leather and brown spice aromas transfer onto the juicy medium-bodied frame, which becomes more sturdy on the finish.
title: Freitas 2011 Private Reserve Merlot (Arizona)

description: If freshness is the challenge, this very light yet vibrant bottling by Chad Melville is a champion. Aromas of pear flesh and lime blossom lead into a sip that dances across the tongue with flavors of Asian pear, white melon and lemon juice, finishing with a hint of intriguing ash. The wine still zips days later.
title: Melville 2017 Clone 76 Inox Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The price has come down on Ruffino's Lumina this year, and this is great news for consumers. This expression of Pinot Grigio pushes all the usual buttons: the wine is compact, luminous and redolent of citrus, pear and peach.
title: Ruffino 2009 Lumina Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: Made from 89% Cabernet Sauvignon, 7% Malbec and 4% Petit Verdot and aged in 100% new oak for 20 months, this is a burly red wine with impressive structure and presence. Tangy red fruit, recalling cranberry and currant, is spiced with clove, mountain sage, bay leaf and molasses notes.
title: Mount Veeder 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

description: Rich, soft and creamy, with flamboyantly ripe raspberry and cherry pie filling, vanilla, roasted almond, honey and cinnamon spice flavors. Tastes like a granola fruit bar in wine form, with a pleasantly hot hit of alcohol. Drink now.
title: Olson Ogden 2008 Unti Vineyard Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Gaseous on the nose, with aromas of celery and lettuce leaf. The palate has a simple, bland feel and green, drying flavors of flimsy citrus. Soft overall and low on acidity.
title: Pascual Toso 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

description: Big and woody to start, with heavily toasted blackberry and herbal aromas. The palate is thick, dense and tannic, but it doesn't punish. Tastes of cassis, blackberry and herbs before transitioning to dry oak and roasted berry on the finish.
title: Dominio del Plata 2010 Crios Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Smoky and savory with a touch of spring ramps and moss, this medium-sweet Riesling balances ripe, luscious peach and nectarine flavors with a gradation of green, herbal accents. It's delicately framed with a steely, honed acidity that lingers on the finish.
title: Bollig-Lehnert 2012 Piesperter Goldtröpfchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Salty, briny oak gives a lift to the bolder richer flavors of baked pear in this lovely vineyard-designate, made in small amounts. Caramel and vanilla accent a nicely lush, yet balanced palate of full flavor and grace.
title: Saxon Brown 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Green Acres Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Given the lauded conditions of 2010 in Rioja, this wine's herbal minty grassy nose and raw tart pulling palate are surprising. Savory herbal tomatoey red-plum flavors finish minty, with lasting fresh acidity.
title: Finca Valpiedra 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)

description: A signature bottling from the relatively new appellation, this Sashi Moorman wine shows fresh-pressed boysenberry, black raspberry, dried violets and lavender on the zesty nose. There is an extreme amount of vibrancy to the palate, with black and white pepper spicing up the tart elderberry and juniper fruits, with licorice and menthol playing supporting roles.
title: Stolpman 2013 Angeli Syrah (Ballard Canyon)

description: Light, bright and racy, this wine from Dave Potter's new label shows fresh and clean touches of lime, quinine, mandarin orange pith, baking soda and light mint on the nose. The texture is appropriately oily, with petrol flavors and sprinkles of acidity that play across the palate.
title: Potek 2013 Kick-On Ranch Riesling (Santa Barbara County)

description: With its inky concentration, rich extraction and ripe aromas of blackberry pie and cherry preserves, fine craftsmanship is evident. Soft veins of spice and chocolate weave elegantly throughout.
title: Rocca delle Macìe 2008 Riserva di Fizzano  (Chianti Classico)

description: This is a simple, fruit-driven white wine, ideal as an apéritif or for patio-sipping. Pear, melon and pineapple notes mingle easily on the nose and palate, finishing moderately long.
title: Sacred Hill 2014 Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)

description: Although its fresh lemon and savory apple flavors are pleasant, this is clumsy and disjointed with a soapy, floral nose and shriekingly high acidity levels.
title: Chaddsford 2009 Pinot Grigio (Pennsylvania)

description: This is a stellar and immensely attractive Merlot that's sure to impress any true wine lover. Fig, black plum flesh, sweet cola glaze and black raspberry sauce dominate, with accents of leathery spice and cigar tobacco adding depth and complexity. It's round and full in the mouth with dainty fine grain tannins and a long finish. This can easily be drunk now or cellared for another 2–5 years.
title: Shannon 2008 Mount Bullet Merlot (Elgin)

description: Round and juicy, this opens with aromas of stone fruit, dried herb and a whiff of pear. The ripe, enveloping palate doles out white peach, mature apple, juicy nectarine and a hint of bitter almond. A mineral note closes the lingering finish.
title: Gradis'ciutta 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Rubber and black fruits carry the standard nose, then comes a zesty palate with upfront acids and related zingy berry fruit flavors. Despite a touch of scour, this  brings freshness and a clean, tasty fruit level. Perfectly good for Central Valley Cabernet.
title: Maniña 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: A little sharp and direct, but nicely dry, and offering a rich mouthful of blackberries, black currants and cola. Best now and for a few years.
title: X 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Rich acidity and dense tannins lock this Cabernet in a veil of toughness—despite its flashy, elaborate black currant, dark chocolate and cedar flavors. The dryness and elegant balance strongly suggest its ageability. This could really be something around 2018.
title: Seavey 2009 Caravina Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Four generations of the Fourrey family have produced wine in Chablis. This latest vintage hails from one of their top parcels. Its crispness contrasts well with the weight and mineral texture of this young wine. Good acidity and a tangy texture indicate a good future. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Fourrey 2017 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Made from the best four barrels of the vintage, this bottling shows an intriguing nose of soy and hoisin sauce, fresh-pressed blackberries, star anise and sandalwood. A similarly Asian-spiced character shows on the delicious palate, where nutmeg and clove meet with more blackberry fruit, black pepper, crushed herbs and a touch of caramel.
title: Chateau Margene 2013 Cask 4 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This is a new project from Matt and Lauren Reynvaan of Reynvaan Family Vineyards. Aged 24 months in barrel and 36 months in bottle, this wine shows vibrant, nuanced aromas of charcuterie, bacon fat, violet, fresh herbs, olive and wet gravel. The palate is textured and packed with fruit and savory flavors, while showing loads of elegance and freshness. The insane, smoked meat finish lingers.
title: MTR Productions 2012 Memory Found Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: It opens with aromas of toasted wood, cherry cough medicine, espresso, vanilla, black spices and Mediterranean brush. The muddled palate delivers sweet oak, vanilla extract and caramelized sugar sensations alongside astringent wood tannins. It lacks fruit richness and closes on a bitter, medicinal note.
title: Castelgiocondo 2009  Brunello di Montalcino

description: This wine has intense aromas of blueberry pie and vanilla, along with a barnyard note. The palate is jammy in prune and baked berry flavors. There is a yeasty and resinous quality as well. The finish is long, tart and mouthwatering, with a charred-oak note on the back.
title: Narmada 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Virginia)

description: Lightly tropical and entirely mineral-driven, racing in acidity, this tightly wound wine is cradled in toasty, integrated oak that's still trying to let go. It shows hints of the goodness within, from crisp green apple to caramel and lemon meringue. Drink now through 2023.
title: Joseph Phelps 2013 Pastorale Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: The 2010 vintage in Chile was quite cool, and that's reflected in this wine. Aromas of berry fruits are lean and underdeveloped. In the mouth, this shows astringency and rubbery tannins, while flavors of red fruits are slightly sharp and a touch green. Drying tannins make for a drawing finish.
title: Santa Ema 2010 Amplus Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: The cedar, sandalwood and pine-forest aromas work well on the Sangiovese in this bottling, which also shows red cherry on the nose. There is good tannic tightness to the palate, where red-fruit flavors meet with sawdust and vanilla on the finish.
title: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Clara Valley)

description: This wine is bursting in lavish aromas of blueberry, black currant and fudge that lead into a palate full of mouthcoating tannins and solid acidity. Blackberry, black plum and dried herb flavors complete the picture.
title: J. Lohr 2015 Hilltop Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: From the Mâcon appellation that is dominated by the formidable rock of Solutré, this is a ripe, full-bodied wine. It offers juicy acidity, fresh sliced apple flavors and a touch of spice. The wine is ready, although it will be better from late 2016.
title: Domaine Trouillet 2014  Mâcon Solutré

description: This open, generous wine is already completely in its stride. Ripe yellow fruits are given freshness by flavors of orange zest and citrus. The wood aging shows, but gently, rounding out the fruits and adding a note of spice. It's a full wine, ready to drink in 2015.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2012 Les Morgeots Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Still youthful and showing a fair amount of barrel in the nose, this unfined and unfiltered single-vineyard Chardonnay will benefit from another few years of cellaring. Fresh apple and peach flavors anchor a solid mid palate.
title: àMaurice 2010 Conner Lee Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pale lemon in color, this is quince-driven on the nose, with ripe, pithy citron and lime notes that carry to the dry palate. Medium in weight, yet boasting a soft, pillowy texture, vibrant acidity leads mineral-forward flavors, with a delicate marshmallowy finish.
title: Kelby James Russell 2014 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Dusty and tannic, this is a solid value for its quality—a wine of freshness and grip that offers complexity and approachability in equal measure. Black-cherry and black -pepper flavors highlight the palate.
title: Raymond 2014 Reserve Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A soft wine with attractive fruitiness and lemon and lime flavors. Fresh and rounded, it shows its northern French origins with the tight acidity at the end.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2011 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This Cab boasts big cherry and vanilla-oak flavors, but it's slightly smoky and herbal, too. Entirely comprised of Cabernet Sauvignon grapes from Livermore, the wine might benefit from some more time in bottle, another 1–3 years.
title: McGrail 2009 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

description: Gorgeous minerality is the underpinning of this estate bottling. Heaps of dry extract amplify racy lemon and lime flavors. Despite its low alcohol, this wine has exceptional concentration and power.
title: Trisaetum 2011 Ribbon Ridge Estate Dry Riesling (Ribbon Ridge)

description: A tremendous wine, satisfying in youth, but this should also age for a while. Made with just 2% Merlot, it's impressive in young Cabernet blackberry and cassis flavors, liberally oaked and sweetly pure in the finish. The tannins are so soft, yet so refined. Should develop through the decade, but if you drink it now, give it a good decant.
title: Merryvale 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)

description: Youthful and compact, this shows a lot of unresolved oak aromas when first opened. Slowly more complexity emerges—rose petals, tart berries, anise, cedar and ground coffee. It's balanced, young and age worthy, but decant it if you plan to drink it anytime soon.
title: Abacela 2008 Estate Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

description: A bit abrupt, with edgy tannins, but quite good for the price. Give it an hour or two in a decanter to let it mellow, and enjoy the blackberry, black currant and oak flavors.
title: Raymond 2009 Family Classic Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: This 100% Cabernet Sauvignon was sourced from Gunselman Bench, McKinley Springs and Phinny Hill vineyards. It brings notes of vanilla, coconut and cherry. The fruit flavors are plush in feel backed by dry, grippy tannins.
title: Robert Karl 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: This Chardonnay shows great concentration and intensity, yet also poise and elegance. Fruity scents of yellow apple and lemon custard are laced with spicy hits of toasted brioche and pie crust. The palate is rich and smooth in texture, but not overdone, thanks to ample acidity and a streak of orange oil that keeps the ripe flavors in check. It's well-balanced and incredibly harmonious, with a long, evolving finish. Drink now–2022.
title: Storm 2015 Vrede Chardonnay (Hemel en Aarde)

description: Notes of sweet quince and pommelo add a soft, blossomy character to this dry yet richly textured Riesling. Quite creamy on the palate, the finish is long, ending with a spray of crushed white pepper over tart grapefruit pith.
title: Belhurst 2010 Dry Riesling (Seneca Lake)

description: Tropical fruit and new wood flavors thread this opulent, seductive Chardonnay. It has surface glamor, with its flavors of ripe mango, peach and toast. Under the surface, the flavors are simple, softly textured.
title: Maison Jessiaume 2010  Bourgogne

description: Perfumed notes of raspberry and pink grapefruit distinguish this delicately framed single-vineyard designate from Keuka Spring's regular-label Riesling. Briskly textured yet lusciously peachy, it lingers long on a streak of lemon-lime acidity. Drink now through 2021 to maximize its fruity freshness.
title: Keuka Spring 2015 Humphreys Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Taut citrus, cleansing lemon and brisk grapefruit show an uncompromsing, dry Riesling that majors in tense citrus and wet-stone flavors. There is a linearity and a very alluring purity that deserves to develop further. This is lovely and briskly refreshing now, but time in bottle will bring out more earthy, stony complexity. Drink 2017–2025.
title: René Muré 2013 Côte de Rouffach Riesling (Alsace)

description: This wine is crisp and fruity. It has attractive acidity, a nice touch of spice and a backbone of minerality. The juiciness leaves a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Domaine Ferret 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: A straightforward, subtle version of Pinot Grigio, light in alcohol, a good choice as an apéritif or as an accompaniment to a light lunch. A lean lemon quality dominates its flavors and aromas.
title: Sorelle Winery 2010 Grazia Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

description: Winemaker Brent Marris (formerly of Wither Hills) has turned out a medium-bodied, creamy_textured Chardonnay that combines peachy fruit and finely tuned nuttiness. Drink it over the next 6-12 months.
title: Marisco Vineyards 2009 The King's Bastard Wairau Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: Aromas of tree bark, pencil eraser, olive, plum and berry fruits are solid. This is quite good for Maule Syrah. The acidity is lively and bracing, while plum and apple-skin flavors finish raw and grating.
title: Viña el Aromo 2010 Private Reserve Syrah (Maule Valley)

description: There's strong oak, vanilla and spice cake on the nose of this rich bottling from Paso Robles vineyards as well as sugar plums and wet soil aromas. There's an earthy minerality of turned loam to the palate, with hints of forest moss, pine oil and cracked pepper.
title: Nelle 2015 Grenache (California)

description: Hearty red-fruit and graham cracker richness mark this well-made wine, blended with 8% Cabernet Sauvignon. A generous tannin structure provides a framework for the ripe weight as the finish explores aspects of sweet tobacco.
title: Whitehall Lane 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of assorted green herbs mix with notes of black cherry, anise and barrel spice. The blackberry flavors are sweet and tacky in feel. There's intrigue but it doesn't all come together.
title: Windy Canyon 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Here's a 100% Sangiovese that opens with aromas of woodland berry, underbrush and a hint of balsamic herb. The juicy palate delivers ripe black cherry, licorice and black pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2023.
title: Lornano 2013  Chianti Classico

description: Fuse's Cabernet has been better in the past, when the vintages were warmer. This '11, from the coldest vintage in years, is a hard wine to embrace. It's very dry and somewhat sharp, with bell pepper-infused blackberry and olive flavors. Drink now.
title: Fuse 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: The wine is stunning, full of bright red fruit and a soft tinge of French bread, tightly structured with dark wood and a leathery component. A beautiful example of what can happen when the right winemaker and site collide: The finish is long and the wine is one to remember.
title: Alienor 2009 Cote de Castelero Syrah (Lake County)

description: Aromas of earthy berry fruit, compost, creamy oak and rubber don't amount to much. In the mouth, this is chunky, lazy and soupy feeling. Herbal blackberry flavors are slightly murky and green, while this is static on the finish.
title: Casas del Bosque 2017 Reserva Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: Opens with briar, raspberry and a spot of char. The palate is basic, simple in feel, maybe a touch curt, but overall the wine is fresh and tastes of plum and herbal berry fruit. It's slightly dry and leafy, but it's bright and fresh in the mouth, with good balance.
title: Concha y Toro 2009 Xplorador Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: A profound Cabernet from Santa Rita's home vineyard in Alto Jahuel. The hue is dark and opaque, while the nose is deep and earthy, but also intensely fruity. Shows fine structure and a lot of black cherry and cassis. Grabby, tight and ageable through at least 2013. The real deal in affordable Chilean higher-end CS; offers a little of everything, from spice to herbs to olive to fine fruit.
title: Santa Rita 2008 Medalla Real Special Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This offers mild citrus, green apple and melony aromas. The palate is soft, flat and marked by low intensity. Its tropical fruit and green herb flavors finish mildly bitter, with fleshy weight and little sizzle.
title: Carmen 2017 Wave Series Left Wave Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Interesting and well structured, this can age a few years or more. Aromas of honey, stone fruit and butterscotch candy give this wine a sophisticated edge.
title: Villa Russiz 2009 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Cropped at less than two tons per acre, this is a full-bodied, creamy-textured Tempranillo marked by vanilla-tinged oak. Black cherries and plums comprise the core, with embellishments of tobacco adding complexity to this lush, easy-drinking wine. Drink it over the next several years.
title: Gemtree 2008 Luna Roja Tempranillo (McLaren Vale)

description: This bottling from Martin Ray has been offering consistent value over the years. With the 2011, they continue that tradition with this smooth, softly tannic Merlot. The cherry, mocha and oak flavors are easy to like.
title: Martin Ray 2011 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: This is a remarkably affordable find, so good in its red-fruited, tangy acidity and spiciness on the palate. Dried herb and pencil lie beneath bigger, bolder swathes of blackberry and cherry. This wine has a large presence but shows structure and balance.
title: Stack House 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This wine is at the fringes in Washington, exploring dry farming where irrigation is the norm. Fresh herb, blackberry and raspberry aromas lead off. Packed with rich, elegant fruit flavors, it also has an herbal streak running from head to tail.
title: Tulpen 2010 Dry Land Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Fresh, cutting gooseberry and grapefruit flavors persist from nose to finish in this exquisitely light bodied Riesling. The palate is off-dry in style, suggesting sweet-tart tangerine and apricot accented by shades of green herb and bramble. The finish is brisk but clean. Drink now through 2020.
title: Johannishof 2015 Johannisberg V Kabinett Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Made with 100% Chardonnay, this opens with aromas of toast, oak, acacia flower and orchard fruit. On the palate, oak-driven sensations compete with yellow apple, citrus and bitter walnut. Even though it has an abv of 13.5%, you'll notice evident alcohol on the close.
title: Passopisciaro 2013 Passobianco Chardonnay (Terre Siciliane)

description: Very light in color in the glass, this single-vineyard expression shows light chalky aromas on the nose alongside lemon peel and candied honeysuckle. Green-apple-flesh flavors pop on the palate with bright citrus flashes.
title: Crū 2016 Paraiso Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Though the residual sugar hits 5%, this has so much creamy texture and fresh acidity that it does not seem too sweet; it could in fact be drunk with certain main dishes, such as pad thai or white meat with a fruit sauce. Spritzy and lush.
title: Chehalem 2008 Sext Riesling (Willamette Valley)

description: Whispers of lemon zest and orange blossoms lend subtle dimension to this brisk, minerally Chardonnay. Fresh apple and pear are demure on the palate but jolted into action by a kick of zappy lemon-lime. It's a zesty, refreshing wine ideal for youthful enjoyment.
title: Glenora 2014 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: Structured, mineral and tense, this is a classic Pouilly Fuissé. It has lemon and crisp sliced white fruits, very linear in character with a bright, tight texture. The wine is young and could age until 2016.
title: Jaffelin 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Dried lemon peel and hay flowers make for an inviting nose. On the palate, the vivid brightness of lemon brightens notes of tart apple and the merest touch of earth and stone. This is precise and pure, absolutely dry and magnificent. The freshness is incisive and invigorating. It's another one of those gloriously bright and unapologetically fresh 2014 Rieslings. Clearly a vintage for adults only. The finish is lip-smackingly clean and utterly moreish. Drink 2017–2037.
title: Paul Blanck 2014 Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Too sharp and aggressive in tart acidity, which emphasizes the tannins, making it feel overly astringent. Not a bad wine, with pleasant cherry and blackberry flavors, but it sure is tough in the mouth.
title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2007 Picazo Vineyard Merlot (Livermore Valley)

description: This Sauvignon Blanc offers a snappy spin of citrus and spice aromas, followed by balanced flavors of gooseberry, citrus, white fruit and herbs. stylish and distinctive, it will pair well with seafood, asparagus dishes and spicy cuisine.
title: Mulderbosch 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: A mild concentration of peach, pineapple and an underpinning of floral tones mark the nose. The medium-sweet palate shows good tension and balance, with ripe yellow apple flavors meeting brisk pineapple.
title: Chateau Grand Traverse 2014 Late Harvest Riesling (Michigan)

description: There is a strong wet-chalk note on the nose of this bottling, along with aromas of marmalade, sourdough, apple, pear and lemon candy. The palate is consumed by a compelling tannic grip, framing diverse yet complementary flavors of chalk, clay, honeysuckle, Asian pear and nectarine.
title: Albatross Ridge 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: An excellent value for such an elegant wine, this medium-bodied Syrah offers pert blackberry flavor edged by layers of crushed stone and earth. It's pristine in fruit yet lingers with mineral intensity and fine, slightly sandpapered tannins.
title: Arnoux & Fils 2015 Chapelle-St-Arnoux  (Crozes-Hermitage)

description: Earthy blackberry aromas are spicy and moderately complex. Structured and sound on the palate, with a strong tannic framework, this tastes of well-defined cherry and cassis. Spice and chocolaty notes on the finish are barrel driven.
title: Kaiken 2014 Ultra Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Broad and earthy, with a dash of funk and a peppery lift, this grips the tongue with authority and power. It's poised and tense, as if balanced on the edge of a precipice, with the fruit, herb, roasted earth and coffee notes all tumbling around in glorious profusion.
title: K Vintners 2009 Cougar Hills Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This wine has all the tight minerality of the appellation, surrounded by delicious, ripe yellow and white fruits. The wood aging is still there although balanced with the richness and the intensity of the wine. It is going to develop well. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2014 La Garenne Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: The Middle Reach is an informal name for the warmer, northern part of the valley that should have its own appellation. In this wine, you'll find elaborate apricot, tangerine, Meyer lemon and peach flavors, alongside brisk acidity and oak influences. It's a gorgeous wine for drinking soon.
title: De Loach 2011 Ritchie Vineyard Middle Reach Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Unique and appealing, with scents of pear drop and roasted walnuts leading into a luxuriously textured palate. Caramel notes from toasty new oak vie with kiwi flavors in the mouth while the finish is long and dry. Drink now or age a few years for even more complexity.
title: Pio Cesare 2007 L'Altro Chardonnay (Piedmont)

description: The aromas bring notes of braised green pepper and cherry. The palate comes off as quite light, with the concentration lacking.
title: Hedges 2016 Le Merlot Moderne Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Hot gravel and blackberry fruit combine for straightforward, light-on-the-feet aromas on this bottling from a small estate near Happy Canyon. Cherry and blackberry pie flavors show on the palate, with tart, fresh berries framed by a buttery crust.
title: Baehner Fournier 2012 Solus Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Aromas of honey and freesia penetrate from start to finish on this fruity wine sourced from one of Prinz zu Salm's finest vineyard sites. Ethereal on the palate, it balances penetrating stone-fruit flavors with nervous lemon acidity and whiffs of orange rind and spice on the finish.
title: Prinz Salm 2012 Berg Roxheim Grosse Lage Spätlese Riesling (Nahe)

description: While the nose on this Cabernet Franc is fresh and bright with primary red-cherry and plum aromas, there's an earthy rusticity that extends through the palate. Zippy cranberry flavors are touched with shades of autumn leaves and savory herbs. The finish is marked by a crush of mouth-dampening tannins. Enjoy now with a decant.
title: Damiani 2011 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

description: This pure, full-bodied Merlot coats the palate with purple fruits and a creamy mix of mint, spice and vanilla. The herbal highlights are subtle and proportionate, and it's a very flavorful wine for the price.
title: Watermill 2009 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: Lots to like in this Cabernet, which has ripe, juicy flavors of blackberry, plum, dark chocolate and flashy oak. Made thoroughly in the modern style, it's marked by soft tannins and a certain uniformity. Drink now.
title: Emblem 2008 Oso Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Chunky, ripe black-fruit aromas come with violet accents. The mouthfeel is good but gritty, with hard tannins and a lot of oak that creates a buttery topping to plum, cassis and molasses flavors. This ripe wine finishes stable but quick, with some chocolate flavor but not much else.
title: Portia 2009 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

description: This clean and relatively crisp wine has mild fruit-salad flavors and lively acidity. It's medium-bodied, not too assertive and should please a crowd.
title: Murphy-Goode 2014 The Fumé Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

description: This wine starts off with great aromas of baking spice, plum and vanillin. The palate has some nice fig and prune flavors, but there is also a charred oak note that is bitter. Disjointed in body, it has austere acidity, an opulent body and rough tannins. It finishes long, dry and bitter.
title: Narmada 2013 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

description: A lovely Cabernet, rich and ripe in blackberries and cassis, with a touch of herbs and a little heat from high alcohol. A good steak, with its salty fattiness, will take care of that. But it's tannic. Not so much that you can't drink it now, but it really wants a year or two in the cellar.
title: Raymond 2008 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: Tastes young and jammy now, with perky, tartly sweet flavors of blackberries, cherries and currants. Oak adds smoky complexities that bring to mind mocha, vanilla and buttered toast, with a sprinkle of cinnamon. Somewhat lacking in nuance, with plenty of flash, this Cab should develop over the next 6–8 years.
title: Martin Estate 2006 Collector's Reserve Puerta Dorada Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: This pure Cabernet is a stubborn beast—a full 24 hours after being opened it was still shut down tightly, almost as if bottle shocked. Just a hint of leather in the nose, with extremely compact black fruits and firm tannins.
title: DaMa 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The most taut and steely of the wines made by Guillaume Vrignaud from Fourchaume fruit, this offers a tight, minerally texture, lively acidity and an apple- and grapefruit-like crispness. With its structure, this has the potential to age for 4–5 years.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2011 Les Champréaux Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Just a bit of Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon is added to the blend, most of which comes from the Ciel du Cheval, Tapteil and Weinbau vineyards. In this cooler vintage, an herbal character emerges, lending firm tannins and structure to the tight black cherry and cassis core.
title: Tamarack Cellars 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Lush and ripe, made in the modern California cult style of flamboyantly sweet blackberries, cassis and chocolate, soft tannins and immediate appeal. Defines richness and opulence, if not complexity. Drink now–2014.
title: Sixteen by Twenty 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This wine was whole-cluster pressed and puncheon fermented, with native malolactic fermentation. It's intriguing, with aromas of corn on the cob, lees, almond butter and chamomile that are followed by a dense flavorful palate. The balance is exquisite.
title: Sixto 2013 Roza Hills Chardonnay (Washington)

description: This is a low-production wine sourced from a single block in the winery's estate vineyard. It has a modest oak influence and brisk acidity. The wine is easy to like with tart papaya, lime, peach and vanilla flavors.
title: Kunde 2012 Vineyard Block 4SB20 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

description: Lovely natural acidity keeps this sweet wine light on its feet, underscoring the honeyed pear fruit flavors with grapefruit and a hint of minerality. For a wine in this price range, with 11,000 case production levels, it's a marvelous achievement.
title: Ste. Chapelle 2008 Special Harvest Riesling

description: This is a big, bold, oaky and delicious wine from the first whiff of cedar and mint to the lingering, meaty, spicy finish. In between are layers of black cherry, blackberry and dark chocolate that coat the palate and a mouthfilling body braced by firm tannins.
title: Ruby Hill Winery 2014 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

description: Dry and tannic, this Syrah has some juicy blackberry, blueberry, beef jerky and black pepper flavors. The underlying wine feels too soft, even though there are brusque acids toward the finish. Ready now.
title: D'Anbino 2007 Pine Hawk West Vineyard Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: Whiffs of dusty mineral and pollen lend savory accents to intense tangerine, grapefruit and pineapple flavors in this fresh, fruity Riesling. Just a shade off dry, it's approachable yet elegantly zesty. Drink now–2016.
title: Standing Stone 2014 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Earthy aromas include some black olive along with full berry notes. A firm palate with tannic grip tastes mostly of spiced plum and berry fruits, which are honest flavors for Chilean Cabernet. A solid finish fades out with a final note of brined olive.
title: Antiyal 2015 Pura Fe Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Deliciously jammy orange, pineapple, peach and apricot fruit flavors, along with buttery, caramelized oak, mark this Chardonnay. What balances it so nicely is crisp acidity and a minerality that helps make the finish dry.
title: Sanctuary 2012 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an off-dry Riesling with concentrated acidity softened by a light touch of honey and a delicate floral character. The wine is perfumed, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Bott Frères 2010 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)

description: Sweet vanilla oak gives this full-bodied, tropical wine its signature, a luscious taste of fruit-forward approachability that risks becoming overdone. From Vine Hill Ridge Vineyard in the heart of the appellation, it exhibits the power and warmth of the vintage.
title: Dutton Estate 2013 Kyndall's Reserve Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A concentrated, intense wine, filled with cherry-berry fruit and more than a hint of vanilla. It's tart and edgy, with some firm tannins on the finish, so hold it another 12 months and then drink it over the next 5–6 years.
title: Sidewood 2008 Syrah (Adelaide Hills)

description: Marked by potent aromas of green apple and lime sherbet, this is an intense, flavorful Riesling that just lacks that little bit of finesse. It's dry and medium-bodied, with a slightly oily, slightly coarse texture. Drink it young.
title: Kilikanoon 2012 Killerman's Run Riesling (Clare Valley)

description: The nose of this lively white is a combination of delicate aromas of wildflower and orchard fruit while the bright palate offers tart Granny Smith apple, tangerine and a hint of crushed stone. Vibrant acidity carries through to the crisp finish.
title: Nals Margreid 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Big, rich and vital, this has a cherry flavor, with herb, mushroom and cola notes that give the wine an earthy complexity. There's also a lot of oak influence in the form of a sweet buttered-toast note. Give this time in a decanter, and serve now with steak or beef-based Mexican fare.
title: Boëté 2008 Saunders Vineyard Estate Grown Reserve Cabernet Franc (Carmel Valley)

description: Bright berry fruit and a thin, crisp finish characterize this easy-drinking Chianti Classico. It delivers bright aromas of violet, raspberry and forest bramble.
title: Banfi 2010  Chianti Classico

description: Full-bodied, lush and showing just a bit of alcoholic warmth, The Wild Ride features high-toned boysenberry fruit on the nose, a touch of herbal nuance and the slightest hint of raisined fruit on the palate. Drink this creamy-textured, superripe Shiraz over the next few years.
title: Tait Wines 2007 The Wild Ride Shiraz (Southern Flinders Ranges)

description: Handfuls of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot figure into this wine, a lovely, medium-bodied beauty that finds balance in its measured use of oak. Vanilla, plum and bold jolts of pepper and cinnamon combine well on the lengthy palate.
title: Ballentine 2014 Estate Grown Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: With a sensual mouthfeel, but firm tannins, this is just what you want a Merlot to be. The cherry, red currant, violet and mocha flavors are complex and easy to drink now, especially with a great steak. At the age of four-plus years, it's soft and mellow.
title: Wellington 2009 Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

description: Light aromas of tropical fruit, apple, melon and spice lead to lightly styled fruit flavors. The concentration doesn't seem to be all there.
title: Kestrel 2015 Falcon Series Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The aromas of blueberry, sugared plum and herb are bright and fresh. The flavors are sweet and full and go down easily.
title: Washington Hills 2014 Merlot (Washington)

description: Woody and aromatic of muggy earth, this has a spicy, tannic finish and a big-time structure. Its aromas at first veer on the funky side, but then they swirl into tar and spicy, cinnamon berry.
title: Ferriere Vineyards 2003 Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

description: Here's a stellar Chianti Classico with ripe aromas of plump cherry, blackberry, spice and chewy molasses. It delivers sweet, velvety softness on the finish.
title: Poggio Scalette 2009 Poggio Scalette  (Chianti Classico)

description: Rich Sauvignon flavors here, the herbaceous element made weighty by the full-on apricot and green plum tastes. There is a tight, steely texture, with powerful acidity well integrated with the fruit.
title: Xavier Flouret 2008 Domaine Chatelain French Blonde  (Sancerre)

description: Pleasantly bitter hints of orange peel mingle with notes of ripe pear on the nose. The juicy palate adds tart orange and zesty grapefruit to this incisive, aromatic and very moreish mix. The palate is precise and lip-smacking, fresh and concentrated. The full refreshing impact becomes clear on the long finish.
title: Loimer 2015 Heiligenstein Riesling (Kamptal)

description: Subdued aromas suggesting dark-skinned berry, tobacco leaf and baking spice slowly take shape on this. Densely concentrated, the monolithic palate offers dried black cherry, clove and star anise alongside firm tannins. Drink 2021–2028.
title: Val di Suga 2012 Vigna del Lago  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: With the Wente clone from the original 1973 plantings at this vineyard, it's a moderately aromatic, nuanced wine with candy corn, summer squash, lemon butter, mineral and spices. The palate is textured and rich yet restrained with a vein of lemony acidity that runs from head to tail with a lingering finish. Walks the balance beam exceptionally well.
title: Ashan 2012 Celilo Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Gorge (WA))

description: Attractive toasted oak and baking-spice aromas dress up the tasty pear and apple flavors in this deceptively light-bodied yet plush-textured wine.
title: 786 Wines 2014 Chardonnay (California)

description: A heavy, oaky wine. Still, it will appeal to many for its buttered toast, buttered popcorn, tropical fruit, apricot and creamy flavors.
title: Lafond 2011 SRH Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Extreme lawn clipping and green bell pepper aromas show on the nose of this bottling, with slightly rounder hints of guava, passion fruit and struck flint also arising. It's a bit riper on the sip, with yellow pear, Key lime, rainy cement and wet hay flavors.
title: District 7 Wines 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

description: Shows Dry Creek's ability to produce dry, complex Syrahs of interest and sophistication. You'll find layers of blackberries, currants, bacon, black pepper and sweet, toasty oak, wrapped into strong but pliable tannins. The deliciously fresh fruit suggests popping the cork over the next year or two.
title: Gustafson Family 2009 Logging Road Block Estate Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Herbal and elegant, it's perfectly balanced, with a beguiling mix of cranberry, strawberry and raspberry fruit flavors, and tightly stitched tannins that will need some bottle age to unwind.
title: Gramercy 2006 Lagniappe Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: On the reserved side, this trim wine has subtle fruit and vanilla aromas, mild apple and butter flavors and a good balance between acidity and ripeness. It's a good value and a great choice for a non-showy wine.
title: Girasole 2016 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: This is a balanced wine with touches of honey and toast, along with ripe yellow and white fruits that are cut by a salty structure. Great acidity runs through the wine, giving a tight, steely, very pure aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2013 Drouhin-Vaudon Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Upon first whiff, there's more earth than fruit here, but aeration reveals a surprising bounty of tropical fruit on the palate. Light footed and medium sweet in style, its chock full of honeyed mango, pineapple and citrus flavors juxtaposed by zesty lime acidity. The finish is moderately long, tinged by struck slate and smoke.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2016 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Brambly berries and blue plums anchor the flavors of this lovely Syrah, sourced from the Lewis Vineyard. The balance of natural acids and lightly astringent tannins keeps the fruit razor sharp, and the highlights of red licorice add dimension. Drink now or over the next five years.
title: Scarborough 2010 The Immortal Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: Plum, blue flower, star anise, leather and eucalyptus aromas mingle together on this polished fragrant red. On the taut medium-bodied palate, elegant tannins and fresh acidity balance wild cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and tobacco flavors. Loaded with finesse, it's already tempting but will develop even more complexity over the next decade.
title: Gianni Brunelli 2012 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This is one of those wines that tastes sweet and dry at the same time. It's rich in sour cherry, raspberry and blackberry candy fruit, yet the finish is thoroughly dry. An elegant, polished wine to drink now.
title: Robert Hall 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Full-bodied and fudge-like, this is a big black chocolaty Shiraz. Hints of cracked pepper and dried fruit run through this rich, thickly textured wine. It's ready to drink now.
title: Penny's Hill 2014 Cracking Black Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: A spicy, sharply defined Syrah, this is streaked with a strong flavor of clove. The fruit is light and suggests blueberries, but there are stronger flavors of vanilla and tobacco that dominate. A bit of heat slips into the finish, as the fruit quickly fades.
title: Kestrel 2006 Winemaker Select Co-Ferment Estate Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: An easy Cabernet, delivering plenty of ripe, juicy blackberry jam and dark chocolate flavors. It finishes a little on the sweet side.
title: Decoy 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County)

description: After years of tinkering with Sauvignon Blanc, Grgich Hills has finally produced a truly notable bottling—its best ever. This is lightly oaked, clean and delicious, with tart, lemony acids that provide brightness to the green apple, lemon, lime and pear flavors. The finish is honeyed and spicy.
title: Grgich Hills 2011 Essence Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: This cool wine is typical of one of the more structured of the premier cru vineyards, enhancing the mineral character and tight green-fruit acidity. The balance comes from a touch of spice and hazelnut flavors. Drink the wine from 2020.
title: Domaine Fourrey 2017 Côte de Lechet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Close to the slope of Grand Crus, Fourchaume is one of the best known of the premiers in Chablis. This ripe wine with its touches of vanilla as well as yellow fruits and acidity has a lightly honeyed character typical of the vintage. It is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2017.
title: Domaine Gérard Duplessis 2013 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Restrained Mirabelle fruit is contained on a focused and streamlined palate that provides as much refreshment as it does texture. It manages to refresh and has lots of backbone.
title: Alphart 2013 Vom Berg Chardonnay (Thermenregion)

description: Flinty, mineral-like aromas and flavors lend a complex personality to this compelling, medium-bodied wine. The palate is crisp, dry and citrus-driven, inviting another sip and begging for some fresh-shucked oysters.
title: Wente 2013 Louis Mel Sauvignon Blanc (San Francisco Bay-Livermore Valley)

description: Grassy and herbaceous, as befits this variety, you'll want to drink this zesty, lively wine while it's at its freshest. Peppery and pungent, it's a good stand-in for an inexpensive Loire Valley Sauv Blanc.
title: Ledger David 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

description: Good price for a Cab this good. It's dry, rich and complex, with blackberry, cherry, currant and herb flavors wrapped into firm, dusty tannins. Not an ager, but beautiful now for its elegance.
title: Rodney Strong 2007 Estate Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: This Chianti Classico Riserva has deep layers of spice, chocolate, wild berry, cherry, licorice and black pepper. The mouthfeel is smooth, long and fresh.
title: Rocca delle Macìe 2009 Riserva Famiglia Zingarelli  (Chianti Classico)

description: A tremendous Cabernet, authoritative and exciting. Shows a great structure of acidity and tannins, with a cedar and sweet tobacco earthiness. Yet it's also explosive in blackberries, black cherries, red and black currants and anise liqueur. A real accomplishment, and a great compliment to the high-altitude Stagecoach Vineyard, which straddles the Atlas Peak and Napa Valley appellation lines. Drink now–2016.
title: Sequoia Grove 2006 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is an easy pleaser with typical Chard flavors of ripe red apple and pear accented by toast. There's a hint of beeswax in the bouquet, while the nutty oak notes linger through the solid finish.
title: KWV 2008 Cathedral Cellar Chardonnay (Western Cape)

description: Flabby, with sugary orange and peach flavors that finish with the vanilla-honey notes of oak.
title: Sterling 2011 Vintner's Collection Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: The winery's single-vineyard Syrah spent 20 months in 50% new French oak. It has an appealing mix of black cherry fruit and citrusy acids, with a hint of stone. The tang of Meyer lemon resonates long after the first swallow.
title: Two Vintners 2009 Seven Hills Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: They muscled up this Sangiovese with some Cabernet, which gives it a fuller body and sturdier tannins than usual. Nonetheless, it has Sangiovese's silkiness and red cherry and leather flavors.
title: Frank Family 2010 Reserve Sangiovese (Rutherford)

description: A solid, regular, generic style of SB with white fruit aromas and apple, nectarine and pithy citrus flavors. Mildly tropical and sweet, with a finish that holds steady. Resonably good at this price.
title: Finca El Portillo 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

description: Fleshy and borderline mealy on the nose, with banana and melon as the primary aromas, this feels heavy even though firm acidity creates spine and depth. It tastes like a mash-up of apple, melon and baking spice before the chunky finish.
title: De Martino 2011 Legado Reserva Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)

description: Hints of crushed slate lend a smoky, flinty character to concentrated flavors of tangerine and quince preserve in this beautiful off-dry Riesling. It's intensely fruity, but anchored in minerality from start to finish.
title: Ansgar Clüsserath 2010 Trittenheimer Apotheke Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Apple and peach aromas are slightly waxy and show a spot of petrol. This is citrusy but full in body, with flavors of apple, pear, melon and citrus. A plump, basic finish is monotone, but clean and fruity.
title: Alfredo Roca 2013 Fincas Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: This is a pleasantly juicy, soft and approachable wine, made with value in mind, that delivers in easygoing flavors of black currant and cassis. Light bodied, it's a good choice for the table.
title: Laely 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Very ripe fruit aromas, a touch of volatility and a bold powerful set of flavors make this full-bodied wine dramatic to taste. It has a firm structure, too, based on good acidity and a considerable layer of fine-grained tannins that easily support all the black cherry and pomegranate flavors.
title: AuburnJames 2013 Cabernet Franc (North Coast)

description: This 100% Cabernet is a blend of Oak Knoll, Oakville and St. Helena fruit. It's flashy, impressive, and a fine representation of Napa Valley. Dry, full bodied and tannic, it's concentrated with blackberry, black currant, baking spice and cedar flavors. Drink now–2017.
title: B Cellars 2009 Syn3rgy Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Briny, lightly green citrus aromas are round and pungent. A juicy, crisp mouthfeel is formed by citric acidity, while flavors of stony lime and green apple finish crisp and in fine form.
title: Viña Leyda 2015 Single Vineyard Garuma Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Pollen dusted herbs and lime start off this delicate Riesling. The palate is slick in feel, displaying flavors of green melon rind, slate and lime juice, while a strong current of acidity keeps it alive and kicking. Pair with a meal to counteract all that zest.
title: Bellwether 2016 S Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: The rare Australian Grenache you might consider cellaring for more than a couple of years, the 2007 Romas features dark, plummy fruit accented with hints of coffee and chocolate. It's full bodied and richly textured without being overly astringent, with a long finish. Drink 2012–2020.
title: Clarendon Hills 2007 Romas Grenache (Clarendon)

description: Another in a string of great Sauvignon Blancs from Hall. The wine is richly textured in citrus, green apple and peach flavors, with a zingy hint of gooseberry. Acidity is crisp, and the finish is curiously dry and sweet in honey at the same time.
title: Hall 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Wet cement and cut grass make for a very fresh nose on this bottling. The palate is quite grippy in texture, offering lime pith, red pear and more damp sidewalk flavors.
title: Velvet Bee 2016 McGinley Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: Minerality and fruit take turns hogging the spotlight in this elegant off-dry Riesling. While brisk and breezy on the palate, it calibrates concentrated white grapefruit and peach flavors with deep tones of wax, wet stone and steel. Finishes long with an airy wisp of blossom.
title: Treleaven 2012 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Shows lots of flamboyant pineapple, pear and green apple flavors, with a deft touch of smoky oak. But the wine is uplifted by a firm, steely minerality, as well as fine acids. It finishes a little sweet. Drink now.
title: Cambria 2008 Katherine's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This Sauvy offers a nicely balanced experience, starting with fresh scents of lime leaf, thyme, citrus peel and pineapple core. The citrusy tones carry through to the refreshing palate alongside medium acidity. The lime-pith-flavored finish boasts a subtle astringent texture that lends some length to the close.
title: Merwida 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Fruit flavors take the lead in this medium-bodied, lightly sweet wine. It gushes cherry and raspberry aromas, coats the palate with a pleasant jammy character and feels soft in texture.
title: Van Ruiten 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: Fragrant, fresh and floral, this textbook Rosso di Montalcino offers lovely aromas of wild berries, violets, pressed powder and cake spices. The delicious palate doles out juicy red cherry and crushed raspberry accented with notes of cinnamon, all wrapped up in an elegant, silky-smooth texture. Enjoy over the next few years.
title: Le Chiuse 2012  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Aromas of underbrush, sunbaked earth, ripe dark-skinned berry and cake spice slowly emerge on this structured red. Made entirely with Sangiovese, the full-bodied palate delivers juicy black cherry, cinnamon, chopped mint, leather and tobacco. Velvety tannins provide structure and a polished mouth feel. Drink 2017–2022.
title: Luiz Barichello 2012 Iohanna Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

description: A pure, varietal Cabernet Sauvignon, well aged, from an excellent vintage. It's a smooth wine, drinking perhaps at its peak, with an herbal edge to the red fruit and a suggestion of green in the tannins.
title: Skylite Cellars 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Sweeter and more medicinal than Morandé's basic Pionero Cab, but more or less on the same quality level. The mouthfeel is solid with slightly rough tannins, while the flavor profile revolves around medicinal cherry and cassis. Finishes similarly.
title: Morandé 2007 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Quite light fruit flavors suggest that these grapes were from young vines. That said, there are pretty strawberry flavors up front, though the wine quickly tails off and disappears. It doesn't have the muscle of most Cabs, but it's fine for a light sipping red.
title: Guzzo 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rogue Valley)

description: Aromas of citrus, tropical fruit and herb lead to just off-dry flavors with a lightly creamy feel.
title: Purple Star 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Ancient Lakes)

description: Balanced and deeply aromatic, this luminous Pinot Grigio from Alto Adige delivers aromatic tones of stone fruit, honeysuckle and citrus. The wine is smooth and tonic with a nicely silky feel on the close.
title: Colterenzio 2009 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Grassy, green aromas are suggestive of honeydew and lychee but also canned beans and peas. Feels round while showing medium intensity and lightly vegetal flavors of fresh asparagus mixed with bitter greens.
title: Santa Ema 2011 Amplus Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Plum, dill, oregano, pencil lead, tobacco and woody berry aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Light in body and flavor, the palate offers leather, tobacco, dried berry and plum-skin elements.
title: The Archivist 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Rubbery, raw aromas of tomato and red fruits show a sweet note of milk chocolate. Tight, wiry and tough on the palate, this tastes mostly of red fruits and herbs. A lasting, herbal finish tastes a little salty.
title: Viña Casablanca 2014 Nimbus Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Deficient in acidity and tannins, this soft wine lacks needed structure. It feels melted and collapsed in the mouth, and a little hot. But it's very tasty in raspberries, cherries, milk chocolate and spices.
title: Hearst Ranch 2007 Pico Creek Merlot (Paso Robles)

description: Oak-based milk chocolate is the dominant aroma on this earthy, creamy Tempranillo from a warm vintage. A full-bodied and syrupy mouthfeel has cutting tannins but not a lot of acidity. Flavors of mocha, tobacco and chocolate sit atop black plum and berry fruit, while this is slightly soupy feeling on the finish. Drink through 2025.
title: Cuna de Reyes 2009 Edición Limitada  (Rioja)

description: With just 1% each of Cabernet and Merlot, this wine is darker in color, and offers pretty while dense aromas of concentrated violet, hot brick and boysenberry juice. It's dense and grippy on the palate, but quite lively with flavors of dried blackberry, pepper spice, black slate minerality and, on the finish, semisweet chocolate.
title: Cent'Anni 2010 BuoniAnni Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Dry plum and cherry aromas seem hard and capped. The palate feels scratchy, with chunky berry flavors and a tough black-pepper finish. This is really basic in flavors and composition.
title: Earth 3.0 2010 Made with Organic Grapes Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: Pure and focused, Bruwer Raats's love of and attention to Cabernet Franc results in a wine that always impresses, and is a bit of an anomaly in the South African wine world. Bright notes of red cherry and currant unfold on the nose and mouth, with accents of ashy tobacco, foliage, pepper and just the faintest suggestion of vanilla bean. Medium weight, with dry, dusty tannins that lend grip to the finish.
title: Raats Family 2010 Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)

description: Whiffs of green herbs and nuts lend savoriness to fresh apple and pear in this easy-drinking Riesling. Dry in style, it's marked by zesty lemon-lime acidity that leads a brisk, refreshing finish. Drink now through 2018.
title: Hans Lang 2013 Dry Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Using grapes sourced entirely from the En Chamberlin Vineyard, this pure Cabernet is deep, dark, focused and tight, with firm but velvety tannins and a perfect mix of cassis, coffee and earth. Even more than previous years, this vintage displays astonishing depth and power. Flavors of Serrano ham and other cured meats, plus a delicate saltiness and minerality keep the flavors developing onto  the long, fascinating finish.
title: Cayuse 2009 The Widowmaker Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: Warm, ripe Riesling, just off dry which gives the texture softness and richness. It has flavors of almonds and lime juice with hints of peach and melon. Ready to drink, but could be aged for 2–3 years.
title: Joseph Fritsch 2011 Riesling (Alsace)

description: This explosive, ripe wine is part of a trilogy that the producer has made from three of the greatest villages in Champagne. This tense, mineral-driven wine is rich with white fruits. It is still young, so wait until 2020.
title: Franck Bonville 2012 Pur Avize Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: There's a really nice, creamy feel to this wine as it moves smoothly across the palate. As it does, the wine imparts lasting flavors of apricot, honey and Golden Delicious apple. There's a touch of almond spice too and you can't beat this low price.
title: Mezzacorona 2008 Riserva Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: Fully oaked and modern, with popcorn, buttered toast and baked apple aromas. The palate is nicely layered and integrated, with lemon, orange and banana flavors. Complex given the competition, but also smooth and very good by Chilean standards.
title: Quintay 2008 Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Tropical and more blunt and citric than previous vintages. At first blush, it's borderline sheering and sharp, but with time it mellows and settles on pungent grapefruit and citrus flavors. Predominantly it's about zest and power; not as balanced as prior bottlings.
title: Kingston Family 2009 Cariblanco Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Riff is a fun and informal Pinot Grigio that shows lively aromas of citrus and passion fruit, backed by cheerful tones of green mango and lime. It's a light, clean and fresh white wine.
title: Alois Lageder 2009 Riff Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Dry Riesling began as a limited, regional offering, but with a price drop and a three-fold increase in production in 2009, it seems to have arrived on the national stage. Loaded with tight, tart fruit flavors of apple, pear, grapefruit and lemon, this dense and delightful wine is surefire for a wide range of seafood and pastas in white sauce.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2009 Dry Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Tart in lemon peel and tangerine, this lively white also offers a magnitude of stony minerality that manifests as a gravelly complexion on the texture. Honeysuckle figures prominently on the nose.
title: Calstar Cellars 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: The chilly vintage has given this Sauvignon Blanc an unripe edge. There are notes of gooseberries alongside the lemons and limes. The finish is dry, but honeyed, and brightened with crisp acidity.
title: Quivira 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Salty toffee and a sweetness of applesauce make for an intense aspect of ripeness and richness in this wine, with a touch of lemon meringue.
title: Byington 2014 Tin Cross Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: High-toned aromas of raspberry, cherry, dried herb and baking spice lead to light but well-balanced red and black-fruit flavors with a lightly tacky feel. Oak accents abound.
title: Novelty Hill 2015 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This wine has a classic nose of pencil shavings, cedar and ripe black plum, following through on the palate in similar fashion. Full bodied and highly concentrated, it layers in flavors of cherry compote and dark chocolate.
title: Joseph Carr 2014 Revelist Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Located on the right bank of the Serein, this vineyard produces rich warm wines. This is a ripe full wine with great white fruits that are balanced by spice and fine acidity. The texture is dense and full—a generous wine that needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Gueguen 2015 Vaucoupin Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: It's oaky, leesy and creamy, with buttered toast and caramel flavors dominating the pineapple fruit.
title: Luke Donald 2011 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A muted nose of toasted oak and brioche leads to an expansive and fleshy midpalate of apple and peach in this moderately structured, medium-bodied and balanced wine. The finish is lingering and vibrantly bright in acidity.
title: MacRostie 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Kirsten's Feinherb, or gently sweet bottling, maintains a firm foundation of stoniness, but also embraces softer, less angular dimensions of spring blossom and peach. High-toned acidity brighten and lifts the palate through a long finish. Drink now through 2021.
title: Kirsten 2014 Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

description: A raw nose with green-herb and bell pepper aromas offers just enough cohesion and fruit to be decent. In the mouth, this is wiry and racy on first impression, then soft. Leafy herbal berry and prune flavors culminate on a vacuous finish.
title: Tres Palacios 2014 Family Vintage Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Bland, plump aromas of honeyed white fruits aren't exact or zesty. The palate is modest in feel, with basic citrus flavors that come with green notes. This is soft on the finish, so drink now before it fades.
title: Yali 2012 Wetland Winemaker's Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Lolol Valley)

description: Blue fruit and herb aromas are followed by full-bodied blue and purple-fruit flavors. The balance is spot-on and the finish lingers.
title: Helix by Reininger 2012 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Delicate scents of blue flower and red berry lift out of the glass. The slender, easy-drinking palate offers wild cherry and a hint of baking spice alongside soft, fleeting tannins and vibrant acidity.
title: Villa al Cortile 2014  Rosso di Montalcino

description: This is a fruit-forward and balanced white, crisp and fleshy in bold layers of pear and apple. The acidity is nicely integrated.
title: Precision Wine 2017 Fly By Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Honey and saffron accent pristine peach and floral aromas on this wine from Robert Weil's historic “tower hill” vineyard. It's extravagantly ripe with yellow stone-fruit and tangerine flavors, yet dancing on the palate with zesty lime acidity and a shimmering mineral streak that lingers on the finish. Complex and penetrating from start to finish.
title: Robert Weil 2012 Kiedrich Turmberg Spätlese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: An overtly raisiny, almost cooked bouquet, leads this full-bodied, ultraripe CS. It is appealing for its richness, density and weight. Flavors of cassis and blackberry are on the fringe of being syrupy, while moss, prune, black pepper and herbal flavors pop up on a plush finish.
title: Casarena 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: While showing some smoky wood, this wine is more about pure fruitiness with yellow fruit flavors given a crisper shot with acidity. Full-bodied and rich, the wine keeps a refreshing brightness. The aftertaste is crisp and fruity.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Genevrières Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Berry, lemon peel, tobacco and molasses aromas make for a rich and appealing bouquet. The palate is chewy and mildly syrupy in feel, with baked black-fruit flavors receiving a boost from molasses and spice notes. This is dark, handsome and generous but not overly complex. Drink now–2016.
title: Rento 2006  Ribera del Duero

description: This wine's gritty black fruit aromas bring road tar to mind. Its full mouthfeel is cut by acidity, keeping it from feeling soupy. Its tart, spicy plum and currant flavors finish with overt oak, punchy acidity and heat.
title: Sancho Barón 2014  Rioja

description: Marked by jammy fruit and high acidity, this Syrah is strong in cherries, raspberries and oak. It's not especially subtle, but it is pretty and polished, and could even acquire bottle complexity over the next 3–4 years.
title: Jax 2005 Y3 Syrah (Napa Valley)

description: This is all estate-grown from the original (2004) planting. Tannins are smooth and the wine has a pleasing chocolate streak upon entry. Peppery and herbal highlights come into play through the finish, which firms up nicely.
title: Hightower 2011 Murray Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: It helps to have a brand like Yellowtail in one's portfolio, as it provides the cash flow to hold back top red wines for many years before they're deemed ready for release. At eight-years-old, however, Casella's Cab still feels like a baby. The blackberry and plum fruit remains as plush and primary as ever, and those chocolate, vanilla and sweet herb oak spices are still prominent. As of now, this wine has a long way to go before it shows complexity and finesse.
title: Casella 2010 1919 Cabernet Sauvignon (South Australia)

description: This Pinot Grigio is ripe and round without being overly heavy, marrying muskmelon and nectarine flavors to a cool, refreshing finish. Drink now.
title: Yellow Tail 2009 Reserve Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

description: A handful of Pritchard Hill Petit Verdot adds color and vibrancy to this impressive wine, sinewy in leather, black pepper and robust cigar. Currant and cedar highlights make for a classic profile, with firm, integrated tannin in support. This wine should do well in the cellar, finding its peak between 2021 and 2023.
title: 29 & Oak Wines 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: Here's a Sauvignon Blanc (with 15% Chardonnay) from a warm Italian climate (Cortona, Tuscany) that offers broad and thick aromas of passionfruit, peach and a touch of mango. The wine is light and streamlined in the mouth and makes a good partner to light finger foods or appetizers.
title: Avignonesi 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Cortona)

description: Co-fermented with a bit of Roussanne and blended with 18% Mourvèdre, this opens with a lovely floral topnote, then underscores its bright berry flavors with a dash of cayenne and cumin. It's fully ripe without being over-extracted or hot, and carries a bit of herb on through the finish.
title: Ott & Murphy 2010 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a steely wine, tight with acidity and lemon fruits. It has a mineral, tangy texture that is still calming down, which suggests a young wine that needs time. Certainly the fruit is all there, if with a nervy character. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Louis Max 2013 Les Plantenays  (Rully)

description: This blend from Seven Hills, Pepper Bridge and Octave vineyards brings distinctive raspberry, cedar, orange zest, black cherry, plum, flower and spice notes. This is supported by firm tannins that need time to soften.
title: Pepper Bridge 2015 Estate Vineyards Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Black licorice, blackberry and a luxurious current of dark chocolate play off the palate in this full-bodied, well-crafted and ultimately delicious wine. Plush and lush, it ends memorably in a spark of spicy clove and nutmeg.
title: Prime Solum 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: The aromas on this wine lean into the green, with notes of herbs, cedar and woodspice that seem somewhat at odds with the variety. The supple flavors show a mixture of intensity and restraint.
title: Hogue 2012 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Tastes briary and brambly and peppery, almost like a Zinfandel, with flavors of black currants and cola and a hint of oak. This dry, well-structured and rustic wine will pair well with smoky tri-tip.
title: Harmony Cellars 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: A  herbal and perfumed nose opens this lovely, well-made and robust wine, which is both softly round and complex in nature. A billowy texture supports firm acidity, integrated oak and bursts of red and black fruit, plum and clove.
title: Chiron Wines 2015 Pelkan Ranch Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)

description: Dry and a little bitter in tannins, with flavors of cherries, cranberries and herbs. It's elegantly constructed and feels silky and balanced in the mouth. A very nice and versatile food wine that will take a few years of cellaring.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2006 Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Layered berry and cassis aromas are a bit scratchy and gritty. This Cabernet feels saturated, pure and deep; flavors of blackberry, cassis, prune and chocolate are ripe and generous, while the finish is mildly herbal in flavor, with good length and build. Drink through 2018.
title: Sur de los Andes 2010 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Aromas of stewed black fruit, oak, coffee and espresso carry over to the palate along with sour cherry layered with hints of bitter chocolate. It has firm but not very persistent tannins and closes on an astringent, drying note.
title: Poggio Antico 2009 Altero  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: For pure, young Sauvignon Blanc, this is a soft, rounded wine. It is attractive to drink immediately, with quince, apple and lemon flavors. The final taste is packed with fruit.
designation: Les Hauts de la Gaffelière Sélection d'Excellence
title: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2017 Les Hauts de la Gaffelière Sélection d'Excellence  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: From the biodynamic block at Wallula, this is truly a bone-dry style, with intense concentration. It's fruity and complex, with grapefruit and lemon rind flavors that are backed with astonishing minerality. The acidity is high but natural and perfectly integrated. The dry extract gives texture to an amazingly-long finish.
title: Beast 2010 Wallula Vineyard Sphinx Riesling (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Opaque and thick, this soft, black peppery wine is ripe and bright in clove, crisp red currant and cranberry, with a streak of eucalyptus-like mint. It finishes in a subtle flourish of cedar and tar.
title: Paratus 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
