title: Avennia 2016 Arnaut Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: Flat on the nose, this has a mild whiff of paint or turpentine along with touches of banana and melon. The palate is flat and chunky in feel, with clipped, pithy flavors of mealy citrus.
title: San Nicolas 2011 Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)

description: The nose is a bit shy but eventually offers a whiff of black currant while the round, soft palate offers dried black cherry, blackberry and a hint of Mediterranean herb. It's simple but well made. Drink soon.
title: Poggio al Tufo 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Toscana)

description: This very fragrant, perfumed wine shows white fruits with lovely summer-hedgerow aromas. It has fresh acidity as well, but does need some time in the bottle. Drink from 2016.
title: Loimer 2012 Riesling (Kamptal)

description: This is a raisiny Cabernet, tannic and slightly coarse. Drink it now with barbecue or beef stews.
title: Field Stone 2008 Wally's Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: One of a string of great values made at Terravant near Santa Barbara. Attractively oaky, it's full-bodied, full-flavored and just tannic enough to make it a good pairing for rich meat or cheese courses. It is deep in color, with a slightly tawny rim. It smells like wood smoke and grilled bread, tastes deep as blackberry and delivers cherry flavors that linger on the finish.
title: Cookies & Cream 2010 Merlot (California)

description: Simple and straightforward, with a deep purple/plum tone that belies the rather light flavors. This shows tart black cherry fruit with herbal highlights. Tannins have been rough-sanded but are still on the noticeably green and astringent side. A good, everyday steak wine.
title: Silver Lake 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rattlesnake Hills)

description: Coming from vineyards scattered across the Wahluke Slope, this immediately charming wine has aromas of mocha, coffee, plum, herbs and assorted barrel spices. The sweet blue fruit flavors are soft and bring plenty of appeal.
title: Milbrandt 2012 Traditions Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Done in a spätlese style, this off-dry wine is elegance personified. Complex flavors weave through the palate—sweet hay, honey, citrus and stone fruits, breakfast tea, chamomile, jasmine. It just keeps on going, while retaining a lightness and transparency that rivets your attention.
title: Trisaetum 2007 Riesling (Willamette Valley)

description: While the nose is demure here, offering faint whiffs of lemon and honey, there's an avalanche of fruit and flavor to be found on the palate. Luscious yellow peach and tangerine flavors are concentrated yet spine-tingling, calibrated by shards of zesty lime and a steely tang of minerality. A deeply penetrating wine that's gorgeous now but likely to improve through 2030.
title: Peter Nicolay 2017 Graacher Himmelreich Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: This is the very definition of a modern cult-style Napa Cabernet. It's extraordinarily rich and flavorful in blackberries, blueberries, cassis and chocolate, while the jacket of tannins is as soft and velvety as modern winemaking can achieve. It doesn't seem likely to age beyond 2015.
title: Carte Blanche 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: The fantastic nose pitches French toast together with Meyer lemon pith, crushed rock, struck match and a slight sour-cream element. This wine is immediately lively on the tongue, with lots of but not overdone acidity. Yeasty toast flavors are cut by lemon and poached pear on a racy and focused palate.
title: Testarossa 2013 La Rinconada Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Here's the poster child for a massive Howell Mountain Cabernet. Made from 100% Cabernet, it shows the concentrated intensity of mountain fruit, with a molten core of blackberry essence, cassis liqueur, cola and spice flavors, liberally oaked and wrapped into gorgeously thick but fine tannins. So delicious now, it's hard to wait, but this wine is a guaranteed ager. The window is 2018–2020, at the very least.
title: Hall 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

description: Full of buttery, tropical flavors, it also has a barrel-infused taste of petroleum and char.
title: LangeTwins 2010 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Clarksburg)

description: Here's an elegant, mineral-driven Sangiovese-based wine from the Rufina zone of Chianti that opens with floral notes of lavender and blue flower. The wine presents a thin, tight sensation in the mouth. There isn't much pulp or concentration, but it does deliver crisp acidity.
title: Fattoria Il Lago 2009  Chianti Rufina

description: Extremely light in the glass, this single-vineyard expression shows pear, chalk, honeysuckle and lily aromas on the clean focused nose. There is grippy texture and bright acidity on the palate, where the flavors are quite tropical, with guava being dominant.
title: Kitá 2017 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This full-throttle Cab tastes like oak-aged cherry and raspberry jam, with cinnamon and nutmeg stirred in. Despite the jamminess, it's pretty dry, with soft, drink-me-now tannins.
title: Truett Hurst 2012 Paso Ranches Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Sauvignon Blanc has never been a focus at Kumeu River, and this is an overly lean, green and underripe rendering.
title: Kumeu River 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Kumeu)

description: This unoaked effort sure tastes sweet, with flavors of sugared orange, mango and apple juice. The acidity is fine, giving balance to the sweetness.
title: River Road 2011 Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This bottling starts with aromas of cedar, dried oregano, black olive and the slightest hint of bell pepper. Crisp black raspberry shows on the clean and decently complex palate before the herbs come through, including marjoram and dill.
title: Matchlock 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Strong notes of Gravenstein apple along with touches of white peach, crushed vanilla and light butter show on the nose of this bottling. There is a vibrant acidity and pithy citrus grip to the palate, with ripe apples in the midpalate and a candied pink-grapefruit rind finish. It's more about intriguing texture than strong fruit.
title: Lea 2015 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a robust white, exhibiting an exotic nose of spicy nutmeg and lemongrass. Fully oaked, it presents ripeness and concentration, a sign of its youthful vigor and the density of the vintage. Lemony acidity provides freshness against the bolder landscape of ripe apple and melon.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Allen Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Mossy, furry, leafy black fruit aromas are a reasonably good opening. Feels upright and alert, with bright acidity. Flavors of plum and berry blend with chocolate, herbs and spice in front of a grabby, slightly clacky finish.
title: Siegel 2010 Crucero Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: A fairly standard Syrah, softly sweet and direct in berry, mocha, spice and oak flavors. Tons of fruit, but lacks complexity for the price.
title: Collier Falls 2009 Syrah du Soleil Syrah (Sonoma County)

description: Muddled boysenberry and plum sauce aromas unfold on the nose of this smooth, ripe wine, followed by flavors of black cherry and plum that finish with a sweet edge. A hint of warmth appears on the close, alongside a touch of milk chocolate.
title: Voiturette 2017 Merlot (Vin de France)

description: This wine boasts aromas of chamomile, peach and lemon-lime that are supported by a mineral-laden undertone. A citric midpalate provides lift while the slight roundness of the oaky, nutty finish brings everything together.
title: King Family 2016 Chardonnay (Monticello)

description: A mix of floral, tropical and citrus aromas is more than fine. A snappy citric palate is racy and high in cleansing acidity. Citrus flavors are plain and simple, while this is entirely clean and fresh on the finish.
title: Santa Julia 2016 [+] Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: The fruit is flamboyantly ripe on this Cab, which contains a drop of Petit Verdot for tannic balance. Raspberries, cherries, blackberries and plums are all there. So is oak, smoky and spicy. The wine's exuberance is also its limitation. It needs greater complexity and elusiveness.
title: Westerly 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: Very gamy and umami-rich aromas of bacon fat and animal hide meet with maple, boysenberry, white pepper, rosemary and teriyaki on the nose of this bottling. The savory and somewhat smoky touches thrive on the palate too, where roasted pork and charred plums combine with coffee bean and warm-toast flavors.
title: Kimsey 2014 Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

description: Dark in color, this smells great, with cassis, plum and black cherry aromas, bearing very little herbal character. It feels tight and secure, with ripe blackberry, tobacco and oak flavors.
title: Calcu 2010 Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)

description: Aromas of wild berry, forest floor, new leather, grilled herb, menthol and dark spice all come together on this full-bodied red. The structured palate is still young but shows great depth, offering mature black cherry, tobacco, clove and licorice framed in youthfully assertive tannins that give it an age-worthy structure. Drink 2022–2040.
designation: Vigna di Pianrosso Santa Caterina d'Oro Riserva
title: Ciacci Piccolomini d'Aragona 2010 Vigna di Pianrosso Santa Caterina d'Oro Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Plenty of ripe black currant, licorice and cedar flavors in this dry, full-bodied young Cabernet. It feels luxurious in the mouth, with a depth and spicy finish that are notable. Drink by 2017.
title: Godspeed 2010 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

description: This is a bright, spicy, generous Cabernet, with 17% Malbec in the blend. The flavors mix pretty cherry fruit with streaks of black olive and hints of Asian spices. The tannins are firm and chewy.
title: Sparkman 2010 Rainmaker Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

description: A terrific value, the 2009 Arona Sauvignon Blanc features bold aromas of gooseberries and pineapple and assertive flavors of Ruby Red grapefruit and crushed tomato leaf. It's medium-bodied, with a suprisingly long finish for a wine of this price.
title: Barker's Marque 2009 Arona Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is a huge Cabernet, explosive in oak-infused black currants, dark chocolate, licorice and cola. It's tannic, and there's a burst of acidity that gives it a welcome freshness. Impressive as it is, it's too much of everything now, an elephant in the china shop on a rampage. Needs time to settle down. Give it until 2017.
title: Ackerman 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of stewed berry fruits, olive and herbs combine to form a soupy bouquet. This is fairly racy, with a touch of spiky tartaric acid creating mild astringency. Stewy, roasted flavors of black fruits and carob finish herbal.
title: Echeverria 2012 Classic Collection Carmenère (Curicó Valley)

description: Cloudy in the glass and strong in the excited bubbles game, this pet nat shows lots of apple-driven aromas, from Pink Lady to Pippin, as well as white rose petals, Anjou pear and only the slightest hint of yeasty funk. It's also very clean, crisp an tight on the palate, with Bosc pear, grapefruit pith and citrus skin tang on the finish.
designation: Block 11 Bien Nacido Vineyard Methode Ancestral a|muse
title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Block 11 Bien Nacido Vineyard Methode Ancestral a|muse Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: One of the better Sangioveses out there, because it avoids the pitfalls of unbalanced flavors and textures. It's a dry, crisply acidic wine that's ripe enough in cherries and cola to satisfy. Good job. The next step is to build in complexity.
title: Koehler 2007 Oak Savanna Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: A few minutes in the glass releases quintessential Sangiovese aromas of ripe dark-skinned berry, underbrush, baking spice, tobacco, leather and a floral note. The elegant, balanced palate doles out juicy Morello cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and white pepper alongside polished, velvety tannins and fresh acidity. It's already almost accessible but also shows staying power. Drink from 2018 through 2025.
title: Il Colle 2010  Brunello di Montalcino

description: The L-Block Shiraz is a broody, powerful beast meant for many years of cellaring. Right now, it shows dense black and red fruit, chocolate, black olive and oak spice. The tannins are big and savory but everything appears to be in balance. It should start to reveal its true colors in several years' time. Drink 2019–2037.
title: Domaine Terlato & Chapoutier 2013 L-Block Shiraz (Pyrenees)

description: Mature, slightly oxidized berry aromas lead to a palate that has the clamp and tension of rubber bands. Black-fruit and plum flavors are good but basic, while this feels rocky hard and rubbery on a tannic finish.
title: Dominio de la Abadesa 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

description: This Chardonnay offers aromas of peach, citrus and minerals on the nose, followed by creamy, nutty spice and peach on the palate. Aromatic and elegant on the palate, it's a more traditional style of Chardonnay that has both complexity and freshness. Pair with lobster, cream dishes.
title: Rustenberg 2008 Five Soldiers Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)

description: This wine comes from the oldest Chardonnay vines in the state, planted in 1972. Opulent aromas of ripe peach and tropical fruit lead to sweet but lighter-styled fruit flavors. It's a pleasing, varietally correct wine that goes down easy.
title: Kestrel 2014 Old Vine Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

description: This is one of those pleasurable Sangiovese wines that seems perfectly engineered for cheesy pasta and hearty lasagna. The acidity and general freshness is perfectly integrated and ready to pair with fatty foods.
title: Volpaia 2006 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: This wine is chock full of freshly crushed black pepper and blackberry jam flavor. It's big in tannins, but large proportions of aging in new French oak gives it hints of toast and a caramelized touch. The wine is disappointing given the bottling's history, but it's likely the chilly vintage that undermined it.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2010 S.L.V. Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: An impressive wine from an impressive vintage, this Tuscan expression of Cabernet Franc opens with opulent fruit notes of blackberry, prune, plum and ripe cherry backed by clove, pepper, leather and cigar box. The tannins are firm and silky and the fade is long and velvety.
title: Poggio al Tesoro 2007 Dedicato a Walter Cabernet Franc (Toscana)

description: Scorched underbrush, new leather, steeped prune and exotic spice aromas come to the forefront. Buffed and lean, the taut light-bodied palate offers dried cherry, clove, powdered sage and a hint of espresso alongside dusty but not very persistent tannins that still leave a drying finish.
title: Fattoria Svetoni 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: A very down-the-middle red wine, sure to please most, this bottling starts with dark blackberry, elderflower, char and vanilla aromas. The palate offers dried blueberry and hints of thyme, riding fine-grained tannins and strong acidity into the finish. Still a tad sticky, so it could use more time.
title: Arndt 2014 Merlot (Paso Robles)

description: Aromas of white flower, herb and apricot lead the nose. Made solely with Chardonnay, the palate delivers yellow apple, citrus and roasted nut paste alongside a soft mousse. Bitter walnut marks the finish.
title: Antica Fratta 2010 Essence Saten  (Franciacorta)

description: Peppery notes emanate from the bouquet first, followed by more traditional notes of black plum, black currant leaf and dried fig. The mouth is loaded with more brambly fruit flavors against an easygoing structure and light tannins.
title: Eikendal 2008 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

description: Made with 100% Chardonnay, this opens with aromas of bread crust, toasted nuts, and yellow apples that all carry over to the creamy palate. It's fresh and elegant with bright acidity and a soft mousse.
title: Enrico Gatti 2009 Saten  (Franciacorta)

description: Aromas of white fruits, oak and grape skins are mild on the nose. A resiny, sticky palate leads to ripe white-fruit flavors that are oak-covered. Low acidity and heavy oak on the finish make for a cloying end.
title: Vega Sindoa 2016 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Navarra)

description: Pretty notes of fresh apples and sweet cream tempt on the nose and palate of this dry, full-bodied Chard, but sadly, they're overtaken by a green, vegetal tone that persists from start to finish.
title: Clovis Point 2007 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Serviceable and soft, this Stromberg Cab could use a bit more heft to liven its fruit.
title: Lava Cap 2010 Stromberg Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)

description: Light strawberry, raspberry and Bing cherry fruit, medium weight, straight-ahead, nicely ripened. The tannins are soft and the balance works just fine.
title: Gård 2006 Lawrence Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: In this wine, herbal, green flavors bring out a bright, fruity character. It's fresh and crisp, while also having ripe green fruits and a light touch of spice. Drink now.
title: Roland Tissier et Fils 2014 Tradition  (Sancerre)

description: With its dryness and firm tannins, there's lots of structural integrity in this Cab. New oak adds the right suggestions of toast and wood spices. It's an elegantly streamlined wine whose nuanced berry, cherry and currant flavors won't overwhelm a beautiful cut of beef.
title: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of black plum, black cherry, green bramble and a touch of eucalyptus precede flavors of blackberry, raspberry and red plum.
title: Cramele Recas 2014 Legendary Estate Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Romania)

description: Full, ripe notes of red apple, pear and peach resound on the nose. The medium-bodied palate carries the same expression, with a juicy, round feel counterbalanced by the astringency of apple peels. Enjoy this medium-sweet Riesling alongside a creamy Thai curry.
title: Sheldrake Point 2016 Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: A Chardonnay with an easygoing disposition, this has a broad, waxy aroma of white orchard fruit. The melon-flavored palate bears a slight oiliness. Pair it with grilled swordfish steaks.
title: The Williamsburg Winery 2010 Acte 12 of Sixteen Nineteen Chardonnay (Virginia)

description: Pricey, but it's a very good Sauvignon Blanc. You can tell right away that it's pedigreed, from the perfumed aroma to the complex flavors of citrus fruits, peaches, sweet hay, vanilla, toast and white pepper. With a dry finish, it's versatile across a range of foods.
title: Nitty Gritty 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Somewhat raisiny and bitter. Tastes like press wine, with harsh, grapeskin tannins that make it feel astringently dry. Pretty good flavors, though, of blackberries and currants. Drink up.
title: Paoletti 2007 Bella Novello Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: With an underlying richness, this medium-bodied white never forgets about its throughput of acidity, allowing for an undeniable crispness on the palate. Floral on the nose in apple and orange blossom, it shows a stony character that speaks to mineral components like oystershell and rock.
title: Kistler 2015 McCrea Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: What a surprise to find that this Riesling is bone dry. It boasts complex flavors of mineral, lime, Meyer lemon and orange zest, with fantastic acidity that awakens the palate and prepares it for food.
title: Ojai 2010 Kick On Ranch Riesling (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a simple, soft and quite floral wine, showing a wealth of dusty tannin and full-bodied power. Cedar and pomegranate are the highlights that ride a textured wave of chalky oak.
title: Rutherford Hill 2013 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

description: Dry and reedy smelling, with juicy berry-cherry aromas and flavors. The wine is snappy, zesty and juicy, with accents of cocoa and pepper. Clean, simple Cabernet with ample pop and freshness.
title: Morandé 2009 Pionero Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: The aromas draw you in with complex notes of chamomile, almond butter, herb and citrus. The palate shows depth and vibrant texture, exhibiting poise and exquisite balance. It delivers.
title: Sixto 2013 Moxee Chardonnay (Washington)

description: Here is a spicy racy palate-ripping Chardonnay. The fruit rules here, a tasty mix of lime, pineapple, grapefruit and green apples. It was barrel fermented in French oak, though its flavors are more along the lines of a stainless steel style.
title: Irvine Family Vineyards 2015 Chardonnay (Oregon)

description: Rich and elegant aromas of black cherry, blueberry, vanilla, lilacs and Concord grape show on the nose of this wine. The palate is complex, with pencil lead, black pepper, elderberry, milk chocolate and bloody meat flavors, bound by a strong tannic structure.
title: Byington 2013 Bates Ranch Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Offering aromas of citrus, stone fruit, white almond and toasted baguette, this also has a smooth, creamy density on the finish. The cleansing perlage would pair well with shellfish or raw seafood.
title: Villa 2008 Satèn Brut Millesimato  (Franciacorta)

description: Sawdust and lemony oak scents come alongside standard berry aromas. This is rough and acidic, while strong notes of rubber and raw oak complement herbal berry flavors. The finish shows hard tannins and oaky, green flavors.
designation: Puerto Viejo Single Vineyard Reserve Estate Bottled
title: Viña Requingua 2012 Puerto Viejo Single Vineyard Reserve Estate Bottled Carmenère (Curicó Valley)

description: Scorched earth, dry underbrush and chopped aromatic herb aromas lift out of the glass. The lean palate is rather evolved, showing dried cherry, espresso and a hint of anise alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Terralsole 2012  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Aromas of red apple and spice lead to rounded fruit flavors that provide easy-drinking appeal. It's a well-priced spot-on example of the variety.
title: Lone Birch 2015 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

description: The allure of ripe but zingy passion fruit proves almost irresistible. Juicy and plump, the palate is saved by citrus freshness. Tropical fruit rules and makes for immense, easy pleasure.
title: Glatzer 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Carnuntum)

description: This wine arrests the senses with dazzlingly pure aromas of dark raspberries, cherries, clove, mineral and spice. Flavors are intense, layered, and rich without sacrificing one iota of balance. The plush mouthfeel and long finish only add to the enjoyment and sensory experience.
title: Latta 2012 Upland Vineyard Grenache (Snipes Mountain)

description: Aromas of bread crust, dried chamomile and mature orchard fruit come together on this. The palate offers ripe yellow-apple skin, vanilla and toasted oak alongside a vigorous perlage. The somewhat brief finish closes on a note of bitter almond.
title: Contadi Castaldi 2011 Satén  (Franciacorta)

description: Zesty notes of tangerine are met with earthier hints of russet pear peel on the open appetizing nose. The palate shines with even brighter citrus appeal—think tangerine and tart blood orange with a wonderfully vivid lemon streak. This is linear and concentrated, utterly refreshing and lively. The finish is dry, long and beautifully invigorating. Drink 2017–2030.
title: Emile Beyer 2016 Eichberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Flavors of green hay, tart juniper berry and gooseberry surface in this Sauvignon Blanc, in addition to richer notes of Meyer lemon and vanilla. It's dry and elegantly complex, with a honeyed richness. This shows the versatility to pair across a huge range of cuisines.
title: 1070 Green 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

description: Thick, concentrated and rich, this is a 100% stainless-steel fermented white that tangles in tart flavors of lemon and grapefruit.
title: Round Pond 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

description: A well-behaved 100% Chardonnay fermented in stainless steel, it had no malolactic conversion to add a buttery quality. Smooth-textured and medium-bodied, it's filled out by moderate pear and apple flavors accented with hints of white pepper, fig and vanilla.
title: Verde Sole 2013 Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)

description: This opens with aromas of wild herbs and field greens. This wine is full but flat in feel, with green, minty flavors that overshadow the minimal fruit. The finish is herbal and broad.
title: Quintay 2012 Clava Reserve Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: This big, ripe and fruity wine shows both the richness and the structure of the vintage, but never loses sight of balance. It's full of rich yellow fruits, green plums and citrus, but structured with refreshing acidity, a minerally texture and gentle hints of wood aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Henri de Villamont 2010 Blagny Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This is a dull, hugely tannic wine. It's hard to penetrate, with its robust use of dry oak and heat. The finish delivers a shot of gunpowder and graphite.
title: V. Sattui 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Light in the glass, this bottling is quite funky on the nose with reductive red cherry and tar notes. Flavors are sour, full of tart cherry and composting earth tones.
title: Cougar 2014 Estate Cask Reserve Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)

description: A wine that starts with ripe citrus flavors, then moves easily into soft richness as the spicy wood and sweet peach flavors come through strongly. The wood is dominant, but not excessive. Full, ripe and still young.
title: Pierre Morey 2007  Meursault

description: A heady mélange of peach, melon, citrus, apple blossoms and snow pea lead into a sea-salt palate with more stone and citrus fruit flavors, focused acidity and just the slightest textural weight.
title: Mount Fishtail 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: While the nose is delicate, this dry, medium-bodied Riesling offers fresh tangerine and white melon flavors accented by a hint of crushed mineral as well as racy lemon-lime acidity. It's an elegant wine that's approachable now but should evolve well through 2025.
title: Schloss Vollrads 2017 Dry Riesling (Rheingau)

description: A solid and concentrated wine. it promises much for the future. For now, the red fruits come with a stalky structure and high acidity. These will integrate well, to grow into a wine that is rich and firmly structured. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Coudray Montpensier 2012 Le Grand Bouqueteau  (Chinon)

description: Incredibly rich and dense with blackberry jam, chocolate and cassis liqueur flavors, yet still dry, this Cabernet defines the modern style of balanced extraction. The vineyard is in the easterly Vaca Mountains, and this 2010 is one of its finest, most ageworthy expressions. Drink now–2020.
title: Janzen 2010 Cloudy's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Whiffs of smoke and nuts lend a savory contrast to pristine white grapefruit, lime and lemon in this racy mineral-focused Riesling. It's bracing yet composed, dry in style yet sunny in citrus flavors. Drinks beautifully now but should improve through 2020.
title: Thörle 2013 Saulheimer Kalkstein Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: This is 100% varietal, and sports interesting aromas of Provençal herbs. Peppery cranberry fruit is spicy and tart, fading through the midpalate into a lean, but lingering finish.
title: Folin Cellars 2013 Estate Grenache (Rogue Valley)

description: There is considerable power in this rich wine. With its dark plum and chocolate flavors it is dense and extracted. The alcohol shows in the pepper edge. It is probably too ripe and bitter for its own good.
title: Château de Tigné 2011 L'Isensé Cabernet Sauvignon (Anjou)

description: This wine has great potential to emerge as a classic in the years to come, but is a bit tightly wound right now. Hearty roasted plum and blackberry aromas are coated in smoke, chocolate shavings and subtle violet on the nose. The sip starts bright before the strong tannins take hold, hiding the dark berry and minty flavors.
title: Zaca Mesa 2014 Estrella Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This wine's black cherry and spice aromas are clean and inviting. Despite angular acidity, it feels fresh, while the palate deals a mix of dark fruit, spice, herb and chocolate flavors. The finish is herbal and slightly briny.
title: Laroche 2010 Punto Niño Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: A new offering from this partnership, this wine brings aromas of jasmine, lime and dried Nestea Ice Tea. It tingles the palate with lightly spritzy, off-dry lemon and peach flavors with a floral finish.
title: Charles & Charles 2014 Riesling (Yakima Valley)

description: Old vines have produced a superconcentrated and ripe wine. It has notes of toast, spice and yellow fruit as well as bright acidity. With its structure, depth of flavor and density, it should age well over 3–4 years.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2009 La Bourgeoise  (Sancerre)

description: From a different block of the same vineyard as the “Whale label” Memorista, this is drinking much better at the moment. It's smooth and supple—a pretty wine with honeyed minerality around fruit flavors of citrus and peaches.
title: Ovum 2015 Memorista Tradition Riesling (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A lovely wine that sings crisp Chardonnay, with the added complexity of a taut mineral character and richness from its ripe pear and melon flavors. It will age, its tight acidity needing 2–3 years to soften out.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2008 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Rustic and sweet, a simple Syrah with flavors of candied berry, black pepper and sassafras.
title: Cameron Hughes 2010 Lot 292 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Drawn and leathery on the nose, and then as it opens it reveals citrusy red fruit aromas. The palate is lean and tight, with light cherry, raspberry and plum flavors. Toasty, dry and a bit buttery tasting on the finish.
title: Marqués de la Concordia 2008 Hacienda Abascal Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

description: A pleasure to taste a Cabernet this rich in fruit, yet one that finishes so dry. It's delicious in blackberries, currants and mocha, wrapped into sweetly smooth tannins. It's a little high in alcohol and soft in acidity. Drink now.
title: Justin 2010 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Minty and herbal smelling, with stemmy, generic fruit aromas. The palate is sticky and creamy, while the flavors are chunky, flat and lean toward herbal berry. An oaky, syrupy wine with a mild green streak.
title: Colina Verde 2008  Rioja

description: A reductive element of petrol and oak blows off over time bouquet-wise, but in taste and weight, the wine retains a sultry sense of oak and baked apple. Full bodied in style, it manages to stay balanced throughout, finishing in a buoyant twist of citrus.
title: Glasshaus 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This Rhône-inspired red from a great site takes a lovely, light-hearted approach to the variety, capturing its ability to conjure black olive tapenade and savory, leathery texture while keeping the ripeness of the fruit more elusive. Already given a respectable amount of time in bottle, it's enjoyable now and for years to come.
title: La Diligence 2010 Stagecoach Vineyard Syrah (Napa Valley)

description: An waft of leather saddle opens this release from an historic Diamond Mountain site celebrating 40 years of wines with this vintage. Soft and refined, it's a complex expression of cassis, black currant and mountain tannins, well integrated and age-worthy. The finish is lengthy in a touch of coffee. Drink now through 2022.
title: Diamond Creek 2012 Fortieth Anniversary Volcanic Hill Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

description: Hints of smoke and crushed minerals lend a savory tone to this dependable classic from Red Newt, accenting subtle flavors of white peach and nectarine. It's delicate in frame, but penetrating lemon-lime acidity jolts the palate.
title: Red Newt Cellars 2012 Circle Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: This wine is buttery and has a creamy texture along with a fresh streak. Apple flavors are lifted with citrus while also filled out with that rounder character, making for an immediately attractive, ripe wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine Carrette 2014 Les Mûres  (Saint-Véran)

description: Bright and light, this offers yellow fruits that are cut with citrus to give a clean character as well as richness. Drink now for its crisp aftertaste and warm texture.
title: Domaine de Biéville 2013  Chablis

description: Packaged in a screwcap bottle, Tuscan blend (85% Sangiovese with Merlot, Petit Verdot and Alicante) opens with notes of plush dark fruit, soft cherry jam and a pleasing point of savory spice. It is slightly sweet and very velvety on the finish.
title: Caparzo 2010 Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: Divio, notes winemaker Bruno Corneaux, is the ancient Roman name for Dijon, hence, a sly reference to the clones in this outstanding Chardonnay. It's lush and flavorful, with a juicy mix of pear, peach and papaya fruit. Aged 15 months in 50% new French oak, the fruit sets up against a palate-popping wash of toasted hazelnuts, filling out the extended finish. An all-around splendid bottle.
title: Domaine Divio 2014 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Berry preserves, black plum flesh and tobacco abound on the nose, while the medium-weight mouth provides more dried berry flavors laced with cocoa powder. Soft on the palate with an off-dry finish. Drink now.
title: Backsberg 2008 Kosher Merlot (Paarl)

description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling smells of concentrated black plum, black currant and violet on the nose. The palate shows Concord grape sauce on roasted beef flavors, along with licorice and tarragon, and grows very tangy by the finish.
title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 The Conspirator Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: The aromas in this 100% varietal Cabernet Sauvignon from Cold Creek and Stone Tree vineyards rise out of the glass, suggesting scorched earth, dried herb, graphite, flint, cassis and cherry. It has bright but balanced acidity to support its fruit flavors, with green pepper and cherry notes that linger on the finish. It's flat-out delicious and exceptionally balanced. Put it on the dinner table and watch it shine.
title: Waters 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: A rich wine, full and fruity up front, then opening up into a much more mineral, textured character. It is a great explosion of citrus, pear and green apple, the wood aging showing with subtlety. It's a wine for aging, complex and tight at the end.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2010 Les Pucelles Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Aromas like brown sugar and bourbon meet bold oaky, spicy flavors in this medium-bodied wine. This will be good for fans of those exotic oak flavors.
title: Leese-Fitch 2013 Merlot (California)

description: This is a light, steely white with more honeysuckle and floral characteristics than fruit. It's light in alcohol and texture, and especially good for the wine drinker looking for something subtle.
title: The White Knight 2012 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

description: This Merlot includes 13% Syrah, along with smaller amounts of Petit Verdot and Cabernet. Vanilla and tobacco scents open the door to a sharp, peppery wine, with flavors cloaked in bark and scorched earth. It's rustic, big and flavorful, with a fat, meaty finish. This is the wine to go with your tri-tip.
title: Boomtown 2011 Merlot (Washington)

description: A brilliant wine that shows the world how delicious young Napa Valley Cabernet can be. Just dazzles with the richness and purity of blackberry, mocha, leather and cedar flavors, with a finish you can measure in minutes. Bordeaux yearns for such ripeness. Terrific now and through 2015.
title: Von Strasser 2007 Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

description: This Merlot currently offers a dry palate and firm tannins. As it warms in the glass, subtle blackberry, cola and pepper notes emerge. It's pretty tightly wound for a Merlot, but it's attractively priced and should soften with a little time to breathe.
title: Kirkland Signature 2012 Signature Series Merlot (Oakville)

description: An extraordinary Cabernet that stands out even in this great vintage, and among its Rutherford peers. Quite dry and tannic in youth, it shows an astringency that strongly suggests the cellar. Underneath are powerhouse flavors of blackberries, black and red cherries, spices, tea and cedar. Really defines balance and elegance in a Napa Cabernet. Decant if you drink it now, but it should develop for years to come.
title: Long Meadow Ranch 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Soft with ripe yellow-fruit flavors, this is an immediately attractive, simple wine. Its brightness is enhanced by the acidity and light texture. This open wine is ready to drink.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2017  Mâcon-Vinzelles

description: Fig and fennel star in this block-designated white that is crisp and fresh around a medium-strength body. Ready for the table, it finishes quick and clean.
title: Kunde 2014 Block 4SB20 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

description: Light and fresh, the emphasis here is on green herbs and citrus, with grapefruit, jicama and a garnish of tomato leaves.
title: Rabbit Ranch 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Basic raspberry and plum aromas and flavors are accented by herbal, foresty notes. The palate is grabby, tannic and chunky, with herbal accents to the berry fruit flavors. Finishes with milk chocolate, acidity and tannic bite.
title: Calina 2009 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)

description: This is a smooth and elegant wine with a robust backbone of dark berry and currant, espresso and tea that presents full-bodied ripeness and exuberance on the palate. Minty vanilla closes things out.
title: Kenwood 2012 Six Ridges Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: A brooding, masculine expression, this offers savory aromas of cured meat and smoked bacon, with bright fruit aromas of blackberry and soft cherry. The wine is thick, inky and structured on the close, with a point of bright acidity that gives it balance.
title: Carpineto 2007 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: The wine comes from the only appellation in Burgundy to grow Sauvignon Blanc, located not far from Chablis. This is classic herbal Sauvignon that is light and fruity with tangerine and citrus flavors and a tropical fruit hint. Drink now.
title: Domaine Gueguen 2015  Saint-Bris

description: As rich as Napa Cab gets. Made solidly in the modern style, it's soft, elaborate and flamboyant, suggesting ultraripe blackberry pie, currant, mocha-choca and sweet oak flavors. The all-important tannins are smooth as velvet. Few Cabs are more delicious for drinking now, but longterm prospects are entirely unpredictable.
title: Carter 2007 Coliseum Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A huge success given the price. Impeccably smooth on the bouquet, with clean yet generous berry aromas. Ripe and balanced, with bright berry and chocolaty oak flavors. Solid on the finish, with lasting plum and berry flavors. Satisfying in every way.
title: O. Fournier 2010 Urban Uco Tempranillo (Uco Valley)

description: Aromas of berry and cassis come with a shot of raw oak. This is grabby and puts on the clamps, but spicy, peppery flavors of olive, berry and oak are very good in front of a hard, moderately tannic finish.
title: Calcu 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: The grapes were grown in the Oak Knoll appellation of the southern valley, and the wine shows the acidity and tannic structure of Napa's cooler regions. Rich and complex in blackberries and black currants, it will age well for a good 12 years.
title: Quantum 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Concentrated and lush, livelier and better than the producer's 2007 which still needs time to develop, this reserve-level Cab with small amounts of Petit Verdot, Malbec, Carmènere and Cabernet Franc is ready to drink now, its cassis and cranberry fruit showing well.
title: Duarte Georgetown 2008 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)

description: Barnyard and berry aromas are piercing but lack elegance. A thick, wide palate is a bit shapeless and lacking in framework. Burnt berry flavors are a bit herbal and green, while the finish is a bit chalky and tannic.
title: Koyle 2015 Gran Reserva Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: Just three barrels of this outstanding reserve were produced. It's full bodied, richly fruity and broadly textural, it holds its alcohol well, with strawberry jam highlighting a lush palate of ripe, sweet fruits. The barrel notes of toast, caramel and mocha are the frosting on the cake.
title: Watermill 2008 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This shows the tightly knit tannins of Spring Mountain, and is unapologetic about them, demanding that you cellar this wine. It's very finely constructed, with brisk acidity and a firm, grounding minerality below the intensely concentrated core of blackberry and cassis flavors. It should hit its stride in 8-10 years and go for well beyond that.
title: Lokoya 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

description: Ripe apple and pear fruit are comfortably blended with more citric flavors in this structured wine. It has good fruitiness, a tight mineral structure and the potential for aging. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Domaine Roger & Christophe Moreux 2017 Les Bouffants  (Sancerre)

description: Arguably Puligny's most famous Premier Cru has produced a wine that is structured and taut as well as fruity. For the moment, mineral texture and great acidity are balanced by the wood-aging spice. More time will usher in the fruit to give a ripe, full wine, always with a tangy edge. Drink from 2022.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2015 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Bursting with fruity aromas of peaches, peach ring candies and orange blossom, this is a fresh wine. Juicy mango and more peach unfold on the palate. The feel is thin and isn't able to compete with the intense flavors and aromas, while the finish is tart and saccharine.
title: Trump 2015 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Monticello)

description: A bit sweet and raisiny on the nose, but also dense and powerful. The palate runs rough and tannic, but there's enough richness and extract to allow for that. Flavors of cassis and raspberry are dark but snappy, while the finish has raisiny notes but also some edge. This one may improve with time; drink now through 2013.
title: Bodegas Peñafiel 2006 Miros  (Ribera del Duero)

description: This vineyard is far better known for Pinot Noir, although Failla has excelled with its Chardonnay. Novy's 2010 isn't particularly like Chardonnay. Too floral. Could almost be Viognier. Yet it's a fine wine, crisp and rich in orange, lime and honeysuckle flavors.
title: Novy 2010 Keefer Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Extra time in bottle has benefited this wine and brought out its inner beauty. It's balanced and complex on the palate, with concentrated flavors of jammy blackberry, clove and white pepper that are supported by polished tannins. Hints of vanilla and nutmeg ring on the finish.
title: Venge 2012 DLCV Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: Damp, earthy berry aromas are murky and lack freshness. This feels soupy, with no edge to the palate. Herbal, lightly green berry flavors are about the same on the finish.
title: Canciller 2016 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Dark smoky charred aromas lend a crusty, slightly burnt topping to the nose. In the mouth, this cool-vintage wine is wiry, with magnetic midpalate acidity. Saucy flavors of plum and berry finish savory and tight. Fitting for a 2013, this is never overly ripe. Drink through 2022.
title: Sonsierra 2013 Pagos de la Sonsierra Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Medium in body, this has pretty lemon-blossom and white peach flavors that are boosted by fresh acids, and that linger on the open-textured finish.
title: Tarara 2012 Chardonnay (Virginia)

description: This opens with subdued aromas of dark fruit, baking spice and a hint of mocha. The firm no-frills palate offers clove, black currant jam and vanilla alongside assertive close-grained tannins. Drink after 2023.
title: Mocali 2013 Vigna delle Raunate  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Very ripe pear and plum notions dominate the nose. The palate has concentration and drive but still blossoms with generous fleshy fruit of great purity. This is an expression of joy and ripeness—of ready overflowing fruit kept taut and in focus by ripe orange freshness. The long finish has a touch of earth.
title: Rainer Wess 2015 Loibenberg Riesling (Wachau)

description: Gritty aromas of road tar and green herbs are offset by spicy black-fruit scents and a hint of root beer. This Cab Franc feels dense and chewy. Herbal plum and currant flavors include spicy oak notes. It tastes woody, minty and toasty on a full finish.
title: Durigutti 2015 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

description: No Chardonnay in California is richer or riper than this. It detonates on the palate with an explosion of pineapples, green apples, tangerines, apricots, honey, butterscotch and dusty cinnamon spices. Acidity is pretty and zesty. Would benefit from greater subtlety, but it sure is opulent.
title: Alta Maria 2009 Alta Maria Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Butter, butterscotch and baking spice aromas explode from the glass and lead to extremely rich, butter and caramel flavors in this unapologetic full-bodied wine. It has a soft creamy texture that coats the palate and little acidity to counter it.
title: Paris Valley Road 2017 Chardonnay (California)

description: A bit firmer and more powerful than the producer's regular bottling, the Vintner's Select boasts a core of black cherry and cassis accented by shades of bramble and forest floor. Rich, rounded and full bodied, it's balanced by a streak of cranberry acidity and lingering notes of anise.
title: Clovis Point 2013 Vintner's Select Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Lemon butter, apple pie crust and hazelnut are first to the aroma party on this carefully crafted Jackson family offering from a vineyard about 400 feet up in limestone-dotted soils. On the palate, strong but integrated acidity carries the myriad citrus, apple and spice flavors to completion.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2012 Jackson Estate Camelot Highlands Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Roasted black currant, char and a hint of pepper show on the deep, dark, elegant and yet somewhat reserved nose of this bottling. There's a flash of black cherry on the tip of the sip and then comes waves of black pepper and roasted beef. The texture is full and grippy, with tangy acidity and a long peppery finish.
title: Potek 2013 Tierra Alta Syrah (Ballard Canyon)

description: Grenache is being treated with more and more respect around Australia, which means more bottlings are reaching the variety's potential. Gentle herbal notes intertwine with bunches of black cherries and a hint of vanilla in this medium- to full-bodied example. Hints of red peppercorn capture a unique combination of fruit and spice, while the finish is long and crisp.
title: Langmeil 2013 The Fifth Wave Grenache (Barossa)

description: In the blend are smaller percentages of Cab Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. The Red Mountain AVA is noted for thick, tannic wines, with superior aging potential. Here the earthy, peppery red fruits are buttressed with vivid acids and somewhat chewy tannins. The wine was aged two years in 40% new French oak.
title: Lachini 2011 La Bestia Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: Salmon pink in color, this rosé brings buttery and floral (orange blossom, night jasmine) aromas together for an all-encompassing bouquet, powered by the 19% Grenache inclusion. On the palate, tropical touches of papaya and mango dance with tart apple and nectarine flavors, which get midpalate lifting from the 6% boost of Riesling as well.
title: Ampelos 2013 Rosé of Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: A very slight notion of hazelnut hovers on the fresh nose. The palate comes with wonderful citric intensity of ripe lemon and a dash of lime. That same smoky hint stays on the palate throughout, adding an extra dimension. The finish is pleasantly long and refreshing.
title: Lackner Tinnacher 2015 Ried Steinbach Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

description: This wine is soft and velvety, awash in classic notes of black currant and berry, textured in full-bodied, oaky waves of toast and cigar box. Approachable on the palate, it winds its way powerfully though softly from start to lengthy finish.
title: Turnbull 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: Pineapple juice and baked mango mark this pleasing, straightforward and approachable wine, which takes a full-bodied approach to its ripeness, with minimal oak.
title: Tuli 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This soft, round and juicy wine is ripe and full bodied, a good representative of the vintage. It shows brambly black fruit, mocha and hints of coconut flakes that endure through the finish.
title: J. Moss Wines 2012 Spicer Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: While demure on the nose with faint hints of blossom and mineral, the palate of this sprightly kabinett surges with ripe yellow cherry and peach flavors. It's a finely filigreed yet unctuously juicy sip. Drink now through 2020.
title: Carl Graff 2014 Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: A simple Sauvignon Blance with apricot, pineapple and spice flavors. The acidity is bright and crisp, as you'd expect from this cool-climate Monterey region.
title: Martin Ranch 2009 Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

description: This ripe, green-plum-flavored wine is crisp with acidity and a lively texture. It comes from vines on the elevated plateau behind Nuits Saint-Georges, giving the wine a cool, collected and tangy character. Drink now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2016 Domaine des Perdrix  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: A touch of yeast still swings alongside the lively Meyer lemon aromas on the nose of this wine. The palate then presents full-blown lemon zestiness and ample tangerine notes. It's dry, brisk, enlivening and zippy and packs a zesty citrus punch.
title: Hiedler 2017 Steinhaus Riesling (Kamptal)

description: There's an interesting counterplay between the bright and the dark in Lovingston's hand-picked, small lot Josie's Knoll. On the nose, black cherry preserves are countered with black pepper spice and char. On the palate, ripe, concentrated black fruit is layered with tar, earth and bramble. It's elegant and seductive, but anchored by a core of gripping tannins.
title: Lovingston 2007 Josie's Knoll Merlot (Monticello)

description: Lovely aromas pour from the glass, a heady mix of lime, Asian pear, cucumber and apple. In the mouth some sweet honey pours over the crisp fruit, and the wine feels lush and perfectly melded, despite its youth. Residual sugar is under 2% and the alcohol just 12%.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2009 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Fans of no-dosage sparklers will appreciate this elegant, bone-dry wine. Made with Chardonnay, it offers pretty aromas of chamomile, hay, citrus and pear. The sleek palate delivers yellow apple, ginger and herbs alongside a fine perlage and vibrant acidity.
title: Ferghettina 2006 Pas Dosé  (Franciacorta)

description: A simple rendition of Merlot, with soft plum fruit and supple tannins. Easy to drink and pair, this should make for a fine midweek wine with roast chicken or turkey meatloaf.
title: Fenestra 2007 Thatcher Bay Vineyard Merlot (Livermore Valley)

description: Mostly Cabernet Sauvignon along with 10% each Merlot and Petit Verdot, this wine displays aromas of dried and fresh herbs, flowers, black tea, dark chocolate and cherry. The fruit and savory flavors are sweet and supple, backed by tightly coiled tannins that need time to unwind.
title: Pomum 2012 Shya Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: With initial weightiness and fullness on the palate, this wine ultimately delivers crisp, cool peach and melon flavors, a lingering lemon zest note adding to its freshness.
title: Ousterhout 2016 Redwood Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

description: Generous aromas of fresh black currant, blackberry, herb and anise are followed by fruit-forward flavors. The tannins give a gentle squeeze. Coffee notes linger on the finish. It's straight down the fairway for this variety.
title: Côte Bonneville 2015 Train Station Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

description: Intensely earthy notes of honey and wax, and just the faintest whiff of petrol, are enticing precursors of maturity within an otherwise delightfully fresh, fruity Riesling. It's delicately crisp on the palate, but ends with a long, lanolin-coated finish.
title: Joh. Jos. Prüm 2010 Graacher Himmelreich Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Fresh, simple, apple-flavored wine, with an edge of citrus and soft vanilla flavors. The wine is attractive and clean with elegance coupled to ripe fruit.
title: Labouré-Roi 2009 St Amand  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: An interesting Chardonnay that does not quite all come together. Lemons, orange peel and other lively citrus aromas are mixed in with flavors of grain—cracker, oatmeal, and so on. The finish confuses rather than blends.
title: Le Chateau 2008 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Luxuriously honeyed, this wine sings in rich hazelnut but also remains crisp on the palate, relatively light-bodied in fresh pear and lemon. Staying lithe as it goes down, it has subtle power and integrated oak, finishing creamy and bold.
title: Corner 103 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A rich, dry young Cabernet, with fresh blackberry, cherry and oak flavors, brightened by a burst of citrusy acidity. The tannins are strong, however, giving the wine a sandpapery astringency. Needs a few years, although it doesn't have the stuffing for the long haul. Your window is around 2014.
title: Y Rousseau 2009 Cavedale Vineyards Smokin' Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: Cabernet specialist Alpha Omega is increasingly showing a knack with Sauvignon Blanc. This vintage shows crisp acidity and a dry palate with flavors of citrus, tropical fruit, grass, honey and oak.
title: Alpha Omega 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Stillwater Creek, Conner Lee and Bacchus vineyards provided the fruit for this young, sappy and rich Syrah. It captures the varietal character of the grape, especially as expressed in Washington State. Inviting aromas of berries and chocolate, bright and fresh, lead into brambly red fruits, umami-soaked mushrooms and moist earth.
title: Arbor Crest 2008 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The steep slopes of the Monts Damnés are some of the best known in Sancerre. From grapes grown on this almost vertiginous slope, this wine is concentrated from the low yields and wonderfully juicy, fresh fruits. Apple and spiced pear flavors are totally freshened by the bright, crisp acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2014 La Côte des Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)

description: Still young, this powerful wine has intense steely minerality to go with its almost stark green fruits. It has a great texture, edged with acidity, and a light toast character. A wine for aging.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2007 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Dense and reduced initially, this Syrah from the Toledo area delivers fresh raisin on the nose and then a solid, rugged palate with saturated plum, berry and mild herbal notes. It's thick, ripe, healthy and balanced, all leading to a fine final product. Drink now.
subregion: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Casa del Valle 2006 Hacienda Shiraz (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Wiry plum and earthy cherry aromas announce a lively, medium-bodied Tempranillo with plum and raspberry flavors. A light, solid, adequately fruity finish is clean and tasty.
title: Radio Boca 2012 Tempranillo (Valencia)

description: A lovely, elegant wine whose dryness and acidity make it perfect for a late afternoon cocktail. The lemon, lime, grapefruit and vanilla flavors finish a little thin, but this is a very nice Sauvignon Blanc for the price.
title: Courtney Benham 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Very ripe hints of apricot and juicy pear veer toward lemon on the nose. The palate presents the same tension between tangy, wonderfully sharp citrus and ripe generosity. It is the ripe freshness that wins out due to a precise fine-boned structure that almost crunches. This is truly lip smacking, concentrated and very, very refreshing with its uncompromisingly dry finish. Drink now through 2040.
title: Domaine Pfister 2015 Engelberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Sea salt, mandarin zest, fresh white spring flowers and lemon balm make for a very appealing and fragrant nose on this vineyard blend by Mikey Giugni and Michael Brughelli. The palate is zesty, fresh and savory, with flavors of salted apple slices, preserved lemons, toast and a hint of roasted wood.
title: Scar of the Sea 2015 Seven Leagues Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Heavily stewed and frankly it smells vegetal, with soupy aromas of corn, tomato and squash. Lacks vital fruit and definitely smells and tastes heavily herbal. That said, the wine has good feel and texture. Not sure why this wine tastes significantly more soupy, corny and green than the previous vintage.
title: San Pedro 2008 Kankana del Elqui Syrah (Elqui Valley)

description: Rich in layers of raspberry and bright cherry, this full-bodied Grenache surprises in its depth of structure. The finish dives deep into caramel and oak, rounding it out pleasantly.
title: Fenestra 2009 Grenache (Livermore Valley)

description: A touch of salted caramel appears before the flesh of ripe yellow apples takes over on the nose. The palate sings with freshness and presents a mousse of tiny pin-prick bubbles. The spicy but rich notion of salted caramel tantalizes again on a bone-dry palate. This wine is both weightless and profound, with lovely length and a lip-smacking finish.
title: Ebner-Ebenauer 2010 Blanc de Blancs Zero Dosage Chardonnay (Niederösterreich)

description: Colorful and fresh, with a bit of latex/Band-Aid on the nose to go with bacon, raspberry and oak-based maple aromas. The feel is stout and chewy, while flavors of cassis, cherry and chocolate work well together. An oaky customer but a good and tasty one. Drink now and over the next two years.
title: Bodegas Navarro López 2005 Old Vines Reserva Tempranillo (Valdepeñas)

description: Intense lemon and lime flavors are accented by hints of mineral in this off-dry Riesling. Racy acidity is balanced elegantly by a lavish, silky mouthfeel and long, clinging finish. Enjoy now–2021.
title: Prinz Salm 2017 Two Princes Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Trisaetum produces both a dry and an off-dry cuvée from each of its estate vineyards, and continues the practice with this Estates Reserve. This offers extra concentration, grip and complexity. Floral, citrus, stone fruit and bracing acidity combine in a midpalate that is packed with young fruit flavors. Good as it is, the best is yet to come.
title: Trisaetum 2013 Estates Reserve Dry Riesling (Willamette Valley)

description: Intense aromas of freshly scooped honeydew melon, flowers and herbs. The rounded palate brings plenty of appeal with its tropical fruit flavor. Enjoy now for its straightforward nature.
title: Palencia 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Rich and succulent, with pineapple and jasmine top notes and intense stone fruit in the mouth. There's no shortage of sweetness here but it's well framed by a vibrant acid structure that carries the fruit through to the medium finish. Really well done.
title: Schmitges 2008 Erdener Treppchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Here's an easy, racy and fun bottle of red wine to pack away in a picnic basket or to enjoy with friends at an outdoor barbecue. This is Sangiovese from southern Italy, showing ripe notes of cherry and raspberry, backed by a touch of sweet almond.
title: Rapido Red 2011 Sangiovese (Puglia)

description: From 100% estate-grown fruit, this 100% varietal wine is dusty and dark with elements of pencil shavings, cedar and cassis. With that herbal and earthy intensity giving it defined character, it remains medium bodied and textured on the palate, with a saltiness to the finish.
title: Lobo 2012 Wulff Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

description: Brine and oak accents cradle this impressive wine's elegant green apple, wet stone and lime notes. Bold and concentrated yet complex, it's balanced by lively acidity and persistent freshness.
title: Lynmar 2015 Monastery Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Rich on the nose, this juicy, ripe Cabernet unfurls with layers of black currant, blackberry and vanilla that are soft and structured. The finish offers tar and leather amid more vanilla, ending in balance and finesse. Stock up for dinner parties.
title: McManis 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: An exorbitantly rich Cabernet, one of the ripest from Santa Ynez Valley in memory. Just huge in blackberry, cherry and chocolate flavors, if a bit direct. Drink soon.
title: Alta Maria 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This full-bodied wine is made in a fumé style and tastes as if it's been oak aged, making it feel rich and rounded on the palate. It gives generous flavors that are riper than usual, plus a lingering vanilla and almond finish.
title: Galvan 2015 Russo Family Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Solano County)

description: From a mediocre vintage, it seems as though the winery poured on the fully toasted oak to cover up marginal fruit. This smells like burnt meat and rubber, tastes charred and baked, and finishes blackened and overly toasty, with a choppy feel and hard tannins.
title: Telmo Rodríguez 2008 Altos Lanzaga Gran Viñedo  (Rioja)

description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this single-vineyard Sauvignon Blanc is medium bodied, with notes of lime and herbs. There's a touch of sugar to offset the tart acids, and the alcohol lingers on the finish.
designation: Talitha Cumi Bloc in Prayer Rock Vineyards
title: Reustle 2012 Talitha Cumi Bloc in Prayer Rock Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Umpqua Valley)

description: This wine is a blend of Evergreen, Schmitt and Oasis vineyards. It displays a mixture of butter, tropical fruit and red-apple aromas that lead to creamy feeling flavors and a drawn-out finish that impresses.
title: L'Ecole No. 41 2014 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This 100% varietal wine opens with brooding aromas of vanilla bean, herb, tobacco and black fruit still seemingly quite closed. The palate packs a mouthful of black-fruit flavors that show richness and deftness. The finish lingers.
title: Tenor 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Hot pink in color, this wine offers reduced aromas of herbs and cranberry that are followed by off-dry citrus-peel and kiwi flavors. It's a straightforward quaffer.
title: Waterbrook 2015 Rosé Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is dark and pointed on the nose, with graphite, mint, peppercorn and creamy oak aromas supporting herbal berry fruit scents. The palate feels lush and almost airy, with soft tannins and baked black-fruit flavors accented by chocolate and coffee. An earthy finish with licorice and mild tannins says drink this Carmenère now through 2015.
title: Santa Carolina 2010 Reserva de Familia Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: A strong and tasty oak component makes this full-bodied wine an attention-grabber, beginning with the toasted aromas, then complex and spicy flavors and firmly tannic texture. While the oakiness tamps down the fruit flavors, it does make it fun to drink.
title: Klinker Brick 2013 Farrah Syrah (Lodi)

description: There is a considerable amount of Petite Sirah (11%) blended within this wine, which helps emphasize its big power and concentration. Earth, soy, currant, cedar and graphite accent a core of juicy blackberry and chocolate-covered cherry.
title: Maxville 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A beautiful Chardonnay notable for its food-friendliness. Strikes a firm path toward dryness and minerality, with suggestions of citrus, peach and vanilla. The racy acidity is wonderful. Defines elegance in Chardonnay, at a good price.
title: Paul Dolan 2008 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: This is 85% Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Syrah, with a core of blueberry and cocoa. It's super-smooth and quite easy to sip and enjoy. But apart from that, and the seductive coffee/mocha flavors that run rampant through the finish, it shows little of the depth and complexity that Washington Cabernet can display. Drink 2017–2019.
title: J. Bookwalter 2011 Foreshadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The freshness of ripe lemon and crunchy, green apple pervades everything: the nose and palate sing with light-footed, unfettered freshness. This is crisp, light and spritzy and just the thing for a sunny, summery mood where refreshment is supposed to come on tiptoe but have a lasting effect. Full points for joy and ease. Drink soon.
title: Winzerkeller Andau 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

description: With lots of sweet oak, this is a simple Chardonnay. It's marked by buttered toast, caramel, vanilla and pineapple jam flavors that will appeal to fans of this ripe California style.
title: Bedarra 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Fresh grapefruit, lime and lemon collide in this invigorating waterfall of citrus flavors. Off dry in style and breathlessly light in texture, it hits the palate with an electric edge of acidity that reverberates through a long finish. Drink now through 2024.
title: Schloss Johannisberger 2014 Rotlack Kabinett Feinherb Riesling (Rheingau)

description: This is a rich and rounded wine, full of yellow fruits that shine through the tense texture. It is ripe, showing minerality as well as tropical fruits and red apples. The wine is going to age relatively quickly, so drink from 2019.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013 Les Preuses Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Spring flower aromas and attractive minerality are the hallmarks of this wine. Bright apple and ripe apricot flavors partner with attractive acidity. Everything is bound together by the smooth aftertaste, suggesting a relatively high dosage. Drink now.
title: Thiénot NV Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Firm and closed, this shows both richness and minerality. It has hidden power, concentration and a steely edge. It's crisp and densely packed with minerality and ripeness. For aging over at least seven years.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2010 Grenouilles Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A good buy for a white wine that's dry, clean and crisply acidic. The flavors are fine, of lemons, limes and tart Mandarin oranges.
title: Backhouse 2009 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Apple peels, squeezed lime, rain on cement, jicama and Asian-pear aromas show on the crisp yet rounded nose of this bottling by actress Drew Barrymore. The palate is quite inviting with broad apple flavors, offering just enough texture and acidity to keep all sorts of wine lovers interested.
title: Barrymore 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: It's rich in blackberry jam, with heady notes of cassis liqueur and sweet oak. At this price, it's a great everyday wine.
title: Leese-Fitch 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of scorched soil, used leather and game. The aromas follow over to the funky palate along with mature plum and black pepper. It's already accessible, with evolved tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Guicciardini Strozzi 2011 Sòdole Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: The golden color suggests evolution and the nose does not disappoint, presenting lifted notes of petrol, saffron, candied lemon and mandarin. Rich sweetness on the palate pairs with 2010's laser-sharp acidity, becoming more honeyed with each moment. This acidity still rings with greengage and lime freshness, providing lift. In the middle of its evolution, the wine is developed but still has potential. Drink now–2026.
title: Domaine Bernhard & Reibel 2010 Vendanges Tardives Riesling (Alsace)

description: The vineyard is in Rutherford, and this 100% Cabernet does show the dusty tannins for which the commune is known. It's also very ripe and exuberant, with tiers of black and red cherry pie, currant and oak flavors, as well as a delicious, earthy note of green olives. Forward now, but should gain in the bottle over the next 10 years.
title: Castello di Amorosa 2010 Don Thomas Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: It's surprising how outright herbal and leafy this wine is, which isn't to say it's bad. But it does seem greener than in the past, with olive and green tobacco on the nose and then leafy, herbal, light fruit flavors controlling the palate. Otherwise, it's oaky and a little tannic, with good structure.
title: Echeverria 2007 Founder's Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Slightly green, like almost all basic Carmenères, but there's also spice and depth to the nose and blackberry aromas. Tight and saturated in the mouth, with weight, darkness and concentrated flavors of sweet blackberry and chocolate. Finishes hard and narrow. Contains 15% Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Vistamar 2009 Sepia Reserva Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: This is estate grown, from a Lake Chelan winery in an emerging region. Riesling is clearly a strength, as this has a delicate elegance often missing from the fruit bombs that can be grown in warmer sites. Bone dry, dusty and lightly floral in the nose. The balance of blossom, yellow fruits, juicy acidity and wet rock is impeccable; the wine extends itself gracefully into a lingering finish.
title: Nefarious 2009 Stone's Throw Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: From an estate site alongside Westside Road, this impressive white shines in full-bodied nutty oak and a slight element of reduction that adds rather than detracts. Exotic in salty tangerine, peach and stone, it lingers in lasting oak spice.
title: Davis Bynum 2015 River West Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Coming all from the winery's young estate vineyard, this wine displays aromas of dried herbs, bittersweet chocolate, barrel spices and dried cherries. The black-fruit flavors are sweet and rich, backed by a firm scaffolding of tannins.
title: Col Solare 2012 Component Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: Aromas of green apple and citrus are as classic as it gets for Chilean Sauv Blanc. This is straight forward but enjoyable, with modest minerality. Flavors of citrus and gooseberry carry over onto a refreshing finish.
title: Ritual 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Gradations of textures ripple on the palate of this full-bodied dry Riesling. It's unctuously rich and fruity, full of ripe peach and honey flavors, while also elegant, struck by tones of steel and lemony acidity. A touch of saffron persists through a long, lingering finish.
title: Peter Jakob Kühn 2013 Mittelheim Sankt Nikolaus Trocken GG Riesling (Rheingau)

description: A blend of fruit from Quintessence, Ciel du Cheval, Klipsun and Obelisco vineyards, the aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of luxurious barrel spice, black-cherry meats, high-cacao chocolate, blackberry, high-toned herb, crème de cassis, dried earth, coffee and graphite. The palate is loaded with sweet cherry flavors that display a slightly linear styling at first, fleshing out a bit over time.
title: Mark Ryan 2015 Dead Horse Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: What a pretty Syrah this is. With moderate alcohol and subtle oak influences, it's dry and stylishly elegant in the mouth. The flavors veer toward ripe cherries and blackberries, sprinkled with cinnamon, cocoa and finely-ground black pepper. Drink now–2015.
title: Foxen 2011 Williamson-Doré Vineyard Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Well made in large quantity, this wine offers fleshy tropical papaya around a structure of toasty oak and vanilla. Medium in body and length, it's balanced with a crisp finish.
title: Decoy 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: With Ribera wines there's an assumption of tannic presence, but this older vintage, while displaying a classy bouquet, is brutally tannic, with an acid-washed palate. Splashes of cranberry and plum flavors are cut by lemony acidity and drying sandpaper tannins.
title: Resalte 2001 Gran Resalte  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Hugely extracted in cherry pie flavors, this Merlot makes up for the absence of subtlety with its sheer deliciousness. The tannins are soft, making it ideal for drinking now with steak.
title: Frog's Leap 2010 Merlot (Rutherford)

description: A medium-bodied Chardonnay with a slight lactic note to it, the 2008 Martinborough Vineyard Chardonnay is crisp and long on the finish, highlighting its flavors of vanilla and pineapple. Might improve with another year or two in the bottle.
title: Martinborough Vineyard 2008 Chardonnay (Martinborough)

description: This rich, ripe Chardonnay is made in the modern style, with oaky flavors of pineapple jam, orange zest and vanilla custard, housed in a buttery, creamy texture. Brisk acidity provides needed balance.
title: ZD 2011 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Ripe, soft and oaky, with gentle, sweet flavors of blackberry, blueberry and cherry jam, mocha and toast. Easy to drink now with a great grilled steak.
title: Daou 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: What a nice Merlot, Brander's best yet. It's easy to drink now for the rich array of cherries, currants, cola, smoked meat and cedar, brightened with brisk acidity. But give it an hour or two in the decanter to soften and mellow.
title: Brander 2010 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This wine's vividly layered nose blends dusty garden herbs of oregano and marjoram with hints of chile pepper, wet concrete and plum skins. The palate is supple and complex, showing dynamic spices and herbs, cut olives, savory meats and pipe smoke, much like a Middle Eastern tagine.
title: Brave & Maiden 2013 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Made with organic Sangiovese grapes, this offers subtle aromas of red berry and underbrush. The straightforward palate shows plum, toast and red cherry while accents of white pepper and clove add interest. It's structured but easy drinking, with seasoned tannins.
title: Fattoria La Vialla 2014 L'Abbandonato  (Montecucco)

description: The vineyard is up on Atlas Peak, in the eastern part of Napa Valley, and is source to increasingly great Cabernets. Hard mountain tannins and incredibly concentrated blackberry fruit mark the wine, which is blended with a little Cabernet Franc that brings softness and cherries. Stunningly beautiful now, but a wine you want to try over the next decade to see how it changes.
title: Sequoia Grove 2007 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Soft, ripe quince and pear flavors are lifted by the presence of pink grapefruit. The wine has weight as well, the ripe Sauvignon blossoming in the glass. It's crisp, while also having a rounder profile.
title: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2009  Sancerre

description: Here's an elegant, full-bodied Cabernet packed with power and grace. It feels lush and classy in the mouth, a dry, softly tannic wine with rich flavors of blackberries, black currants and cedar. Drinks well now and should age well for 6–8 more years.
title: Arger-Martucci 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

description: Sugary flavors of red-cherry jam and toasted, almost ashy oak mark this simple Merlot.
title: Turning Leaf NV Merlot (California)

description: This retro-styled Chianti Classico is so dominated by aggressive, raw oak it recalls the 1990s, when producers all over Italy experimented with new barriques—to mixed results. Underneath all the oak, chocolate and coffee, you can detect muffled black fruit sensations. It closes with astringent wood tannins.
title: Barone Ricasoli 2010 Colledila  (Chianti Classico)

description: Soft and easy, with ripe, fruity cherry jam, cassis, mocha and spice flavors. The tannins are strong, and may give the wine some ageability, but you're better off drinking it soon.
title: Hawks View 2010 Syrah (California)

description: Evaluating young Eden Valley Rieslings isn't easy, as they often don't show their full potential for several years. The 2012 Bin 51 is tight and linear, crisply focused and a bit one-dimensional at this age. But the lime-driven fruit is potent and the finish beautifully clean and long. It should develop well over the next 7–8 years or more.
title: Penfolds 2012 Bin 51 Riesling (Eden Valley)

description: Though shy on the nose, this popular bottling delivers intrigue on the palate. Light red-cherry flavors are bolstered by pepper spice and a chalky tannic grip. Even for geeky connoisseurs, it's a good bottle for later in the night.
title: Castle Rock 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Crisp and fresh aromas of lime sorbet and iced apple flesh greet the nose on this Riboli family bottling. The palate is steely and bright, with Anjou pear flesh, a bit of smoke and some red-apple ripeness.
title: San Simeon 2014 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Big, oaky and roasted up front, with charred aromas. The palate is full but clacky, with piercing acidity leading to a saucy, sharp set of tangy red berry and herb flavors. There's a chocolaty element to smooth things out on the finish, but it's always snappy and sheer.
title: Morandé 2008 Gran Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Tasca d'Almerita produces one of southern Italy's finest metodo classico sparklers. Made from Chardonnay ripened under the Sicilian sun, this is creamy, rich and long, redolent of apricot, toasted almond and honey.
title: Tasca d'Almerita 2007 Almerita Extra Brut Chardonnay (Contea di Sclafani)
