description: Despite hot conditions in 2012, this manages to deliver pungent aromas of nettle, green herbs, passion fruit and pink grapefruit. It's clear and straightforward in the mouth, with passion fruit, lychee, lime and tangerine flavors. A long finish holds off on the bitterness while maintaining exuberance and pop.
title: Casas del Bosque 2012 Pequeñas Producciones Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: A good Cabernet, but outclassed in a flight by its more concentrated and attractive competitors. Taste too fruity, in a jammy sense, and over-oaked, showing lots of upfront vanilla extract and buttered toast. Could well develop bottle character after 2012, but it's a dice throw.
title: Lieff 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: This ripe wine opens with aromas of stewed black fruit, underbrush, prune, and a just whiff of farmyard. The palate reveals nearly overripe black cherry, cinnamon and clove alongside bracing, astringent tannins.
title: Lisini 2009  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Softly delicious, this Cabernet is perfect for drinking now. Its blackberry, currant and cocoa flavors are housed in wonderfully ripe, accessible tannins. Shows the elegance of a superior Napa Cab.
title: Turnbull 2009 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This opens with sensations of underbrush, tobacco, espresso and toasted notes. The extracted palate displays stewed fruit sensations, oak, vanilla, roasted coffee bean and searing alcohol. It's already evolved and ends on an almost sugary-sweet note.
title: Tenuta Vitanza 2012  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Exotic pineapple, lime and tangerine scents combine with notes of slate and wet stone on this lovely Riesling. It's quite dry, but feels lush on the palate with a sweet grapefruit softness. Finishes long and minerally.
title: Rooster Hill 2009 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: This wine has inviting caramel-apple aromatics, which follow along a subdued palate of ripe texture and oak. A brightness of orange blossom and tangerine add freshness and vibrancy to the lush fig-filled surroundings, dotted in nutmeg.
title: Martinelli 2015 Bella Vigna Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Dense on the nose, this has aromas of wet clay, tomato and herb-accented berry. It feels tight and tannic, with notes of red plum, berry and hard spice on the back palate. The finish is peppery and mildly herbal.
title: Bodega Norton 2009 Reserva Merlot (Mendoza)

description: Lots going on in this softly appealing Cabernet. It's full-bodied and ripe, showing classic Alexander Valley flavors of blackberry jam, chocolate, anise, dried herbs and spices. Will develop bottle complexity over the years while gradually losing fruit.
title: Frei Brothers 2008 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Nectarine and tangerine aromas come with a floral note and a whiff of sea foam. This is light in acidity, so the palate is round and chunky. Flavors of citrus and melon finish pithy and slightly bitter.
title: Vaya Vadiso 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: While slender in frame, this vibrantly zesty, herbal wine offers loads of intensity and vibe. Tart tangerine and apricot flavors are piercing and fresh, building in concentration and richness through a long, penetrating finish. It seems closed in its youth still, but should gain texture and complexity from 2020–2030.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2015 Kaseler Nies'chen Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

description: Crisp and incisive, a wine that shows roundness and softness, finished with bright and fresh acidity. A small amount of Pinot Blanc is in the blend, a legacy of plantings in the 1980s.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2007 Haut-Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Brisk notes of lemon, pineapple rind and peach kick off this zesty, refreshing Sauvignon Blanc. Round in feel, the palate is plump in tropical fruit and melon tones, with a persistent line of grapefruit acidity maintaining focus. The finish lingers on a light, chalky note.
title: Paumanok 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This has ripe blackberry and oak flavors. It's dry, full bodied and tannic enough to cut through a rich, ketchup-strewn cheeseburger.
title: Lost Angel 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This stood out among the Cornas tasted for this issue as being unusually red-fruited and herbal. Stewed raspberries tinged with briar stems manage to be mouthwatering despite some drying tannins. Not sure where this is headed.
title: Tardieu-Laurent 2010 Coteaux  (Cornas)

description: High toned aromas of vanilla, baking spice, pencil lead, smoke and fresh tobacco are followed by tart, light cranberry and plum flavors that taper on the finish.
title: Sawtooth 2014 Classic Fly Series Tempranillo

description: Dry, acidic and watery, with modest citrus, pear and vanilla flavors.
title: Tangley Oaks 2008 Lot #5 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A pretty, polished Grenache, balanced and savory. Shows a Pinot Noir-like delicacy in the mouth, with cherry and red plum fruit, leading to a slightly sweet finish. Drink now for it's freshness.
title: Jaffurs 2009 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

description: Unapologetically rich, this full-bodied wine offers heady aromas of baking spices, butterscotch and toast. The mouthfeel is round and creamy, with plenty of spicy, oak notes but also a bounty of peach and melon fruit to keep things balanced.
designation: Ladies who Shoot their Lunch Wild Ferment
title: Fowles Wine 2016 Ladies who Shoot their Lunch Wild Ferment Chardonnay (Victoria)

description: Ripe and full bodied, this is a wine that reflects the softness of the vintage. Aged in wood, it has a rounded texture, with spice, apricot and pineapple flavors, finishing with a touch of acidity.
title: Michel Picard 2009 Le Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Bold and very woody, this full-bodied wine takes charred oak, pine needle and aromatic cedar aromas through to ripe plum, licorice and black-cherry flavors. It stays smooth in texture, with a layer of fine tannins but otherwise is soft in mouthfeel.
title: Lodi Estates 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: Rubbery and hard on the nose, but with solid berry and cassis aromas lying in wait. The palate is solid, fresh and good, with raspberry, plum and herbal flavors. Finishes dry and herbal but there's enough fruit and clarity to push it up a notch or two.
title: Caliterra 2009 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: Enticing hints of sweet spice, black pepper and bacon fat seduce on the nose of this rich but balanced Hermitage. Blackberry and cherry flavors are fresh and juicy but structured by firm tannins and brisk acidity. A polished wine already, it should intensify its savory, smoky complexities well through 2030.
title: Delas Frères 2015 Domaine des Tourettes  (Hermitage)

description: This is a supremely earthy and highly tannic wine, leathery and smoky in oak and texture. Grown in the foothills of Diamond Mountain, as well as pockets of Atlas Peak and Mount Veeder, the variety is unusual for the Napa Valley. This one is worthwhile, showing subtle cassis, cranberry and vanilla.
title: Castello di Amorosa 2012 Sangiovese (Napa Valley)

description: This is undeniably an oaky wine with a prominent layer of buttered toast and butterscotch, but the underlying orange, guava and lime flavors are pristine.
title: Frank Family 2011 Lewis Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Perfumed tangerine and lemon notes are glazed with a waxy sheen on the nose of this elegant wine. While dry and light bodied in style, the palate is surprisingly tropical, bursting of fresh pineapple, mango and guava flavors. Spry acidity and a hint of crushed minerals freshen a long, meandering finish.
title: Prinz Salm 2015 Vom Roten Schiefer Riesling (Nahe)

description: Quite light aromas of apple and flower blossom are followed by sleek fruit flavors. The concentration seems a bit light.
title: Vino 2014 Pinot Grigio (Washington)

description: Heady florals, honey and smoke mix languorously on the nose of this deeply concentrated, multifaceted dry Riesling from Fox Run. The palate is sultry with smoke and orange rinds, a dark minerality and lime acidity.
title: Fox Run 2009 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Deep, alluring aromas of blackberry and cassis are youthful and thus a bit animal and wild. In the mouth, this young CS is chunky, rubbery and dense. Flavors of blackberry, cassis and black coffee are on the dark side, while the finish offers a meaty, substantive feel, tons of lasting fruit flavor, and a touch of heat and burn that will fade away with more time in bottle. Best from 2016–2022.
designation: Terrunyo Andes Pirque Vineyard Block Las Terrazas
title: Concha y Toro 2011 Terrunyo Andes Pirque Vineyard Block Las Terrazas Cabernet Sauvignon (Pirque)

description: A nice everyday Cabernet, this is softly tannic and rich in blackberry and cherry flavors that finish a little ripe. It's an easy wine to drink now with beef dishes.
title: Wolfgang Puck 2010 Master Lot Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Beautiful floral fragrances of violet and rose accompany whiffs of leather and wet soil. The smooth palate delivers succulent wild cherry accented with notes of white pepper, black tea and a hint of vanilla alongside silky tannins. This will develop more complexity over the next decade but it won't have the longevity of other vintages. Drink 2015–2024.
title: Biondi Santi 2009  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Cedary, spicy aromas and flavors rather than a strong fruit character define this medium-bodied, soft-textured wine. It is heavy on the spice and light on acidity and tannins.
title: Leaping Horse 2014 Merlot (California)

description: This soft-textured, mouth-filling wine has woodsy, fallen leaf aromas, gentle flavors that combine savory and fruity accents and mild acidity and tannins. It's medium to full-bodied and soothing to sip.
title: Iron Hub 2014 Estate Bottled Grenache (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: Light on the nose, this shows delicate aromas of Asian pear, honeysuckle, squeezed lemon wedge, fresh coconut flesh and a tiny bit of butter. The palate is also demure yet delicious, with lightly poached apples, squeezed lime and a chalky textural grip.
title: Foley 2014 Rancho Santa Rosa Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: With organically grown grapes from both Lake County (58%) and Mendocino (42%), this showcases the best of both regions. It has a great mix of lemon, grapefruit, honeydew and kiwi freshness that remains balanced on the finish. It's a quaffable summer wine.
title: Bonterra 2010 Made With Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County-Mendocino County)

description: Asian pear, spice and pineapple aromas lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors that drop off on the back half. It comes off as a bit light, but there's interest to be had.
title: 4 Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A fruity, soft, enjoyable red wine for drinking now. It's medium bodied and lightly oaked, with sour cherry candy and pepper spice flavors.
title: Pietra Santa 2007 Sangiovese (Cienega Valley)

description: This unoaked Chardonnay shows admirable weight on the palate, but slightly one-dimensional, citrusy flavors. Clean and correct on the finish; drink now.
title: Woop Woop 2009 Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

description: This is only light to medium in body, but it has a tactile, peach-skin element that gives it extra interest on the palate and pleasant flinty notes alongside modest citrus fruit. Drink now.
title: Starborough 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: The use of 75% new oak applies a thick coating of vanilla over the fruit, which nonetheless is in plentiful supply, sweet, sappy and delicious. Immense black cherry and cassis turns a bit liquorous in the mouth, with streaks of tobacco, lots of vanilla and some finishing heat.
title: Mark Ryan 2007 Wild Eyed Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: Thin and vegetal, with barely ripened cherry flavors and lots of black pepper on the finish.
title: Boeger 2007 Tempranillo (El Dorado)

description: Vanilla, coconut and toast aromas are vibrant and out-front, followed by tropical fruit. This wine is full bodied with a viscous, almost oily feel that persists through the finish. It offers some good things, but the variety gets lost in the style.
title: Browne Family Vineyards 2014 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Named after the Bay of Biscay near Gascony, this wine is light, fruity and crisp. It has an herbal character, refreshing green fruit and lively acidity. Drink now.
title: Biscaye Baie 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Layers of crushed slate, bramble and earth lend savory nuance to juicy lemon and white peach flavors in this invigorating off-dry Riesling. It's a piercing, mouthwatering wine, highlighted by streaks of lime and lemon acidity. Drink now through 2024.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Old Vines Offdry
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Old Vines Offdry Riesling (Mosel)

description: Francesco Galliano is a creamy and opulent Chardonnay-based sparkler that opens with a deep golden color, yeasty notes followed by butter and toasted almond. The wine shows loads of ripe and sticky fruit that almost bring it over the top.
title: Borgo Maragliano 2010 Francesco Galliano Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Piedmont)

description: Full bodied, muscular and intense, this brooding Shiraz is built for the cellar. Smoke and blackberries are crunchy with acid and primary fruit, finishing crisp. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Wirra Wirra 2013 RSW Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: This special Sauvignon Blanc is only being released in top vintages. The first was the 2010; the 2013 is the second vintage. Fermented in oak, it offers up complex aromas of pencil shavings and grapefruit, followed by hints of toast, cedar, red currants and gooseberries. It's a ripe, weighty style, but it carries those traits without a hitch, gliding seamlessly through a long, silky, mouthwatering finish.
title: Brancott 2013 Chosen Rows Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Clove and vanilla make for a serious, if not terribly refreshing, opening. There's nice grapefruit and pomelo fruit here and a medium, lemony finish that veers towards tart. Drink up.
title: Castello di Borghese 2006 Founder's Field Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: With a smidgen of Petit Verdot, this dark, tight and leathery wine is exalted in tobacco, graphite and tar, still youthfully awkward and shy. The flavors lean savory into meaty aspects of currant and clove, waiting to find companionship in fruit. Drink now after a decant, or cellar through 2023.
title: Stone The Crows 2013 Three Twins Vineyard Fallen Feather Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: The Beaujolais Blanc style is well expressed here: rich, creamy and light on structure. That gives an early-drinking, fruity wine full of baked apple and pear flavors. It can be enjoyed now.
title: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2016 Roche Noire  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: This is a ripe, rich wine, with an open yellow-fruit flavor. It has weight that lends a full-bodied character. While missing a more nervy character, it gives warm pleasure.
title: Cave de Kientzheim-Kaysersberg 2009 The Furst Riesling (Alsace)

description: Baked apple is about all you draw from the flat nose, and the chunky palate is ultrasweet and tastes of corn and candy more than fruit. Cloying on the finish.
title: Andeluna 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Tupungato)

description: Barrel notes of vanilla and spice take the lead in this aromatically brooding wine, followed by dried herbs and dark fruit. The flavors are pitch black, coating the palate from end to end with layers of fruit, tannins that go the distance and a graphite-filled finish that lingers. It will drink best from 2020–2027.
title: Woodward Canyon 2013 Old Vines Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: Mineral and flinty at the start, this young wine has an intense structure. Tannins and fruit skins give a strong, tight texture. At the same time, the acidity is just as intense, crisp and juicy, tight and needing many years to develop. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2013 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Delicate mint aromas play alongside notes of bittersweet cocoa powder, dried blackberry and date. Mouth-coating tannins provide a firm structure to the medium-weight mouth, while a touch of black pepper spice remains after swallow.
title: Beau Joubert 2008 Shiraz (Stellenbosch)

description: Bursting with ripe, juicy peaches, this intensely fruit-forward white Merlot is surprisingly dry and dainty on the palate. It's straightforward and approachable in style, with just a hint of stony minerality on the finish.
title: Sannino 2012 Bianca Rosé Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: While this Tempranillo is straightforward in style, it does have some good cherry, herb tea and cola flavors. It's rich and soft, but has a pleasant burst of acidity.
title: Casa de Arcilla 2010 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

description: From the winery's Bob's Ranch vineyard primarily, this is a beautiful white wine, and an inaugural release, that is floral and voluptuously creamy in texture. Despite its fulsome nature, it retains balance via a thread of persistently bright acidity amidst rich tones of candied pear, peach, anise and vanilla crème brûlée. It has length for days.
title: Walt 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A dark, dramatic Merlot, giving the palate a tour de force of flavor and depth. Dry and somewhat tannic, it displays a huge core of blackberries, black cherries and minerals, with a coating of sweet, smoky oak. One of the more delicious Merlots on the market.
title: Kenefick Ranch 2007 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Aged in French and American oak (88% new), aromas of toast, vanilla, coconut shavings, blackberry, cocoa and black cherry lead to rich ripe sweet full-bodied fruit flavors, with vanilla and coconut notes lingering on the finish. For those looking for a big full warm vintage Syrah, look no further.
title: Fielding Hills 2015 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Syrah (Wahluke Slope)

description: This gets the job done with classic varietal flavors of lemon, lime and savory green grass, as well as tart acidity to get those tastebuds watering. There's an off-dry taste of honey, but the wine is basically dry.
title: Sterling 2011 Vintner's Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

description: A deep-purple look and aromas of cherry cough drop and berry jam announce a fruity wine with hard, drilling tannins. Seemingly overextracted, this is a packed, medicinal tasting red with toast and fire on the finish.
title: Château Los Boldos 2012 Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

description: A little old fashioned in style, this wine shows plush plummy fruit, vanilla and cola aromas that are overpowered by sweet oak spice. The palate is tart and tangy, with more plummy fruit, savory spices and chunky, oaky tannins.
title: Davey Family 2015 Estate Grown Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: With 4% Petit Verdot added for body and color, this Cab is otherwise on the brighter side of red fruit and acidity, nicely balanced and approachable in cranberry, cassis and a wink of violet. It's not as meaty and robust as the winery's Morisoli, a tamer version of a similar beast.
title: V. Sattui 2010 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: While this wine is packed with red-berry flavors, it is still too young with its stalky edge. Tannins and smoky flavors are there along with intense acidity. Keep it until late 2016 for it to be at its best.
title: Château Laulerie 2014 Merlot (Bergerac)

description: Jacopo Biondi Santi hits a home run with this beautiful Morellino. The wine is smooth and dense, with lively cherry notes, soft spice and tobacco. It's straightforward and plush, but elegant at the same time.
title: Jacopo Biondi-Santi 2008 Castello di Montepò  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Cherry and raspberry aromas are simple as pie, while this feels a touch astringent and drawing. Tart but fresh plum and raspberry flavors are slightly briny. Juicy and satisfactory on the finish.
title: Vicente Gandia 2014 Hoya de Cadenas Organic Tempranillo (Spain)

description: This Cabernet Sauvignon has enormously high alcohol that results in a glyceriney sweetness. However, in that category it's one of the best of the vintage. Hard to imagine a wine richer in currants and mocha, and the tannins are as beautiful as any Napa has ever produced. But it's difficult to see the wine aging well, so drink it soon with the most Cabernet-friendly food you can find.
title: B Cellars 2010 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: Aromas like iron, earth and cherries lead to good rich fruit flavors in this well-balanced and medium-bodied wine. Energized by firm tannins and lively acidity, it matches them with ripe cherry and raspberry flavors and a tantalizing spiciness that lasts through the finish.
title: Noceto 2015 Hillside Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: The wine is generous, rich and full of the finest ripe citrus and apple fruits. It also has a steely edge to it, crisp with acidity and minerality. The wine comes from the one acre parcel of Le Clos Grand Cru that once belonged to the Hospices de Chablis. Drink this intense wine from 2021.
designation: Les Clos Grand Cru Clos des Hospices Dans les Clos
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2015 Les Clos Grand Cru Clos des Hospices Dans les Clos  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Dry, minerally and acidic, this Chardonnay offers pineapple, lemon and mineral flavors. It's a food-friendly wine that won't compete with what you eat. At this price, it's a good restaurant wine, and easy to find, with 7,500 cases produced.
title: Black Stallion 2010 Estate Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A smoky note of flint signals youth, while a pliable, light and fresh body of grapefruit zest and yeasty brings a slender but juicy feel. A slim but impressive package of lively, taut fruit.
title: Jäger 2014 Achleiten Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

description: There's a seemingly sweet edge to the lemon, lime and vanilla flavors, which are fortunately balanced with crisp acidity. Fans of richly styled white wines will like this bottling.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2011 Vintner's Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: The vineyard needs a warm vintage to fully ripen, which 2010 definitely wasn't. The wine is acidic and green, with an ammonia edge to the pineapples, mangoes and limes.
title: Kunde 2010 Magnolia Lane Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

description: The Mother Vine Cabernet is drinking soft and easy now, with gentle tannins framing slightly herbaceous blackberry and black cherry flavors, touched with smoky oak. It feels like a wine you want to age, although the softness suggests it won't for long.
title: Concannon 2007 Mother Vine Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

description: Layers of spice, lanolin and orange rind stand out curiously on this intriguing Riesling fermented spontaneously with indigenous yeast, and subject to 5 months on its lees. It's strikingly brisk with tart, lemony acidity, but rich with a rustic, savory apple flavor. It's a funky, thoroughly unique wine, but also a remarkably complex wine to savor through the course of a long evening.
title: Bloomer Creek 2011 Tanzen Dame Auten Vineyard 1st Harvest Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: There's a juicy lemon-lime popsicle quality to this wine that's hard not to like. The slight floral character helps, too. It's crisp yet slightly viscous in texture, with lemon and lime notes on the finish that make it a fruity and fun little number.
title: Smythe & Renfield 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Lush, concentrated and richly put together, this coastal, estate white offers a mix of inviting flavors from Bosc pear to pineapple and fennel. Integrated in oak and balanced in ripeness, it'll pair well with a range of foods and be wholly satisfying on its own.
title: Flanagan 2015 Platt Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Soft and simple, with candied pear, orange, vanilla, honey and buttered toast flavors that finish with a sugary feel.
title: Franciscan 2011 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a lush, rich and toasty Chardonnay, with upfront scents of grilled apple, brioche, orange custard and sweet spice. The medium-weight palate is balanced by ample acidity, lending a freshness to the finish that closes on notes of honeydew melon and toasted hazelnut. Drink now–2018.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2011 Aigle Royal Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: This is beautifully rich and powerful, with tropical fruit flavors and a hint of wood. It has enormous concentration of sweet, ripe white and yellow fruits, balanced by the sharp cut of acidity.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2010 Valmur Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: An impressive Syrah, showing a good structure of acids and tannins and considerable complexity. Offers layers of blackberries, charred meat, moo shu plum sauce and exotic, peppery spices, wrapped into firm but finely-ground tannins. Drink over the next six years.
title: Longboard 2010 Goosechase Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)

description: A blend from more than 20 individual vineyard sites, this wine is an excellent reflection of the Pouilly-Fuissé appellation. With a strong mineral character as well as tight acidity, it is structured, rich and intense. Drink from late 2019.
title: Château de Fuissé 2015 Tête de Cru  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine all comes from Rosebud vineyard and is blended with 17% Sémillon. Bright aromas of lees, pineapple, fig and lemon are followed by tart, full-bodied flavors with mouthwatering acidity.
title: Elevation Cellars 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Wahluke Slope)

description: Aromas of bread crust, pastry cream and toast come together in the glass. The creamy palate offers mature pear, yellow apple and toasted hazelnut alongside a soft mousse.
title: Fratelli Berlucchi 2012 Freccianera Saten  (Franciacorta)

description: Dry compressed fruit flavor accents pronounced oak and tannin in this full-bodied, rich and rounded wine. Tangy and tart on the palate, it leans into savory elements of tobacco and pencil, with a leathery persistence.
title: ZD 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of gravelly earth, dark black cherry, wet wood and smoke show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also very earthy, although a tad weak, with smoke-laced black currant and peppery spices.
title: Robert Hall 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Hard aromas of matchstick, bramble and tart fruit don't exactly qualify as friendly, while the palate is grabby and tastes of fruit punch and herbal berry. Short and a touch burnt tasting on the finish. Acceptable, as it leaves you wanting more.
title: Condado de Oriza 2008  Ribera del Duero

description: The wine is structured and concentrated, showing a strong sense of minerality. Citrus and ripe apple fruits are complemented by richer apricot, always cut through with acidity and a tense texture. It needs to age, drink from 2016.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2012  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: A thick, rich and balanced expression of great, estate-owned dirt, this wine has well-developed elements of green apple, pear and lemon, with teases of wet stone and gravelly minerality.
title: Silverado 2013 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Full and sweet smelling, but also a little cidery. The palate is drawn, narrow and citrusy, with grapefruit, passion fruit and orange for core flavors. Finishes citrusy and a touch vapid; overall it shows flashes of elegance but not enough to rise above average.
title: Reina de Castilla 2009 Isabelino Rosado Tempranillo (Rueda)

description: Subtle aromas suggesting citrus blossom and ripe pear make their way to the forefront. Simple but well made, the palate offers suggestions of yellow apple, white peach and a dollop of vanilla.
title: Feudo Disisa 2016 Chardonnay (Sicilia)

description: The least expensive Saint-Joseph from LVV is this attractively tarry, smoky offering. It offers exciting complexity, marrying herbal, savory notes of black olive, smoke and wood ash with just enough blackberry and raspberry fruit while remaining medium bodied and almost delicate on the palate. Drink now–2018.
title: Les Vins de Vienne 2011  Saint-Joseph

description: A ripe, bold and impressive wine, showing yellow peaches and pineapple flavors to go with its tight core of minerality. There is a touch of wood, but the main thrust is for broad fruit, open and welcoming.
title: William Fèvre 2007 Cote Bouguerots Bougros Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a well-behaved, medium-bodied, dry wine. Good doses of ripe fruit and oaky spices in the aroma and flavor are carried on a firm structure of supportive tannins and fruit acidity. Everything balances out well and the price is right.
title: Barbed Wire 2014 Winemaker's Reserve Lot No 9 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: Black cherry and blackberry aromas share space on the nose with varietally familiar herbal saucy notes. A firm grip and tight tannins make for a structured palate, while this is minty, spicy, oaky and herbal more than outright fruity in terms of flavors. Tightness via pulling tannins remains on the finish, meaning this has time to evolve. Drink through 2025.
title: Matias Riccitelli 2015 Viñedos De Montaña Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

description: Candied blackberry, black cherry, plum paste, mint and dark chocolate show on the nose of this dense built-to-last bottling by Mike Officer. The palate is thick and the tannins are still a bit stiff, but the intense marjoram, oregano, thyme and elderberry jam flavors will grow even more fascinating with time. Drink from 2019 through 2035.
title: Carlisle 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Good price for an upscale Chardonnay this rich and interesting. It's oaky, with vanilla and buttered toast flavors, but the underlying pineapple and Meyer lemon fruit easily supports the wood, while brisk, refreshing acidity provides balance.
title: Mercy 2008 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Floral and a tad vegetative, this Cab is decent at first, but quickly turns disjointed and donut-y.
title: Healdsburg Ranches 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: This is a taut wine, touched by yeast and warmed by ripe yellow fruit. Flavors of melon and spice from the new wood give it an open feel. It's ripe, already rounded and full bodied.
title: Louis Latour 2010 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: A bold, leathery and savory wine, this offers dark chocolate and black pepper within a soft layering of full-bodied approachability and ripe, red berry and currant.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2013 Artemis Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is an easy, simple wine that's lush and ripe with apricots, oranges and pineapples, but crisp with acidity and clean on the finish.
title: Pennywise 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: Look for the 2010 vintage of this wine, as the 2009 seems a bit tired now with muted notes of melon rind and lemon in the round mouth and a finish that shows a bit of heat.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2009 Cadet d'Oc Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Profound mineral notes of crushed slate and river rocks differentiate this goldkap bottling from the producer's regular labels. Fleshy white peach and yellow cherry flavors are sweet and plump, but cast in breathtaking layers of shimmering minerality. Electric acidity pierces through a long finish. Although it's a stunner already, it will improve well through 2030 and likely beyond.
designation: Brauneberger Juffer Sonnenuhr Auslese Goldkap Grosse Lage
title: Fritz Haag 2016 Brauneberger Juffer Sonnenuhr Auslese Goldkap Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: There are basic flavors of oranges, apples, pears and oak in this Chard. There's also a sea-salt tang that makes it savory and suggests pairing with seafood.
title: Murphy-Goode 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: For a 2008, this seems to be developing rather quickly, showing toasty notes that emerge on the nose, expand on the palate and jump out on the finish, largely overshadowing the admirable citrus and crushed-stone elements. Drink now.
title: Peter Jakob Kühn 2008 Oestrich Doosberg Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)

description: This partnership between the Rhône's Michel Chapoutier and his American importer seems remarkably consistent. Peppery clove aromas presage a medium-bodied, silky wine that combines spice with black olives on the midpalate. It's long, finely textured and espresso-tinged on the finish.
title: Domaine Terlato & Chapoutier 2012 L- Block Shiraz (Pyrenees)

description: Big, bold and concentrated, this full-bodied wine was given the complete new-barrel, lees-stirring treatment. It has a deep gold color, with ripe pear and buttered toast aromas that transition to waves of pear and apple on the palate and lingering finish.
title: Ironstone 2012 Reserve Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)

description: Subtle hints of sweet grass and lemon verbena mingle with the green melon, lime and underripe mango core of this wine. It's medium in weight, with a flatness to the midpalate that countered by a bitter pithiness on the finish.
title: Kiwi Cuvée 2017 Bin 88 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: Tall Tales is a new designation for the winery's reserve Syrah. It's unfined, unfiltered and unabashed—a potent, powerful wine which teeters on the edge of bitterness. But within its compact and textural body are lively flavors of boysenberry and coffee grounds, tobacco and vanilla, cola and rock. It pushes deep into the palate and extends into a complex and long-lasting finish.
title: Dusted Valley 2008 Tall Tales Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: The vineyard isn't well known, but it's on Pritchard Hill, near much more famous sources of Cabernet. It's a deceptive wine, so rich and flamboyant in sweet, jammy blackberries and cherries, chocolate and licorice, you want to drink the whole bottle. Yet it has the tannin-acid balance to age, possibly for a long time. Made from 100% Cab, yet produced in tiny quantities, it shows the Pritchard signature of youthful deliciousness combined with ageability.
title: Castello di Amorosa 2010 Melanson Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Deep, dark and still very tightly wound three years after harvest, this second vintage of the Daou brothers' top-tier effort continues their march toward phenolic perfection. Aromas of black currant, elderberry jam, crushed black rocks, loamy soil and light purple flowers lead into a plush palate that's very dry, extremely textural and well balanced. Flavors of black plum, dark berries and dark chocolate ride sticky tannins that will smooth with patience. Drink 2019–2034.
title: Patrimony 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)

description: Appealing aromas of black cherry, cocoa, herb, pencil lead and wood spice are followed by generous pit-fruit flavors. The tannins show some chalkiness and astringency.
title: North by Northwest 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Aromas of bees wax and clover honey come with some volatility. The palate tastes a touch bitter and high pitched, and the acidity feels flat. A note of honey-infused breakfast tea surfaces on the palate.
title: Doukénie 2011 Pinot Grigio (Virginia)

description: Wood aromas set the scene for a wine that shows wood-aging flavors. Spice, vanilla, baked apple and citrus flavors all mingle easily and to great effect. The wine, with its textured character, could age another year or two. Drink from 2015.
title: Collovray et Terrier 2012 Domaine des Dexu Roches PRC  (Saint-Véran)

description: This is an attractive fruity wine with citrus fruits and a tangy, zesty texture. The lightest hint of wood gives the wine extra richness. It is already drinkable.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014  Montagny

description: Here's a lush, fruity Cabernet, brimming with blackberry, black currant and flashy oak flavors. It straddles that line between a tannic young wine you can drink now after decanting, and one to age. Probably best opened by 2015.
title: Midsummer Cellars 2009 Cañon Creek Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This vineyard lies around the winery in the heart of the appellation, and it imparts lovely aromatics of dusty rose petals and mocha chocolate. Soft tannins wrap around a ripeness of baked plum, cedar, clove and earthy compost, with a shot of coffee on the finish.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2013 John C. Sullenger Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: Quite savory on the nose and palate, with notes of cooked apple, lemon and peach purée. This is judiciously oaked with bright, lemon-lime acidity that livens up the palate.
designation: Unionville Home Single Vineyard Estate Bottled
title: Unionville 2010 Unionville Home Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Chardonnay (New Jersey)

description: This wine starts with alluring scents of warm pastry dough and peaches. And it shows ample weight in the mouth without going overboard. Yet on the palate, the oak is slightly coarse and obvious. It's still a very good wine, just needs more finesse.
title: Vasse Felix 2015 Filius Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: Dense, baked and mulled blackberry and cassis aromas include bold but classy oak notes. This feels seamless except for raring tough tannins, while flavors of toast, graphite and spiced blackberry finish smooth and chewy, with a sense of lushness despite lasting residual tannins. Drink through 2025.
title: Cono Sur 2013 20 Barrels Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Very mineral-driven on the nose, with aromas of chalk and wet gravel, this bottling also shows scents of lime and pear rind. The palate is very tangy, with pomelo-pith flavors, but there is also a more rounded touch of cut pear and orange rind.
title: Star Lane Vineyard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: A tan-leaning color and a nose defined by toasty oak on top of pear and apple aromas make for a good opening. This Tupungato Chardonnay is plump, viscous and well balanced, with a mix of oaky spice and melony flavors. A steady finish confirms that this is of high quality.
title: Zuccardi 2017 Q Chardonnay (Tupungato)

description: This is an interesting wine that offers plenty of Chardonnay pleasure at a fair price. It's dry and creamy, with pineapple, peach and lime fruit flavors, brightened by tart acidity and accented with sweet oak.
title: Roth 2011 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Even tasted blind, this wine's Awatere origins shone through, bursting with fresh nettles and tomato leaf which garnish currant-like fruit. It's amply concentrated and round in the mouth, then long and mouthwatering on the finish.
title: Awatere River 2009 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Elegant peach and floral tones on this off-dry Riesling build in complexity on the nose and palate, with layers of waxy lanolin and fresh green herbs. It's forward and fruity, yet honed and balanced, with bright lemon-lime acidity.
title: Anthony Road 2011 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Subtle yet complex characters of lemon, stone fruit, flint, and wet stone minerality are woven into a creamy textured palate. Bright acidity keeps everything in balance, with a savory, toasty note on the finish. Drink now–2022.
title: Franklin Tate 2015 Tate Alexanders Vineyard Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: Disappointing, but perhaps this is just past its best? Scallion and green veggies nearly swamp nectarine fruit in this medium-bodied wine.
title: Kate Radburnd 2014 Bud Burst Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

description: One of a pair of single-vineyard, reserve-level Chardonnays, this seamlessly pulls together yellow apple, lemon panna cotta, white pepper and a suggestion of wet rock. Located in the Chehalem Mountains AVA, Aurora fruit is fermented with wild yeast all the way through malolactic, and aged in one-third new and two-thirds neutral French oak. The wild yeast adds detail and texture, and the wine makes a soft, buttery, graceful, prolonged exit.
title: Ponzi 2013 Aurora Vineyard Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Candied cranberry and pomegranate juice meet with a hint of dark soil on the nose of this bottling from Camp 4 Vineyard, proving playful but also serious in density. Black plum and açaí rise on the tip of the sip, then the flavors dive into thicker, richer plum paste, chocolate and oregano, surrounded by simmering acidity.
title: Rideau 2016 The Englishmen Sangiovese (Los Olivos District)

description: Fancy name for a simple wine. Tastes like sweetened pineapple juice.
title: Parkers Estate 2008 Tolleson High Corniche Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: There's a cinnamon and clove sweetness in aroma of this Sangiovese, which would be a fine accompaniment to pizza or pasta during the week.
title: Barra of Mendocino 2010 Estate Grown Sangiovese (Mendocino)

description: This earthy wine has overripe fruit aromas and sweet apple flavors. It's medium-bodied and soft in texture.
title: Jaxon Keys 2014 Estate Grown Cecil Keys Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

description: This is the biggest, most tannic and closed of the winery's three new 2007 Syrahs, and also the one most likely to improve in the cellar. It's intense and concentrated in pure blackberry and black cherry fruit, with the pepper, bacon, earth and smoky oak notes you want in a good 100% Syrah. But then, there are those big tannins. Give it a good 4–6 years.
title: Olson Ogden 2007 Unti Vineyard Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Peppery and thick in cured meat, game and smoked oak, this has violet undertones and a powerful grasp of brambly blackberry and blueberry. The tannins are well managed and supportive, showing ability to age with grace. Enjoy best 2025–2028.
title: Carlisle 2016 Papa's Block Syrah (Russian River Valley)

description: Simple and soft, with jammy berry-cherry flavors and lots of oak. Finishes sweet. Easy to drink, but that's about all.
title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: For the price, you get just what you pay for with this Chard. It's honeyd and soft, with flavors of buttered toast and apricot-orange jam.
title: Angeline 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: Nelson Neves has made a rich wine, recognizably Portuguese in its tannic structure while also having a jammy, juicy red-fruit character that comes from the Merlot. This ripe wine is ready to drink.
title: Nelson Neves 2013 Neves Merlot (Bairrada)

description: Tangy, savory and elegant, this bright, silky sparkler offers inviting aromas and flavors of Golden Delicious apple, tangy tangerine drop, white peach, mineral and herb. A creamy mousse lends even more finesse while cream-filled brioche lingers on the finish.
title: Bonfadini NV Carpe Diem Satèn  (Franciacorta)

description: There's no denying that this is a saucy, tomatoey Cabernet. But despite its leafy, herbal leanings and a lively mouthfeel, it's not unpleasant and its snap makes it food-friendly.
title: Vila 2009 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: This unoaked Chardonnay offers soft notes of marzipan, white peach, ripe yellow apples and ginger powder on the nose. It is round and mouthcoating on the palate, with flavors that echo the nose.
title: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Stainless Steel Fermented Chardonnay (Virginia)

description: Available at an attractively low price, this Sangiovese shows easy berry aromas with soft accents of blue flower and diced almond. The wine's natural freshness makes it perfect to pair against cheesy pasta dishes.
title: Caldora Vini 2011 Sangiovese (Terre di Chieti)

description: This mellow, well-balanced wine hits the mark between almost-sweet fruit flavors, subtle oak influence and a firm, lightly tannic texture. Medium to full bodied, it smells lightly spicy, feels sleek on the palate and has a lingering finish.
title: Putah Creek 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Solano County)

description: Before the zesty lime reaches the nose, there is an almost decadent streak of apricot in demerara sugar. On the palate, however, it is the zing of citrus that asserts itself with exquisite speed and ease. It colonizes mouth and mind with its swirls of ripe bright pure lemon. It makes you smack your lips with its concentration, freshness and zip. There is lots of verve here. The finish is dry and driven, full of energy. Drink now through 2038.
title: Jean Biecher & Fils 2017 Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Softly mellow yet surprisingly powerful, this 100% varietal wine speaks loudly to its sense of place, born of a region known for combining elegance with sheer force. Cherry and plum highlight a supportive layering of subtle oak, while the gravely texture is juicy and lengthy, a mix of ageworthy complexity and instant appeal.
title: Pine Ridge 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: From one of the most famous vineyard slopes in Sancerre, the wine is tight, structured and still young. It has great potential with rich citrus, herbs and green fruit flavors. Along with the tense, mineral texture, the wine has both concentration and aging ability. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Roger & Christophe Moreux 2016 Les Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)

description: Shut down by hard tannins and utterly dry, this fine young Cabernet is simply not ready to drink. It's very rich in blackberries, smoked meat and charred wood, with a finish that's fine, long and sweet in ripe fruits. Should blossom after 2014 and hold for a number of years.
title: Arrowood 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: This wine offers ground cranberry, red currant, dried herb and golden raisin aromas. The flavors are surprisingly elegant, considering the warmth of the vintage and region; they taper toward the finish.
title: Kiona 2015 Estate Grown Merlot (Red Mountain)

description: Fiery berry aromas come across sort of rough and scratchy. The palate is softer and more creamy, with vanilla, berry and pepper flavors. Finishes toasty and peppery, albeit slightly bitter.
title: Medanos 2009 Tempranillo (Mendoza)

description: This comes from a vineyard established in 1971—one of the first in the appellation to contribute a single-vineyard bottling of the variety. It features a treasure trove of rich red cherry, leathery tannin and dry mocha on the palate, emboldened by a twist of cedar and dried herb.
title: Rodney Strong 2012 Alexander's Crown Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Hints of nuts add a savory tone to subtle apple flavors on this dry Chardonnay. Tart, crisp lemon and lime acidity on the midpalate makes it effortlessly refreshing, leading to a pleasant honey and floral note on the finish.
title: Standing Stone 2011 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: Shrouds of leafy herbs and savory stems lend a fresh tone to this brisk yet fruity, concentrated Cab. Crisp blackberry and currant flavors shine bright and pert on the palate, framed squarely by lingering strikes of tannin and acidity.
title: Fulkerson 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Finger Lakes)

description: Aromas of roasted coffee bean, ripe plum and dark kitchen spice waft out of the glass. The forward palate offers mature wild cherry, licorice, sage and espresso that carry through to the firm finish. Drink through 2019.
title: Melini 2011 Vigneti La Selvanella Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: This yeasty, nutty wine is showing signs of maturity. It has spice, hints of red fruits and a dry aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
title: Cave Robert & Marcel NV Maurice Bonnamy Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)

description: Cherry and mild leather aromas are inviting, while the medium-bodied palate, despite having some bite and edge, is topped off with cassis, cherry and light medicinal flavors. A bright wine with lively acidity and touches of oak, butter and vanilla on the finish.
title: Familia Cassone 2009 La Florencia Cabernet Sauvignon (Luján de Cuyo)

description: New management, farming and winemaking practices at this producer, including a focus on smaller production, are remarkably on display in this delicious white. Golden pear and crunchy apple provide an unctuous, delightfully balanced experience that's crisp in underlying acidity and subtle baking spice.
title: Clos du Val 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A mix of dark fruit and warm spice carries the medium-bodied palate. Soft tannins give an easy nature to this wine and the vanilla-cookie finish doesn't hurt either.
title: Lost Oak 2014 Bingham Family Vineyard Tempranillo (Texas High Plains)

description: Light in color, aromas of plum, herb, barrel spice and crushed peanut lead to tart raspberry and plum flavors that come up a bit short on the finish. It's a straightforward, enjoyable offering.
title: Maryhill 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Light and airy, with a reticent nose of green apple, melon and faded flowers undercut by a slight funkiness. Quite dry, this is a good partner for raw clams. Drink up.
title: Pierre Sparr 2008 Reserve Riesling (Alsace)

description: Firm and fresh, this puts pear and apple fruit front and center. There are some skin flavors also, lending a bit of phenolic bite to the finish.
title: Six Prong 2007 Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: The family-owned, Santa Lucia Highlands-focused Wrath Winery produces their Ex Anima line to show off wines from their estate San Saba Vineyard made with very little intervention and no new oak. This wine is nearly as clear as water, and yet offers aromas or freshly cut grass, honeydew melon, kiwi and fresh rain on rocks. On the palate, minerality lingers alongside poached pear and peach. Refreshing and light, yet full of flavor.
title: Wrath 2013 Ex Anima Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

description: This is Cabernet Franc at a perfect moment. It has a solid tannin and fruit base that gives a feeling of weight. Ripe red fruits are bolstered by acidity, toast and a smoky nature that leads to a juicy finish. Drink now and until 2018.
title: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2010 Les Terres Noires  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

description: Very inviting, incredibly rich aromas of butterscotch, crème brûlée, peach custard, lemon curds, honeysuckle and caramelized banana show on this wine's thick nose. The palate offers orange peels cooked in a buttery sauce, marshmallows and marzipan.
title: Bridlewood 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Initial notes of earth and dust blow off with aeration to reveal pretty white floral and peach aromas. Off dry in style, the palate is concentrated with ripe honeydew flavor against a backdrop of steely, linear acidity.
title: Clear Night 2012 Riesling (Pfalz)

description: Here's a rustic Cabernet. With the right foods, at the right time, it's fine. By itself it's awkward, with some elements out of balance, but the cherry-berry notes will play well against a great burger.
title: Mounts 2010 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A strong effort from Olsen Estates, this 100% Syrah has fine varietal character, in a rough and tumble style. Cured meats, herbs, earth and hints of sea salt mingle with the wild berry fruit flavors. It's balanced and fresh, with lingering and nuanced flavors threading through the gulpable finish.
title: Olsen Estates 2007 Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: Made by Karl Wente for golfer Annika Sorenstam, this Chardonnay is luxuriously big, oaky and full of vanilla, caramel, ripe apple and lime characters and very good for its style. Textured and looking for buttery lobster rolls or similar such fare to pair itself with.
title: Annika Vineyards 2009 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: A rich but elegant Chardonnay. Shows massive, concentrated flavors of pineapples, pears and green apples, liberally accented with the vanilla and buttered toast of oak barrels. Flamboyant, yet balanced with crisp coastal acidity and a tang of minerals.
title: Patz & Hall 2007 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: All Syrah from the estate vineyard, this robust and flavorful wine is a burst of pure raspberry and cassis fruit, heavily accented with cigar-box scents and flavors. There is sufficient acidity to balance out the alcohol.
title: Gamache 2010 Estate Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A rich and thick style of Cabernet with leather, dried cheese, cedar, tobacco and minty berry aromas. Feels full and well built, with rich, sweet flavors of cola, creamy oak, fudge and blackberry. A bountiful wine with a candied, chocolaty finish.
title: Angulo Innocenti 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Simple and direct in oaky, fruity pineapple and lemon jam flavors, this Chardonnay tastes a little sweet. It's made in the modern style, appealing if not particularly complex. Drink now.
title: Presqu'ile 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Fennel and spicy ginger account for much ado on the nose, before this medium-bodied wine exhibits well-integrated oak, baked apple and a hit of lemongrass on the palate. It finishes with a burst of spice.
title: Napa Cellars 2013 V Collection Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The first of the vintage to be tasted from the region, this bottling is a promising sign. Fresh-cut green apples, Anjou pear skins, honeydew, bubblegum, wet stone and whiffs of cut grass show on the nose. There's lots of verve to the palate, with white pepper, apple skin and slight jalapeño flavors. It's perfect for shellfish and salads.
title: Robert Hall 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

description: A beautiful Cabernet Sauvignon, balanced and elegant. It's flashy in blackberries and currants, with an elaborate coating of oak, yet not over the top, withdrawing its fruit at the last minute to finish in a swirl of minerality and spice. Should develop over the next six years.
title: Broman 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Rich wine, but also with good minerality and steely texture. So although it does have some sweetness, it keeps all the crispness of a Blanc de Blancs. Ready to drink now.
title: G.H. Martel NV Victoire Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This wine displays the aggressive acidity typical of Central Coast Merlots. While it's rich and dry in raspberry, cherry and red currant flavors, with a fine note of smoky oak, the tartness is central. Pairing this with ham will help tame the acids.
title: Bargetto 2009 Regan Vineyards Reserve Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Lots of acidity gives this Merlot a bite. It's bone dry and pretty thin in fruit, with a modicum of cherry and herb flavors. A solid wine to serve at big parties where no one's very fussy.
title: Snapping Turtle 2010 Merlot (California)

description: Cocoa, toffee and dried-herb aromas are followed by soft-feeling cherry flavors with a tart finish, with fruit and barrel not seeming entirely meshed. The tannins have a slow attack but sneak up on the finish.
title: Stottle 2012 Doc Stewart Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)

description: Tight and intense for a $10 varietal, with crusty, charred oak aromas on top of ripe berry fruit. The palate is thick and full, with clamping tannins and flavors of lemony oak, plum and blackberry. Vanilla and mocha work the woody finish.
title: Trapiche 2009 Oak Cask Syrah (Mendoza)

description: A nice Chardonnay that shows ripe pineapple, green apple and pear flavors, with added smoky richness from oak, and the finish is dry and crisp. A good price for a wine of this quality.
title: Lake Sonoma 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Loads of black fruit intensity is backed by soft notes of chocolate, leather and spice. The wine boasts a very plump and round style that makes it a pleasure to savor.
title: Querciavalle 2007 Armonia Famiglia Losi Sangiovese (Colli della Toscana Centrale)

description: Dry in style but lusciously textured, this full-bodied Riesling stands out for its luminous ripeness. Layers of honey and decadent citrus and peach flavors are calibrated neatly by zesty acidity and notes of sweet spice and pollen. It's unctuously concentrated with a long, deeply penetrating finish.
title: Johannishof 2014 Rüesheim Berg Rottland GG Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Clean aromas of honeysuckle converge with richer, rounded components of Asian pear, coconut and pineapple on the nose of this single vineyard expression. There's a caramel touch at the tip of the rich sip, with layers of brown spice, yellow fruit and rocky earth.
title: Lucienne 2013 Lone Oak Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Buttery, caramelized oak tones dominate the weak fruit flavors of orange and apricot. A simple and creamy Chardonnay.
title: Red Pony Ranch 2011 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A throwback to the monster Shiraz style of old, with loads of toasty, vanilla-laden oak, meaty nuances and driving, intense boysenberry fruit, the 2004 Grange should prove tremendously long-lived. Its massive concentration and firm tannins suggest cellaring through 2020, after which it should drink well for at least another decade or two.
title: Penfolds 2004 Grange Shiraz (South Australia)

description: Only one barrel of this wine was produced, and it seems to have taken a leathery direction, owing perhaps to its two years of oak aging. That leathery note permeates the black cherry and cassis fruit, which is concentrated enough to withstand that feature. Still, it's a bit over the top, with coffee liqueur, amaro and cured meat flavors and austere, drying tannins.
title: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2014 Mae's Vineyard Grand Reserve Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

description: Aromas of tobacco, dried rose, mature berry and leather meld together on the glass. The firm palate is still a bit closed, but offers dried red cherry, licorice, grilled herb and a hint of black tea alongside firm tannins that give the finish some grip.
title: Marchesato degli Aleramici 2010 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Straightforward and enjoyable, it delivers aromas of peach blossom and citrus. The juicy palate offers white peach, green apple and banana peel. Sip this as an apéritif or pair with light first courses.
title: Cormòns 2013 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: A good, restaurant-style Chardonnay at a fair price for the quality. It's dry and crisp in acidity, with pleasant flavors of pineapple, kumquat, lime, vanilla and buttered toast.
title: Meadowcroft 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: In hommage to the man who pioneered the use of oak to ferment Sauvignon Blanc, this wood-fermented and matured wine is only produced in the best years. It is rich and just toasty, but equally about the structured mineral texture and ripe citrus. It is a wine to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2013 Etienne Henri  (Sancerre)

description: There's a serious herbal edge to this wine, with notes of bergamot tea leaves and menthol shining through the black raspberry and plum core. But it's all balanced and delicious, with the rich fruit never failing to support it all, especially as the peppery spice comes into play in the mouth and the cocoa-like tannins linger on the finish.
title: Rudi Schultz 2008 Syrah (Stellenbosch)

description: Honey butter, vanilla bean and dried banana aromas emerge on the nose of this Chard. The palate shows seared apple slices cut with lemon juice, boosted by minerally tension and a peppery energy.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2013 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This wine is peppery and leathery, with a rustic rambling edginess. Tart varietal flavors of black cherry, black pepper and a feral underbelly of mushroom, sage and barnyard are supported by supple tannin and supportive oak. This wine is lightly ripe and bold in acidity.
title: Red Car 2014 Syrah (Sonoma Coast)

description: This gorgeous, concentrated, mouthfilling wine is delicious to sip now but will certainly improve in the cellar for a decade or more. Tempting black cherry and boysenberry flavors seem to swell in the mouth, while light baking-spice and black-pepper accents weave in and out. Even on the finish it keeps surging with dark fruits and spices.
title: Terre Rouge 2013 Sentinel Oak Vineyard Pyramid Block Syrah (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: Bright, friendly and pure mandarin flavors make for a very appetizing, fruit-forward wine. The same friendly, sunny mandarin fruit fills the palate with its tension between citrus tartness and luscious sweet freshness. Bruised apple peel makes an attractive appearance on the lasting finish that concludes with lots of freshness.
title: Robert Karcher et Fils 2013 Harth Riesling (Alsace)

description: Stylish oak aromas combine with rich fruit flavors in this full-bodied, velvet-textured wine. It smells like ripe black cherries, vanilla and caramel, with a fruit-forward palate. Made by the Lange Twins Winery.
title: Caricature 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Clarksburg)

description: Apricot aromas are followed by ripe fruit flavors, giving a rich texture, yet retaining a very clean, fresh character. Opulence with steel.
title: Gritsch Mauritiushof 2009 1000 Eimerberg Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

description: This is a floral, zesty and vibrant white wine, given six months in French oak, half of it new. With a complex hit of briny salt and citrus, it flirts between layers of savory and sweet, finding just the right balance of structure and acidity.
title: Waterstone 2013 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This bottling, which includes 20% Sémillon, offers aromas of cut grass, sliced Anjou pear and a lemon-lime freshness on the nose. Sour Granny Smith apple and green lime rinds rule the palate, making for a solid and classic style of Sauv Blanc.
title: Refugio Ranch 2015 Tiradora Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: The lush aromas are dense and dark, with streaks of coffee, baking chocolate, iron ore, and earth. In the mouth the fruit explodes into full bloom—broad flavors of cherry and chocolate, lovely Asian spices.
title: Va Piano 2008 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Here's a clean, brisk Sauvignon Blanc for pairing with Asian fare. It's spicy and overtly sweet, with lemongrass, honey and vanilla flavors.
title: Kenwood 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: Lush and juicy, this has a grippy firmness of structure and the accompanying suggestion of years to go. Cassis and cedar lead over notes of black cherry and berry, with the support of a full, concentrated body. Drink now through 2022.
title: Patel 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A fine value, this is sourced from vineyards in the Rocks and Seven Hills regions of the Walla Walla valley. Bright fruit flavors of raspberry and cherry, amped with vivid acidity and showing pretty,  lively spice, carry on through a finish lightly touched with flavors of grapevine and espresso.
title: Watermill 2009 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: Pure Syrah from Pepper Bridge, Seven Hills and Ash Hollow vineyard fruit, this shows the maturing of Walla Walla vines, which more and more reveal the earthy, herbal, garrigue qualities of the grape. Coopered in neutral oak, it showcases the typicity and regionality of the grape. Funk, earth, seaweed, green tobacco, and a hint of pepper dominate. You might wish for more fruit, but for those who love the funk this is a fine bottle.
title: Reininger 2007 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: A brilliant Chardonnay. It's powerful and ripe in fruit, offering a blast of pineapple, green apple, Key lime pie and Meyer lemon tart flavors, accented with the buttered toast of oak. As intense as the fruit is, it's balanced by keen acidity and a stony minerality. Defines the elegant, opulent Russian River style.
title: Rochioli 2010 Rachael's Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Who knew Ohio made such tasty Chardonnay? Bright and fresh, with scents of green apple, pear, fresh herbs and just a hint of nut oil. This dry, medium-bodied wine offsets juicy flavors of nectarines and apples against a backdrop of sweet cream and white flowers that lingers on the finish. Drink now.
title: Debonné 2009 Chardonnay (Grand River Valley)

description: Quite a good wine, dry and firm in tannins, with a certain distinguished elegance. It has pleasant black and red cherry fruit, cola and sandalwood flavors, but would benefit from greater complexity and interest. Drink now.
title: Matanzas Creek 2007 Merlot (Bennett Valley)

description: This 100% Cabernet Sauvignon has rich, flashy flavors of spice and crème de cassis, and it will reward some time in the cellar. The tannins are strong, but the wine is drinkable now after decanting and especially when paired with steak. It will soften and mellow in 7–8 years, and it should last at least 15 years while gradually losing fruit.
title: Corley 2009 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A note of cupcake batter hits the nose first, but it quickly integrates into the chief aromas of raspberries, ladyfingers and herbs. Powdery tannins provide some traction to the otherwise lithe palate.
title: Veramar 2012 Estate Club Free Run Merlot (Virginia)

description: Fruit sourced from Red Mountain's top vineyards––Ciel du Cheval, Klipsun and Kiona––comes on rich and fruity, with big and powerful black cherry and cassis interwoven with threads of smoke, coffee, graphite and baking chocolate. Deep, dark and dense.
title: Mark Ryan 2008 Wild Eyed Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: This sets a high standard for Oregon Chardonnay. Bright and snappy, yet deep and concentrated, it's a symphony of lemon, citrus, stone and tropical fruits, well-differentiated yet perfectly integrated. The extraordinary length and precise focus, along with the overall balance and structure, suggest that this should improve for many years to come.
title: Evening Land 2010 Seven Springs Vineyard Summum Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Grippy black cherry and blackberry burst out of the entry of this full-bodied, richly concentrated wine, its palate lush, smooth and big-boned. Dried herb and a floral tease of rose round out the fruit-forward experience.
title: Bennett Lane 2015 Lynch Family Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

description: This is soft, unfocused and gently fruity. Hints of herbal and citrus flavors give a green-fruit character to the wine, which has a tight, nervy aftertaste.
title: Café du Midi 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: Here's a very correct and clean Sangiovese with bright cherry nuances and blueberry followed by a touch of bitter almond. The mouthfeel is thin, easy and watery.
title: Poderi dal Nespoli 1929 2011 Prugneto  (Sangiovese di Romagna Superiore)

description: Sweet and soft in vanilla, buttered toast, golden apricot and lemon honey flavors. Turns cloying after a sip or two.
title: In Re 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

description: Vigorous in body, this Syrah comes from one of Foxen's warmest vineyards, the well-known Vogelzang. It's riper and higher in alcohol than their Tinaquaic Syrah, making it richer, rounder and tastier. With blackberry, orange peel, red licorice and cola flavors, it's balanced with fine tannins and acidity. Drink now–2017.
title: Foxen 2011 Toasted Rope Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Give this wine more structure, and the score would soar. It's dry and smooth, with classic blackberry, black currant and cedar flavors that finish long and spicy. But it's so soft, it feels like it melted in the mouth. Ready now.
title: Starmont 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Made from 100% Sauvignon Blanc fermented and aged in stainless steel tanks, this wine shows why Dry Creek Valley has achieved such a fine reputation with this variety. Totally dry and brisk in acidity, it has savory flavors of lemons and limes, passionfruit, gooseberries and white pepper. Awesome with Vietnamese, Ethiopian and Indian fare calling for white wine.
title: Pech Merle 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This is a very fairly priced Cabernet given its quality. It's made from 100% Cab and all estate grown in the high elevations of Fair Play in El Dorado County. Oaky and smoky, it whispers of mountain fruit, with herb, cassis and blackberry highlights amid a background of savory earth. Age 3–5 years.
title: Cedarville 2008 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)

description: Hot, tannic and simple, with cherry jam and currant flavors accompanied by high, tart acidity and chile-pepper alcohol heat. An unbalanced wine.
title: Bella Piazza 2007 Estate Bottled Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: Diminished white-apricot and apple-like aromas lead to a yielding, medium-weight palate, which comes with a sense of flesh and a hint of pastry shell.
title: Bluestone 2011 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Shenandoah Valley)

description: Bursting aromas of black raspberry, bright blackberry, lavender and chaparral scrub make for an intriguing nose to this single-vineyard Tempranillo. There's a leathery Old World vibe to the palate, where gamy dusty touches give depth to dried berry and herb flavors.
title: Bodega de Edgar 2014 Laetitia Vineyard Tempranillo (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: A bit lighter in color than the typical Syrah, this wine, which comes in a squat wide bottle, shows strawberry, roasted fennel and a savory smoke quality on the nose. There's a bountiful burst of acidity at the tip of the sip, followed by a spice rack of flavors that give depth to the light, slightly sour red-currant fruit. It's very tangy on the finish.
designation: Old Fashioned Superstition Tierra Alta Vineyard
title: Bevela 2014 Old Fashioned Superstition Tierra Alta Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)

description: Bright lemon, tangerine and white-floral notes are countered by whiffs of spice and earth on this robust, yet structured, ice wine. The mouthfeel is rich and lush, but brightened by clean, focused acidity and a hint of bitter grape tannin on the finish.
title: Wagner 2012 Ice Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: With rich, sweet blackberry and cocoa flavors, this is a very nice Cabernet for drinking with a good meal. It's a little rough around the edges, with jaggy tannins. Ready now.
title: Robert Mondavi 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Soft and fruity, it shows rounded apple and fresh pineapple flavors. A crisp side is smoothed by the natural fruitiness. It's a wine to drink now, easy and fresh at the end.
title: Gitton Père et Fils 2012 Les Belles Dames  (Sancerre)

description: Right away, this Cabernet Franc puts up a red flag in the form of heavy raisin and burnt wood aromas. A soupy palate is thick but lacking in acidity and structure. Overripe flavors of black fruits, raisin and wood finish hot and heavy, with residual notes of root beer, licorice and prune.
title: Luna De Esperanza 2014 Barrel Fermented Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

description: This is a new offering from the winery. Almost all varietal with just a splash of Cabernet Franc (3%) coming from Quintessence and Red Willow vineyards, the aromas of toast, spice, cedar, black raspberry and dried herb aren't entirely revealing. The palate seems a bit linear and wound up. Perhaps some time will flesh it out?
title: Mark Ryan 2015 Little Sister Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Dry and rustic, with bizarre sweet raisin and vegetable flavors.
title: Delicato 2010 Domino Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: A shock of white pepper remains memorable throughout this wine, which hails from a high-elevation vineyard overlooking the Pacific Ocean. Pinot Noir-like in its leanness and silky mouthfeel, it's prickly with feral jolts of cinnamon and tobacco.
title: Red Car 2011 Estate Vineyard Syrah (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: There's a serious minty core to the black cherry and berry fruit aromas of this wine that continues into the medium-weight palate. Creamy with satiny tannins and a hint of mocha spice and cigar tobacco on the close. Delicious and approachable now.
title: Ken Forrester 2008 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

description: Juicy black cherry and grippy oak are the stars of the show in this delicious red wine, softened by the addition of 16% Malbec. Elongated tannins support the leathery texture as highlights of cedar and sage play on.
title: Hess 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

description: This selection is fruity and refreshing, yet it has a full body and a ripe character. Taut and tangy on the finish, this wine can age for another 6–9 months to allow the structure to soften.
title: Domaine Luquet 2011 Vers les Monts  (Saint-Véran)

description: When a producer renowned for its red wines can turn out an elegant, understated white of this quality, you know Australian Chardonnay has firmly arrived. Subtle accents of toasted nuts frame citrusy fruit, and while the wine is full-bodied and round in the mouth, it remains focused and long and on the finish. If you're fortunate enough to get some of the 600 bottles imported, drink the wine over the next couple of years.
title: Wolf Blass 2010 White Label Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)

description: Sharp and jammy, like blackberry and cherry jam wine. Lots of freshness and acidity, not much elegance. Drink up.
title: Angeline 2009 Merlot (Russian River Valley)

description: Gritty, oily matchstick aromas are followed by a blocky palate with apricot, peach pit and citrus flavors. On the finish, a lasting flavor of citrus rind is tough and pithy. Overall this is hard to plow through.
title: Cadus 2014 Chardonnay (Valle de Uco)

description: Cocoa, toast, vanilla, cigar box, coconut and raspberry aromas lead the way on this 100% varietal wine. The palate is full of dark fruit flavors with slightly gritty tannins and tart acids. Give it some time to come together.
title: Airfield Estates 2012 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

description: There's a rich, thick quality to this Italian Pinot Grigio, giving it heft and determination on the palate. Melon, apricot, honey and cantaloupe give momentum to its soft, creamy texture.
title: Teresa Raiz 2010 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: There are lots of rich, ripe blackberry, blueberry and chocolate flavors in this oaky wine, and the tannins are smooth. However, it's a bit soft and sugary sweet. Drink now.
title: Galvan 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Hints of spice and smoke add intrigue to sunny peach and pear aromas on this semi-sweet Riesling. The palate is invitingly fruity and floral, with lush stonefruit flavors accented with vibrant acidity and a flurry of dried herbs on the finish. It's a creamy, textured wine that's accessible yet multidimensional as well.
title: Keuka Spring 2011 Semi Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: This light-bodied wine smells fresh and tastes refreshing. It has lemon and herb aromas, delicate citrus flavors, good acidity and a lively mouth-feel.
title: Dark Horse 2014 The Original Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: Leathery berry aromas are full but young and rudimentary. This feels jumpy and acidic, but that also provides definition and balance to an otherwise ripe young wine. Flavors of black fruits and citric tang play off each other, while the finish deals grippy tannins and black-fruit flavors.
title: Viña Mayor 2011 Tinto Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Meaty, funky aromas raise questions about fruit quality. A tight, hard palate isn't much for complexity or structure, while this tastes of plum and rubber. A dry finish leaves a sense of heat.
title: Vaza 2014  Rioja

description: Woodland berry, forest floor, dark spice and new leather aromas lead the nose. The bright linear palate offers wild cherry, strawberry and star anise set against youthfully austere but refined tannins and fresh acidity. Drink after 2023.
title: Casanuova delle Cerbaie 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

description: A single vineyard, 100% varietal Cabernet Sauvignon, this is deep, dark, dense, chewy and tannic. Yet it still captures some delicate floral aromas as well as smoke and rock and black fruits. You go from flower to fruit to earth and black olive in a rush of full-bodied flavor.
title: Arbor Crest 2007 Stillwater Creek Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Showing some signs of maturity, with a yeast and toast character, this is a full Champagne, with red apple and kiwi fruit flavors. There is also a distinct mineral, steely edge that gives the wine a firm final structure.
designation: Grand Couronnemont Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: J. de Telmont 2000 Grand Couronnemont Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is a mix of four different clones of Syrah, aged in 30% new Burgunday barrels. Rich aromatics suggest coffee liqueur, vanilla and raspberry compote. Flavors are comparable, deep and sappy, with exceptional length. Mark McNeilly (Mark Ryan Winery) is the hand at the helm.
designation: Collaboration Series III Ciel du Cheval Vineyard
title: Force Majeure 2010 Collaboration Series III Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: This wine is ripe, full of yellow fruits and soft acidity. It's creamy and ripe, but cut with orange zest and a mineral texture. It will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Meursault

description: Produced from the Sierra Foothills winery, Shenandoah, this is a dry, briary and rustic Cabernet. It has wild berry, currant and black pepper flavors, with edgy tannins. Needs rich beef and cheese dishes for balanced food pairing.
title: Nobos 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This is all Cab Franc, aged in neutral barrels, and as pure an expression of the grape as it is made and grown in Washington as you will find. It has much of the herbal astringency of Carmenère, and could easily pass for a Chilean bottling of that grape.
title: Animale 2008 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

description: Briny in preserved lemon and a twinge of lemongrass and green apple, this is a lovely, burly wine with some weight and breadth to it, oaky but not overly so. Rich on the palate, it has layers of flavor and enough acidity to keep things ultimately light.
title: Kelleher 2013 Three Sisters Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Friendly, easygoing Cabernet in which almost everyone will be able to find something good. The nose is medicinal and cherry driven, while the palate has good feel, acidic grab and flavors of red fruits, herbs and tomato sauce. Nothing special; just plain good-drinking, affordable CS.
