title: Quasar 2007 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)

description: While floral notes waver a bit chemically on the nose, the palate on this Michigan Riesling is nicely concentrated, with abundant fresh apple and citrus flavors. Just slightly off-dry in style, it finishes sprightly with cut and focus.
title: Bowers Harbor 2010 Block II Riesling (Old Mission Peninsula)

description: This Syrah is considerably lighter in body than you'd expect for a variety that's often heavy and full bodied. It has the silkiness of a Pinot Noir, and it's dry and complex in wild berry, leather, black pepper and cedar flavors. It shows lots of elegance throughout, and could even pick up bottle notes over the next six years.
title: Carr 2009 Morehouse Vineyard Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: A really good Sauvignon Blanc, so easy to drink, yet complex and elegant as well. Fully dry, it shows intricate flavors of citrus fruits, green apples, gooseberries and tangy minerals, with a long, spicy finish. Terrific example of how well this white variety flourishes in Dry Creek Valley.
title: Draxton 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A prime example of what Margaret River is capable of, this is a full-bodied, supple yet tannic Cabernet Sauvignon at a fair price. Notes of cedar, cassis and mocha offer ample interest, finishing rich and chewy. Drink 2013–2020.
title: Robert Oatley 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)

description: Give this wine credit for dryness, crisp acidity and intensity. It's rich and strong in sour black cherry candy, cola, bitter dark chocolate and herb flavors. It's also very tannic, so much so that it's practically undrinkable now. Give it 4–5 years in the bottle, decant, and drink with beef or lamb.
title: Grgich Hills 2008 Estate Grown Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Aged for a few months in tank before bottling, this wine captures the herbal and ripe green-fruit character of Bordeaux Sauvignon Blanc. Its light acidity, fruitiness and crisp aftertaste all come together well. Drink now.
title: Schröder & Schÿler 2017 Chartron la Fleur  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Roasted, warm and rich, which is what we want from our Carmenère. The palate is dense and smacks down with mellow tannins, while flavors of roasted berry, smoked meats and herbs are textbook. There's some heat and weight to the wine, but overall it's big, solid and likable.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2008 Family Selection Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Made with Sangiovese, this fun, lively sparkler opens with aromas of perfumed berry and a floral note. The vibrant, straightforward palate offers strawberry, crunchy red cherry and a nectarine note alongside vivacious bubbles.
title: Montauto 2012 Metodo Classico Sangiovese (Vino Spumante)

description: Opens with sharp cherry, cola and mint aromas. The palate is fairly acidic and sheering, but it's also zesty and fresh, with clean berry and mild raisin flavors. Offers reasonably good length, with an acidic choppiness balanced by good fruit flavors.
title: Merum 2006 Old Vines Crianza Tempranillo (Vinos de Madrid)

description: Crisp, fresh and luminous, this bright Pinot Grigio would pair with salads, vegetables or seafood. It rolls over the palate with citrus, peach and pineapple.
title: Tiefenbrunner 2010 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This variety is rarely found in California. Strong aromas of tobacco, river rocks, black peppercorns, dried herbs and rustic elderberry dominate the nose. The palate is full of herbs, spice and crushed rocks, yet rounded by dark berries, oak, coffee and crème brûlée to make a complete experience.
title: Jason-Stephens 2013 Swing Carmenère (Santa Clara Valley)

description: Soft and sweet in vanilla, buttered toast and honey flavors, this Chard also features plenty of pineapple and pear jam richness. Good price for the opulence.
title: Grayson 2009 Lot 11 Chardonnay (California)

description: Dark berry and tobacco ride along a pathway of taut tight-grained tannin in this well-made wine, aged in all French oak, 75% of it new. Within a powerfully ripe robust frame it allows room for bright vibrant acidity to speak and freshen the otherwise full-bodied expression.
title: Sleeping Giant 2014 Inglewood Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: Elaborately rich, this has a velvety smooth texture due to its refined tannins. It's slowly picking up bottle character, with the primary fruit flavors of blackberries and cherries mellowing as it picks up olive and earth notes. While it's remarkable for its sheer luxuriousness, this is a little soft and warm, which may limit ageability. Drink now–2015.
title: Casa Piena 2008 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Very rich and dramatic—the grapes used for this wine were grown in a tiny, cool block of the estate in this corner of Cabernet country. It's full, yet balanced, with crisp acidity, tangy minerality and lots of ripe tropical-fruit flavors. This did not undergo malolactic fermentation.
title: Pine Ridge 2010 Le Petit Clos Chardonnay (Stags Leap District)

description: Cherry, cassis and a yeasty celebration of grapes mark this wine, which is a majority varietal with small amounts of Merlot, Petit Verdot, Malbec, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Medium bodied, it's softly approachable and priced to serve for a crowd.
title: Summers 2013 Andriana's Cuvee Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County-Napa County)

description: From a hot year with an early harvest, this Sauvignon smells green and ashy, like asparagus mixed with green tobacco. In the mouth, spunky acidity suggests sharpness, while tangy flavors of nectarine and nettle finish with touches of bell pepper and tarragon.
designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel
title: Concha y Toro 2012 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

description: This is a very sweet wine, with a honeyed, sugary taste to the tangerines and apricots. It has zesty, balancing acidity, but, at this price for a half bottle, disappoints for failing to concentrate the flavors all the way through.
title: Work 2009 Botrytised Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Rounded plum and berry aromas grow more complex thanks to hints of sarsparilla bark, rose buds, cinnamon stick and nutmeg on the nose of this cool-climate bottling. The palate is quite peppery, with dried red flowers, red plums, peppercorns, strawberries and a texturally earthy core of fine-grained tannins.
title: Stephen Ross 2013 Jespersen Ranch Grenache (Edna Valley)

description: Massively ripe fruit and brisk, zesty acidity are the hallmarks of this wine, which comes from the western benches of the Salinas Valley. It's enormous in tangerine fruit, with a firm minerality that comes from the big rocks that gird the soil. A friendly, impressive Chard to drink now.
title: Mercy 2009 Griva Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: A good effort in the rough-and-ready genre. Aromas are straightforward plum shot through with earthy notes. The palate shows good cherry fruit and is quite gripping, with slightly rustic tannins that carry over to the short finish. Give it a year in the cellar to smooth out, then try with hearty beef dishes.
title: Vivác Winery 2006 V. by Vivác Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (New Mexico)

description: A melodious medley of tropical fruit and peach, this is a robustly ripe and oaky expression of the site in a warm year. It's round and medium bodied, settling in the glass to show balance and refinement. A crisp green apple note shines on the finish.
title: Ocean's Churning 2014 Sangiacomo Green Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The second vintage of this variety for the popular Acrobat brand, this is a fine value: ripe and fruity, with a pleasing mix of citrus and tree fruit flavors. There's a gentle touch of fruit skin bitterness, balanced acidity and a light, butter-inflected finish.
title: Acrobat 2016 Chardonnay (Oregon)

description: Rich, ripe black-cherry and plum flavors penetrate throughout this plump, juicy Cabernet Franc. It's decadent and forward in style, but lingering notes of spice and tea leaves lend complexity to the palate.
title: Fox Run 2013 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

description: Oak gives this wine buttered toast richness, while crisp Central Coast acidity makes it bright and clean. The flavors are pure Edna Valley Chardonnay, of limes, kiwi fruits, tangerines and minerals. Flashy and exotic, if a little direct.
title: Tolosa 2009 Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: On the nose, this smells like bath soap or air freshener. It feels fleshy and oily on the palate, with tropical flavors of banana and papaya. The finish is smooth and tastes of candy.
title: Cono Sur 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Sweet and soft, this has pineapple, orange and vanilla flavors. The firm acidity helps to maintain some balance.
title: Dominican Oaks 2011 Unoaked Chardonnay (California)

description: Saline, apple and not much else create an innocuous bouquet. The palate is short and lemony, with tangy acidity and stalky flavors of lemon and pineapple. Burns a little on the finish, which tastes stemmy.
title: Tamaya 2010 Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)

description: Ethereal yet deeply penetrating, this light-footed wine offers layers and layers of yellow peach, apricot and tangerine intensity. It's luminous and ripe yet racy and lip-smacking, finishing on smoky notes of slate and crushed mineral. A powerful, electric Kabinett to enjoy now through 2028.
title: St. Urbans-Hof 2017 Nik Weis Wiltinger Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: What's so nice about this Chardonnay is the way the dryness, acidity and minerality combine with tropical fruit to make for a splendid, Chablis-style California wine. It's a connoisseur's Chardonnay, requiring some understanding of structure. Don't drink it too cold; could even stand a brief decant at room temperature.
title: Freestone 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is big and fruity on the nose, but there's also a stalky, roasted quality to the bouquet. This feels round, grabby and on the soft side, while mulchy flavors of rubber and blueberry hollow out quickly on the finish.
title: Torrederos 2009 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Aged only in stainless steel in order to preserve the freshness of its citrus and peach aromas, this would wash down with spicy barbecued shrimp or vegetable dumplings. The finish is crisp and sharp.
title: Lechthaler 2011 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: A touch sharp and edgy, but still sound enough with its full berry, smoke and rubbery aromas. The palate has a moderately fresh feel along with herbal, snappy flavors of red plum, cherry and pepper. Spicy and dry on the finish.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2009 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: Warm almond, white peach and sweet oak aromas show on the nose of this wine from legend Jim Clendenen. There is solid tension to the palate, where edgy flavors of lemon skin are balanced by the warmth of hazelnut.
title: Au Bon Climat 2016 Los Alamos Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: There's a beautiful wine in this Cabernet blend, which was grown at the foot of Howell Mountain. But it's not showing its best now. Just too tannic, and the fruity flavors are all primary and unintegrated with the new oak barrels. With a wealth of raspberries, cherries and currants, it should begin to come into its own after 2013.
title: Notre Vin 2006 Cuvee l'Etrier Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Made primarily from estate fruit, this is a full and fleshy wine, with robustly integrated offerings of rich apple, mango and pear. It has a fresh, layered finish that sparks the palate for more.
title: Schug 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Fragrant currant aromas drive this concentrated and rich wine forward. The old vines give a great depth of flavor and ripeness while keeping the fine herbaceous citrus touch. It's that rare Sancerre for aging, over 3–4 years.
title: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)

description: Fresh-pressed blackberry-juice aromas meet with herbal elements of dried sage and sweet mint on the nose of this bottling. A dried herb quality carries the palate through its black-currant and boysenberry core, with more minty freshness and fennel bulb toward the finish.
title: Kitá 2015 Camp 4 Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This Riserva Morellino offers a wonderful bouquet of bright cherry, mature blackberry, plum and light spice. You feel the warm sunshine of southern Tuscany here thanks to the wine's natural thickness and intensity.
title: Conte Ferdinando Guicciardini 2007 Massi di Mandorlaia Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Delicately scented, this opens with aromas of acacia flower, citrus blossom and orchard fruit. The straightforward palate offers Granny Smith apple, tangerine zest and a touch of mineral while tangy acidity provides balance.
title: Comelli 2014 Amplius Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

description: The wine, unusually 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, is ripe and juicy with some smoky tannins in support. It has a finely perfumed character although touches of extraction give it a bitter edge. That should blow by, leaving an attractive fruity wine.
title: Château la Freynelle 2014  Bordeaux

description: Deeply colored in the glass, this wine shows blackberry, elderberry and light smoke on the nose. The sip starts with fresh black-raspberry and plum-juice flavors, and the tannic tension is strong and sticky, though the mouthfeel is somewhat thin.
title: Proximity Twenty Six 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)

description: This aggressive and tart wine pushes the limits. It has raspberry and raspberry-vinegar aromas, vivid acidity on the palate and sharp cherry flavors.
title: Donkey & Goat 2014 Fenaughty Vineyard Syrah (El Dorado)

description: Generous in brambly wild raspberry fruit and leather, this lush bottling has peppery spice to spare. Aromatically it's as fine as perfume, floral and pretty; in texture, it's soft, but with just the right tension and electricity. Savory and spicy, it will bring out similar characteristics at the table.
title: Terre Rouge 2011 Monarch Mine Vineyard Syrah (Sierra Foothills)

description: Raw and green from the opening shot, this smells like bell pepper and wood. The jumbled palate is abrasive, while severely green flavors of olives, herbs, weeds and dried red fruits finish scratchy.
title: Balduzzi 2013 Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Hard, rubbery black-fruit aromas end with a whiff of cherry-cola. This feels zesty and fresh, with a medium body and snappy acids. Short, choppy flavors of red plum and cherry finish quick, with a salty note.
title: Mil Piedras 2011 Merlot (Mendoza)

description: Whiffs of oak, matchstick, toasted nuts and reduction form the nose of this finely etched and youthfully exuberant wine. The palate is marked by juicy acidity, with flavors of lemon peel, green apple and brioche that lead to a salty sea-spray finish.
title: Benovia 2015 La Pommeraie Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: While steely in acidity, this wine offers a counterbalance of fleshy pineapple and mango flavors. It finds a balance between both sides of the equation and also shows great integration with the oak.
title: Au Contraire 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Some ageable Cabs are also drinkable on release. Not this one. It's just too tannic. The astringency stings the palate, making the acidity feel more pronounced, and effectively smothering the fruit. But it's good, rich blackberry fruit. Already throwing some sediment, the wine should begin to come into its own around 2018.
title: Krutz 2010 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Standard berry aromas show touches of raisin and earth, but not too much of either. It feels fresh, crisp and alert, with cherry tomato, berry fruit, tobacco and vanilla flavors. This feels healthy but not real deep or complex on the finish.
title: Finca El Encinal 2009 Single Vineyard Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

description: The nose here is quite subtle, offering hints of lemon, lime and crushed mineral. Sunny yellow cherry and pink grapefruit flavors on the palate, however, are buoyant, peppered by hits of slate, steel and acidity. A zesty yet elegant, exuberant Spätlese with a delicately sweet finish.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: A good Syrah, rugged in tannins and a little rustic, but offering plenty of blackberry, roasted meat and black pepper flavors. It's full-bodied and lusty, and suggests equally strong dishes, like beef stew, short ribs or game birds.
title: db Winery 2009 Premier Coastal Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Intense in oak and black olive, this Cab is svelte and austere, varietal in both Cabernet Sauvignon and the 24% Cabernet Franc it contains. With soft tannins, the wine is accessible now, but able to hold on for awhile, paired best with braised ribs.
title: GrapeHeart Vineyards 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Suisun Valley)

description: There's a delicate whiff of dried orange peel and apple cider vinegar on the nose of this unique Finger Lakes Riesling, but the palate is chock full of fresh apples accented by a sweet tangerine acidity and hints of clove and spice.
title: Bloomer Creek 2008 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Pale lemon color with flecks of gold. Snappy citrus aromas with hints of peach and a floral note. Delightfully racy feel in the mouth with lots of juicy grapefruit, lemon and lime flavors. Light bodied and not very complex but very refreshing with a moderately long tangy finish.
title: Kuentz-Bas 2008 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)

description: This wine comes from a single vineyard site on a south/south-east facing slope. It is rich in everything that a Saint-Véran should have: ripe fruit, balanced acidity and a generous full texture. With acidity to match, this is developing into a fine wine. Drink from late 2018.
title: Domaine des Valanges 2015 Les Terres Noires  (Saint-Véran)

description: Opening with aromas of fresh and dried herbs, this wine follows with notes of blackberry, flowers, and black currant, with smoked meat and black olives providing undertones. The black fruit flavors don't hold back, packing a powerful punch.
title: K Vintners 2012 The Hidden Syrah (Wahluke Slope)

description: This opens with subtle plum, tobacco and baking-spice aromas. The straightforward palate offers black cherry, clove and a hint of star anise alongside taut tannins. Drink after 2022.
title: Pietranera 2013  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Black in color, this wine is tightly tannic, still wound up from a warm, wonderful vintage exhibiting plenty of structure. Chocolate and blackberry wrap around an aroma of crayon and leathery texture.
title: Elementary Cellars 2013 Library Collection Volume II Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: While the nose suggests more earth and dusty mineral than fruit, there's plenty of concentrated tangerine and quince on the palate of this juicy, semidry Riesling. Light bodied and spry on the palate, it's an uncomplicated but tasty sip, finishing with a hint of orange blossom perfume.
title: Schmitt Söhne 2016 Relax Riesling (Mosel)

description: This opens with aromas of leafy underbrush, incense and a balsamic note of menthol. The evolved palate has seen fresher days, showing steeped prune, raisin and the warmth of evident alcohol alongside firm but not very persistent tannins that dry out the finish. The fruit has largely dried up.
title: Paradisone 2013  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Soft and one-dimensional but interesting, this Cabernet has upfront flavors of blackberry jam, black currants, anise and oak. It's dry and tannic, but doesn't have the stuffing to age. Drink now–2016.
title: Lake Sonoma 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: This is a brawny wine, but a complete and delicious one, because all the separate, dramatic components balance each other nicely. Butter and vanilla oozes from the aroma, ripe apple and delicious pear pour from the flavors, and vibrant acidity balances the almost unctuous texture.
title: Occasio 2014 Del Arroyo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Ripe berry, cassis and grilled meat aromas presage a fresh, zesty palate with free-flowing acidity that pumps up cherry, red plum, cassis and loamy earth flavors. It stays fruity, stout and smooth on the finish. The wine is ripe and fully representative of Mendoza and winemaker Alejandro's Vigil's style.
title: El Enemigo 2011 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

description: The nose on this red is a bit shy but eventually reveals aromas suggesting moist underbrush, crushed berry and a whisper of violet. The simple light-bodied palate offers sour cherry, tart cranberry and a hint of orange peel. It's on the slender side, with firm acidity and loose-knit tannins.
title: Val di Suga 2014  Rosso di Montalcino

description: A whiff of leather introduces this tight, interesting, southern Oregon Syrah. Black fruits, iron filings, and smooth tannins mark a wine made from grapes that were carefully selected (just three rows of vines) and given special consideration by winemaker Herb Quady.
title: Troon 2008 Reserve Syrah (Applegate Valley)

description: This wine appears to be at its peak, showing some developed notes of kerosene to go with apple and citrus flavors. It's medium-bodied (12% abv) and just barely off dry (7.8 g/l). Enticing notes of Earl Grey grace the nose, while the finish is long, crisp and refreshing.
title: Te Kairanga 2008 East Plain Riesling (Martinborough)

description: This smooth, layered wine is medium bodied, well balanced and rich, with soft tannins to give it heft. Flavors run to black cherry, clove and cinnamon. The great sense of polish and composure make it a pleasure to drink.
title: Prima Materia 2013 Cabernet Franc (California)

description: An aromatic wine with notes of freshly cut red apple, overripe pear and jasmine. The palate drinks closer to dry than the aromas might suggest, with a phenolic feel.
title: Foris 2012 Estate Grown Riesling (Rogue Valley)

description: This is 100% varietal, with a mix of vineyard sources including Champoux, Weinbau, Conner Lee and Dineen. It's a carefully crafted blend of different AVAs; a bright and clean example of Washington state Cabernet. Firm, compact, with blue and purple fruits, just a hint of barrel age and polished tannins.
title: Fidelitas 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A very classic style, with peach and floral notes upfront set against a mineral backdrop. There's riveting acidity in the mouth and some slate character but it fades away a bit too quickly. Drink or hold a few years for a richer texture.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2008 Bernkasteler Badstube Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Dense aromas consume the nose of this bottling, showing orange liqueur, apple juice and concentrated lemon syrup. The palate is nicely sharp in mouthwatering acidity, offering juicy stone-fruit flavors.
title: Jason-Stephens 2014 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Clara Valley)

description: Stagecoach Cabs are always impressive for their power and depth, but this one seems like Stagecoach on steroids. It's insanely rich and extracted with blackberry and cherry jam flavors, along with plenty of sweet oak. It's so rich, it could use 7–8 years to calm down.
title: Patland 2010 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Early aromas of apple and pear show no oak, but with time more pungent notes of juniper and herbs enter the fray. Juicy in the mouth, with no weight issues, but modest in its delivery of true Chardonnay character. Clean white wine but it doesn't taste like much.
title: San Elias 2009 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Plum and berry aromas are mildly jammy. This is fast moving on the palate, with racy acidity pushing berry flavors that veer toward tartness but pull back in time. An aggressive finish is also almost sour but not, while oaky coffee and bitter chocolate flavors wrap it up.
title: Domaine Jean Bousquet 2013 Reserve Made with Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Tupungato)

description: Strong wood aromas and flavors dominate the wine at this young stage. Good fruit and a steely texture lie behind the toast. As those yellow fruits develop, it will become a delicious, while always structured wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château des Rontets 2012 Clos Varambon  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Another fine Chardonnay from this producer. It's typical of the vineyard, showing intensely concentrated tropical and citrus fruit and green apple flavors, enhanced with mouthwatering acidity. Vertical tastings of this bottling show its ability to slowly evolve in the bottle over as much as eight years.
title: Talbott 2011 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Ripe aromas of Anjou pear and apple are leveled by clean lines of white rock minerality and wet river stones on the nose of this block-designated bottling. Tangy pear and lime flavors are fresh and zesty, with more wet rock touches in the background.
designation: Mount Eden Clone Block 11 Bien Nacido Vineyard
title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Mount Eden Clone Block 11 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: The variety is unmistakable on this wine, with its aromas of black currant, black cherry, dried herb and spice. The palate is fruit filled but well structured, with tart acids and a firm squeeze of tannin. Dark chocolate notes linger on the finish.
title: Disruption 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: This easily affordable wine is a full-blown oaky version that has prominent toasted oak and wood smoke aromas that meld with butter, caramel and ripe pear flavors. It feels almost sweet and is full-bodied with mild acidity.
title: Bogle 2014 Chardonnay (California)

description: Tart and sappy, like fresh raspberry/cranberry juice, this wine displays the vivid acidity that occurs naturally in the grape, along with some peppery herb from the addition of 8% Syrah and 9% Malbec. It's wild and young, with a finish that tastes like fresh herbs from the garden.
title: Walla Walla Vintners 2008 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The aromas of this wine pop, with notes of fresh flowers, green herbs, olive brine, coffee, grilled asparagus, gravel and a touch of smoked meat lurking in the background. The fruit and savory flavors are plush and palate-coating in feel, with floral and smoked meat notes persisting on the finish. It's a very pretty interpretation of the area, with a compelling sense of balance.
title: Saviah 2013 The Funk Estate Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Slight smoke and dark plum, a hint of polished mahogany and the merest touch of leather suggest restrained elegance and complexity. The palate is just medium-bodied but of such subtle balance that the entire wine becomes utterly seductive even though heat is palpable. There are dark, brooding elements of fruit that play above the taut, grippy but fine structure. What a distinguished, beautiful rendition of Merlot.
title: Netzl 2012 Bärnreiser Merlot (Carnuntum)

description: Aromas of this wine convey notes of roasted corn on the cob, popcorn and peach. The stone-fruit flavors are sweet and easygoing.
title: Original House Wine 2013 Chardonnay (America)

description: With great intensity and structure, this is a wine that's all about texture and potential. It's expressive with white fruits and perfume, but there's a richness that's still to come. Drink from 2016 and see how the minerality and acidity will come into balance.
title: Willm 2011 Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: No one will ever complain that this Napa Valley-Sonoma County blend isn't fruity enough. It's deliciously explosive in jammy blackberries, cassis, cherries and milk chocolate. Oak adds notes of caramel. But flavor isn't everything, and this wine would benefit from greater restraint and structural integrity.
title: Keating 2009 Encomium Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This wine appears to have suffered from the cool 2011 vintage with prominent herbal notes that lean far into the green. It seems to carry noticeable residual sugar, with the sweetness making for an odd juxtaposition to the aroma profile.
title: Sagelands 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: An elaborate Chardonnay, ripe in orange, apple and pear flavors. Oak adds the usual notes of buttered toast. It's rich and flashy, but despite a vibrant minerality, it lacks that drink-me-again factor.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2009 Arcadia Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Juicy, this affordable red is high-pitched in acidity, with soft simple layers of red currant and strawberry buoyed by chocolatey oak.
title: Publix 2015 Limited Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

description: This is a great success, showing brisk acidity and savory lemon, lime, grapefruit and mango flavors. There's a delicious richness to the palate, even though the wine was fermented and aged in stainless steel.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Ripe red cherries with hints of fresh green herbs and menthol perfume both the nose and palate of this elegant, medium-bodied Cabernet Sauvignon. On the palate, intense fruit flavors gain complexity with sprinklings of olives, cedar and sturdy tannins that lead to a long, sour cherry finish.
title: Fox Run 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Finger Lakes)

description: Rustic in the texture, with unevenly ripened tannins, and the cherry and berry flavors have a touch of raisins. Pretty standard stuff.
title: Red Rock 2008 Reserve Merlot (California)

description: This is a lovely Syrah. It has a medium-bodied lightness that feels velvety in the mouth, and is packed with sweet blackberry, plum, mocha and bacon flavors, accented with smoky sandalwood. Nice to drink now, and will gain traction over the next 6–8 years.
title: Longboard 2009 Syrah (Russian River Valley)

description: Snappy red fruit aromas endow this Cab with approachability, while the palate is clean, tasty and a little lean, with spicy, piquant raspberry flavors. Dry and peppery on the finish, but honest and clean throughout. Average wine; good value.
title: Finca La Niña 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Combines slightly pungent herbal notes with passion fruit and pineapple in a chunky, assertively fruity style that lacks a bit of elegance.
title: Matariki 2008 Aspire Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

description: Graphite, high-toned cherry, vanilla and herb aromas lead to somewhat elegantly styled fruit flavors. The tannins bring a bit of grip.
title: Seven Hills 2015 Seven Hills Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: While gossamer-light in texture, this intensely sun-kissed spätlese builds in fruity, floral exuberance. Tropical mango and melon flavors are almost ruddy in richness but offset by an electric jolt of acidity. The finish is long and persistent, marked by tea leaves and lavender. Drink now through 2020.
title: S.A. Prüm 2014 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Spätlese Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: A bright red wine rustic in black plum and cherry flavor, lightweight and easy, a rightful companion to spaghetti and meatballs or even a BLT.
title: Auriga 2010 Smokey Ridge Ranch Sangiovese (El Dorado)

description: Earthy, savory aromas include notes of cured meat, dried leaves and red berries. A solid palate is grabby but in shape. Leafy, earthy flavors of roasted plum and berry fruits end with peppery spice notes and a lasting sense of dryness. Drink this by-the-book reserva through 2024.
title: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Laztana Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Smells clipped, tough and oily, with a hardness to the bouquet. The palate is fleshy and wet, with reasonably fresh melon and papaya flavors. Finishes pithy and slightly bitter, and overall it's barely a good wine on its best day.
title: Errazuriz 2009 Estate Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: A soft, sweet, heavy wine. Tastes sugary in cherry pie filling flavors, and lacks vibrance. Ready now.
title: Spelletich Cellars 2006 Reserve Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Zesty tangerine and lemon peels accent citrus-blossom aromas on this pert, light-bodied Riesling. Off dry in style, the palate showcases layers of sweet yellow peach and apricot dusted with earthy pollen and saffron. A shock of pineapple acidity extends the finish.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2013 Bernkasteler Badstube Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Very fruity, but weirdly acidic, giving the blackberry and black cherry flavors a sour candy taste. Despite the pretty flavors, the acidity doesn't taste natural and is off-putting.
title: Adelaida 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Pipe tobacco, black-skinned berry, new leather and a whiff of espresso aromas lead the nose. On the firm chewy palate, taut fine-grained tannins frame dried black cherry, raspberry compote, clove and licorice. Drink 2022–2032.
title: Amantis 2012  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Strong scents of green herbs and olive come with whiffs of bell pepper, tomato and blueberry. This is acidic and hard driving on the palate, with herbal flavors of blackberry, plum and blueberry blending with spice and green pepper. A long, herbal, olive-infused finish is raw in feel but lively. Drink through 2018.
title: Lapostolle 2011 Collection Pumanque Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: This is a well-crafted, likable wine made at a fair value. The tightly wound mix of red fruit and licorice softens on the palate to offer approachability and a bite of tannin and oak.
title: Kenwood 2013 Merlot (Sonoma County)

description: Crisp, elegant black-plum and cassis flavors are framed with notes of fresh herb, dried lavender, cedar and tobacco on this single-vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon. Generous proportions of new French-oak add abundant vanilla and sweet-spice tones to the nose and palate. Pleasurable now, but grippy tannins and a firm structure could evolve well over the next 3–5 years.
title: Paumanok 2005 Tuthills Lane Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Tremendously pretty with honeysuckle and apricot highlights and memorable texture as well as a bright, crisp finish, this Chardonnay makes for a very good food wine, its cool-climate grapes grown organically along the banks of the Russian River.
title: Patianna 2009 Estate Vineyards Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: The aromas of this wine are delicate and pleasing, giving way to apple, passionfruit, guava and flowers. There's a satiny texture and a good lick of acidity on the palate. It's nothing too complicated but is nevertheless thirst quenching
title: Echo Bay 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This wonderfully refreshing, dry Riesling is redolent of ripe honeydew melon and freshly pressed Granny Smith apples. Lime and a nice steely backbone combine mid-palate with the sour tang of lemon drops and a lingering bitter almond finish.
title: Glenora 2008 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Tobacco, dill and vanilla aromas transition to cherry and raspberry scents. The high-acid, cutting palate contains tart raspberry, plum and vanilla flavors that maintain through the finish. From a rough vintage, this wine is not excelling.
title: El Coto 2008 Coto Real Reserva  (Rioja)

description: A ripe, full wine that has almost too much weight, it offers a very rich texture and firm tannins. The blackberry jelly fruits are dense and powered by a fruity feel. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Larteau 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Hugely extracted with blackberries, cherries, blueberries and chocolate, this wine immediately impresses for its sheer power. Oak and high alcohol are key components to this powerful wine, but pour it with barbecue, and nobody will complain.
title: Acorn 2010 Axiom Alegria Vineyards Syrah (Russian River Valley)

description: This sources from multiple appellations, combining grapes into a cohesive unit of deep richness and dusty mineral. The richness takes form in flavours of chocolate-covered-cherries and currants, with accents of graphite and dried herb.
title: Newton 2015 Unfiltered Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: With prickly aromas of nettle and sweat, this unoaked Chardonnay is quite atypical. The palate is zesty but underdeveloped and edgy, while green notes of bell pepper and citrus pith finish bitter.
title: Viña Casablanca 2015 Cefiro Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: This is the winery's stainless-steel-fermented Sauvignon Blanc. Dry and racy in acidity, it shows lemon and lime flavors, with a rich hint of tart kiwi.
title: Gainey 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Intensely fruity, this off-dry Riesling boasts a bounty of superripe tropical fruit, and even a hint of red berries. It's soft and lush on the palate with a caramelized, glycerine-like texture, but balanced with brisk tangerine acidity.
title: Trullo 2011 Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Overextracted aromas of reduced kirsch and cassis make for a very ripe nose. The palate is almost sweet but also very tangy with ripe extracted fruit.
title: Millésimé 2014 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Powerfully dark in color and strong in aromas of blackberry and chocolate, this smooth, sizable wine has big tannins that soften as they go. Black pepper, tobacco and cinnamon round out on the palate, before a lengthy finish of coconut and vanilla.
title: Roth 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Green pepper, jalapeño and herb aromas are out front, with cherry notes lurking in the background. Dark fruit flavors follow, with a strong herbal thread running throughout. It comes off as quite green and light.
title: Structure 2016 Wallula Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Fresh lemon and orange blossom aromas make for an inviting entry to this impressively fragrant wine. Surprisingly light on the palate, despite the concentration and power, this is a focused, subtle expression of the variety, with layers of ripe apple, pear and peach, unimpeded by the supportive oak.
title: Parallel 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe, rich and overall yummy, this Syrah offers bright notes of red plum and cherry laced with a touch of gaminess and soft foliage. The medium-weight mouthfeel boasts fine tannins and prominent acidity that provides a nice lift to the long, spicy finish.
title: Graham Beck 2008 The Ridge Syrah (Robertson)

description: Truffle, scorched earth, graphite, mature black-skinned fruit and crushed blue flower aromas emerge in the glass. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, mint, clove, anise and a gamy note alongside youthfully assertive tannins. Drink 2018–2023.
title: Marchesi Antinori 2011 Pian delle Vigne  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This is slowly developing into a beautiful wine. It dazzles with its combination of fresh acidity and generously ripe yellow-fruit flavors. The texture and structure give a steely edge to this impressive wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Louis Moreau 2012 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Aromas of citrus blossom, tropical fruit and a whiff of vanilla lead the nose while the bright palate delivers raw peach, tangerine zest and a dash of nut alongside racy acidity. A light mineral note marks the close.
title: Cormòns 2014 Chardonnay (Collio)

description: Smoky oak and peppercorn combine for a dense, still-puckering vineyard-designated wine, the vineyard high atop the wilds of Howell Mountain. Graphite and pencil play into its character, finishing dense and fleshy. Drink now through 2017.
title: Midsummer Cellars 2012 Clark-Claudon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Immediate in its appeal, this young wine is redolent with aromas of blueberry and huckleberry pie. The blue-fruit flavors are saturated and smooth in feel, trailing a touch toward the finish.
title: Barnard Griffin 2014 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Hints of brine and sea water lend rusticity to pressed-apple flavors in this dry, delicately framed wine. Fruit flavors seem rather oxidized on the palate, but a tart, lemony zing adds some freshness.
title: Osprey's Dominion 2010 Reserve Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Spice, mint, herb, raspberry and currant aromas form a good nose. Things run a bit choppy and rough on the palate, but overall it works, bearing roasted berry and herb influences, with grabby tannins. This is a full, stocky, spicy and mildly green-leaning Cabernet.
title: Andeluna 2010 1300 Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)

description: This unctuously concentrated Cabernet Franc offers loads of succulent black-cherry and berry flavors nuanced with bramble and green herb. Prominent notes of spice, vanilla and toast integrate well on the palate. While full bodied and a bit plush, a bite of firm tannin structures the finish.
title: Benmarl 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

description: A spare hint of varietal character suggests moderately ripe blue and purple fruits. Those flavors are mostly buried in green tannins, despite the listed alcohol of 15%. The finish is streaked with tobacco and charred wood.
title: Obsidian 2012 Syrah (Oregon)

description: This is a big, jammy, over-the-top Cab with mulchy aromas of coffee grinds and ripe berry fruits. The palate has a sticky, cloying feel to it along with flavors of herbal berry, mocha, cocoa and brown sugar. On the finish, it's creamy feeling and overtly rich.
title: Altocedro 2012 Año Cero Cabernet Sauvignon (La Consulta)

description: From the grandson of the inventor of Brunello, this iconic bottling opens with a classic bouquet of rose, violet, berry and spice. The vibrant palate delivers bright wild cherry, white pepper and energizing mineral notes along with impeccable balance and finesse. It's very elegant, with firm but supple tannins and still-nervous acidity. Give it time to unwind and develop complexity. Drink 2016–2038.
title: Biondi Santi 2008  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Orange blossom and other common white fruit aromas make for a standard, generic type of bouquet. The palate is regular in feel and weight, with shy flavors of melon and apple. Entirely middle of the road in aromas, body, feel and flavors.
title: Cruz Alta 2010 Reserve Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: This is the first release from the newly-planted estate vineyard, located further up Red Mountain on rock-strewn soil. Resulting in juice remarkable for such young vines that's showing tight wild berry flavors and a firm base of mineral and chalk.
title: Force Majeure 2010 Collaboration Series Force Majeure Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: Young wild berry, cherry, rubber and cheese aromas lead to a big, rubbery, loud palate of plum and raspberry. Herbal notes, moderate sweetness and simplicity wrap it up.
subregion: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Spanish Vines 2008 Selección Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Black cherry and plum run deep, dark and rich throughout this concentrated Merlot (blended with Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot). Refreshingly brisk on the palate, it's nuanced with earthy hints of granite and bramble wood. It's bold and richly structured, yet impeccably balanced.
title: Wölffer 2010 Merlot (Long Island)

description: Light aromas of white fruit greet the nose in this Chardonnay from red-wine country. The plump palate is simple and low on acid, while this tastes of lightly oaked melon and apple.
title: Coto de Hayas 2016 Chardonnay (Campo de Borja)

description: While barrel-influenced and full-bodied, this unctuous wine remains crisp in edgy acidity, with lean flavors of lemon and grapefruit amidst a deeper, richer background of oak and caramel.
title: Merryvale 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Banana blends with cut grass for a tropical-meets-traditional take. On the palate, the wine is very soft, reminiscent of pineapple-flavored whipped cream, and there is a nice touch of smoke as well.
title: Still Waters 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

description: This opulent Chardonnay-based sparkling wine offers a luminous golden color and aromas of mature fruit, melon and toasted almond. The wine imparts a rich, creamy feel in the mouth.
title: Contadi Castaldi 2003 Soul Satèn  (Franciacorta)

description: Classic smoky, spicy aromas and complex fruit flavors make this dry, light-bodied wine from veteran winemaker Scott Harvey fascinating to taste. Its green apple, grapefruit and peach hints are accented with light floral, spicy touches. Vibrant acidity keeps it lively and appetizing with each sip.
title: Jana 2015 Dry Riesling (Mendocino)

description: The chilly 2010 vintage was not kind to Spring Mountain's Sauvignon Blanc. The wine is unripe, despite oak and sur lie aging, featuring green flavors that can charitably be described as gooseberry. This is a frequent problem with this wine, which is so vintage dependent.
title: Spring Mountain Vineyard 2010 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Spring Mountain District)

description: Soft, sweet and robust, with upfront cherry pie, red currant and plum flavors. Lots of spices, too, ranging from cinnamon and anise to black pepper. Easy to like this Cab with a juicy filet mignon.
title: Greg Norman California Estates 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Tight when first opened, with polished fruit flavors of blackberry and cassis, mingling with barrel accents of anise and clove. The alcohol, listed at 13.5%, does not indicate the weight and power of the wine. One caveat—there is a chalky aftertaste from the combination of very dry tannins and citrusy acids.
title: Boudreaux Cellars 2006 Champoux & Loess Vineyards Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: Wild yeast, lees stirring and oak aging come together in this rich, full-bodied Sauvignon Blanc, with heady notes of brioche, coconut, salted cashews, lime, pineapple and baked apples. The acidity is bright and bouncy enough to keep things balanced, while oak flavors build on the finish.
title: Greywacke 2015 Wild Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Wonderfully aromatic notions of blood orange zest and ripe Meyer lemon swirl on nose and palate of this wine. Its slender yet concentrated body imbues that citrus tautness with hints of richer fruit—think juicy Mirabelle plum and ripe orange. A lemon note keeps the balance firmly in the tart camp, making for a zesty, intense and clean midpalate and finish. That blood orange aroma lingers magically. Drink 2020–2035.
title: F X Pichler 2016 Ried Kellerberg Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)

description: This is a pleasurable but ultimately simple wine, crisp and appealing in rather sweet orange, pineapple and apple fruit juice flavors.
title: Jacella 2009 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A soft pink color, this bottling from the Riboli family's new Stefano Vineyard shows watermelon, lime rinds and orange on the nose. It's clean and crisp on the palate with lime, strawberry and a fresh acidity.
title: San Simeon 2017 Stefano Vineyard Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)

description: Lives up to its reserve status, being the creamiest and most densely packed of Roche's several new Chardonnays. With brisk, bright acidity and ripe flavors of pineapples, Key lime pie and vanilla cream, its buttered toast and char flavors provide the perfect counterpoint from oak barrel aging.
title: Roche 2008 French Oak Reserve Barrel Select Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Made in a leaner, crisper style than many Chards nowadays, this Chardonnay trades power for elegance. It's almost like a Sauvignon Blanc, with citrusy acids framing flavors of limes, pineapples and green apples that have a minerally edge. New French oak adds just the right touch of richness.
title: Clos du Bois 2007 Calcaire Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: An elegant wine, with nicely framed red berry fruit flavors. Hints of dried herbs and modest tannins put everything in balanced proportion.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2009 Indian Wells Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a bold, vital young Syrah. It's from the Santa Ynez Valley, although you'd never know that from the label, and shows that region's affinity for producing superior Syrah, when the farming is good. The wine is full-bodied and fairly high in alcohol, with rich, intricate blackberry, black currant, licorice, bacon, baker's chocolate and black pepper flavors. Delicious now, and will evolve over the next six years.
title: Rusack 2010 Ballard Canyon Estate Reserve Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: This wine makes an interesting contrast to the estate's GG from the Wallhausen Johannisberg—it's seemingly much tighter. There's passion fruit and fern fronds, wrapped in crisp acids that leave the wine finishing long, but tart and scoury.
title: Prinz Salm 2009 Berg Roxheim GG Trocken Riesling (Nahe)

description: Perhaps this wine could be drier, as the orange and apricot flavors seem to finish with a touch of sweetness. Still, it's clean and brisk in acidity. This should pair well with slightly sweet Asian fare.
title: Geyser Peak 2011 Block Collection River Ranches Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: Made from 100% Cabernet, this is a very rich, flamboyant wine. It brims with blueberry and cherry jam flavors, with a chocolate edge to the smoky new oak. The structure is impeccable. While it doesn't seem to be age worthy, it will drink well over the next 2–3 years.
title: Scarlett 2009 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Round and fruity, this offers gentle acidity and ripe melon fruit. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Bouchard Aîné et Fils 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Mortared savory herb, cherry and spice aromas are at the fore. Broad cranberry flavors follow, with a light grassy note on the finish. It comes off as green for the variety. Drink now.
title: Gordon Estate 2015 Estate Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is Les Vins de Vienne's upscale Crozes, and it's very successful in 2009, featuring bold, concentrated blackberry fruit supported by hints of vanilla and toast. It's full bodied and richly textured, with a long, layered finish. Drink now–2020.
title: Les Vins de Vienne 2009 Les Palignons  (Crozes-Hermitage)

description: Luscious but not overbearing blueberry and boysenberry fruits power the nose on this wine from a coastal region. It suggests blackberry pastries, chalk and pleasingly aromatic incense. The palate combines oak smoke, black fruits and a spicy, black pepper-driven acidity, providing lots of tactile action on the tongue.
title: Beauregard 2012 Beauregard Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Ben Lomond Mountain)

description: Despite mild high-tone and mulchy notes, the nose on this Carmenère deals woody aromas, a touch of tree bark and earthy berry scents. A plush, fleshy palate is moderate in structure, with earthy raspberry and black-plum flavors that finish meaty and savory. Drink now.
title: San Pedro 2012 1865 Single Vineyard Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: A 100% varietal wine, this is robust and oaky, with a touch of vanilla sweetness to the oak. Blackberry and cherry combine with ease on the palate, with a smooth, rich roundness to the texture.
title: Violet-Green Winery 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is a wine that needs warm vintages, and unfortunately 2010 was anything but. There's a green aroma of bell pepper, and while the toast, lees and citrus flavors are pleasant, an ammonia note persists throughout. This is also the first vintage Quintessa has turned to Sonoma County to partially source grapes.
title: Quintessa 2010 Illumination Sauvignon Blanc (Napa-Sonoma)

description: The blend includes 14% Syrah and 11% Cabernet Sauvignon. As usual the scents of barrel toast lead the flavors. The wine shows excellent structure, and the flavors are a spicy mix of plum, cherry and kirsch. It's got crisp definition, ripe tannins and medium length, with a toasty beginning and a toasty finish.
title: J. Bookwalter 2011 Foreshadow Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pretty hibiscus nectar and lychee notes add an exotic twist to this dainty late-harvest Riesling. Light on its feet, it's deliciously juicy on the palate with showers of pink grapefruit and stone fruit. Finishes clean with a brisk, black tea note.
title: Chateau Lafayette Reneau 2010 Late Harvest Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Very rich, reflecting 100% barrel fermentation in partial new oak and 100% malolactic fermentation. Under the creamy lees and buttered toast are scads of pineapples, pears and papayas. The grapes come from the Nielson Vineyard.
title: Byron 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Despite its alcohol and potential richness, this has as much green, herbal character as fruitiness. It's structured and juicy, and shows considerable acidity.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2009 Má Partilha Merlot (Península de Setúbal)

description: Instantly, beautifully fragrant, this jumps from the glass with fresh strawberry/watermelon scents, pretty, fruity and quickly approachable. In the mouth it shows chunky black fruits, some astringency, a slightly green edge to the tannins. Overall a chewy, almost blocky wine, a good quaffer—the kind of wine you want to drink, not analyze.
title: Salida 2008 Tempranillo (Yakima Valley)

description: With a palate-drenching fountain of peach nectar, grapefruit and orange blossom notes, this Finger Lakes standard packs a surprising punch in the 2014 vintage. Dry, yet intensely ripe, it boasts long, lingering streaks of honey and fruit offset by zigzagging daggers of lime zest and lemon. It's penetrating and deliciously persistent.
title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2014 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Lifted honeysuckle and jasmine perfume abound throughout this textbook Mosel Kabinett. Sun-kissed apricots and peaches burst on the palate, yet maintain a graphite edge of minerality and acidity. It's a crystalline fruity wine that's irresistible now for its youthful exuberance.
title: St. Urbans-Hof 2014 Ockfener Bockstein Kabinett Erste Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: There's great vibrancy on the nose of this wine, with bright scents of ripe nectarine and pineapple core, framed by a floral accent reminiscent of rose water. The mouthfeel is light and accessible, with yellow apple and lime rind flavors. Drink now.
title: Winery of Good Hope 2011 Unoaked Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)

description: Tropical fruit, air freshener and bath soap aromas lead to a candied, sticky palate with a mix of sweet flavors that include papaya, powdered sugar and mango. The finish is confected and soft.
title: Sombras del Sol 2011 Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: Aromas of medicine cabinet, dried fruit, dried tobacco and spice lead to elegantly styled fruit flavors. It shows a lot of restraint for the vintage and appellation.
designation: Bel' Villa Vineyard RMAVA Grand Class
title: Goedhart Family 2013 Bel' Villa Vineyard RMAVA Grand Class Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: Tastes a bit raw and herbal in the mouth, like a piece of celery, although there are also richer blackberry and cherry flavors. Yet it's a dry, elegantly constructed Cabernet. Best soon, before the fruit disappears.
title: Jordan 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: This Mendocino Syrah is concentrated, rich and savory, full of big dark-plum and blackberry flavors. The meat and white pepper notes go down smooth on the finish.
title: Les Caves Roties de Pente 2009 Bells Echo Vineyard Syrah (Mendocino County)

description: Inviting aromas of peach, citrus, white stone and wild flowers open the bouquet of this light and luminous Pinot Grigio. The wine is simple, easy drinking and should be served very chilled.
title: Giovello 2009 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Soft, plump and fruity, this pleasing, pure Washington Merlot pushes black cherry, coffee and baking chocolate flavors into a roundly accessible wine with no rough edges at all. It's a quaffer with cojones.
title: :Nota Bene 2007 Conner Lee Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Abrasive aromas of cherry and red plum are medicinal and rudimentary. This feels clamped and severely tannic. Foxy berry and buttery oak flavors finish choppy, with prodding acidity.
title: La Legua 2013 Roble Tempranillo (Cigales)

description: Offering layers of juicy black currant, this is a soft, malleable wine, subtle in oak and tannin, blended with 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. A touch of cedar and herb provides additional character, while the finish lands softly.
title: Merriam 2012 Windacre Merlot (Russian River Valley)

description: The aromas of black pepper and grilled meat immediately pinpoints this as a cool-climate Syrah, and quite a good one. It's dry, rich and smoothly tannic, with blackberry, blueberry, bacon and smoky cedar flavors. While it's asy to drink now, this should hold over the next six years.
title: Waxwing 2010 Syrah (Sonoma County)

description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, rose, menthol, leather and a whiff of grilled herb lead the nose. The ripe palate offers fleshy black cherry, chopped mint and licorice framed in close-grained tannins that dry out the finish.
title: Casale dello Sparviero 2011 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: There's a rustic feeling in the mouth, as though the tannins aren't fully ripened. That famous Dry Creek spiciness also contributes to the scoury, briary texture. Elaborate oak stands out in stark relief to the blackberries and cherries. The result is somewhat erratic, but could knit together in a few years.
title: Hawley 2006 Hawley Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Herbal aromas announce the 100% Sauvignon Blanc in this wine. It is crisp, although touches of tropical fruit and citrus bring out the Bordeaux origins. Drink this fruity wine now.
title: Grand Bateau 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Elegantly soft and succulent, this wine is polished in tannin and integrated oak, with dark brooding flavors of black cherry and sage. Powerfully concentrated, it impresses from first sip, with a length of black pepper and clove.
title: Pellet Estate 2014 Pellet Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: An intriguing wine that lacks fruit in the traditional sense, yet possesses ample weight and a brooding, mineral presence that comes across as wet stone and machine oil. Those elements linger on the finish.
title: Peter Jakob Kühn 2009 Quarzit Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Gooseberry and lemon peel mix with a wet cement, stony character on the nose of this crisp sipper from the middle of Monterey County. It's light, bright and tart on the palate, with lime peel, grapefruit peel and grassy tones, all laid across a zesty energy and cement minerality.
title: Comartin 2014 Stone Row Zabala Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

description: Flirts with being overoaked, with a flood of buttered toast, vanilla and butterscotch notes that dominate. After that some powerful flavors of Asian pears, tangerines and pineapples kick in, brightened with acidity. Drink it now.
title: Dutton Estate 2009 Kyndall's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This bold, beautifully made wine is sizable in tannin while imparting an old-world entry of herbaceousness and classic notions of pencil shavings and cedar. Gritty on the palate, it flirts with black cherry, currant and cassis before offering a rounded lengthy finish of clove and tobacco.
title: Turnbull 2015 Black Label Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: Berry, pickle and bramble aromas are a little tough and crusted over, while the palate is snappy and fresh in feel, with flavors of herbal berry fruit and pepper. A mild hint of oak and resin dry up the finish.
title: Morandé 2008 Pionero Merlot (Rapel Valley)

description: Thin, herbal, and tannic, this does not show much in the way of either varietal character or ripeness.
title: Del Rio 2007 Syrah (Rogue Valley)

description: Craisin and geranium aromas mark the nose of this Texas Syrah. The medium-bodied palate brings more floral tones, soapy in nature, with soft tannins giving little support.
title: Arché 2012 Syrah (Texoma)

description: Flinty smoke appears first and leads onto a textured palate where grapefruit zest mingles with green pear peel against a stony, mineral background. Tight, bright and lemony acidity adds focus.
title: Hirsch 2013 Zöbing Riesling (Kamptal)

description: This is the first Chardonnay release from Anam Cara, estate grown from young vines, and softened by secondary fermentation. The flavors suggest almond and butter, light citrus, a whiff of toast and a taste of cracker. It's smooth, with a lemony finish.
title: Anam Cara 2011 Nicholas Estate Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This is a big, robust Syrah, as chewy as a piece of grilled steak, as delicious as blackberry jam. You find both those flavors, along with a spectrum of dark chocolate, Canadian bacon, heady black currant liqueur, black pepper and sandalwood. It's pretty tannic, but you can drink it now, after a few hours of breathing.
title: Peju 2009 Syrah (Napa Valley)

description: This is a fine, impressive Cabernet that shows the soft tannins and slight herbaceousness of Alexander Valley, yet is rich in cherry jam, cassis liqueur, chocolate and sweet oak flavors. Feels plush and fancy in the mouth. Drink soon.
title: Dewitt 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Chunky black-fruit aromas are ripe but familiar, meaning the nose is pumped full of richness and oak. Racy acidity on the palate gives this modern Cab spine, while in the mouthfeel stays on the fast track due to zesty acidity. Flavors of cassis and blackberry register as fresh and ripe, and the finish is crisp and not the least bit flabby. Drink through 2016.
title: Viña Cobos 2011 Bramare Marchiori Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Perdriel)

description: Neutral smelling except for some pith and green melon. The palate is angular and high in acidity, which yields a citrusy, sharp-tasting flavor profile. Finishes zesty with even more acidic scour.
title: Michel Torino 2010 Don David Reserve Chardonnay (Calchaquí Valley)

description: This is good solid Chardonnay at a very reasonable price. Pear, melon and citrus flavors mingle easily on the plump, midweight palate, then finish briskly, in a burst of refreshing citrus. Drink now.
title: Miles From Nowhere 2012 Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: Grippy leather and tobacco provide a gravelly texture and burly nature to this medium-bodied wine, which finds its groove in the glass. Concentrated and dense, it offers smoother elements of black currant, cassis and leather on the finish.
title: Joleté 2013 Olson Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This wine has a throwback label celebrating Chateau Ste Michelle's 50th anniversary. Upfront aromas of clarified butter, peach and spice are followed by medium-bodied stone fruit flavors. It's a varietal crowd-pleaser.
title: Ste Michelle Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: T-L's 2007s from the Northern Rhône came out well, including this example from Saint-Joseph. Intense espresso, cracked pepper and black olive notes scream of cool-climate Syrah, while the feel in the mouth is supple, ending on a silky note.
title: Tardieu-Laurent 2007 Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Joseph)

description: The AVA shines in this cool vintage, delivering robust, ripe fruit flavors without aggressive tannins. The acids are in place to provide good support, and the aging in two-thirds new French oak adds a nice dusting of cinnamon and mocha.
title: Ancestry 2011 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: With significant amounts of Mourvèdre (15%) and Grenache (8%) blended in, this drinks more like a GSM than a Syrah. Cranberry, herb and woodspice aromas are followed by tart, sleek fruit and smoke flavors that linger.
title: :Nota Bene 2012 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Golden Mirabelle plums and apricots are evoked on the aromatic nose. The palate reprises these ripe notions with added lemon verve. Concentrated, dry, aromatic and long, the body reveals notions of riper citrus among the stone fruit. The flavors last and last.
title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2015 Silberberg de Rohrschwihr Riesling (Alsace)

description: Not sure what the difference is between this wine and Agustinos' Gran Reserva and Reserva Privada because all are priced the same and rate about the same. Here we get banana, apple and fresh hay aromas along with a spunky palate of lemon, pineapple and green apple. Finishes with some honey and spice.
title: Agustinos 2008 Reserva Chardonnay (Bío Bío Valley)

description: The medium-intense nose of this solid and easy-to-like Cab offers scents of blackberry, cassis and plum, all laced by hints of cocoa and cigar box. The medium-weight mouth offers a pleasant texture, thanks to moderate tannins and ample acidity, with solid black-fruit flavors at the core.
title: Romantic 2014 Authentic & Chic Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: Soft notions of grapefruit zest and green apple provide an inviting opening, the palate delivers fresh, juicy flavors that broaden in the mouth. A lemony freshness lights everything up.
title: Nigl 2014 Hochäcker Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

description: From an excellent vintage, with 10% Merlot and 10% Malbec in the blend, this is Dusted Valley's first-ever estate wine. It's a big, thick, dusty, earthy Cabernet, for those who want more fruit, more oak, and more tannin. Mulberry and sweet plum are augmented with brown spices.
title: Dusted Valley 2006 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This is a medium-bodied, oak-inflected wine. Initial aromas of sun-warmed lumber and vanilla give way with air to scents of cola, earth and mocha. The overall impression is savory, especially on the long finish, which picks up some asphalt notes. Probably best with herb-crusted beef or lamb.
title: Maimai 2013 Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

description: This wine is rich and dense with blackberry, cassis liqueur and cedar flavors. It's frankly delicious, but those tannins are really hard—that's Diamond Mountain for you. Will be more mellow in 6–7 years, but it's fine now with a nice steak.
title: Courtney Benham 2010 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

description: Soft notions of apple blossom suggest a light touch. The palate comes in with earthy confidence and fluid harmony of pear, orange and mandarin. There is a directness in the concentration of this wine with its pleasant dryness garlanded in ripe, fresh fruit. It finishes clean.
title: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2014 Les Éléments Riesling (Alsace)

description: Bramble and dusty mineral notes extend from nose to finish in this dry Riesling, lending a savory tone to freshly pressed apple and dried orange peel flavors. Its voluminous, mouth-filling texture is pleasant, balanced neatly by a strike of lemonade acidity.
title: Suhru 2014 Dry Riesling (New York)

description: Easy, fresh and simple, this crisp Pinot Grigio is informal and approachable with aromas of citrus, stone fruit and pear. Pair it with shrimp cocktail or spicy Thai dishes.
title: San Simone 2010 Prestige Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: Made from Elerding Vineyard fruit, this wine is aged in 100% new oak for 24 months. It's dark and concentrated, and it deals attention-grabbing barrel-derived flavors of dark chocolate, licorice and espresso. The black cherry flavor has the grip and power to handle the barrel influence, but the wine will profit from additional bottle age.
title: Seven Bridges 2009 Elerding Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

description: This rare, single vineyard offering of Sangiovese brings notes of sour cherry, cranberry, dried plum and a kiss of vanilla. It's spot-on with excellent concentration and depth to the fruit flavors, vibrant acidity and a tart, lingering finish.
title: Genoa 2010 Doebler Vineyard Sangiovese (Wahluke Slope)

description: This is a soft, flavorful wine full of creamy yellow fruit. Hints of wood aging and a delicate mineral texture add depth to the palate, but this wine will age quickly, so drink now–2020.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2012 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A tiny amount of Merlot is added to this Chianti Classico to lend a soft, plush feel to the mouthfeel. But the Sangiovese element does come through to deliver bright aromas of cherry, wet earth, pressed roses and dried spice. There's a touch of bitter almond on the finish.
title: Fattoria la Castellina 2008 Tommaso Bojola  (Chianti Classico)

description: Aromas of brown sugar, strawberry, mint and wood spice lead to red-fruit flavors on the lighter side of medium bodied, with a grip of tannins and bitter notes on the finish. It's an unusual offering of this variety.
title: Maryhill 2014 Painted Hills Vineyard Tempranillo (Columbia Valley (WA))
Reinhold Haart 2007 Piesport Goldtröpfchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: There's 5% Cabernet Franc in this Temp, which makes all the difference, bringing greater body and tannins to a variety that, on its own, can be simple. The cherry, cola and licorice flavors are accented with a touch of sandalwood, making for a lovely, medium-bodied red wine to drink now.
title: Maisonry 2008 Stagecoach Vineyard Tempranillo (Napa Valley)

description: Made in a heady, voluptuous style, this wine conveys quality from the fruit to the oak, one-third of it new French. Golden honey and apple blossom combine for a floral, powerful and hearty expression on the palate, finishing in crème brûlée.
title: Ram's Gate 2013 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Very pure—this has a straight line of acidity right to the wine's citrus- and pineapple-flavored heart. It is structured and taut, with its acidity dominant. It is concentrated and ready to age for 2–3 years.
title: Domaine Fouassier 2010 Les Chailloux  (Sancerre)

description: A fully rich yet integrated Chardonnay that offers great value and clean flavors of golden apple and yellow fig and plenty of crisp acidity on the finish.
title: Concannon 2010 Conservancy Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Ripe black-skinned fruit, underbrush, leather, sunbaked earth and a whiff of crushed herb come together on this solid red. The round palate doles out juicy wild cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon, a hint of vanilla and anise alongside robust, velvety tannins that impart muscle and polish. A note of grilled sage closes the finish. Drink 2018–2025.
title: La Palazzetta 2011  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Very acidic, giving the ripe tropical fruit and green pea flavors an almost sparkling spritziness. But very rich and flamboyant and complex. This wine was tasted at just about a year of age, and should calm down by summer 2012.
title: Melville 2010 Clone 76 Inox Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Light, lemony aromas work for the most part. This feels full, even creamy. Flavors of papaya, melon and apple finish with a note of pineapple. The longer this sits, the more soft and tropical it becomes.
title: Chakana 2014 Estate Selection Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Sourced from Les Collines and Pepper Bridge, this is very ripe, high in alcohol, and quite tannic. Blocky black cherry fruit is covered with charred wood flavors, after spending 22 months in 70% new oak. Drink soon.
title: Covington 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: A trace of savory earth tones lend contrast to lively green plum, lime and gooseberry notes in this slightly off-dry Riesling. Light-footed and frisky, it's a refreshing, spry wine to enjoy now through 2019.
title: Dr. Nägler 2016 Rüdesheimer Feinherb Riesling (Rheingau)

description: There's an oaky edge to this attractive Sauvignon Blanc, with sweet-spice notes that accent the ripe-fruit aromas and flavors of peach, apple and melon. Medium weight and clean, with a touch of menthol that unfolds on the finish.
title: Nederburg 2011 The Winemaker's Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

description: Intensely mineral, structured wine, with a taut character. There is great acidity here, with green apple and citrus flavors. It's a dry, food-friendly wine.
title: Ayala 2004 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The fruit on this drily complex Chardonnay is starting to fall out, giving an herb, cashew nut edge to the pineapples, tangerines and apricots. The wine retains its sweet coating of buttered toast and vanilla honey. Will continue to dry and become earthier over the next several years.
title: Harbison Wines 2007 Le Bon Climat Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This Chardonnay is dry, with vibrant acidity and tangy, mineral-infused flavors of stone and earth. It shows subtle notes of Meyer lemons, limes and tangerines. Don't drink this too cold.
title: Mahoney 2011 Gavin Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This Moldovan Merlot carries aromas of black raspberry, vanilla and fresh red cherries. The smooth palate is balanced, with flavors of black raspberry and black cherry.
title: Milestii Mici 2005 Merlot (Moldova)

description: With watered-down tropical fruit and peach flavors, this Chardonnay shows a strong oak-like note, in the form of butterscotch. It finishes sugary sweet.
title: Paripaso 2011 Chardonnay (California)

description: Simple, direct flavors of pineapple and orange jam, vanilla bean and buttered popcorn mark this Chardonnay. It has just enough acidity to keep things balanced.
title: Vinterra 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This wine is quite aromatic with notes of funk, mineral and dark fruit. The fruit and savory flavors are light bodied, with a mouthwatering quality that keeps the interest high.
designation: The Classic Estate Cabernet Sauvignon In the Rocks Vineyard
title: Reynvaan Family Vineyards 2013 The Classic Estate Cabernet Sauvignon In the Rocks Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Compact and herbal on the nose, this has hints of plastic and wet cement. It feels tannic and cheeky, with varietal flavors of tomato, oregano, herb and berry. The finish is lightly herbal and green, with cheek-blasting tannins.
title: Echeverria 2010 Reserva Carmenère (Curicó Valley)

description: Made from 100% Syrah, this wine shows Zaca Mesa's house style of exceptionally ripe, heady fruit flavors tucked into a balanced, dry wine. It's as lush as velvet in the mouth, with complex flavors of blackberries, anise, cocoa and black pepper. Feels soft and light and yet powerful and insistent at the same time. Drink now–2013.
title: Zaca Mesa 2007 Black Bear Block Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: The mouthfeel of this wine is so full and weighty that one might never guess that it's a South African Sauvignon Blanc. On the nose, glimmers of baby powder and chamomile mingle with soft notes of honeydew rind and crisp apple. The limey finish seals the deal nicely, like a comforting signature.
title: Southern Right 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Walker Bay)

description: This is a fruity Merlot with a strong lemony streak. There are hints of pepper as well. Drink soon.
title: Tildio 2009 Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

description: Hints of lime blossoms, toasted nuts and wood smoke show on the nose of this very fairly priced bottling, whose previous vintages have been shown to age magically. Wood-fired pears and apples show on the palate, which will please both those seeking a bit of oak and those who enjoy a racier style of Chardonnay.
title: Le P'tit Paysan 2016 Jacks Hill Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: What a heady nose. Tangerine peel, hay flowers and ripe apples all dance and swirl across the senses. The palate takes the swirling fruit and fragrance up a notch, heightened with the intensity of tangy lemon freshness. This has utter precision and concentration, there almost seems to be a life force of stone and power behind it. It's a textbook Riesling with a clean, dry and totally tangy moreish finish. Lovely now but with great potential. Drink 2017–2035.
title: Cave de Turckheim 2015 Brand Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Aromas of tree bark, vanilla and herbs mix with peppery red fruit scents, while the palate is comfortable and herbal, with plum and dry oak notes. Peppery on the finish, and overall this is a nice but standard Chilean Cabernet that should strike most as being familiar.
title: Agustinos 2007 Reserva Maitén Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Strained aromas of beef broth and olive underdeliver. Like many Chilean reds from this El Niño vintage, this is lean and acidic. Spicy berry and olive flavors are dry and end sharp and bumpy.
title: Viña Chocalan 2016 Reserva Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: This crisp, straw-colored white wine has interesting touches of complexity in the mineral and prosciutto aromas and the nice combination of savory herb and fresh apple flavors. It's medium bodied and has lively acidity.
title: La Folia Winery 2016 Pinot Grigio (Sierra Foothills)

description: From the Marche region on the eastern flank of Italy, Tiamo offers a simple, easy-drinking value wine. What it lacks in intensity, it makes up for with fresh crispness.
title: Tiamo 2008 Sangiovese (Marche)

description: Tart, almost sour, in gooseberry and pyrazine aromas and flavors, and bone dry, with crisp, citrusy acidity. Finely structured and dry, but those feline tastes are pretty strong.
title: Clos Pegase 2008 Mitsuko's Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Carneros)

description: This is a crisp style of Chablis, bringing out a steely side while keeping fruitiness to the fore. Apple and freshly sliced melon are given texture by the citrus zest and bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2012  Chablis

description: Always one of the superstar Sauv Blancs from Washington, this is especially good in this vintage. Lots of toast, butter cookie and a streak of vanilla are wrapped into silky, seductive, ripe fruit flavors that mix citrus, orange, papaya and lemon hard candy. This is about 20% Sémillon, barrel fermented.
title: Novelty Hill 2008 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Vanilla, cedar and mint notes mark the nose, while this wine boasts just enough fruit on the plate to carry the lavish oak. It's full bodied, creamy and supple, amply concentrated but still very approachable. Drink now–2023.
title: Mitolo 2012 Savitar Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
