title: Weingut Georg Albrecht Schneider 2012 Niersteiner Hipping Spätlese Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: A reedy, raw nose is herbal and minty. This feels balky and highly tannic. Flavors of minty black plum, beet juice and peppercorn conclude in wiry, spicy fashion on a rough and tannic finish.
title: Fabre Montmayou 2015 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Sweet orange and ripe melon notes fill the nose and plump mouth, while additional accents of apple skin and soft toast carry through to the clean finish. Drink now.
title: Indaba 2010 Chardonnay (Western Cape)

description: This has aromas evoking wild flower, white stone fruit and toasted hazelnut while on the light-bodied, straightforward palate, fresh acidity accompanies baked apple. It closes on a bitter almond note.
title: La Rajade 2016 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: Fragrant on the nose with fresh orange, lemon and honeysuckle aromas, this full-bodied Chard is deliciously quaffable with a concentrated apple palate and just a hint of buttered toast. Another well-made Romanian at an unbeatable bargain price.
title: Cramele Recas 2009 Chardonnay (Recas)

description: Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, this has aromas of black plum, star anise and tobacco that carry over to the structured balanced palate together with a touch of cinnamon. The tannins are fine-grained and while it's already enjoyable it will still benefit with a few more years in the cellar. Drink from 2022 to 2027.
title: Cordella 2012 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: From vines averaging 60 years of age in Jurassic chalky clay, this ripe, buttery wine has plenty of ripe apples, pears and a generous texture. An attractive touch of toast adds to the complexity. Drink now.
title: Pierre Merguey 2014 Clos de la Maison  (Saint-Véran)

description: Not afraid to wear high alcohol and toasty oak on its sleeve, it kicks off with a marshmallow, whipped cream and macadamia-nut nose, making it perfect for those who love the California cocktail style but are seeking nuance as well. On the palate, the wine is soft and buttery, with a long buttercream finish. Pair with oven-roasted chicken.
title: Oso Libre 2011 Vino d'Oro Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: A spectacular Syrah, distinctly Californian in the ripe blackberry and blueberry fruit, with rich, firm tannins and a finish of spice. The tannins really mark this wine, so creamy and smooth, making the mouthfeel a delight. Drink now–2014 for youthful exuberance.
title: Novy 2009 Susan's Hill Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A little rustic and tattered around the edges, but its dry, with ripe blackberry flavors that veer into tannic, bitter raisin skins. Drink this with a hamburger to round it out.
title: Chessman 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: This wine has the power associated with this appellation, giving richness even while it is still so young. Its weight, spice and acidity are there, packed into a tight parcel that will need to age. Drink this powerful, toasty wine from 2022.
title: Lucien Muzard et Fils 2016  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Varietally familiar aromas of snappy citrus fruits are feline in nature. This is light in body, refreshing and citric. Flavors of lime and tangerine are stony and show a hint of green herbs, while this is lasting on a fresh finish.
title: Mocén 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

description: Aromas of wild brush and herbal berry fruit include notes of leather and juniper. On the palate, this is more lugubrious and syrupy than in the past. Blackened berry, chocolate and charred flavors precede a finish with lingering burnt toast flavors and excess weight. Drink now; this lacks the acidity and structure for aging.
title: Domus Aurea 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This sturdy, well-made wine has lightly charred aromas, tasty cherry flavors and moderate tannins to give the texture some grip.
title: Owl Ridge 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)

description: This is a Cabernet to drink now. It's soft and clean and pleasantly complex, with black cherry, currant, cola, spice and sandalwood flavors, and is thoroughly dry. It will go downhill quickly, though, so open on buying.
title: Cass 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Bold berry and black-cherry aromas come with equal amounts of overt oak and coconut scents. This has hard but manageable tannins that create a powerful but rocky mouthfeel. Flavors of coconut, vanilla, blackberry and chocolate finish with firm, dry tannins, fresh acidity and a lasting mocha flavor. Drink through 2022.
title: Viña Vilano 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Smooth and lightly roasted on the bouquet, this has tobacco, cola, fine oak and earthy berry aromas. It feels generous but a little soft and syrupy, with raisin, licorice and savory baked-fruit flavors. The finish is long and continues to be savory tasting. Drink now–2014.
title: Alidis 2009 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Very easy-going, this light effort delivers aromas of cut grass, lemon and crushed stone.
title: La Corte 2010 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: High in acidity and well-defined minerality, this wine is also soft and velvety, with a sensibility of crushed rocks and preserved lemon. From a younger block of the famed Ritchie Vineyard, it celebrates youthful playfulness on the palate, with a long-lasting, voluptuous finish.
title: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2013 Kent the Younger Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Earthy, leathery aromas are baked, stewy and a touch muddled. This feels round and raw, with acidic bite. Flavors of mocha, coffee, toast and baked, stewy berry fruits finish tannic.
designation: Finca Santa Cruz Single Vineyard Crianza
title: Ochoa 2011 Finca Santa Cruz Single Vineyard Crianza Tempranillo (Navarra)

description: Made from Riesling planted on grey-green soils of diabase (a volcanic basalt) and slate, there's a smoky dusty mineral undertone that abounds from nose to finish here. Crisp yellow-apple, grapefruit and tangerine flavors are a shade off dry, offset by bristling acidity. It's juicy, spry and approachable now but maintains a long mineral finish.
title: Zilliken 2016 Rausch Diabas Riesling (Mosel)

description: Spiced cherry and berry aromas are common but good. A bright, acidic palate feels perfectly healthy and lively, while flavors of plum and berry fruits get a dusting of dry spice. A slow-driving finish offers a steady ending.
title: La Greña 2011 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: Fruity and fresh, this is Sauvignon Blanc at its most attractive. It shows a touch of minerality, but the citrus and crisp apple flavors dominate. With its light touch, it will make a fine apéritif wine.
title: Domaine Dyckerhoff 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Reuilly)

description: Quite light herb and citrus aromas are followed by elegantly styled citrus and tropical flavors. It needs more oomph to bring it together, coming off as a bit generic.
title: Columbia Crest 2015 H3 Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: So sweet and caramelized in smoky oak, it tastes almost like a dessert wine. There might even be some leftover sugar in the wine. Yet it has brisk, refreshing acidity, and there's no denying the deliciousness of the pineapple and lemon-pie flavors.
title: Costa de Oro 2008 Gold Coast Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Though aged in just 20% new French oak, the wood seems to take over much of the show in this young wine. Notes of char, caramel, and sawdust accompany tobacco and dark berry aromas and flavors. The fruit flavors are light and citrusy with a spice filled finish and a gritty feel to the tannins.
title: Jaxon 2011 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

description: A short finish closes out this easy Shiraz that offers attractive but simple notes of red plum and berries. Faint nuances of licorice and black pepper can be found upon deep nosing.
title: La Capra Presented by Fairview 2009 Shiraz (Coastal Region)

description: There is no lack of dark, smoky flavors in this 100% varietal bottling. Leather, cola, cassis, tar, burnt rubber and smoke all whirl about, with an underlying impression of dried leaves. The listed flavors may not stir you with longing when named in this way, but taken all together and accompanied by a bowl of beef stew, they will satisfy.
title: Silvan Ridge 2013 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

description: This pure, supple, fruit-laden Syrah is loaded with wild blackberry fruit, and detailed veins of licorice, coffee, and iron filings. The wine's excellent length and polished tannins showcase exceptional handling of superb fruit.
title: Syncline 2010 McKinley Springs Vineyard Syrah (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: With it's brisk acidity and tangy minerality that gird the Asian pear and tropical fruit flavors, this wine expresses its coastal origin as well as the cool vintage. It feels streamlined and elegant.
title: Benovia 2010 Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: Chunky, jammy and full of blackberry and boysenberry aromas, this is lively but limited in mouthfeel, with wild berry and savory flavors. It feels pointed and short on the finish, but overall it's dark, full and well made.
title: García Figuero 2009 Tinto Figuero 12 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

description: This tannic young 100% Cabernet, which comes off the Pritchard Hill estate, is ageable, although it's not quite in the same league as the winery's legendary 2009. Blame it on the irregular vintage. Still, you'll find a rich core of black currants, violets, cassis and cocoa, girded by the tangy, firm minerality that Pritchard Hill frequently offers. Begin drinking it in 2016.
title: Montagna 2010 La Presa One South Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Whiffs of crushed earth and clay on the nose are quiet but this off-dry Riesling's lemon and tangerine flavors pack a zesty punch. It's an easy-drinking, refreshingly composed wine that finishes on a delicate lace of residual sugar. Drink now.
title: Weingut Georg Albrecht Schneider 2016 Niersteiner Hipping Kabinett Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Scintillating acidity highlights crisp yellow peach and apple in this racy, light-footed kabinett. It's a delicately honeyed but penetrating wine that's approachable now but concentrated enough to hold well through 2025.
title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2016 Ockfener Bockstein Kabinett Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: Dried herb, sage and lavender make for a potent bouquet of inviting complexity and intrigue, followed by a tease of anise. Juicy, thick and rich on the palate, the wine has a grip and power that never lets go, showing its youth and 100% barrel fermentation. It will be hard to wait on this one, but cellaring will reward. Best 2024–2034.
title: Alpha Omega 2014 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: Good cherry, cocoa and sweet oak flavors in this dry wine. It's too soft, lacking structure, but is a pretty good buy for the price.
title: Pennywise 2009 Merlot (California)

description: This beautiful, rich wine has yellow fruits and is concentrated, tightly textured and conveys a ripe character. The touches of wood are just right, adding spice to the opulent fruitiness. A mineral texture gives some tightness to the aftertaste. Drink from 2024.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Le Montrachet  (Montrachet)

description: This medium-bodied Chardonnay kicks off with nutty notes of baked meringue layered over plump pear and melon fruit. There's a bit of toasted-grain as well, and a focused, lemony finish that lingers. Drink now–2019.
title: Marchand & Burch 2014 Villages Chardonnay (Western Australia)

description: Spicy, lemony acidity balances out a classic barrel imprint of oakiness and toast in this medium-bodied, concentrated wine. Silky-smooth on the palate, it rewards patience in the glass and will pair well with rich, creamy foods.
title: Landmark 2014 Damaris Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Aromas of gun smoke, herb, raspberry, cranberry and fire pit are followed by sweet, well-balanced raspberry jam flavors. There is a lot to like.
title: Casa Smith 2016 Cinghiale Wahluke Slope & Rosebud Vineyards Sangiovese (Wahluke Slope)

description: Aromas of charred earth, toast, ground pepper, mature black-skinned fruit and espresso lead the nose. The big, ripe palate presents licorice, fleshy black cherry, clove and tobacco alongside a tannic backbone.
title: Poggio Nardone 2010 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: On the nose, the aromas are of wood and fruit, but the palate demonstrates the ripe fruit of the vintage. It's smooth and opulent, and the barrel influence is in balance with the yellow and orange fruit flavors. This will be ready to drink in two years.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2009  Saint-Aubin

description: The nose is dominated by spices and herbs, a whiff of violets, fennel and white chocolate. Complex and intriguing, it leads into fruit flavors of plum and cherry, with a hint of alcoholic heat. The wine improved substantially after being open for several hours.
title: Ott & Murphy 2010 Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Scents of cherry and raspberry sauce unfold on the bouquet, while the approachable palate offers similarly intense, fleshy fruit flavors that are laced with hints of pepper and soft mint.
title: Neil Ellis 2010 Sincerely Shiraz (Western Cape)

description: This wine is made from equal parts Upland, Hedges and Destiny Ridge vineyard fruit. The aromas leap out of the glass, suggesting green olives, chopped parsley, fresh flowers and smoked meat, the fruit notes lurking the background. The concentration of fruit and savory flavors is seamless and exquisite, with a lengthy finish.
title: Structure 2015 Bauhaus Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Though the wine saw just less than 25% of new American and Hungarian oak, the vanilla and baking spices stand out at present along with tart cherries, cough syrup and dried herbs. It's tart and somewhat lean in style with a firm handshake of tannins.
title: Waterbrook 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Clean aromas of peach, lemon and pineapple move toward tropical ripeness on the nose of this bottling—a well-balanced white from the warm region. It's bright and fresh on the palate with guava, tuberose and sweet cream flavors.
title: Wilson Creek 2017 Yes Dear Happy Wife Vineyard Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)

description: Introduced by a lively, crisp mousse, this 100% Chardonnay sparkler is made méthode Champenoise, and dry. Highlights on the nose and palate include a nuttiness of hazelnut and almond, green apple and orange, with a lilt of lemon zest.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: As the impressive counterpart to a Blanc de Noirs from the 2003 vintage, this is a ripe, round and fully mature wine. Quince, juicy apple and ripe pineapple flavors are cut by steely acidity, crisp green plum and a perfumed aftertaste. This is a wine to drink now.
title: Jean Laurent 2003 Blanc de Blancs Millésimé Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Wet leaf, black cherry, and assertive barrel flavors of brown sugar, maple syrup and crème brûlée are the dominant notes in this blend of Tempranillo and Cabernet Franc. The short, slightly bitter, green finish is the downside.
title: Cave B 2010 Estate Tempranillo (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This Pinot Grigio offers aromas of lemon grass and lime pith that lead to flavors of grapefruit, and honeydew melon before the clean finish.
title: Purcari 2016 1827 Pinot Grigio (Moldova)

description: Fresh citrus has a tang of green apple on the nose. The palate colors this with an equally zesty dollop of grapefruit, but something riper, richer, almost of dried fruit, also swings in there. This is intriguing and fresh, zesty and taut, lip-smacking and moreish. I feel that this will give up its secrets with a little more bottle age, but it already is delicious now.
title: Proidl 2015 Hochäcker Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)

description: Full, perhaps too soft wine, the flavors lost in a rather dilute character.
title: Catherine et Didier Tripoz 2008 Clos des Tournons  (Mâcon-Charnay)

description: Passionfruit, lemongrass, exuberant lemon-lime soda and squeezed orange juice aromas show on the fresh, exotic nose of this botttling. The palate is driven by citrus, simple yet tasty, with fresh limes, kumquat and light guava, proving both tropical and racy.
title: Esser 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Very ripe and forward in fruit, this Cabernet floods the mouth with cherry fruit flavors, liberally enhanced with the sweet vanilla and toast of oak barrel aging. The tannins are strong but finely ground. Appeals now for sheer beauty.
title: Carter 2008 Revilo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: This wine from the Franscioni family's home vineyard shows tight aromas of lime candy, chalky rock, Pink Lady apple, sliced mandarin orange and a hint of honeysuckle. The palate is full of energy, with a wide range of orange flavors, from Pixie tangerines to Creamsicles, with a touch of honey on the finish.
title: Testarossa 2013 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Fair warning: the alcohol level on this wine reaches 18.6%, which really can't help but be felt. It does deliver an impressive array of cherry, plum, chocolate and spice complexity, just don't expect it to age gracefully given its tenuous balance.
title: R Wines 2007 Chateau Chateau Island Ebenezer Grenache (Barossa Valley)

description: Hard to describe the balance and elegance of this Cabernet Franc, although it's pretty hard in tannins. Below that is a fabulous core of blackberry, black cherry and mineral flavors. Rich, complex and dramatic, this is arguably one of the best Cab ernet Francs on the market. Drink now–2017.
title: La Jota Vineyard 2009 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)

description: Very simple and straightforward, this bright wine opens with aromas of lime, cut grass and white peach. It's crisp and lean on the finish.
title: Angelini 2011 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Give this young Cabernet a good decant before you serve, because it's a big, brooding wine that needs some air to open up. Right out of the bottle, it's tannic and dry, and the blackberry and black currant flavors are buried under a blanket of astringency. But it's quite a good, well-made wine.
title: Cameron Hughes 2007 Lot 149 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Gritty citrus aromas are oily but adequate. This basic SB tastes of citrus and green vegetables. Beyond that, it's mostly fresh in feel.
title: Santa Luz 2015 Alba Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Basic apple, melon and bready aromas are fine but not distinct or complex. Ditto the palate, which feels balanced but highly basic. Simple papaya and melon flavors finish flat.
title: Chilensis 2015 Reserva Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: Januik makes just four barrels of this 100% Walla Walla Cabernet. The usual plushness of the Seven Hills Vineyard comes with a harder, steelier edge—a hallmark of Januik's style. It's structured for aging, with black cherry fruit that's annotated with tobacco, coffee and baking spice.
title: Januik 2009 Seven Hills Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: Sassy berry, lemony oak and asphalt aromas are untamed and a bit rustic. A grabby, rough palate doesn't qualify as silky, while flavors of spiced berry and cassis are true to the variety. Prune, berry, chocolate and spice flavors help a finish that's abrasive in texture.
title: Argento 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Roasted plums and preserved berries are coated in cocoa and spice in this rich, warming yet elegant Syrah. Sharp but fine-grained tannins, fresh acidity and tinges of bitter chocolate and coffee extend a long, precise finish.
title: Cave de Tain 2015 Grand Classique  (Saint-Joseph)

description: Delicate but alluring scents of spring flower and orchard fruit lift out of the glass. The palate is linear and rather lean but still refreshing, offering pear, yellow apple and mineral alongside bracing acidity. It closes crisp and clean.
title: St. Pauls 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

description: Aromas of pomegranate, fruit punch and carnation show on the nose of this bottling, which is quite fruity all around. The palate offers candied red plums and rosewater flavors, set against a sticky tannic structure.
title: Montemar Wines 2014 Stolpman Vineyard Sangiovese (Ballard Canyon)

description: This is unmistakably a mountain-grown Merlot, hefty with dark fruit and layers of baking spice. Concentrated and ready to age another 5–7 years, it has a long and leathery finish.
title: Lava Cap 2009 Merlot (El Dorado)

description: This opens with dry, traditional Tempranillo aromas of cherry, plum, tobacco and even some asphalt and woodsmoke. The palate is smooth and loamy, with mild tomatoey acidity keeping things fresh. Wiry cherry, plum and baked flavors finish with mocha and stewed notes. Drink now.
title: Peña Roble 2006 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

description: This 100% Syrah hasn't even begun shedding its hard, dry tannins at the age of nearly seven years, and it probably never will. It's also overripe, with a porty finish.
title: Millésimé 2007 Le Reflexion Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Very fruity and fresh, this light-bodied wine shows vivid floral and apple aromas and flavors. It's attractively clean, snappy and straightforward.
title: McManis 2017 Certified Sustainable Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Despite some rich blackberry and currant flavors, a rich overlay of oak and smooth tannins, this Cabernet is a little off in texture. It's gritty in the mouth, but it is nicely dry, and has a certain complexity.
title: White Oak 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Forest floor, tilled soil, mature berry and a whiff of new leather combine on this. The ripe palate offers fleshy black cherry, dried aromatic herb and tobacco, while fine-grained tannins give the finish some grip. Drink 2018–2023.
title: Carillon 2010 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This is a very big, elaborate Cabernet whose main feature is fruity flavor. It's explosive in blackberry, black currant, cassis and dark chocolate, accented with sweet, smoky oak. Made in the modern cult style, it's a little too sharp in the finish, but the richness is impressive.
title: Venteux 2007 Starr Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Crisp melon rind, apple and pear flavors lend a cool, refreshing vibe to this off-dry Riesling. Brisk and vibrantly structured, it's a thirst quenching quaffer for everyday enjoyment. Drink now.
title: Thomas Schmitt 2014 Private Collection Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: This wine has pretty floral elements that come to fore ahead of a heavier, riper style that's viscous and plush on the palate. Golden-apple flavors take on a baked note, accompanied by pineapple and crème brûlée.
title: Knights Bridge 2016 East Block Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: This is a rich, young Sauvignon Blanc for drinking now. Dry on the finish and tart in acidity, it shows complex pineapple, pear, grapefruit and hay flavors, with a touch of peppery spice.
title: Laird 2011 Big Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Spiced berry, dry oak and a note of latex define the nose on this ripe, likable, friendly Tempranillo. The wine is lively on the palate, with candied, jumpy flavors of berry fruits that finish with some foxiness and a wet-fur note. The emphasis here is on fresh fruit more than power or oakiness.
title: Resalte 2011 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Lightly barrel aged, this wine is ripe, hinting at spice and full of ripe apple and melon flavors. It has a crisp and nervy side to its fruitiness as well as a rounded, full aftertaste where the creamed toastiness comes through. Drink from late 2018.
title: Lieubeau 2017 Domaine de la Fruitière Chardonnay (Val de Loire)

description: Smoke and oak pronounce themselves vigorously on the nose and entry of this 100% varietal wine, which holds on with a tight grip. Black fruit dominates with leather, chocolate and tobacco playing secondary roles. The finish is lengthy and powerful.
title: Korbin Kameron 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

description: This is pure Merlot, well made, with classic balance and structure. It's not a flashy wine, but the undertones of dried leaf support and enhance the crisp currant, strawberry and cherry fruit.
title: Gifford Hirlinger 2006 Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This is a simple, fruity, quaffable wine with light baked apple and cinnamon flavors. It's balanced and soundly made, though insubstantial.
title: Eola Hills 2015 Chardonnay (Oregon)

description: You'll want to age this wine for a good 6–8 years, because right now it's rather tough in tannins, and the fruit and oak have not married. Nonetheless it's quite a good wine. Shows complex layers of blackberries, currants and caramelized oak. Lifts Alexander Valley Cabernet above its usual level into noteworthy.
title: Goldschmidt 2006 Vyborny Vineyard Plus Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Slightly foxy on the nose, with rubbery aromas of cherry and cassis, this offers a tight, tannic palate with hard, elastic tannins. Flavors of cherry and cassis are pleasant, while the finish is ripe, warming and healthy.
title: Luberri 2011 Seis  (Rioja)

description: A solid if unexciting Cabernet, dry, tannic and balanced. Shows blackberry and black currant flavors that are tinged with smoky oak. Drink now.
title: Merryvale 2009 Starmont Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Wild, tropical fruit aromas are marked with saffron and pollen on the nose of this zingy, extroverted Riesling. Off dry in style, the palate is thirst quenching with sunny tangerine and peach flavors lifted by a vein of lemon acidity. Finishes moderately long on a sweet, honeyed note
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Kabinett
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2013 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: This wine is ripe with full-bodied tropical-fruit flavors that are cut with lime acidity. It is a warm, open wine from a rich vintage, full of fruit and without any wood aging. Drink now.
title: Domaine Saumaize-Michelin 2015  Mâcon-Villages

description: A surprisingly soft wine, showing as much richness as minerality. The wine has weight, some yeasty character with peach and citrus. It finishes with a round, full and creamy character.
designation: Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Billecart-Salmon NV Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This rich wine balances ripe yellow fruits with intense citrus acidity in a harmonious whole. Its structure is laden with minerality, toast and a smooth, delicious creamy aftertaste.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2009 Les Pucelles Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Light aromas of herbs, woodspice, tire rubber and red fruit lead to jammy raspberry and spice flavors that provide easy drinking pleasure.
title: Sagelands 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Despite the reasonable price tag, this is a very good bottle of Cabernet, the kind that should be poured by the glass at your local steakhouse. The mixed berry and cedar flavors are easy to like, and it has enough crisp acidity and silky tannin to stand up to rare beef without being overly heavy or rich.
title: De Bortoli 2008 Deen De Bortoli Vat 9 Cabernet Sauvignon (Australia)

description: Vines around 25 years old on this family domaine yield this soft and creamy wine. It has attractive, crisp acidity and a bright texture that brings in apples and lemon flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Fourrey 2014  Chablis

description: From the winery's estate, this wine opens in pretty floral notes of jasmine and orange blossom, following on the full-bodied palate with baked pear and vanilla. It finishes tart and dry.
title: Kunde 2014 C.S. Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Vanilla cream, honey and tropical-fruit flavors mark this Chardonnay, which was fermented and aged in stainless steel. It's a straightforward wine, for drinking now.
title: Passaggio 2011 New Generation Unoaked Chardonnay (California)

description: Chardonnay is emerging as a leader at this estate, especially for those who prefer oaky, old school styles. A strikingly bright gold shade, this is deeply carved with tangy citrus and tree-fruit flavors. The barrel aging adds substantial flavors of oily, buttery toast. Drink now through 2020.
title: Torii Mor 2015 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Creamy aromas of butterscotch and candied corn are shot through with a vitalizing kick of lemon zest on the nose. The smooth, textured palate is bright and citrus-forward, with creamy, savory elements that broaden the feel and linger on the finish.
title: Shaw 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: Herbal, spicy berry aromas are varietally correct. This has a chunky mouthfeel and also some flatness to the palate. Flavors of herbal berry, spice and lactic oak finish a bit green, with herbal, olive notes.
title: Santa Carolina 2012 Reserva Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Aromas of peat, fire pit, earth and funk are followed by elegantly styled fruit and savory flavors that show deftness and length. It's a very pretty expression of the area, putting a focus on elegance.
designation: The Unnamed Estate Syrah In the Rocks Vineyard
title: Reynvaan Family Vineyards 2013 The Unnamed Estate Syrah In the Rocks Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Sommeliers will appreciate this Chardonnay for its dryness and elegance, not to mention the price. It favors restraint over flamboyance, yet offers plenty of rich tropical and citrus fruits, with hints of honey and minerals. The alcohol is refreshingly balanced.
title: Bump 2011 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: This wine bridges the gap between mass-market wines that are soft and sweet, and more serious dry ones that have better structure and more powerful fruit. It is nicely fruity but dry, has generous aromas and flavors supported by light tannins and good acidity.
title: Murphy-Goode 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Powerful and also elegant for New World Syrah. The nose offers fine herbs, tobacco and sly berry fruit aromas. It's rich and full in the mouth, with layereing and ripe flavors of black raspberry and plum. A supercharged wine that's generous but not overdone.
title: Koyle 2008 Royale Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: A distinct note of honey hovers above the ripe, tart apple fruit. On the palate the apples have the rounded richness of baked fruit and the zing of lemon freshness, making for a friendly, approachable, zesty Riesling with a clean finish.
title: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Eichberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Smoky, rubbery aromas of plum and foresty berry fruits turn damp and earthy with airing. This feels wiry, with tomato, herbal plum and boysenberry flavors. Barrel spice and toasty oak take over on the finish.
title: Casas del Bosque 2013 Reserva Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: Syrah grown in sandy soil just above the Tagus River produces a wine that is soft, spicy and fruity. It is well balanced, the acidity giving a lift to the dark plum skin and berry flavors. It feels rich, full in the mouth, spicy with hints of wood aging. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2012 Grande Escolha Syrah (Tejo)

description: The aromas of cocoa, raspberry, black tea, vanilla and cranberry are in full bloom. The cranberry and cherry flavors are ripe and full, backed by firm tannins. This wine is in a sweet spot. Drink now.
title: Liberty Lake 2009 Merlot (Red Mountain)

description: This wine is closed, giving little at this stage. But the texture, the suggestions of opulent, ripe pear and peach fruit flavors and the juicy toastiness all give promise. It will be a very fine wine, but wait until 2017.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2011 Les Combettes Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Aromas of barrel spice, lees, corn silk and citrus rise up from the glass. The palate is bone dry, with creamy feeling fruit and barrel flavors. It's a unique offering of this variety for the state. Not for all tastes.
title: Gård 2015 Grand Klasse Reserve Lawrence Vineyards Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This Cabernet Sauvignon opens with aromas of ripe black fruit, cedar and toast. The palate delivers notes of ripe plum, black currant and spice, with smooth tannins that make this very enjoyable to drink young.
title: La Carraia 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Umbria)

description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of fresh and dried herb, cedar box, cranberry, Red Vines, smoke and dark fruit. The palate reveals tightly wound, slightly dried-out seeming red and black-fruit flavors that carry through the finish.
title: Barons 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Made in a popularly appealing style, this slightly sweet wine has honeyed flavors of lemons, limes, green apples and white pepper. Very food-friendly, especially with salty foods.
title: Tyler Florence 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Produced in association with Katnook Estate, this is an easy-drinking Cabernet with substantial oak influence. The cranberry and currant fruit is rather herbal and even peppery, but it's cushioned by cedar and vanilla, turning silky-textured on the finish.
title: Nick Faldo 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)

description: A classic Cabernet from a veteran producer. Strikes a fine line between ripe fruit and a noble structure. The blackberries, cherries, currants and cedar are lush and delicious, yet framed in sturdy tannins, and balanced with fine acidity. Should develop through the next decade.
title: Tudal 2006 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Unctuous in anise, apple and Asian pear, this wine is beautifully layered, fleshy and lushly complex. A twist of ginger rises on the midpalate as a backbone of acidity refreshes and lingers on the finish. This is balanced and lovely.
title: Joseph Jewell 2015 Shiloh Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Sharp acidity girds a steely, austere expression of the variety, stony in lemon peel, grapefruit and jasmine.
title: Houdini 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: With just a touch of bottle age giving a toasty character, this impressive wine is already showing some maturity. That said, the apple and citrus character, the mineral tight texture and crisp acidity promise some aging. The wine conveys a sense of elegance, intensity and richness. Drink now, but the wine will also age.
designation: Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Taittinger 2005 Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Blended with a little Syrah, Petite Sirah and Sangiovese, this Merlot in a big box is clearly a terrific value. It's so lush and delicious in berries and spices, it's crazy that the price works out to $6.25 for a regular bottle. With production over 200,000 cases, it's a testament to the art of blending.
title: Black Box 2009 Merlot (California)

description: This wine opens on an earthy note of tilled soil along with aromas of mature black fruit, baking spices and grilled Mediterranean herbs. The flat palate is showing signs of fatigue, revealing dried cherry, espresso and a hint of licorice notes alongside evolved tannins.
title: Col di Lamo 2009  Brunello di Montalcino

description: This is a seriously good Chardonnay, given its California appellation. But then, the Delicato family has superb grape sources. It's rich and ripe in tropical fruit, orange, honey, vanilla and buttered toast flavors, balanced with crisp acidity. Production is an easy-to-find 12,000 cases.
title: HandCraft 2012 Artisan Collection Chardonnay (California)

description: There are woody aromas to the nose but little fruit. This is fresh but empty in the mouth, with woody flavors of barbecue and hickory but, once again, minimal fruitiness.
title: Concha y Toro 2012 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)

description: Tannic astringency marks this Cabernet, even though it's more than seven years old. It feels hard and unrelieved in the mouth, although there's enough blackberry, cherry and cassis flavor to satisfy. The question is whether or not continued aging will eventually bring this tough, aggressive wine around. Try after 2013.
title: Ardente 2003 Grande Riserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

description: An elegant and well-balanced Syrah, initial scents of red cherry and brambly berry lead into more refined notes of cola spice, game, leather and a touch of sweet smoke. The palate is smooth and easy, with silky tannins that are surprisingly approachable and red cherry and berry flavors that are bright and refreshing. Final hits of white pepper and cured game grace the medium-length finish.
title: Kershaw 2013 Clonal Selection Syrah (Elgin)

description: This enticing wine is savory on the nose, displaying light herb, fig and mineral aromas. Rich melon and crushed rock flavors yield a creamy texture.
title: Encanto 2017 Encanto Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

description: Smells like spiced applesauce. The palate is more full than light, with roundness but lemony, tart flavors of citrus and green apple. Tart again on the finish, with an odd oily feel. Seems green as well.
title: Chilcas 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: A rounded style of Sauvignon Blanc, but one that doesn't lose sight of its herbaceous element. So there is crispness, a vivacious acidity, but also flavors of creamy apple and ripe pear. To drink this year.
title: Hans Moser 2008 Klausen Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

description: This opens with vibrant aromas of green olive, herbs and fresh asparagus along with dark cherry. Not shy, the full-bodied, tightly wound flavors bring a core of dark fruit and savory flavors that persist on the finish.
title: Gård 2013 Thunderstone Lawrence Vineyards Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is an extremely smooth Syrah, another reminder of how well the Rhône grape does when planted in California's cooler Pinot Noir climates. Licorice and boysenberry characterize the nose, with the combination of rich fruit and peppery spice framing the palate. The lingering vanilla finish kicks it up even one more notch.
title: Joyce 2012 Tondre Grapefield Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A healthy 8% Petit Verdot gives added strength and color to this wine, while the 5% Merlot adds smooth, layered, velvety-rich texture. Bittersweet chocolate and wild mushroom play off each other's sweet-savory tension, balancing at the end.
title: Pride Mountain 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Sonoma County)

description: Scents of violets and savory herbs add complexity to tart, juicy red cherries and plums on this crisp, elegantly framed Cabernet Franc. A touch of menthol highlights a cool, acidic edge on the palate. Finishes moderately long with a murmur of fine-grained tannins.
title: Benmarl 2012 Cabernet Franc (Seneca Lake)

description: Waxy on the nose, with buttercup, creamy yellow-fruit scents and white flowers. The palate is wet, racy and a touch like soda, with sweet, candied flavors of peach and melon. Plods along with good enough acidity to support the wine's core sweetness and candied qualities.
title: Viñas del Vero 2009 Chardonnay (Somontano)

description: This seems to be hurrying along its aging curve, showing a burnished gold color. It's smoky and intense, with citrusy fruit that's more like grapefruit than anything else, plus plenty of weight and bright acidity. Drink up.
title: Man O' War 2009 Valhalla Chardonnay (Waiheke Island)

description: This beautiful wine offers intense fruit, touches of toastiness and a pure line of acidity. Its succulent texture and generous fruit are layered with the fresher, mineral character of this still-young wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2014 La Garenne Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)
winery: Domaine Au Pied du Mont Chauve

description: Inky, earthy berry aromas come with a hint of animal. This feels grabby but solid, with firm tannins. Standard plum and berry aromas are the slightest bit stalky, while flavors of roasted black fruits and coffee are bolstered by hard tannins on the finish.
title: Sierra Cantabria 2011 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: Raspberry and cherry fruit carries an impression of sweetness, a bit of hard candy flavor. It's round, forward and chocolaty with a little burn in the finish. Overall a very tasty and enjoyable Cab.
title: Market Vineyards 2008 Arbitrage Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Earthy aromas of game, porcini mushroom, scorched earth, saline and crushed herb meld together on this. The taut palate offers raw red berry, mineral and grilled sage alongside austere tannins. Drink 2018–2023.
title: Lambardi 2011  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Fleshy, melony and tropical smelling, with a bit of warm radiator dust. The palate is plump but maintains a level of freshness, zest and clarity. Tastes citrusy up front and then shows a softer, more melony side. Quite good for under $10.
title: Emiliana 2010 Eco Balance Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Stone flint and smoke join a lovely combination of superripe orange and juicy mandarin. The palate focuses even more on these luscious juicy citrus flavors. It gets direction from gentle but definite lemon freshness. With a little air, an earthier aspect grounds this beautifully and gives a three-dimensional picture of aroma, flavor and texture with immense and intense length.
title: Pichler-Krutzler 2015 Kellerberg Riesling (Wachau)

description: Loads of black pepper and foliage notes unfold in the bouquet here, with supporting aromas of bacon, game and red plum skins. The fruit is a bit more assertive in the satiny mouth, with plum flesh and ripe cherry lifting the cured meat character. A superb value that's complex yet approachable.
title: Ernst Gouws & Co. 2008 Shiraz (Coastal Region)

description: A rustic, everyday Cabernet, with enough blackberry and oak flavors to pass. It's rough in the mouth, with jagged tannins and an ashy note that's weird.
title: Wine Spots 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Marked by big, sharp acidity, like biting into a lime, and clean, linear flavors of limes, green apples and pineapples, this bone-dry Chardonnay badly needs food to balance it out. Think of bacon-wrapped grilled shrimp, or a spicy Ahi tuna tartare dish.
title: Fogdog 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Savory whiffs of dried herbs, pine needles and dusty minerals open to a bright, delicately fruity palate of crisp tangerine and quince. Dry and spry, it offers brisk, cooling refreshment. Drink now–2017.
designation: Estate Grown and Bottled Falling Man Vineyard Dry
title: Keuka Lake Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown and Bottled Falling Man Vineyard Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Sourced from vines approaching 30 years of age, this is quite dry and complex, with plenty of dry extract. Scented with citrus and stone fruits, flavors run more toward apple and pear. The length is impressive.
title: Kramer 2012 Yamhill Vineyard Riesling (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: Mondavi's done it again, produced another very nice Cabernet at an everyday price. It shows classy elegance, with blackberry, currant and mocha notes.
title: Robert Mondavi 2011 Private Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

description: The 2006 L'Ermite boasts a wonderfully fragrant bouquet of cracked pepper, beef blood and plummy fruit, but is a full-bodied, powerful expression of Syrah on the mouth, bulging with crushed stone and espresso nuances. It's velvety without being soft, the tannins showing supple strength. Drink 2015–2030.
title: M. Chapoutier 2006 L'Ermite Ermitage  (Hermitage)

description: Underbrush, violet, aromatic herb and wild berry aromas appear at the forefront. The light-bodied palate is less expressive, showing dried blackberry and clove alongside dusty tannins.
title: Fattoria Del Cerro 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: This pure varietal bottling spent two years in barrel. It's extremely leathery, dried out, and smells and tastes of the tack room. This is not terroir. It's most likely barrel-related.
title: Cathedral Ridge 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: Made from vines planted several decades ago, this wine shows its worldly sophistication with pungent, smoky earth and gravelly texture. The overall impression is sensual and seductive, enriched by bright blackberry and raspberry flavors and appreciable acidity.
title: Limerick Lane 2015 Headpruned Block Syrah (Russian River Valley)

description: Spicy and completely dry, this fresh and fruity rosé is a pretty strawberry and salmon shade, with persistent flavors of cherry candy, lemon oil and nougat. There's a nice citrus snap to the finish.
title: Waterbrook 2009 Rosé Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This tight, young Syrah has a succinct core of blueberry and raspberry flavors, which are wrapped in a mix of herb, earth and green tea. The tannins are just slightly bitter, but all in balance, and that bitterness is not at all unpleasant.
title: Novelty Hill 2009 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Light peach and honey aromas lead to very ripe, full fruit flavors and a hint of sweetness on the palate. This unoaked wine has medium to full body and a rich soft texture.
title: Jessie's Grove 2017 Steel Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: This mouth-filling Shiraz features plenty of weight and texture and bold, plummy flavors tinged with mocha and black olive. It'll go great with a charred steak off the grill.
title: Taltarni 2009 Shiraz (Pyrenees)

description: Grown on a vineyard less than three miles to the ocean behind Cambria, this bottling shows popcorn, light marshmallow and light cream on the very plush nose. The sip tightens up considerably, focusing on fresh and racy lime peels yet with richer hints of clotted cream and flowing butter in the background.
title: Stolo 2016 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo)

description: A big, bold and beautiful Cabernet. Will appeal to those who like the California style, although Bordeauxphiles will find it too ripe and fruity. Brims with blackberries, black cherries, currants, licorice and sweet toasted oak, wrapped into firm, mountain tannins. Now–2014.
title: Barnett 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

description: Truly herbaceous and aromatic, this is a crisp, clean, easy-drinking wine, with a fresh, bright line of acidity. Ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Laporte 2011 Le Bouquet Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

description: With sizable additions of Petit Verdot, Merlot and Cabernet Franc and aged nearly two years in new French oak, this wine has lavender scents and soft, rounded edges. Mountain tannins and fresh acidity frame its chocolate and dark, spicy berry flavors. It finishes on a toasted oak note.
title: VGS Chateau Potelle 2013 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

description: Zesty lemon and yellow-peach notes are touched with lanolin on this dry, yet deeply fruity Riesling. Stone fruit flavors are intensely ripe, almost pulpy, on the palate, but accented with sharp lime acidity.
designation: Bernkastel Kueser Gold Edition Kabinett Trocken
title: Peter Mertes 2010 Bernkastel Kueser Gold Edition Kabinett Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

description: This young, fruity and spicy Cabernet Franc is perfumed and ready to drink. The wine is structured, tight and offers delicious red fruit. Drink the wine, lightly chilled, with salmon as well as meat dishes.
title: Domaine les Pins 2015  Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil

description: A sweetly soft 100% Syrah, made for drinking now. It's jammy and forward in raspberries, cherries and mocha, with a dusting of pepper and cinnamon. Firm tannins provide a good grip in the mouth.
title: Zaca Mesa 2008 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Plump, dark strawberry, lavish kirsch, along with cola, cinnamon and allspice show on the nose of this rich bottling from a vineyard on the small appellation's northern end. Vanilla, caramel and cherry-jubilee flavors show on the ripe sip, where a solid tannic tension arises on the finish.
title: Kaena 2015 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

description: Stony, earthy aromas lend a mineral tone to lavish rose and yellow-­cherry notes on this concentrated, yet delicately structured, Riesling. It's intensely sweet and honeyed, with luscious, tropical fruit flavors, yet brisk on the palate, with a streak of citrus acidity.
title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2011 Abstberg Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: A nice, fruity Sauvignon Blanc, a little sweet and simple, but satisfying nonetheless for its array of ripe pineapple, citrus, lime, green apple and spice flavors, brightened with crisp acidity.
title: Maisonry 2010 Hanson-Hsieh Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: This abundantly rich wine seems to melt in the mouth like fine dark chocolate. Aromas emphasize fully ripe plums, black cherries and a whiff of spicy oak. Then chocolaty flavors expand quickly on the tongue as they are carried by copious soft tannins. While big in flavor it's modest in body and alcohol.
title: Van Ruiten 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: This bottling by pioneer Richard Sanford is much more widely available, affordable and stylistically accessible right now than the single vineyard option. It's delicate on the nose with bright lime spritz, Meyer lemon pith, crushed lemon verbena and a grippy brie cheese rind component, then proves tangy on the nuanced palate, with lemongrass and pomelo skin meshing into nectarine and apple flesh.
title: Alma Rosa 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This appellation is sometimes overlooked, but for white wines it is star. This is a ripe, full wine, toasty from wood aging and with rich apricot fruit cut by lemon acidity. It is balanced, full of fruitiness and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2015  Auxey-Duresses
